description: 职位描述  区域企业销售经理将负责特斯拉产品的B2B销售渠道；包括租赁公司、公司客户和潜在的大宗客户。通过与客户保持密切沟通，达成自己与公司的销售目标。  主要职责 主动探索企业客户，挖掘将特斯拉车辆作为公司用车及企业员工用车的销售机会 主动探索车辆租赁及车辆运营行业的新客户， 挖掘特斯拉车辆在租赁和运营行业的应用需求和销售机会 积极拓展企业客户资源，展示特斯拉销售方案，并获取新的订单 确保达成所有销售目标并追求超额完成 职位要求 对特斯拉企业文化高度认可 优秀的商业拓展能力和商务谈判能力 拥有4-8年零售、行业销售、以及大客户销售经验，能够达到或超出销售目标 强烈的团队合作意识 快速学习新事物或新工作方法和流程的能力 本科及其以上学历 流利的中英文听说读写能力

区域  销售业务发展 经理  主要职责  ⚫ 根据 区域 销售团队业务目标 及门店业态 ，制定 区域 活动 策略及 计划 ，并完成 预算 及控制  ⚫ 管理 区域 销售业务发展团队 ，并 带 领团队 支持销售团队达成业务目标， 通过 策划并执行  区域内的市场活动，包括但不限于新店开业、车展、试乘试驾活动等；  ⚫ 负责调研车主需求，与内外部团队进行合作，策划并执行车主活动，加强与车主的联系；  ⚫ 负责挖掘潜在个人 企业客户需求，通过策划和执行线上线下活动，对潜在个人 企业客  户进行开发；  ⚫ 负责 搭建渠道及 拓展各类资源，包括但不限于各类商户 , 合作伙 伴，落地项目，并有效  支持区域市场目标达成。  任职要求：  ⚫ 本科学历或同等学位；  ⚫ 5 年 以上 业务拓展开发，或市场活动相关工作经历； 具有跨地区团队管理相关经验  ⚫ 具备良好计划 、预算 、统筹市场活动 能力  ⚫ 对所负责区域的市场商业环境熟悉；  ⚫ 优秀的商业拓展能力和商务谈判能力  ⚫ 有优秀的书面表达及口头沟通能力，能与不同合作伙伴顺畅交流；  ⚫ 对数据敏感，优秀的数据分析能力和逻辑分析能力，能独立解决跨部门和跨组织的问题；  ⚫ 有 较强的抗压力，能在快节奏、充满活力、结果导向的环境中工作，并能在规定限期内  完成多个项目；  ⚫ 保持创业精神及高度敏感的市场嗅觉，持续推动业务发展；  ⚫ 精通 MS 办公软件。

The ideal candidate will be able to appropriately identify the needs of both new and current customers in order to aid customers in their success using our product. This will be done by developing an appropriate level of communication with clients and internal team members to better understand and mitigate any issues the customers may face.  Chinese Nationality  Responsibilities Work cross functionally within the company to communicate with all people in customers' success Create and maintain relationships with customers to better understand and achieve their needs Make visits to our customers to identify opportunities for growth within our platform Manage all reporting about the sales reports. Manage existing customer and distributor base throughout the region Identify, contact and visit potential customers and distributors.   Qualifications Previous account management experience With working experience in Housewares or Home appliances fields' candidates preferred Willingness and ability to travel 5 years of management experience Perfect English in speaking and writing Experience in working with international/corporate teams. Experienced in lifestyle goods or housewares. Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills Excellent planning and organizational, and time management skills. Ability to work on extremely complex problems where analysis of situations or data requires an evaluation of intangible variance factors. In depth knowledge of houseware products

职位描述：  区域培训项目指导/区域培训项目经理将主要负责区域销售和交付的培训项目建立和执行。  该职位需要与关键业务合作伙伴和区域销售领导合作，以确定并分析培训需求和业务健康  状况。通过制作和执行定制化培训内容为区域团队成员提供指导和发展团队，以充分发挥  其潜力，协助提高整个地区的绩效。  工作职责： 设计，制作和执行相关培训项目。包括但不限于入职，产品，客户服务，销售技巧 与业务经理和主要业务伙伴合作，分析业务的健康状况和机会点，以确定工作重心和项目核心 与业务经理和专题项目专家合作以确定培训需求，并迅速建立和实施培训解决方案 能适应在教室，在线和店内任何环境中提供培训 执行知识检查和角色扮演以验证学习成果 为业务经理提供反馈和意见/建议 管理培训后的调查和效果跟踪，以评估有效性并向管理层提供报告 任职要求： 5 年以上的培训或客户服务相关经验 卓越的自我激励能力 积极主动，独立自主工作，有上进心 优秀的书面表达和口头表达能力 可接受出差和到访不同门店，超过50% 的时间 熟悉Mac OS X 和Windows 操作系统 熟练运用Microsoft Office，Office365，Pages 和Keynote 具备多媒体制作能力优先 可英文沟通优先

职位介绍：  企业客户销售团队负责制定和执行特斯拉在中国大陆市场的企业端销售策略。该部门还负责在合作企业内的品牌宣传、企业专属活动、企业车主维护，以及其它一切帮助公司提升和维护双方的可持续合作关系的职能。 作为区域企业客户销售主管/经理，您的首要职责是为特斯拉的产品在企业端的销售快速打开渠道、实现增量。您亦对进行中的合作企业提供持续的支持与服务，对合作企业的现状表现做出分析和提升的行动方案。此职位还将参与公司内部其他商业团队合作，包括商务拓展、金融服务、充电团队等等。  主要职责：  我们正在寻找有相关专业经验，并具有公关经验和能力的候选人。您应具备如下能力： 建立及扩充企业渠道资源：为区域内特斯拉中心和体验店带来客流和销售增量，实现快速打开所在区域企业渠道的目标。 开发客户及签订合约：寻找符合要求的潜在客户，准备与客户沟通的资料，把握重点客户决策链，与潜在客户建立关系，并可以独立完成企业员工购车协议的谈判和签订。 协议签订后，您将与BD/CRM/MKT等其他相关团队合作完成以下工作： 企业员工专属活动：特斯拉科技讲堂、企业专属置换日、专场试驾会、企业车主讲堂等； 作为大客户团队代表来监管在合作企业内开展的活动质量和频率，督促合作伙伴改善项目； 参与推动内部的协调和配合，协助制订和实施符合企业活动品质衡量的标准与流程。 培养与合作企业的关系：发展、推动和管理合作企业的本地团队，通过以上任务的达成和与零售门店的合作，确保企业销售团队目标的达成。 基本条件： 拥有5-10年在中国市场的商务拓展、企业客户销售、公关或其他相关领域的经验 出色的谈判能力，具有参与合同谈判的相关经验及理解诠释法律合同/协议的能力 成功的合作伙伴和影响者 对企业客户合作和商业操作有详尽的了解与知识 能够合理安排并同时胜任多项任务，思路清晰 了解并掌握项目管理工具和技巧 了解特斯拉的品牌和企业文化

Job Description Summary This role will represent and act as a primary customer point of contact in the allocated accounts/territory and proactively build network with government bodies and Key Opinion Leaders as well as deep understanding of healthcare structure/players in assigned territories/accounts.GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  Responsibilities:  Achieve sales/orders targets for sales in assigned one accounts/territory while being within the budget allocated.  Target, get access, builds relations, develop a business strategy and maximize business opportunities for all GE Healthcare businesses, products & services within allocated accounts/territory.  Represents and acts as a primary customer point of contact in the allocated accounts/territory.  Proactively build network with government bodies and Key Opinion Leaders as well as deep understanding of healthcare structure/players in assigned territories/accounts.  Coordinate indirect deals for multimodality projects and aim at maximizing share of direct deals within your territory/accounts.  In Cooperation with Modalities and Marketing drive One GE Healthcare marketing events in assigned territory. Be aware of segmentation and targeting in healthcare system , and apply relevant product benefits to each client’s segment.  Analyze market trends, competition and accounts to develop a business plan and strategy that creates new business opportunities for all GE Healthcare products & services.  Provides on-going feedback to management, modalities, services and marketing  .Leverage Product Sales Specialists, Account Managers, Service and other Company resources to provide necessary technical equipment, service or clinical content to customers.  Coordinate One GE Healthcare team on strategic accounts in order to deliver solutions that meet or exceed customer expectations.  Develop & implement plans with Zone cross functional teams to achieve results through effective project proposals, negotiations, and contracts. Grow the share of wallet in assigned accounts (GE’s share of customer investments in Capital and Operational expenditures).  Develop & maintain a high level of customer satisfaction through consistent high quality interactions with customer management, drive customer on their accounts.  Build long term strategic alliance with portfolio of accounts to continue to add value.  Promote Service offerings, identify and escalate commercial service needs  Pro-actively monitor and escalate service issues to drive customer GE policies, procedures and Operating Mechanism. Proactively participates in company initiatives depending on organizational needs and as directed by management. Ensure knowledge of and compliance of integrity and company policies.  Geographic scope: Zone (could be a territory within Zone)  Qualifications/Requirements ：  Minimum 5 years relevant healthcare industry experience  Bachelor's degree  A proven track-record of achieving and exceeding sales targets, and a desire to grow new business  Experience understanding customer needs and business drivers and using this knowledge to develop account plans and strategies (knowledge of the existing account areas/channels would be advantageous).  Excellent interpersonal skills, including teamwork and communication skills  Persistence in developing prospects and customers, and ability to close business  Strong presentation, analytical and customer service skills  Self-starter, able to manage time and organize and prioritize workload  Inclusion and Diversity   GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.
industries: Hospital & Health Care, Medical Devices, and Pharmaceuticals

description: ROLE PURPOSE   To penetrate large-scale accounts with a focus on those companies based in North Asia. The primary responsibility of the role will be to develop and manage relationships with the key stakeholders in order drive sales across the assigned accounts and territory. In addition, the Global Sales Manager will be responsible for providing consistent management, planning and reporting on their accounts.     RESPONSIBILITIES   ·       Meet or exceed assigned quota. ·       Develop annual business plan, determining sales and activity goals required for attainment of assigned quota. ·       Create consistent activity management, opportunity and account plans within Salesforce.com. ·       Prepare sales forecasts; establish targets in areas such as product mix, sales volume, market share, or business development and monitor the performance of the sales against these goals; adjust sales strategies and plans to meet changing markets and competitive conditions. ·       Broaden knowledge of company solutions and their capabilities versus the strengths/weaknesses vis-à-vis the competition. ·       Pursue large prospects and leads and negotiate terms of sales that will maximize the organization’s business interests. ·       Liaise with other departments across the organization (particularly in implementation and client services) to ensure that sales activities are integrated with other parts of the business and aligned with the overall corporate objectives. ·       Propose and implement opportunity and account plans to ensure client satisfaction, profitability, and retention through building ongoing business relationships. ·       Establish and maintain effective and constructive relationships with internal/external clients, earning trust and respect through demonstrating a consistent commitment to exceed expectations. ·       Maintain a high state of integrity and professionalism in carrying out the duties and responsibilities of this position.   QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE     ·       Bachelor degree or above ·       At least 5 years of sales experience in service outsourcing, HCM solutions and/or related software industries selling to senior-level executives. ·       At least 3 years of exposure to the North Asia region. ·       Strong financial acumen and business orientation with innovative approaches to business development. ·       Possesses BPO/HRO industry knowledge. ·       Solid proven sales record in continually achieving or exceeding assigned business revenue targets. Proven proficiency in account plan development and implementation of related sales strategies to secure large clients. ·       Strong command of English with both oral and written; second north Asia language preferred.   ·       Excellent presentation and written communication skills.

职位介绍：  企业客户销售团队负责制定和执行特斯拉在中国大陆市场的企业端销售策略。该部门还负责在合作企业内的品牌宣传、企业专属活动、企业车主维护，以及其它一切帮助公司提升和维护双方的可持续合作关系的职能。 作为区域企业客户销售主管/经理，您的首要职责是为特斯拉的产品在企业端的销售快速打开渠道、实现增量。您亦对进行中的合作企业提供持续的支持与服务，对合作企业的现状表现做出分析和提升的行动方案。此职位还将参与公司内部其他商业团队合作，包括商务拓展、金融服务、充电团队等等。  主要职责：  我们正在寻找有相关专业经验，并具有公关经验和能力的候选人。您应具备如下能力： 建立及扩充企业渠道资源：为区域内特斯拉中心和体验店带来客流和销售增量，实现快速打开所在区域企业渠道的目标。 开发客户及签订合约：寻找符合要求的潜在客户，准备与客户沟通的资料，把握重点客户决策链，与潜在客户建立关系，并可以独立完成企业员工购车协议的谈判和签订。 协议签订后，您将与BD/CRM/MKT等其他相关团队合作完成以下工作： 企业员工专属活动：特斯拉科技讲堂、企业专属置换日、专场试驾会、企业车主讲堂等； 作为大客户团队代表来监管在合作企业内开展的活动质量和频率，督促合作伙伴改善项目； 参与推动内部的协调和配合，协助制订和实施符合企业活动品质衡量的标准与流程。 培养与合作企业的关系：发展、推动和管理合作企业的本地团队，通过以上任务的达成和与零售门店的合作，确保企业销售团队目标的达成。 基本条件： 拥有5-10年在中国市场的商务拓展、企业客户销售、公关或其他相关领域的经验 出色的谈判能力，具有参与合同谈判的相关经验及理解诠释法律合同/协议的能力 成功的合作伙伴和影响者 对企业客户合作和商业操作有详尽的了解与知识 能够合理安排并同时胜任多项任务，思路清晰 了解并掌握项目管理工具和技巧 了解特斯拉的品牌和企业文化

职位描述： 城市经理需要充满活力，具备优秀的组织能力、沟通能力、积极的工作态度，高效的执行力，以结果为导向，注重细节。该职位将通过全面管理门店日常运营，执行运营政策，协调相关团队资源，提高销售绩效，关注人才发展，提升客户和员工的满意度，提高区域的市场增量。在店长不在店面的情况下，作为代理店长工作。 主要职责： l 全面负责所负责区域内门店日常运营，辅助店长进行人员管理培训，确保门店高效运行； l 确保门店所有陈列摆设符合特斯拉零售标准， 传递极致客服体验； l 高效跟进，执行销售政策，与销售相关团队紧密合作，处理日常客户问题，协助门店达成销售、交付目标； l 以积极正向、职业成熟的管理方式工作，并且在整个团队中发挥积极正向的领导作用，促进团结向上的氛围在整个公司层面的形成； l 和外部客户、外部人员,保持清晰、准确、职业、礼貌的沟通和内部同事保持良好的沟通和团队协作（包括与上下级之间；同部门、跨部门；同门店、跨门店；同地区、跨地区之间）； l 员工须认真学习了解公司及产品的相关知识，并通过公司内部测试，否则将不能达到正式员工的标准和要求； l 其他职责：根据业务发展需要，完成管理层指定的其他工作 职位要求： l 8年以上零售运营管理经验，在零售店运营系统方面有扎实的知识和工作经验； l 自我驱动，具有出色的时间管理能力，高度关注细节； l 有能力同时管理多个项目，把控优先级，坚持在限定时间内达成业务目标； l 逻辑思维清楚，对数据敏感，沟通简洁高效； l 学习能力强，适应能力强； l 以诚信的态度管理销售业务以及店铺运营；能够发展合作型关系，做受人尊敬和信任的合作伙伴； l 持有效驾照和具备安全驾驶记录，至少2年驾龄本科或同等学历

主要职责  负责多店管理，驱动业务发展，最大程度提升销售成绩  落实运营政策和流程来满足客户需求，同时帮助特斯拉达到销售目标  负责面试和候选人招聘，选择合适的人才帮助达成体验店的销售和交付目标  管理、培训和发展员工，帮助他们持续达成公司业绩标准  负责计划、执行和跟进体验店运营任务和项目，包括但不仅限于店外市场活动及销售渠道拓展活动  控制体验店成本，包括员工、供给和服务  坚持按照公司流程进行产品展示和库存管理  在当地团队实验并推广提高日常工作效率的方法,与同事及管理层分享最佳实践  在公司内外部沟通中代表特斯拉并保持专业和负责的态度  你的绩效将通过并不限于以下几个方面来评估：很好的管理多个高效的销售顾问团队能力，使得团队能够达成优秀的销售成果以及维持活跃的潜在客户群体；使团队能够达成交付目标以及为客户提供良好的购买及车辆交付的体验，处理好车辆购买及交付过程中发生的客户投诉 管理产品专员、销售主管、交付专员，鼓励销售团队积极主动的与潜在客户联系；跟进所有的销售并确保客户满意，保持良好的客户关系；管理车辆交付的过程，确保客户在交付过程中的良好体验。 开拓当地市场，提升品牌影响力。  员工须认真学习了解公司及产品的相关知识，并通过公司内部测试，否则将不能达到正式员工的标准和要求  以积极正向、职业成熟的管理方式带领和培养团队，并且在整个团队中发挥积极正向的领导作用，促进团结向上的氛围在整个公司层面的形成  和外部客户、外部人员,保持清晰、准确、职业、礼貌的沟通和内部同事保持良好的沟通和团队协作（包括与上下级之间；同部门、跨部门；同门店、跨门店；同地区、跨地区之间）  其他职责：根据业务发展需要，完成管理层指定的其他工作   职位要求  8年以上零售、行业销售、大客户销售经验，能够达到或超出销售目标；3年以上团队管理经验  优秀的商业拓展能力和商务谈判能力  对销售数据敏感，优秀的数据分析能力和逻辑分析能力  自我驱动，具有出色的时间管理能力，高度关注细节  认可特斯拉的创业公司文化，具备创业公司需要的心理素质  抗压能力强，能够适应在高速发展的环境中开展销售管理工作，达到公司业绩指标要求  良好的自我管理能力及自我学习能力  有能力同时管理多个项目，把控优先级，坚持按时达成业务目标  优秀的书面和口语沟通能力  优秀的和公司内外各层级人员沟通的能力  采用人性化的方式热情地投入销售管理和运营  具有建立合作型关系的能力，并作为一名受人尊敬和信任，他人乐于一起工作的业务伙伴  在零售店运营系统方面有扎实的知识和可以证明的工作经验  本科或以上学历

What You'll Do Interested in being challenged and appreciated while embarking in a dynamic career? In an environment where colleagues become friends, where managers actively coach and where creativity and ambition are valued? The Business Development Representative is a specialized resource which allows for a greater depth of knowledge around Cisco’s architectures.  The BDR develops and closes opportunities from qualified leads, working directly with the customer, engineering and partners. Candidates will jump start their Cisco sales career by joining the Demand Response Team, part of the Global Virtual Sales and Engineering organization with opportunity for future growth and promotion. You will respond to customers who want to interact with Cisco, understand their needs and work with partners to provide solutions.  You will work closely with and leverage selected channel partners to maximize new sales opportunities. You will manage sales opportunities while using cutting-edge technologies to remotely interface with customers and leverage new sales models (cloud, services & software) to help customers maximizing their revenue. You’ll manage full sales lifecycle for qualified opportunities and help generate pipeline in all segments of Cisco’s business.  Who You'll Work With  The Global Virtual Sales organization is one of Cisco’s fastest growing sales teams and is the talent engine for Cisco Sales with diverse and motivated teams that consistently deliver profitable growth. We serve our customers through a series of selling motions to drive higher value and an optimal experience from Cisco solutions to drive relevant business outcomes. We are a global, dynamic team that brings excitement to the sales environment every day. We connect Cisco customers with solutions that can transform their businesses and change the world for the better. You will discover a creative, flexible and award-winning working environment using the latest Cisco technology to enable and empower you to perform to the very best of your abilities. Our teams adapt to respond to market changes and are all highly encouraged to give back to our local communities.  Who You Are If you enjoy selling in a changing environment, are goal motivated and believe in performance rewards for exceeding annual sales goals through strong collaboration with partners and internal stakeholders, we have a place for you. •      3+ years’ B2B selling experience in similar or adjacent industry, start-up or consultancy company, ideally in sales with tech knowledge ·       Tech Education background •      Experience owning the full sales cycle (developing and closing opportunities, working closely  customers and/or partners •      Passionate about Sales and building positive relationships with customers •      Highly motivated candidates with determination, tenacity and drive •      Willingness to learn and launch sales experience and technology expertise •      Flexible and resilient problem solver •      Passionate about IT and ability to tap into technology •      History of career progression and desire for professional development •      Thrives in a team environment, Madarian+ English speaking  •      BS/BA Equivalent  Why Cisco At Cisco, each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference. Yes, our technology changes the way the world works, lives, plays and learns, but our edge comes from our people. We connect everything – people, process, data and things – and we use those connections to change our world for the better. We innovate everywhere - From launching a new era of networking that adapts, learns and protects, to building Cisco Services that accelerate businesses and business results. Our technology powers entertainment, retail, healthcare, education and more. We benefit everyone - We do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities. Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.

Description Work with central Account executive team, feedback regional customer needs, work regional Joint Business plan, own regional business Point Of Sale as Key Performance Indicator. Sell in regional strengthen plan. Sell in Headquarters plan execution compliance to 100%. Description Work with central Account executive team, feedback regional customer needs, work regional Joint Business plan, own regional business Point Of Sale as Key Performance Indicator. Sell in regional strengthen plan. Sell in Headquarters plan execution compliance to 100%. Qualifications: Education Background: college degree or above. English Proficiency: speak, read and write fluently in English. Leadership. Analytical skills & logic thinking to review data to identify abnormalities/ rationale for a solution. Flexibility to adapt to change & Problem-solving skills. Hardworking to collaborate & establish relationship with oversea colleagues and customers.

Job Responsibility Work with cross functional team to lead Supply Chain initiatives for customer Build relationships with key customers and external partners to drive account development aligned with the commercial strategy Drive the process for incorporating the operations and supply chain areas (order management, deliveries, value-added services, etc.) into the overall customer management process, from customer strategic planning through in-season execution. Lead NIKE teams and customers to achieve mutually agreed operations plans. Act as the voice of the customer to influence NIKE capability development and service offerings. Manage and coordinate the implementation of operational capabilities and services with key customers. Monitor and manage performance against service level agreements from both a NIKE and customer point of view. Find supply chain improvement opportunities by analyzing routine operation performance result Job Qualification: Above 5 years’ retail operation/supply chain experience in a major consumer driven MNC (FMCG, Consumer Durables/Electronics); Ability to work across multiple functions and drive action via the consensus and alignment with multiple internal (Sales, Customer, Customer Service (CS), S&C, Logistic team, etc.) & external teams (3rd Party vendors); Ability to clearly articulate goals and objective; work independently and cooperatively in a diverse group; Ability to network, influence, and utilize internal and external resources; Strongly data analytical skills with excellent Excel skill setup; Fluent English is a must for the role, both written and spoken.
industries: Apparel & Fashion, Consumer Goods, and Retail

description: PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES § Manage regional licensees: -      Implement regional Category plan / strategy -      Develop & execute appropriate local market category plans  § Develop, implement and achieve yearly revenue budget for the category.  § Ensure licensees have full understanding Disney’s business standards, directions and strategies. Manage licensees to achieve yearly targeted budget.  B)     DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF ALL RESPONSIBILITIES  1.    Strategic Management -      Implement regional category plan / strategy. -      Develop local market category plan in line with regional strategy & plan. -      Undertake market analysis to follow or proactive meet trends & regulations, monitor sub-categories and retail performance, and determine & develop Disney’s segment share. -      Determine category key drivers (franchise, products, price, and retail channel) to expand brand presence consistently with retailer needs. -      Contribute to regional discussion of the category on behalf of the local market.  2.    Category Management -      Develop, implement and achieve yearly revenue budget -      Identify & contract new licensees instrumental in the development of the category -      Identify product, franchises, and channel gaps and ensure that the plans in place to fill the gaps. -      Manager Contract Renewals based on category plan. -      Assist the establishment of efficient distribution services. -      Provide account management to top licensees for long term business development. -      Coordinate with Compliance Group to ensure licensees comply with Disney’s labor standards. -      Ensure licensees’ thorough understanding and compliance of Disney’s contract, terms and conditions. -      Identify and develop manufacturing centers of excellence (global and regional). -      Regularly communicate with Key licensees and conduct performance reviews (quarterly).  3.    Retail Management -      Work with key retail account to manage Disney’s product range and presence at retail. -      Work with buyers from key retail accounts to develop business opportunities, managing product sourcing, mix / range, pricing and new programs specific to each retailer’s shopping profile. -      Act as communication link between Disney and licensees and retail buyers. -      Conduct retail accounts performance review and marketing update (quarterly). -      Identify signage and merchandising needs.  4.    Creative Management -      Direct product development with Product Developer consistently with category plan and ongoing product quality improvement program. -      Administer and coordinate licensee’s product approvals with Product Developer.  5.    Finance Management -      Responsible for the category budget & bottom line responsibility. -      Provide category forecast on quarterly basis (revenue grading). -      Responsible for collection past due accounts receivable.  6.    Marketing Management -      Coordinate with Retail, Sales & Marketing team to support sales promotion, events and advertising in the local market. -      Work with Retail, Sales & Marketing Team to ensure better understanding of consumer profiles and market needs. -      Ensure appropriate licensees implement the Disney visual merchandising programs.  7.    Information Systems -      Maintain competency in business systems Ø Insight (Contract Admin. & Royalty reports) Ø INvision (Forecasting/Budgeting) Ø SAP (Travel expenses & Purchase Orders)
industries: Retail, Consumer Goods, and Apparel & Fashion

description: Our Company  Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.  We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!  The opportunity  As Business Development Representatives (BDR) for China you are responsible for helping the largest global companies re-imagine their customer experiences using Adobe solutions & in the process creating new sales opportunities for your Account Executives (AEs).  What You’ll Do Deliver a “consultative” approach to selling; taking time to understand customer's business, their goals, objectives, and challenges before recommending a solution. Consistently achieve quality pipeline & other metrics such as Inbound lead follow-up & outbound account engagement metrics. Manage territory creation plan for your key account executives & their accounts. Researching key accounts, identifying decision-makers, generating interest, and developing accounts to stimulate opportunity. Prospect, educate, qualify, and develop Target Accounts and inbound leads to create sales-ready leads and opportunities Quickly route prospects and current customers to appropriate colleagues to assist in solving problems and driving value. Nurtures & provides education on areas of interest for under-informed customers. Setup, attend & run qualification meetings with customers in partnership with relevant Account Executive & Solution Consultants. Updating CRM, Outreach, and other tools as necessary to ensure capture of key history & ensuring a smooth hand-off to the relevant Account Executive as necessary. Providing closed-loop feedback to ensure continuous process optimization. What You Need To Succeed Track record of successful business development in enterprise solutions, software, or tech sales environment. Self-starter with high motivation, independence, resilience, and ability to collaborate with sales & marketing teams to deliver pipe creation goals. Proven sales skills delivering inbound & outbound experiences and building strong relationships at multiple levels within an organization. Strong communication including listening, written, verbal skills (English, Mandarin) Experience managing all areas of the BDR process including account planning, pre-call preparation, opportunity qualification, and objection handling. Ability to quickly learn & understand sophisticated business problems & translate customers' needs into solution plays. Consistently achieving inside sales goals in an automated sales environment where accurate entry and management of lead data in a CRM system was required. Positive & upbeat personality who loves to spend time engaging customers through phone, social media & email. Curiosity to learn; always be asking questions! Proficient with standard corporate productivity tools (email, voicemail, MS Office) and experience with sales & marketing automation tools like SFDC, Outreach, Zoom. Good multi-tasking, time management, high integrity.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Information Technology and Services, and Computer Software

description: 主要职责  负责多店管理，驱动业务发展，最大程度提升销售成绩  落实运营政策和流程来满足客户需求，同时帮助特斯拉达到销售目标  负责面试和候选人招聘，选择合适的人才帮助达成体验店的销售和交付目标  管理、培训和发展员工，帮助他们持续达成公司业绩标准  负责计划、执行和跟进体验店运营任务和项目，包括但不仅限于店外市场活动及销售渠道拓展活动  控制体验店成本，包括员工、供给和服务  坚持按照公司流程进行产品展示和库存管理  在当地团队实验并推广提高日常工作效率的方法,与同事及管理层分享最佳实践  在公司内外部沟通中代表特斯拉并保持专业和负责的态度  你的绩效将通过并不限于以下几个方面来评估：很好的管理多个高效的销售顾问团队能力，使得团队能够达成优秀的销售成果以及维持活跃的潜在客户群体；使团队能够达成交付目标以及为客户提供良好的购买及车辆交付的体验，处理好车辆购买及交付过程中发生的客户投诉 管理产品专员、销售主管、交付专员，鼓励销售团队积极主动的与潜在客户联系；跟进所有的销售并确保客户满意，保持良好的客户关系；管理车辆交付的过程，确保客户在交付过程中的良好体验。 开拓当地市场，提升品牌影响力。  员工须认真学习了解公司及产品的相关知识，并通过公司内部测试，否则将不能达到正式员工的标准和要求  以积极正向、职业成熟的管理方式带领和培养团队，并且在整个团队中发挥积极正向的领导作用，促进团结向上的氛围在整个公司层面的形成  和外部客户、外部人员,保持清晰、准确、职业、礼貌的沟通和内部同事保持良好的沟通和团队协作（包括与上下级之间；同部门、跨部门；同门店、跨门店；同地区、跨地区之间）  其他职责：根据业务发展需要，完成管理层指定的其他工作   职位要求  8年以上零售、行业销售、大客户销售经验，能够达到或超出销售目标；3年以上团队管理经验  优秀的商业拓展能力和商务谈判能力  对销售数据敏感，优秀的数据分析能力和逻辑分析能力  自我驱动，具有出色的时间管理能力，高度关注细节  认可特斯拉的创业公司文化，具备创业公司需要的心理素质  抗压能力强，能够适应在高速发展的环境中开展销售管理工作，达到公司业绩指标要求  良好的自我管理能力及自我学习能力  有能力同时管理多个项目，把控优先级，坚持按时达成业务目标  优秀的书面和口语沟通能力  优秀的和公司内外各层级人员沟通的能力  采用人性化的方式热情地投入销售管理和运营  具有建立合作型关系的能力，并作为一名受人尊敬和信任，他人乐于一起工作的业务伙伴  在零售店运营系统方面有扎实的知识和可以证明的工作经验  本科或以上学历

HENKEL IS FOR THOSE WHO STEP UP. DO YOU?  At Henkel, you can make a difference and craft your career. That’s why you own your projects and take full responsibility from an early stage. Our unique brands in markets around the world open up countless opportunities to follow your convictions and explore new paths. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset that allows you to always think out of the box - take the chance and shape the digital future together with us.  YOUR ROLE - Supports KAM / SKAM in steering key customers - Provides regular reporting (e.g. MS, P&L, NPI launch control, distribution, promotion overviews and listing overviews) - Develops cross-functional recommendations derived from above mentioned reports - Designs presentations of insights and recommendations in sales meetings - Monitors budget and invoicing process - Supports in monthly planning and tracking (sales forecast, promotion planning) - New channel development - Formulate strategies and action plans to deliver Sales target - Analyse market dynamics, real-time monitor/analyse KPIs, make/adjust sales operation, and find/define/evaluate new opportunities - Partner with customer teams to amplify/accelerate online store operation related to assortment, content, promotion, etc. - Effectively work with division finance, marketing, supply chain, and other stakeholders - Other sales related topics Your Skills 1、College Degree or above 2、1-2 years or above working experience in FMCG. 3、Good communication and good team player 4、Basic written and spoken English 5、Skillful operation of computer software Microsoft office. 6、Capable of working independently and self-motivated.

description: The Global Virtual Sales organization is one of Cisco's fastest-growing sales teams and is the talent engine for Cisco Sales with diverse and motivated teams that consistently deliver profitable growth. We serve our customer life-cycle through a series of selling motions to drive higher value and an optimal experience from Cisco solutions. We are a dynamic and international team that brings excitement to the sales floor every day. We connect Cisco customers with solutions that can transform their businesses and change the world for the better. We will provide you with a platform for success including: coaching, training and on-the-job learning that will strongly support you in your career advancement. You will discover an innovative, flexible and award-winning working environment leveraging the latest Cisco technology to enable and empower you to perform to the very best of your abilities. Our teams adapt quickly to respond to market changes and we are all highly encouraged to give back to our local communities. Who You Are If you enjoy selling in a changing environment, are achievement-oriented and believe in performance rewards for exceeding annual sales goals though strong collaboration with partners and internal stakeholders, we have a place for you.    Our minimum requirements for this role: • 2-5 years' experience in similar or adjacent industry, start-up or consultancy company. • The love for IT and ability to tap into technology. • Sales experience or Technical/Customer service background. • Fluent in Mandarin & English

Job Description Summary  This role will represent and act as a primary customer point of contact in the allocated accounts/territory and proactively build network with government bodies and Key Opinion Leaders as well as deep understanding of healthcare structure/players in assigned territories/accounts.GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  Responsibilities:  Achieve sales/orders targets for sales in assigned one accounts/territory while being within the budget allocated.  Target, get access, builds relations, develop a business strategy and maximize business opportunities for all GE Healthcare businesses, products & services within allocated accounts/territory.  Represents and acts as a primary customer point of contact in the allocated accounts/territory.  Proactively build network with government bodies and Key Opinion Leaders as well as deep understanding of healthcare structure/players in assigned territories/accounts.  Coordinate indirect deals for multimodality projects and aim at maximizing share of direct deals within your territory/accounts.  In Cooperation with Modalities and Marketing drive One GE Healthcare marketing events in assigned territory. Be aware of segmentation and targeting in healthcare system , and apply relevant product benefits to each client’s segment.  Analyze market trends, competition and accounts to develop a business plan and strategy that creates new business opportunities for all GE Healthcare products & services.  Provides on-going feedback to management, modalities, services and marketing  .Leverage Product Sales Specialists, Account Managers, Service and other Company resources to provide necessary technical equipment, service or clinical content to customers.  Coordinate One GE Healthcare team on strategic accounts in order to deliver solutions that meet or exceed customer expectations.  Develop & implement plans with Zone cross functional teams to achieve results through effective project proposals, negotiations, and contracts. Grow the share of wallet in assigned accounts (GE’s share of customer investments in Capital and Operational expenditures).  Develop & maintain a high level of customer satisfaction through consistent high quality interactions with customer management, drive customer on their accounts.  Build long term strategic alliance with portfolio of accounts to continue to add value.  Promote Service offerings, identify and escalate commercial service needs  Pro-actively monitor and escalate service issues to drive customer GE policies, procedures and Operating Mechanism. Proactively participates in company initiatives depending on organizational needs and as directed by management. Ensure knowledge of and compliance of integrity and company policies.  Geographic scope: Zone (could be a territory within Zone)  Qualifications/Requirements ：  Minimum 5 years relevant healthcare industry experience  Bachelor's degree  A proven track-record of achieving and exceeding sales targets, and a desire to grow new business  Experience understanding customer needs and business drivers and using this knowledge to develop account plans and strategies (knowledge of the existing account areas/channels would be advantageous).  Excellent interpersonal skills, including teamwork and communication skills  Persistence in developing prospects and customers, and ability to close business  Strong presentation, analytical and customer service skills  Self-starter, able to manage time and organize and prioritize workload  Inclusion and Diversity   GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.  Additional Information  Relocation Assistance Provided: No
industries: Hospital & Health Care, Medical Devices, and Pharmaceuticals

description: Job Responsibilities: 1. Plan sales targets, channel management, sales plans and budget plans, and implement them; 2. Cooperate with departments to jointly maintain key customer relationships and consolidate the company's market position and influence; 6. description: INTRODUCTION  Founded in 1856 by Thomas Burberry, Burberry is a global luxury brand with a distinctly British attitude. We are a global business with an extensive network of both owned and franchised stores across EMEIA, Asia Pacific and Americas. We are digital pioneers, and innovative technology underpins every aspect of our business, from product design to distribution and marketing. We believe that modern luxury means being socially and environmentally responsible; this mindset is core to our business and key to our long-term success.  JOB PURPOSE  提供令人鼓舞的店铺销售经验,最大化每天的销售额，支持店铺的日常运营  Responsibilities  持续性的为客户提供高品质的服务  个人形象符合品牌标准和公司着装要求  了解客户并选择适合客人的销售方式来开展销售。具备良好的产品知识、客服反对意见以及提供适当的附加项目(与销售相关的)  收集客户资料并建立客史资料库  有效处理电话预订、问讯以及店内各种促销活动  知晓如何处理客人投诉的程序.  知晓店铺销售目标，并努力达成品类及店铺销售目标  补充商品以确保店适当的店铺运作.  参与店铺盘点并确保店铺货品数量准确  确保所有的货品都有正确的标签和说明  协助店铺货物送递（如有要求）  知晓并有效地执行销售所有流程，比如：退款、换货、增值税、客人投诉、备用金 （现金、信用卡授权、订金)等  知晓并执行公司关于员工内部购买程序  知晓并遵守店铺有关健康与安全的程序并参加健康与安全、损失预防的培训（如有要求）  积极参与员工培训和店内会议  保证店铺日常的清洁  完成店长或管理层分配的其他任务.  在必要情况下能周末或者节假日上班  能在工作时间以外参与货品调配保证店铺运营顺利进行  执行管理人员分配的其他指责  PERSONAL PROFILE  具有服务意识,多样化,工作努力有上进心  掌握流利的英语和普通话  良好的沟通技巧  自我激励,完成目标  至少2年以上时尚零售行业销售经验, 奢侈品行业经验优先

JOB SUMMARY An intense 18 months SHINE Program requiring 3 challenging rotational assignments with a training curriculum to develop both leadership and commercial skills. This program is designed to attract, develop & retain commercial experts and future commercial leaders for SABIC. Program Design: 18 months Program 3 Job Rotation Assignment Leadership and functional training Coaching/Mentoring by Managers Regional exposure  JOB RESPONSIBILITIES Rotation: Understand the assigned market/industry/area and identify the value chains, build connections and maintain relationships with customers, handle daily affairs and manage the business. Cooperate with supporting functions to provide good service to customers. Find opportunities to develop new customers and new business, understand our products and study the relevant applications, translate the voice of customer into material requirements, and convert the opportunities to orders. Well utilize relevant systems and tools to conduct business routine and data management, facilitate sales promotion activities for business development, handle customers' demand in all business aspects to drive continuous improvement of customer experience.                                                Development Rotation: Analyze assigned industry/area to screen opportunities and understand customers needs, specify Specialties' solution in new applications by selling value propositions, make effective communication with customer to build targets for new biz development and build pipelines for continuous growth. Leverage multiple internal & external resources and collaborate with them to follow up the targeted opportunities to make sure real sales result, know industry & technology development trend, learn new product/application knowledge and emerging market to explore new development areas.                                                Operations Rotation: Learn and utilize systems/tools to manage daily operations, such as pricing decision and price management, demand planning and supply management. Work with commercial and SCM to ensure data accuracy, effectively formulate and execute operation plan for better company benefits. Make recommendation/proposal to improve/optimize existing tools and processes to help with operation and commercial teams improving productivity and optimizing operations.  EDUCATIONAL & JOB REQUIREMENTS BA above degree and preferred major in Science and Engineer 3-5 years working experience Demonstrated Success in Sales and/or Marketing Roles Strong Communication & Interpersonal Skills Project leadership Analytical Ability Good industry knowledge Change Agility Be flexible with mobility to other cities in China (Shanghai, Suzhou, Shenzhen and Guangzhou)

description: Responsible for developing and executing the Greater China HSGBU strategy and plan in close coordination with the local and APAC team • Responsible for Sales of Oracle’s Life Sciences & Healthcare Solutions and Services including Clinical Data Management, Trial Management, Safety & Pharmacovigilence, Healthcare Interoperability platform and Analytics • Responsible for establishing the Health Sciences infrastructure for revenue • Teamwork: Working closely with HSGBU Sales consulting, Services, Marketing & Alliances teams to drive bookings and revenue • Customer Satisfaction KEY RESULT AREAS: • Understanding of the Market/Industry and opportunity for Oracle’s solutions in each of the market segments in the defined territory • Developing & executing sales strategies based on the Territory Plan • Forecasting, Pipeline management & Managing the “Lead to Reference cycle” • Articulate Oracle’s message and build relationships with key client executives to determine their needs, business issues & establish Oracle’s Value proposition • Where-ever applicable, working with Partners in the defined territory to generate and mature the pipe • Participate in Industry Forums, Seminars and events to evangelize Oracle and generate leads • Identify PR initiatives and work with customer, partner and internal teams to create customer wins and “go-live” case studies. • Competitive Intelligence • Ensure appropriate alignment with all stake-holders in Country, APAC as well as HQ • Meet sales bookings/revenue targets POSITION REQUIREMENTS: • Strong business acumen, communication and interpersonal skills • Proven Sales Management track record in Greater China • Ability to work independently and with a team • Demonstrates a high level of understanding of tools & processes • Highly motivated self-starter, innovative and creative thinker • Professional with strong planning and analytical skills • Ability to manage key internal and external relationships at all levels

description: Job title:           Area Sales Manager. Location:          Central Shanghai. Reporting to:    National Sales Manager, China.   About the company:  Headquartered in Northern Europe, our client is a premium lighting brand with a 100-year of successful history across the globe. In close cooperation with world-class designers and architects, the company is now a key global supplier of architectural and decorative lighting.  The company started developing its China distributor's and retail networks in 2020. Up until today, there is a total number of more than 20 stores in major cities of China. Due to the rapidly growing market, the company is now recruiting for an experience Area Sales Manager (Wholesale Management) to join the team in Shanghai.   Job duties:  The primary objective of the Area Sales Manager is to expand its wholesale network in China by opening new road stores, and to enhance the Brand’s influence among customers. Details are listed as below:  Scouting for new distribution opportunities for the Brand. Being communicator of company>market / market>company including certain level of product management. Realizing and controlling of marketing plans together with trade marketing. Being the Brand’s ambassador and promoting its products at all the time. Develop and advise/support dealers – bring the Brand in focus! Ensure that customers are informed about products (existing and new) and lighting philosophy. Planning and executing customer events (road stores launches, product introductions/training, social events). Ensure wholesale systems and its products are perfectly displayed. Follow-up on sales activities and campaigns. Ensuring sales-excellence and maintenance of CRM system. Participating in relevant fairs (national and international).   Requirements:  Bachelor’s Degrees in commerce, business management, art, or other related disciplines. A minimum of 5 years of wholesales management experience gained in luxury / premium brands of consumer goods / or similar sectors. Successful track record of establishing and managing stores under similar environment. Successful experience of handling retail accounts for high end international brands. In-depth understanding in business expansion and daily operations within furniture, lighting, lifestyle, watches, jewelry, etc. sectors. Past experience and expertise in design or art related segments would be beneficial. Fluent in Chinese Mandarin and English.   We look forward to hearing from you  Mercuri Urval is the exclusive recruitment partner for this position. Mercuri Urval is specialised in Executive Search, Professional Recruitment and Talent Advisory.  To find out more about this career opportunity, send your CV to Leon.ma@mercuriurval.com (with email title: Area Sales Manager CN#00945) for a confidential discussion.  www.mercuriurval.com
industries: Consumer Goods and Luxury Goods & Jewelry

What You’ll Do Deliver a “consultative” approach to selling; taking time to understand customer's business, their goals, objectives, and challenges before recommending a solution. Consistently achieve quality pipeline & other metrics such as Inbound lead follow-up & outbound account engagement metrics. Manage territory creation plan for your key account executives & their accounts. Researching key accounts, identifying decision-makers, generating interest, and developing accounts to stimulate opportunity. Prospect, educate, qualify, and develop Target Accounts and inbound leads to create sales-ready leads and opportunities Quickly route prospects and current customers to appropriate colleagues to assist in solving problems and driving value. Nurtures & provides education on areas of interest for under-informed customers. Setup, attend & run qualification meetings with customers in partnership with relevant Account Executive & Solution Consultants. Updating CRM, Outreach, and other tools as necessary to ensure capture of key history & ensuring a smooth hand-off to the relevant Account Executive as necessary. Providing closed-loop feedback to ensure continuous process optimization. What You Need To Succeed Track record of successful business development in enterprise solutions, software, or tech sales environment. Self-starter with high motivation, independence, resilience, and ability to collaborate with sales & marketing teams to deliver pipe creation goals. Proven sales skills delivering inbound & outbound experiences and building strong relationships at multiple levels within an organization. Strong communication including listening, written, verbal skills (English, Mandarin) Experience managing all areas of the BDR process including account planning, pre-call preparation, opportunity qualification, and objection handling. Ability to quickly learn & understand sophisticated business problems & translate customers' needs into solution plays. Consistently achieving inside sales goals in an automated sales environment where accurate entry and management of lead data in a CRM system was required. Positive & upbeat personality who loves to spend time engaging customers through phone, social media & email. Curiosity to learn; always be asking questions! Proficient with standard corporate productivity tools (email, voicemail, MS Office) and experience with sales & marketing automation tools like SFDC, Outreach, Zoom. Good multi-tasking, time management, high integrity.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Information Technology and Services, and Computer Software

Company Description  “We’re not in the shipping business; we’re in the information business” -Peter Rose, Expeditors Founder  As a Fortune 500 company, Expeditors employs more than 15,000 trained professionals in a worldwide network of over 300 locations across six continents. Expeditors satisfies the increasingly sophisticated needs of international trade through customized solutions and seamless, integrated information systems. Our services include the consolidation and forwarding of air or ocean freight, customs brokerage, vendor consolidation, cargo insurance, time-definite transportation, order management, warehousing, distribution and customized logistics solutions. Expeditors is headquartered in Seattle, Washington.  Job Description  Scope of Position  The focus of the Global Sales Executive is on achieving results that are aligned with the overall organization and our strategic goals. Initiative, coupled with a sense of competitive drive, and the ability to stay focused on results despite changing conditions, are the keys to achieving the performance objectives of the Global Sales Executive role at Expeditors. Our Global Sales Executives are focused on driving business development on our larger, more strategic accounts.  The Global Sales Executive orchestrates involvement of multiple people in our Sales process, so that new customer revenue is consistently secured for our district offices and Expeditors network. The job environment is flexible, constantly changing, and provides growth opportunity, recognition and reward for the achievement of business results. This position reports to the District Manager and Regional Vice President.  Key Deliverables  These are the minimum results expected from a successful Global Sales Executive: Manage a list of Named Accounts, and demonstrate success at closing new logo and new business with target and prospect accounts based on established new logo/new business revenue expectations. Timely data entry in our Customer Relationship Management tool Orchestrate customer / Expeditors network relationship and collaborate with regional Product, Service, Geo, and Knowledge Management resources Participate in the creation of value-added solutions for customer’s logistics needs, including supporting diagrams and cost-benefit calculations Support the transition of new accounts through customer introductions, information transfer, and securing any necessary customer paperwork When needed, support AR (accounts receivable) collection Attend training & development sessions to continue developing selling skills and updating Expeditors Product and Service knowledge Working knowledge of industry trends and forecasts Take on additional assignments as required, supporting company needs Qualifications  Desired Skill-Sets and Characteristics The ability to meet with customers off-site on a regular basis Fluent in supply chain terms and concepts; including diagnosis, process mapping methodology, and decision-making cost drivers Oral and written proficiency in the English language Strong problem solving, organizational, and interpersonal skills Ability to work productively both individually and in a team environment Sense of urgency for goal achievement Self-motivated with ability to work in a fast-paced and constantly changing environment Comfortable with regular data entry on a laptop computer Strong rapport and relationship-building focused Empowered to make quick decisions in response to changing conditions Extroverted, confident, enthusiastic and persuasive Influences others to action Timeliness and accountability for results Minimum 5 years Sales experience Additional Information  Expeditors offers excellent benefits Paid Vacation, Holiday, Sick Time Full Social benefit; plus Commercial Insurance plan, Unlimited promotion opportunity Employee Stock Purchase Plan Training and Personnel Development Program restricted work from home choice competitive market overall package
industries: Logistics and Supply Chain, Human Resources, and Financial Services

description: Job Description Summary  Responsible for activities and processes that help the sales organization achieve business objectives Jobs at this level operate with some autonomy but are covered by well-defined Commercial policies or review of end results. The job allows modification of procedures and practices covering work as long as the end results meet standards of acceptability (typically annual volume, margin and compliance requirements). Responsible for medium-sized sales territories.GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  角色与职责  通过合作伙伴实现销售；协助并对合作伙伴进行流程和程序教育。 利用自身和他人的销售领域、产品线、市场、销售流程或客户群的深入知识，并运用分析思维和商业经验来执行政策/策略。 具有最佳实践知识以及了解自己的领域如何与他人融合；了解竞争以及在市场上与众不同的因素 运用判断力，并具有在设定参数之外提出不同解决方案的能力，以解决项目、产品线、市场、销售流程或客户的更复杂的日常问题。为决策制定信息优先级的能力。利用技术经验和分析思维。使用多种内部资源和自身团队之外有限的外部资源来帮助做出决定。 这些销售职位将主要由个人贡献者担任。此级别的职位需要强大的人际交往能力。充当经验较少的同事的资源。可能会领导具有低风险和资源需求的小型项目。说明信息；培养使团队成员就领域的话题达成共识的技能。传达绩效期望，并可以处理敏感问题。  基本资格  该岗位要求在领域具有较丰富的工作经验。学力水平相当于从正规高等院校取得学士学位 （或根据相应工作经验具有高中学历）  所需特性  优秀的口头和书面沟通能力。优秀的人际关系和领导能力。能够影响他人并领导小型团队。领导中等范围和影响的计划。能够同时协调多个项目。有效的问题识别和解决技能。可靠的分析和组织能力。  Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.  Additional Information  Relocation Assistance Provided: No
industries: Hospital & Health Care, Medical Devices, and Pharmaceuticals

description: Job Accountabilities:  As a member of the IWS sales leadership team, contribute to the development and implementation of the strategy Participate in and provide input to marketing and business strategic reviews and annual marketing plans Through sales and marketing networks and leads, ensure the obtaining of knowledge and understanding of market business trends, customers' expectations and current competitive position Direct, lead and coach the relevant sales activities through direct reports Establish and develop people resource and implement talent management and succession planning programmes. Complete annual regional sales audits and sales plans (including contingency plans) Ensure the production of phased sales plans and agree contents with PU sales manager Direct the implementation of the agreed sales plan for the region, ensuring the delivery of the results agreed in line with the plan Supply in major account multilevel relationship management and actively lead internal relationships Drive performance through monthly and quarterly reviews of sales, financial and people progress, monitoring versus plan Review the regional sales organisation to reflect the 3-5-year sales plan, go to market findings, cost to serve elements, and capability management Optimise effectiveness of resources in the setup of the Sales organisation  Requirements:  Minimum: Graduate. An MBA or equivalent degree would be value added  Significant sales management experience of handling a large territory.  Experience working in a matrix organization with complex customer interfaces  Well-rounded business experience to be able to implement cross functional plans  Strong people leadership experience  Experience in dealing with multiple important partners both within and outside the organization  Experience in dealing with key accounts and large, complex distributors  Territory Management through distributors  Role model the bp Values and Behaviors and Castrol Mindsets  Ability to develop and implement strategic and tactical business plans and to be hands on and drive the business with direct responsibility  A strong organization and people orientation to be able to build strong, capable and sustainable organizations  Agile thought leadership and action to be able to respond to changing market environments and dynamic business situations  Ability to work across functions and gain support from cross teams  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.    Grade GResponsible for managing a sales direct/B2B team to achieve or exceed assigned sales and profitability goals through the delivery of the sales direct/B2B strategy and financial performance targets (e.g. sales volume, gross margin and over dues) within an assigned territory, and supports the development and implementation of short and long-term strategies and customer retention programmes. The scope of the role will influence the grade - this can include financial accountability, geographical scope, leadership responsibilities and overall level of responsibility.

description: The Territory Account Sales Executive is responsible for expanding new business and renewals in key accounts to meet/exceed financial and business objectives. This job is assigned a sales quota and performance is measured by meeting or exceeding quarterly and annual targets by up-selling, add-on sale, and cross-selling. This position reports to an Industry Sales Manager.   Responsibilities Manage the full sales cycle, usually in complex deals, selling the entire portfolio of products and services into a defined set of major accounts Create strategic, effective and actionable Account Plans that define a clear growth strategy and a solid action plan across and within the covered accounts Develop and manage a healthy and predictable sales pipeline that meets or exceeds quota expectations Develop and close opportunities by ensuring that a virtual team which consists of both internal and external resources is well-organized and leveraged around accounts and opportunities Ensure that customers deploy the solutions acquired by working with team members on deployment plans and customer adoption of these plans  Minimum Qualifications 6+ years of proven sales experience account-oriented in Manufacturing industry, at least 2+ years in the field of application software products and services Extensive experience working in dynamic “virtual” account teams- inside sales, technical specialists, services, partners, and leading these teams towards a common vision/strategy for each account Preference will be given to candidates who can demonstrate knowledge of the business drivers within a variety of vertical industry markets An understanding of Autodesk technologies and sales experiences track in Automobile industry would be a distinct advantage Excellent verbal and written communication skills Must be a self-starter, able to work independently and as part of a team
industries: Computer Software, Computer Hardware, and Internet

description: HENKEL IS FOR THOSE WHO STEP UP. DO YOU?  At Henkel, you can make a difference and craft your career. That’s why you own your projects and take full responsibility from an early stage. Our unique brands in markets around the world open up countless opportunities to follow your convictions and explore new paths. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset that allows you to always think out of the box - take the chance and shape the digital future together with us.  At Henkel, we promote a holistic Diversity & Inclusion approach. The diversity of our employees, their backgrounds, experiences, talents, knowledge, creativity, and the appreciation of all their individual differences are the foundation for our competitive advantage. As a multinational corporation, Henkel employs people from 120 nations in almost 80 countries. About 85 percent of our employees work outside of Germany, with more than half of them in emerging markets.  YOUR ROLE To grow business by executing on KA strategies and driving excellence in Sales execution with defined key account. Responsible for revenue targets (top line and profit goals) as well as overall customer satisfaction Works with cross functional Henkel team(s) regarding account strategy, team member responsibilities and expectations Drives execution of key priorities and ACE sales opportunities Continuously maintain, elevate, broaden, and strengthen Henkel’s key relationships at the account Your Skills Bachelor’s Degree or above Should have 5-10 years of Experience in Engineering or Chemicals Fluent in spoken and written English

我们期待的人才： -      不限行业及背景，但能在各个领域做到一流 -      沟通技巧优秀，强烈的结果导向，快速学习及适应能力 -      多元化的团队管理及带教技巧和经验 -      高度认可特斯拉的产品及文化  职位描述： -      城市经理需要充满活力，具备优秀的组织能力、沟通能力、积极的工作态度，高效的执行力，以结果为导向，注重细节。该职位将通过全面管理门店日常运营，执行运营政策，协调相关团队资源，提高销售绩效，关注人才发展，提升客户和员工的满意度，提高区域的市场增量。在店长不在店面的情况下，作为代理店长工作。  主要职责：  销售目标达成及门店运营 -      全面负责所负责区域内门店日常运营，辅助店长进行人员管理培训，确保门店高效运行； -      确保门店所有陈列摆设符合特斯拉零售标准， 传递极致客服体验； -      高效跟进，执行销售政策，与销售相关团队紧密合作，处理日常客户问题，协助门店达成销售、交付目标；  人才培养与发展 -      以积极正向、职业成熟的管理方式工作，并且在整个团队中发挥积极正向的领导作用，促进团结向上的氛围在整个公司层面的形成； -      员工须认真学习了解公司及产品的相关知识，并通过公司内部测试，否则将不能达到正式员工的标准和要求； 满意度及团队协作 -      提升客户及员工满意度，建立充分的沟通和新人 -      和外部客户、外部人员,保持清晰、准确、职业、礼貌的沟通和内部同事保持良好的沟通和团队协作（包括与上下级之间；同部门、跨部门；同门店、跨门店；同地区、跨地区之间）；  其他职责： -      提升特斯拉市场声量 -      参与门店拓展、选址等商业决策 -      根据业务发展需要，完成管理层指定的其他工作  职位要求： -      8年以上零售运营管理经验，在零售店运营系统方面有扎实的知识和工作经验； -      自我驱动，具有出色的时间管理能力，高度关注细节； -      有能力同时管理多个项目，把控优先级，坚持在限定时间内达成业务目标； -      逻辑思维清楚，对数据敏感，沟通简洁高效； -      学习能力强，适应能力强； -      以诚信的态度管理销售业务以及店铺运营；能够发展合作型关系，做受人尊敬和信任的合作伙伴； -      持有效驾照和具备安全驾驶记录，至少2年驾龄本科或同等学历
industries: Automotive, Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, and Consumer Electronics

description: Description  We are looking for an energetic and results-driven individual with Account management experience to drive China-based NA sellers to maximize their presence and business in Amazon NA marketplaces. The Account Manager will partner with NA sellers, marketing team to grow sellers' businesses on Amazon NA including identifying opportunities, monitoring seller's healthy growth, performance, as well as working with sellers to achieve our standard and deliver the best e-commerce experience for customer on Amazon. The account manager will own forecasting, monitoring, analysis and reporting on CN-based NA seller business.  The Successful Account Manager Will Work with NA sellers to grow the selections to Amazon and their business with profit Work with NA sellers to drive the feature adoption rate to drive the customer experience on Amazon Work with NA sellers to achieve data quality standards and become an expert in using internal tools to achieve results Work with NA sellers to drive the seller performance and product quality to ensure best customer experience. Drive business reviews with sellers and do analysis to understand sales trends and drivers and develop recommendations on how to grow the business. Develop a thorough understanding of assigned product/industry category, including seasonality and NA marketplace business trends/events, and continually monitor competitor/industry developments Show super strong competency in delivering result, bias for actions, dive deep, ownership, earn trust and customer obsession  Basic Qualifications An Bachelor's degree or above 5-8 years successful track records of Account Management or BD experience in e-commerce/retail industry Proven track record in taking end-to-end ownership and driving results Strong verbal and written communications skills, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations Proficiency in Excel and/or other data analysis tools Strong analytical and problem solving skills Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects Work prioritization, planning and task delegation Proficiency in oral and written English Preferred Qualifications Previous working experience in e-commerce / FMCG / retail industry Have oversea experience in studying and living MBA from Top tier schools  Company - Amazon(Shanghai) Intl Trade Co  Job ID: A1684048
industries: Computer Software, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

description: The Oracle Health Sciences Global Business Unit (HSGBU) is a specialized business unit focused solely on the software and service needs of the Life Sciences industry. By delivering software solutions aimed at adding value to Life Sciences organizations the HSGBU has the opportunity to be at the forefront of enabling better patient outcomes within the industry.  The Health Sciences Consulting (HSC) delivery team within the HSGBU works with our Life Science clients to implement HSGBU software solutions that enable them to deliver innovative therapies, devices, diagnostics and optimized care processes to improve people’s health.  In this exciting role, you will join a growing team of Sales professionals, who work closely with Life Sciences organizations. Coming from a strong Field Sales background in the Healthcare and Life Sciences industry, you will be responsible for sales of Consulting Services to Pharma, Biotech and Contract Research Organizations in the Asia Pacific (APAC) region with a focus on China and South Korea.  The ability to hunt for new opportunities and grow the Sales pipeline is a must for this position. You will work with experienced solution architects and delivery professionals to support you. Experience in selling services/consulting are highly desirable.  Develop and manage sales strategy to drive new consulting bookings and revenue throughout APAC. Exercise judgment and business acumen when working with client executives to address their unique business challenges through Oracle Health Sciences applications and solutions.  Develop your relationship as a trusted advisor to the client, serving as the main point of contact, for communications through the sales process. Influence key decision makers who may affect sales outcomes. Maintain an on-going relationship with the client following the initial sale to identify additional opportunities for services or that extend Oracle’s footprint. Work with partners, alliances, application sales, and other internal Oracle organizations.  Ability to travel is a must. Responsibilities and job requirements  •     Responsible for selling the Oracle consulting services. •     Develop new accounts and/or expand existing accounts within an established geographic territory, industry, product segment, or channel. •     Grow Sales Pipeline and hunt for new opportunities. •     Qualify and develop value add propositions for the client. •     Able to network and develop strong business relationships with client executives but also across Oracle. •     Responsible for your accounts throughout the project lifecycle. •     Client contact is typically at all levels including executive and senior management level. •     8-12 years of relevant field sales experience. •     Life Sciences industry experience. •     Able to develop strong internal relationships. •     Able to network and develop strong business relationships with clients such that they turn to Oracle for their resource needs. •     Able to generate leads and submit proposals to the client utilizing a broad knowledge of Oracle service offerings. •     Able to generate consulting services and nurture and close the transaction. •     Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. •     Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization •     Possess Bachelors and/or Masters degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. •     Understanding of consulting projects and delivery methodologies. •     Knowledge of Drug Safety and Pharmacovigilance, Clinical Trial Management Systems and/or Clinical Data Warehousing products Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. That’s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.  Reasonable accommodations available for applicants with disabilities.
industries: Information Technology and Services and Computer Software

description: Job Responsibility Work with cross functional team to lead Supply Chain initiatives for customer Build relationships with key customers and external partners to drive account development aligned with the commercial strategy Drive the process for incorporating the operations and supply chain areas (order management, deliveries, value-added services, etc.) into the overall customer management process, from customer strategic planning through in-season execution. Lead NIKE teams and customers to achieve mutually agreed operations plans. Act as the voice of the customer to influence NIKE capability development and service offerings. Manage and coordinate the implementation of operational capabilities and services with key customers. Monitor and manage performance against service level agreements from both a NIKE and customer point of view. Find supply chain improvement opportunities by analyzing routine operation performance result Job Qualification: Above 5 years’ retail operation/supply chain experience in a major consumer driven MNC (FMCG, Consumer Durables/Electronics); Ability to work across multiple functions and drive action via the consensus and alignment with multiple internal (Sales, Customer, Customer Service (CS), S&C, Logistic team, etc.) & external teams (3rd Party vendors); Ability to clearly articulate goals and objective; work independently and cooperatively in a diverse group; Ability to network, influence, and utilize internal and external resources; Strongly data analytical skills with excellent Excel skill setup; Fluent English is a must for the role, both written and spoken.
industries: Apparel & Fashion, Consumer Goods, and Retail

description: HENKEL IS FOR THOSE WHO STEP UP. DO YOU?  At Henkel, you can make a difference and craft your career. That’s why you own your projects and take full responsibility from an early stage. Our unique brands in markets around the world open up countless opportunities to follow your convictions and explore new paths. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset that allows you to always think out of the box - take the chance and shape the digital future together with us.  YOUR ROLE Develop & execute global/regional Target Account strategy, focused on OEM applications that can use adhesives to improve their design processes, in collaboration with sales engineers Analyze customer’s potential of full value chain & identify scalable opportunities Win spec in’s/approvals at Design Centers/ Flagship sites, while supporting implementation to local sites through sales engineer network Steer joint innovation roadmap with customers & leverage USP to gain competitive advantage Develop sustainable & long-term relationships with global/regional Target Accounts Connect sales engineers around the world supporting global/regional Target Accounts, motivate & coach to achieve targets Your Skills Prefer 7 year or above working experience 4 year or above sales experience with 4 years business development experience Fluent English communication in both oral and written Ambitious / Self-starter Skilled negotiator / value-based mindset Comprehensive business acumen Effective communicator at all levels Willingness to challenge status quo Strong project management skills Preferred University degree in: Management, Engineering, Sciences
