description: Globalization Partners simplifies global business by enabling companies to hire great talent anywhere in the world, without the complexity of setting up foreign branch offices or subsidiaries. You find the talent, and we put YOUR candidate on OUR fully compliant, in-country payroll. This enables you to expand into almost any country around the globe – quickly and easily. Our platform enables you to leapfrog over the legal, HR and tax complexities without having to figure out “how” to do business in a foreign country, while getting all the benefits of a global team.  Globalization Partners’ Globalization Partners’ Global Expansion Platform™ enables you to hire in more than 170 countries within days, and without the need to set up costly international subsidiaries. You identify great talent anywhere in the world, and we put them on our fully compliant global payroll—lifting the burden of global corporate tax, legal, and HR matters from your shoulders to ours. Our systems are accessible at the touch of a finger via our software platform and app.    We make it easy for anyone to do business anywhere and hold ourselves to high standards of doing business by maintaining our triple bottom line philosophy that emphasizes happy clients, happy employees and happy shareholders. And not to brag, but we’ve won multiple awards for our culture, including being named as one of the Top 150 Company Cultures in America by Entrepreneur Magazine  Globalization Partners International Business, Simplified.  About the position: As a Sales Executive, you will be joining a team that is laser-focused on taking over the world, building a company we are proud of, and meeting the needs of 30,000 employers hiring internationally. With our record of phenomenal growth, we need to recruit the best of the best, with the potential to grow with us as we expand.   Responsibility of the role: The team is responsible for the generation of new revenues for Globalization Partners by meeting corporate sales targets. As a member of this key team, you would be responsible for meeting your individual sales targets and other metrics established by the Sales Manager.  What you will do:  You will be responsible for all aspects of the sales cycle including reaching out and following on both incoming and self-generated leads, generating deal proposals through to deal close. Although we close sales on the wire, this is a very consultative sales process, where we act as a trusted advisor to educate our clients about overseas expansion, and at the same time differentiate ourselves through our knowledge and client service. We are looking for someone with high energy, high integrity and exceptional attention to detail, who is focused on provide an outstanding client experience from the very first contact with Globalization Partners.   Responsibilities:  Understand prospective client requirements and validate their suitability for Globalization Partner’s solution Complete sales and achieve quarterly sales targets Meet activity KPIs set by your sales manager Build and sustain a strong understanding of the Globalization Partner’s solutions using the education materials provided Maintain a strong understand of the competitive environment by engaging in internal training, self education and research Follow up on company-sourced and self-generated leads from multiple sources including website, partners, sales team colleagues, trade shows, marketing campaigns, etc.  Proactively call prospects, build relationships by understanding their business and challenges  Educate prospects on the opportunities and benefits of our solution  Draft and follow up on proposals, overcome objections and close sales, while working to a quarterly sales target  Maintain a strong pipeline to meet assigned sales quotas and metrics  Identify potential prospects through LinkedIn, news feeds, online research, etc.  Constantly learn about our business, follow industry-related developments and maintain an entrepreneurial drive  Develop, maintain and engage in business related networking online via LinkedIn, Twitter (etc.) and physically through local networking and industry events Build partnership with sales executives in adjacent solutions to maximise lead opportunities Maintain high quality data in Salesforce   What we are looking for:  We are creating this company together as a team, so it is incredibly important that we have the best and brightest people all working together towards our common goals. In order to be successful in our culture, we look for the following demonstrated attributes:  Ability and experience in researching prospect industries and providing insight as relates to talent acquisition Ability to build and develop excellent customer relationships  Outstanding communication skills both written and verbal  Active listening skills  Attention to detail  Collaborative and support skills to team Presentation & product demonstration experience  Problem solving skills  Information gathering skills  Self-starter with strong time management & organisational skills  Ability to understand and explain complex solutions Successful record in selling solution in a remote environment  Qualifications:  Bachelor’s degree, preferably in a business discipline or equivalent  Minimum of 2 - 5 years’ experience in sales, with a track record in meeting sales targets and pitching to C-Level  Experience in global operations, or a B2B product with a financial focus preferred  Structured Sales training in established sales methodologies preferred International work and/or travel experience a strong plus. Experience working in a start-up environment an advantage  Very good English language skills Working knowledge of Salesforce or similar CRM preferred   “GP is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to ensuring that no candidate/applicant receives less favourable treatment or is unlawfully discriminated against on grounds of disability, gender, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, race, colour, religious convictions, age, nationality or ethnic origin.”

The Company offers solar energy products for any kind of projects, from small applications intended for individuals, up to very large government projects. Now we’re looking for some talents to join us due to the business expansion. Other tasks assigned by leader.   Required Skills： To be a successful export sales representative, you should have at least some of the following skills: 1.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to understand the clients' needs and interact with the vendors and the senior management personnel. 2.Self starter, outgoing personality with exceptional selling and negotiating skills to achieve the sales targets ultimately. 3.Ability to research and analyze the trends in the market and take appropriate decisions or suggest recommendations. 4.Proficient in language, where the products are being marketed. 5.Strong presentation skills, positive attitude and ability to work in a target driven environment. 6.Should be result oriented with good business acumen, computer literate with excellent time management and organization skills.  Education, Experience Requirements: 1.Bachelor’s or master’s degree with a concentration in marketing, promotions, advertising sales, or business administration preferred. 2.At least 3-5 years of industry/ international sales experience.    Note: please state your current salary and expectation, possible onboard date.

Qualifications Bachelor's degree in marketing and sales or related subject; master's degree preferred Hands-on experience in business development, marketing, sales and channel management Logistics industry background is a plus Ability to lead front-line business development and drive holistic sales transformation Maturity in dealing with both front-line workers and CXO executives Comfort with extensive travel (3-5 days per week) What You'll Do  You will work in small teams to build clients’ capabilities, systems, and processes to ensure our clients capture and sustain the anticipated bottom-line results.  In this role, you will have the opportunity to drive the transformation of marketing and sales. You will help design the go-to-market strategy and do the implementation with our client. You will also be involved in a variety of new business building related topics including product management, customer journey, value proposition, sales transformation, etc.  At McKinsey, you will receive exceptional training as well as frequent coaching and mentoring from your team. This support includes a Partner assigned to you to help guide your career as well as formal training throughout your McKinsey career. Additionally, you'll receive guidance and support from our Partners and professional development team in the selection of client projects, helping you to develop your skills and build your network.  Who You'll Work With  You will be based in our Beijing, Shanghai or Shenzhen office as part of McKinsey Digital. This group brings together the best of McKinsey’s digital capabilities to help our clients use digital technology to transform their businesses.  As part of this group, you’ll join a global team working on everything from IT modernization and strategy to agile, cloud, cybersecurity, and digital transformation. You’ll typically work on projects across all industries and functions and will be fully integrated with the rest of our global firm. You’ll also work with colleagues from across McKinsey & Company to help our clients deliver breakthrough products, experiences and businesses, both on technology and non-technology topics.  Our office culture is casual and social, with an emphasis on education and innovation. We have the freedom to try new ideas, experiment and are expected to be constantly learning and growing. There is also a strong emphasis on mentoring others in the group, enabling them to grow and learn.

The manager of sales coordination is responsible for increasing the sales of the village.  He directly manages a team of profit centres (boutique, spa, discovery, ski service - depending on the village) and is also responsible, in a cross- functional manner, for coordination and results of the sales areas of the village, such as VRL / VSL, sale of wine, bar sales, sports training, family services requiring a fee... He will support HQ sales and marketing incl. sales account maintenance, new account development, local market insight, offer recommendation, marketing content production, MICE group resort coordination etc.  As a manager of proximity, he accompanies and motivates the sales forces in the village to increase local sales performance and may, occasionally, participate in sales. JetBrains is a way of life. description: What does dLocal do?  dLocal is the #1 payments leader focused on emerging markets and helps some of the best companies in the world expand in emerging countries. Global brands such as Amazon and Google rely on us to increase conversion by eliminating complexity and managing their payments expansion effortlessly. As both a payments processor and a merchant of record where we operate, we make it simple and risk-free for our client partners to make inroads into the world’s fastest-growing, emerging markets.  What’s the opportunity?  dLocal is looking for a full-time, results driven talent for our growing sales team. The ideal candidate is merchant-focused and able to take smart risks based on solid strategy and deep customer understanding. Experience in payments and other financial systems is definitely a plus.  What will I be doing? Sell dLocal's payment solutions to e-commerce cross-border merchants and PSPs generating new business. Structure, implement, and manage growth-related operational strategies and processes. Identify opportunities to secure new business by establishing relationships with clients and prospects Build and develop long-term strategic partnerships with Global merchants. Close new business deals by coordinating requirements, developing and negotiating contracts Identify new sales opportunities within existing accounts to broaden the scope of services offered to existing clients. Maintain personal networks, participate in and attend professional conferences and industry events, and develop other means of generating interest from potential clients Help our sales team as a regional expert.  What skills do I need? Chinese resident who is passionate about emerging markets, open to constant change in an ambiguous, fast paced environment. A self-starter, open to work across time zones with teams from all over the world 5+ years of sales experience, preferably at a technology company, with a track record of top performance Experience in payments or other financial systems and thorough knowledge of the market Proven success partnering and working cross-functionally to make things happen Established business network Exceptional communication skills and ability to solve tough problems Team player who can effectively lead a project or participate as an effective team member as well as work cross-functionally with other organizations Proven deal closer and strong negotiator Native level Mandarin and fluent English are a must. Other languages are a plus! Able to travel domestically ~25% of the time  What happens when I apply?  First, apply so we can review your CV. We will then reach out to you by email if we find that your profile is a fit for our role and schedule a virtual interview via Google Meets with HR. You will be updated regarding the specific steps along the process. If you don’t hear from us this time, don’t worry! We’re constantly updating our careers page with new positions, make sure to come back and apply for a different one!  Check out our or our instagram @dlocalteam for more about dLocal!  Powered by JazzHR  UDuo5akO66

Are you able to quickly understand where individuals are and where they want to go and build trust and lead them down a specific path to generate big results? Are you able to challenge the status quo, engage customers in new ways and earn their trust and business? Are you ready to be intellectually stimulated and earn financial rewards along the way? Lead large scale transactions to close large scale deals Build pipeline, forecast business, lead the internal team, communicate key updates and competitive intelligence. Exceed quarterly and annual new and expansion software subscription, renewals, professional service and training business goals. About Our Top Sales Performers Minimum 8+ years of exceeding enterprise software sales targets Fast moving start-up and vertical use case driven experience Data management or Data warehousing experience Containers, Kubernetes and public cloud infrastructure technology knowledge and experience BA/BS or equivalent educational background Excellent English written and verbal communication skills The right person in this role has a huge opportunity to make an impact to our business. If you clearly match the above criteria - we invite you apply! An adventure in data awaits.  Cloudera is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. The applicant will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

May be responsible for medium-sized sales territories.GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  角色与职责  向合作伙伴和分销商销售或通过其进行销售。可能包括渠道销售支持和渠道开发职责。 对销售区域、产品线、市场、销售流程或客户群有深入的了解。利用先前的经验和获得的商业专业知识来执行政策/策略。 深入理解关键业务驱动力；用这种理解来完成自己的工作。深入了解自己团队的工作如何与其他团队融合并为该领域做出贡献。 大多数决策都在规定的框架内，但是对于项目、产品线、市场、销售过程或客户的最终决策具有一定的自主权。利用先前的经验和在职培训来解决简单的任务。拥有解决问题所需的技术技能和分析思维。可以使用自己团队以外的多个内部资源来做出决定。 此级别的职位可能由个人贡献者担任，且其具有成熟的人际交往能力。向直接相关的同事和业务部门传达所提供的设计和协调服务。为新团队成员提供非正式指导。在简单的情况下向其他人解释复杂的信息。  基本资格  该岗位要求在领域具有较丰富的工作经验。学力水平相当于从正规高等院校取得学士学位 （或根据相应工作经验具有高中学历）  所需特性  优秀的口头和书面沟通能力。优秀的人际关系和领导能力。能够影响他人并领导小型团队。领导中等范围和影响的计划。能够同时协调多个项目。有效的问题识别和解决技能。可靠的分析和组织能力。  Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.    Additional Information  Relocation Assistance Provided: No

description: Our client has a history of over 120 years and headquarters are located in southern Germany. It is a leading manufacturer of products for aerospace, automotive and industrial solutions in the world. The Group employs over 1,300 employees in 50 manufacturing plants and sales offices worldwide. The China’s presence was established 20 years ago in Jiangsu China. With the rapid development in the China market, the plant was growing continuously and is today one of the most profitable within the Group. About 80% of the local production are customized products for the Chinese market. Today, the China manufacturing facility has a total workforce of about 300 employees. In order to maintain the leading role within the group and to satisfy the future demand on high quality products in China, the company decided to extend the current sales team. The position will report to the German Director of Sales, who is based in Jiangsu.  Job Description: The position is responsible for Application Technology, Service Engineering and Technical sales for a major region in China. > Support the sales staff with technical support and joint customer visits. > Build & maintain good relationships with existing customers and develop new customers. > Develop own projects and provide colleagues with sales related information. > Define and implements regional sales programs. > Planning and execution of sales activities. > Coach & empower local sales teams.  Requirements: Ideally, the candidate should possess a Bachelor Degree. To succeed in this role, the candidate should be a hands-on personality with native German and good Chinese language skills. As a future team leader, he/ she should be a good communicator with a structured and systematic approach. Being loyal, confident and trusting, the candidate should be down to earth with an ambition to achieve success together with the teams.

This position is part of the Global Commercial Learning & Development Team and has a dual role: - Contribute with functional expertise to content development and support the deployment of selling skills training on a global scope - Manage/coordinate sales training activities in the territory - Make the link between territory needs and available global sales training by: Understanding territory needs & constraints to prioritize global content development accordingly Adapting and deploying relevant existing global learning tools and content to address territory needs  Key responsibilities: - Strategic role: Work with the territory leadership teams to identify learning priorities - Consultative role: Advise territory stakeholders on the best methods to address specific learning needs (including product launches) and support them in the implementation. - Tactical role: Coordinate sales training activities to ensure they’re aligned with priorities and are using the best available method/content: - Instructional design role: Contribute to the development of sales learning programs together with the Commercial L&D team - Facilitation role: deliver face to face and virtual classrooms or engage and support Subject Matter Experts for it.    Required skills and competencies:  Had previous experience in Sales and Sales Management At least 5-year experience in designing, developing and delivering sales training Experience in working in international environments Excellent proficiency in English and Mandarin   .

Automotive Sales team is responsible for developing and managing key accounts, implement sales plan and secure opportunities, grow relationships and revenue in assigned accounts. The selected candidate must have a solid track record in semiconductor sales, managing complex Automotive accounts (OEM's and Tier 1 suppliers). They will be results oriented, driven by excellence and work well in a matrix environment with peers in sales, product development, marketing, services and supply chain. Understanding of automotive electrical and electronics systems. Strong interpersonal, communication, collaboration, organizational, and time-management skills. Strong English communication skills both written and verbal. Very good presentation, negotiation and closing skills. Ability to work independently and within multi teams. Domestic and International travel required. Experience in negotiating complex deals that meet strategic revenue goals is a plus. Experience in navigating a multinational corporate environment to be effective in customer program execution and roadmap alignment is a plus. Resourceful and responsive to change – thrives in a fast-paced and dynamic environment with a strong sense of urgency is a plus.

description: JOB SUMMARY Albemarle China Lithium division is projecting significant revenue growth over the next few years, with strong demand from the EV battery industry and Auto OEMs. This role will be focused around understanding the value chain and working with these potential current and new customers.  This is an important role for keeping and developing key customers mainly from the lithium-ion battery industry, to assure a long-term relationship and sales growth with key customers.  Providing valuable market feedback to the business team will be a key focus area.  The individual with develop and implement account plans with clear account strategies and engagement plans while coordinating with the commercial leadership team.  This role utilizes the Challenger skills for value selling.  GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES  Manage assigned customers mainly for the electric-vehicle battery industry, including but not limited to long-term contracts and delivery specification negotiations, volume/price management and quality issue coordination. Owns the Albemarle customer interface with assigned customer portfolio as well as new customers within the value chain. Achieve/exceed sales objectives through both revenue & profit through value added selling. Develop and maintain account plans for key accounts, through deep understanding of customer value chain and their long-term development plan and competence. Includes the account strategy and engagement plan. Understands the EV battery value chain and communicates timely feedback to the commercial leadership team about competition and market price update, industry segment tendencies, competitive landscape, etc. Successfully negotiate, implement, and secure current and new business opportunities. Forecast accurate sales volume and revenues and meets/exceeds the annual operating plan targets. Build and maintain key customer relationships at various senior management levels and throughout new and existing customer organizations (high, wide, and deep). Develop, teach, and apply Challenger Selling tools and techniques to customer interactions. FUNCTIONAL SCOPE Implement sales strategy effectively and meanwhile able to manage customer expectation from a short term and long-term perspective Good communication internally for aligning sales strategy, product availability, sales process, etc. Able to own and analyze assigned business segments independently REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & CAPABILITIES  Organizational skills to communicate and align account activities/goals. Basic knowledge of chemical industry and chemical applications; Lithium knowledge preferred Strong negotiation skills and resiliency to tough situations. Ability to develop relationships and influence across multiple functions of customer organization Understanding of the Challenger Selling principles. Analytical skills to evaluate value chain, risks, growth potential of accounts, etc. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS  EDUCATION/QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor degree or above Good oral and written English Major in Chemistry/ Chemical engineering is preferred Experience in lithium-ion battery industry is preferred MINIMUM EXPERIENCE IN YEARS: At least 5-7 years sales/marketing experience

With more than 7,000 employees worldwide, Waters operates directly in 35 countries, including 15 manufacturing facilities, with products available in more than 100 countries. Working at Waters enables our employees to unlock the potential of their careers. Our global team is driven by purpose. We strive to be better, learn and improve every day in everything we do. We’re the problem solvers and innovators that aren’t afraid to take risks to transform the world of human health and well-being. We’re all in it together delivering benefit as one to provide the insights needed today in order to solve the challenges of tomorrow.

description: Global lead er of construction equipment provider National market coverage position with team management responsibility  About Our Client  Our client provides construction professionals with support, service and a wide range of machines, diamond tools and all accessories that you need to cut, saw, drill, demolish, grind and polish concrete. We let high performance meet usability and safety, making you ready to get the job done efficiently.  Job Description  Together with the Head office develop and implement the sales budget and monitor the cost and efficiency of sales activities in order to optimize resources and prioritize spending, and take full responsibility for sales turnover and profit/loss for the China mainland Sales. Deliver consistently accurate forecasting information in order for the Production teams to plan accordingly. Monitor and report actual sales in the region and make forecasts on a client/ project level and establish targets for product mix, sales volume, market, share and business development and monitor the performance of the sales organisation against these goals to pursue the annual target achievement. Leading the sales team, push the sales force manage and actively work together with the distributors including to monitor, analyse, and evaluate market trends, consumer behaviour, and competitors activity in order to identify market opportunities. And to identify and contact major leads and to develop these into projects, aligned with the company's competitive advantages. Further develop the local sales and make sure the market is effectively and efficiently covered and monitored. Proactively manage key customer accounts to maximize potential revenue and secure future sales opportunities. Provide the support to distributor, together with the distributors identify potential training needs both within product training as well as sales training and arrange training programs, in order to assist distributors to build a strong sales forces, dedicated to selling out products. And actively work with customer satisfaction, investigate and feedback customer complaints and take corrective action when necessary. Actively work with increasing sales within present segments as well as develop sales within new segment. Lead and develop the sales team, includes recruitment and competence development of staff, maintaining and further developing the company culture and retention of staff then further influence the distributors. Work together and support by marketing activities to drive sales growth such as exhibitions and customer and distributor seminars. Ensure that the distributors and the staff are acting in accordance with our code of conduct.  The Successful Applicant  Bachelor Degree in Sales and Marketing or trade with interest in technical products or degree in engineering with additional competencies in sales & marketing or trade. Solid experience in the construction equipment industry and extensive experience from sales management in China Proven track record of sales team management with leadership experience. Ability to manage distributors and assist them to build strong sales teams who are dedicated to selling products and extensive experience from industrial sales both direct and through distributors. Ability to build relationships with key customers that are at high levels within their organizations Ability to develop him/ herself as well as distributors and staff. Ability and willingness to take unpopular decision for the good of the company. Excellent Communications and presentation skills Good command of written and spoken English Honest and responsible Knowledge of both European and Asian business and organizational culture. Customer oriented and flexible Quality oriented Basic Financial skills Personal characteristics a self-starter with developed entrepreneurial and leadership skills Driven and business oriented Assertive Pro-active with good interpersonal skills Result oriented and high performance Used to work under pressure  What's On Offer  Team leading responsibility, full authority for marketing development, attractive salary package. The manager of sales coordination is responsible for increasing the sales of the village.  He directly manages a team of profit centres (boutique, spa, discovery, ski service - depending on the village) and is also responsible, in a cross- functional manner, for coordination and results of the sales areas of the village, such as VRL / VSL, sale of wine, bar sales, sports training, family services requiring a fee... He will support HQ sales and marketing incl. sales account maintenance, new account development, local market insight, offer recommendation, marketing content production, MICE group resort coordination etc.  As a manager of proximity, he accompanies and motivates the sales forces in the village to increase local sales performance and may, occasionally, participate in sales. Perimeter: all points of sale of the village, internalized or subcontracted.  He reports to the Chief of Village (CDV) and dot line to HQ Commercial Development Director Supervision and tracking of sales ·        In resort sales: o   Is responsible for the PNL and internal control of all profit centres that report to him directly, communicating the local sales objectives, establishing/proposing action plans and tracking results. o   Assists the Manager (RDS) with analysis of the customer base before the stay (with occupancy information), obtains information about their consumption behaviours (via Gouvernail) And makes sure of adaptation of the offer as a result in respect of service standards o   Alerts the chief of village and Development Manager for local sales of the zone or the contact in the zone in case of customer dissatisfaction or non-placement of the product in the profit centres, which he manages o   Is familiar with the contracts within his perimeter and ensures that they are executed accordingly o   Within the framework of subcontracting, is the principal contact of subcontractors in the village, monitors their activities and is responsible for their proper integration into the commercial dynamics of the village   ·        Local sales and marketing: o   Support indirect sales team in sales account maintenance and new local account development; o   Update HQ with local marketing insight, competitor information and performance; o   Provide offer/product recommendation following market trend; o   Coordinate and align between HQ and resort on markting campaigns and events, sales promotion and activities; o   Support marketing content production in resort; o   Support MICE group resort coordination.Makes sure of respect of product standards and pricing policies in the village (including respect of rules on discounts, gratuity...) Sales coordination ·        Is the conductor of development of local sales in the village by identification of sales opportunities, while also optimizing margin and sharing resources ·        Is responsible for implementation of the sales policy at the village in line with the Club Med spirit and for the resources necessary for attaining the objectives of each point-of-sale (product offering, merchandising, teams) ·        Develops action plans in coordination with the Room Division Manager or front desk manager, to draw local clients, from outside the village, validates them with a the CDV after consultation of the zone services and organizes the implementation of them ·        Supervises the weekly cross-functional sales committee meeting ·        Supervises the incentives and sales challenges, organizes the sharing of best practices ·        Shares his diagnostics and action plans with the zone services, proposes changes of the offer (product, pricing policy, communication...) to maximize sales ·        Makes proposals to the Meetings & Events Manager regarding sales activities and assists him in handling requests ·        Sets the stage for sales activities by coordinating with the Ambiance Manager and/or the events teams of the village Management and coaching of the sales team ·        Coordinates and assists the Village teams to develop sales ·        Supervises, challenges and assists the teams of the profit centres under his responsibility with their action plans ·        Plays a coaching role with the sales forces of the point-of-sale in the village in collaboration with the Trainers Team (UDT) and the VTMs of the zone ·        Identifies profiles of salespeople in the village to develop them and make them relays for sales in the village ·        Maintains the teams during the “win over” phase: identifies signs of lagging motivation, creates conditions of motivation and sustains them ·        Communicates objectives defined by the zone and evaluates the managers of profit centres managed directly ·        Is consulted by the chief of village for evaluation of the managers of other services on attainment, or absence thereof, of "business" objectives ·        To successfully carry out cross-functional coordination, the Sales Coordination Manager works closely with the Managers of each service and the Sector Managers (Room division, F&B Manager, Ambiance Manager etc.) He proposes sales action plans and ensures motivation of the teams and of the “all salespeople” global dynamic   v CA/HD result, gross margin for HD, GM Feedback all profit centres, respect of Quality standards for implementation of action plans for optimisation of sales and margin Professional skills: v Excellent technical proficiency and in the domain of sales in the broader sense v Excellent capacities for team management and team coordination v Capacities of analysis, synthesis, structuring v Ability to communicate and present with conviction  Personal qualities: v Very good relational and teaching skills, attentive v Results-oriented v Rigour and organization v Autonomy, ability to make decisions and adapt v Leadership, charisma v Good negotiator v Reliability v Ability to see the big picture v Energy, dynamism, persistence, tenacity IT and languages v Fluent Chinese and English v Strong proficiency with IT tools (Office Suite)

description: SHINE Program Highlights An intense 18 months SHINE Program requiring three challenging rotational assignments with a training curriculum to develop both leadership and commercial skills. This program is designed to attract, develop & retain commercial experts and future commercial leaders for SABIC. Program Design: A 18 months Program Three Job Rotation Assignments Leadership and functional trainings Coaching/Mentoring by business managers Regional exposures  JOB RESPONSIBILITIES  Sales Rotation: Understand the assigned market/industry/area and identify the value chains, build connections and maintain relationships with customers handle daily affairs and manage the business. Cooperate supporting functions to provide good service to customers. Find opportunities to develop new customers and new business, understand our products and study the relevant applications, translate the voice of customer into material requirements, and convert the opportunities to orders. Well utilize relevant systems and tools to conduct business routine and data management, facilitate sales promotion activities for business development, and handle customers' demand in all business aspects to drive continuous improvement of customer experience. Marketing Development Rotation: Analyze assigned industry/area to screen opportunities and understand customers’ needs, specify Specialties' solution in new applications by selling value propositions, make effective communication with customer to build targets for new biz development and build pipelines for continuous growth. Leverage multiple internal & external resources and collaborate with them to follow up the targeted opportunities to make sure real sales result, know industry & technology development trend, and learn new product/application knowledge and emerging market to explore new development areas. Business Operations Rotation: Learn and utilize systems/tools to manage daily operations, such as pricing decision and price management, demand planning and supply management. Work with commercial and SCM to ensure data accuracy, effectively formulate and execute operation plan for better company benefits. Make recommendation/proposal to improve/optimize existing tools and processes to help with operation and commercial teams improving productivity and optimizing operations.  JOB REQUIREMENTS BA above degree and preferred major in Science and Engineer 3-5 years working experience Demonstrated Success in Sales and/or Marketing Roles Strong Communication & Interpersonal Skills Project leadership Analytical Ability Good industry knowledge Change Agility Be flexible to work in other cities during rotation (Shanghai, Suzhou, Shenzhen and Guangzhou)

description: About Oracle NetSuite: Oracle NetSuite is the world's leading provider of cloud-based business management software. NetSuite helps companies manage core business processes with a single, fully integrated system covering ERP/financials, CRM, E-commerce, inventory and more. Named by Gartner as the fastest growing financial management software vendor on a global basis, NetSuite netted two prestigious CODiE Awards in 2013 from the SIIA including Best Financial Management Solution and Best Cloud Infrastructure.  Working at Oracle NetSuite: Picture yourself building a successful career at Oracle NetSuite—working alongside talented, driven individuals to help fast-growing, mid-size organizations and large enterprises achieve their business goals with the world’s #1 cloud-based business management suite, including ERP, Financials, CRM, Ecommerce and PSA.   Responsibilities: Develop strategic territory plan for achieving annual quota and business growth by hitting your monthly, quarterly and annual revenue targets. You must be capable to drive demand generation with multi-strategy and orchestrate internal and external resource to achieve pipeline generation goal. As Snr Sales Professional, you need to be comfortable and capable to operate fundamental demand generation activity, social selling, as well as leading large scale of demand generation campaign. Engage with prospective clients to position Oracle NetSuite solutions via electronic and face-to-face customer meetings; Prospect, consult and sell business application solutions and related services to prospective new mid-market business customers; Work with your prospects to learn their business, understand their needs and determine how the NetSuite solution can best address their issues; Build successful customer relationship/ partnership and success references in Hong Kong Market Capable to maintain Sales forecast accuracy and consistency with in-depth account coverage, deal management and win plan. Be able to effectively and efficiently use internal system to manage pipeline and forecast. Strategic Leadership – leverage and Orchestrate available internal and external resources including solution consulting, professional services, marketing, industry experts and management to drive success of GTM and Sales execution with Objective to over-achieve quota.   Requirements: Hunter mentality with demonstrated success building pipeline, progressing pipeline and wining deals; Be able to think Short – Mid- Long term Market Development. Tenacious and extremely results driven. You want to be at the top of the leader board and hate losing. We are looking for quota killer, not quota achievers; ERP Solutions sales experience is a definite plus; Be capable and Experienced selling to C-level executives and senior management at mid-market-sized accounts; Be able to lead strategic discussion with C-level leaders. Be eager to acquiring/applying industry expertise successfully in sales cycles; and continue learner. Someone who has been recognized for his/her performance and received additional responsibilities and/or promotions; Very strong communication and presentation skills; Mature Emotional Quality, be able to take stress and handle tough business case. You care about creating success for your customer and promote them into happy and reference able clients.   Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. That’s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.

Job Description Summary  负责管理和开展公司指定区域指定产品线的分销商关系，完善渠道和区域管理，同时达到市场占有份额目标，以完成规定的区域和客户的销售指标和利润目标。 GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  Essential Responsibilities  • 在指定的区域内完成公司下达的销售指标；  • 执行公司的市场策略和销售政策；  • 为分销商提供产品支持，协助分销商达成销售指标；  • 在指定的区域开发/建立并维护良好的分销经营渠道；  • 建立和维护客户的长期关系，提高客户的满意度；  • 利用销售工具收集/分析所在区域的市场情况，寻找潜在的机会，提供准确的市场预测；  • 开展和组织所负责区域的市场推广和销售活动；  Qualifications/Requirements  • 大学本科或以上学历，医学，临床背景优先；  • 3年以上医疗器械/耗材分销商管理经验或直接销售经验；  • 高度诚信和敬业精神，遵守公司相关规定；  • 较强的市场开拓和沟通能力及优秀的谈判技巧；  • 能用英语阅读专业资料并写作，熟练操作电脑；  • 卓越的对内对外沟通技能；  • 团队工作的技能（包括寻找和利用各种资源达成目标的能力）  • 良好的演讲技能  • 能够承受相应压力，并拥有自我学习的意愿和能力。  Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.  Additional Information  Relocation Assistance Provided: No

description: EARLY DATA is a digital market intelligence agency specializing in using artificial intelligence & machine learning to capture, process and analyze big data. We collect, analyze, and visualize massive amounts of Digital Data from eCommerce, Social Media, and Food/Beverage sites, unlocking insights for our customers to keep them competitive, engaged with customers, and aware of the latest market trends. EARLY DATA strives to maintain our position at the forefront of China’s booming Digital landscape. EARLY DATA is looking for a savvy and experienced sales person to expand the company’s go-to-market for its data products, subscriptions, and services. Qualified candidates would hit the ground running - solving real problems for enterprise clients and working underneath an experienced management team. You will benefit from being surrounded by highly talented professionals who both share ideas and are willing to learn. With the industry that we are in, the clientele that we work with, and the team that is in place – EARLY DATA employees enjoy great opportunities for growth and professional development. We are looking for a highly motivated self-starter, who will lead our sales and client development efforts across China. The ideal candidate is someone who wants to spend the majority of his time meeting clients in the field, discussing their problems and opportunities, is able to understand how data can help them meet their goals. The candidate must have experience and a proven track record in achieving new business within Consumer Products and have strong deal closing capability. Responsibilities: Utilizing a variety of sources, identify and target potential customers, make appointments with clients to demonstrate company products. Work with leadership team to develop highly effective sales materials and presentations. Present EARLY DATA services to clients, with ability to show how services help clients solve problems and achieve their goals. Collect market information, directly from clients or from other sources, & provide to the leadership team. Maintain records of all interactions with qualified prospects, manage and track a high volume of prospects in our sales database. Working with Marketing/ Sales personnel, drive to achieve Lead Generation, Pipeline, & Revenue targets. Desired Skills and Experience: Degree or other qualification, ideally in Business, Economics, or related field.  Must have experience in Consumer Products related Manufacturer, Agency, Retailer. Have proven track record in lead generation, getting meetings with key decision makers, presenting new services and ultimately closing deals. Willing and able to penetrate new clients and get meetings. 3-6 years of sales and/or account management experience with data or related agency. Ability to understand and demonstrate how data can help potential clients. Understand how Sales and Marketing organizations work, able to talk to middle to senior level personnel in these organizations. Strong deal closing capability with both the business decision maker and purchasing departments. Must be Native Mandarin Chinese speaker. English ability helpful but not necessary. Must embody the core values of EARLY DATA: Accountability, Commitment, and Communication Salary: Base salary depending on qualifications + heavy commissions/incentives for meeting sales targets.

公司描述  Fermentis works with everyone in the world of beer, wine, spirits and other fermented beverages. Its range of products and services covers almost all professional requirements: from safeguarding production to expressing sensory characteristics. Born in Lille in the North of France, Fermentis is a Business Unit of the Lesaffre Group; global key player in yeasts and fermentation solutions. For over 165 years, Lesaffre has been focused on yeast and fermentation, and all related applications, with currently more than 69 industrial plants and 11,000 employees worldwide.  Fermentis has a recognized know-how in the fermentation industry allowing the development and production of products adapted for beverage applications based on the research of more than 570 R&D experts. Its wide variety of products has been specifically created to meet the quality requirements of fermented beverage producers around the world, focusing on the development of aroma and character.  职位描述  Location could be based in Shanghai or Beijing Assist Area Sale Manager (ASM) in the preparation of sales & marketing budget (Budget) Reports monthly sales results and/or assist in sales analysis upon request. Reports on the action plan status. Marketing studies/research Carry out studies to confirm projected production volumes in the targeted segments, e.g. by assessing economical & political drivers country by country. Identify and lobby key contacts (influencers, decision-makers), key organizations, technical institutions and associations for each segment. Carry out field visits to end users and distributors, as per Fermentis definition and requirements (company information, technology, yeast purchases, etc.). Update customer Database accordingly. Identify business opportunities and key prospects. Establish contacts with business/sector related trade organizations, research organizations, other suppliers - as per instructions of ASM. Monitor competitive activity by identifying and following up competitors organization and product & services offer. Report to ASM.  Technical sales Visit existing accounts / distributors, target and potential customers (see Yearly Sales Planner) in accordance with the call frequency defined for each market segment (see Yearly Marketing Plan), developing strong relationships with customers. Deliver technical presentations to customers. Prepare sales offers in accordance with the guidelines of the ASM. Provide technical support to direct customers and distributor (technical advice, assistance in trials, operators trainings…). Seek assistance from Technical Sales Support (TSS) in agreement with ASM, as and when required. Promotion Identify opportunities of promotion and report to management. Promote Fermentis products within the trade, highlighting their technical and economic benefits and raising Fermentis as the expert in the industry. Take an active role in the promotion of products through technical publications, paper and poster presentations, seminars, and participation at international and national trade shows, conferences and seminars - as per instructions of ASM. Prepare technical presentations for seminars, conferences, tradeshows, etc., according to a specific plan agreed with management. Seek assistance from Technical Sales Support (in agreement with the ASM), as and when required. Assist the ASM in the organization of seminars and events with customers / distributors. Distribution networks To accomplish yearly objectives and action plans (market coverage, sales objectives, promotional activities, new product development…) with distributors, reporting progress on a quarterly basis. To provide distributors with continuous technical, commercial and marketing support. Organise training as and when required. Seek assistance from Technical Sales Support (in agreement with the ASM), as and when required. Sales administration Liaison with Sales Administration department of each Lesaffre affiliate operating in the territory assigned, and/or other shared services, ensuring good customer service and satisfaction from order capture through to delivery, invoicing and payment. Quality To follow up complaints from customers. Liaison with ASM, DOS and/or TSS as and when required.

description: The Sales director - China is responsible for generating revenues from China based advertisers by selling advertising and content marketing solution from BBC World News Channel, BBC Studio Channels (BBC Knowledge/Earth Channel, BBC.com and other upcoming commercial platform BBC Studio will develop and made available for advertising. The Sales director with the support of sales team both in-house sales staffs, creative solution team, sales planner and external (media representatives) generates ad sales revenues from China and maintains overall responsibility for key direct clients as well being the overseeing manager for our media reps in China. Sitting in the BBC Studio Beijing office, this person is also responsible for collaboration with BBC Studio China team on sponsorship and block sales on terrestrial TV of non-news content once the platform is ready, this includes but not limited to Explore collaboration with TV production/co-production/format sales team among identified group of clients from China. Explore product placement opportunity for destination brand/technology brands within the BBC local format show e.g. Top Gear China, Dancing with the Stars etc. Explore event sponsorship opportunity with LIVE Event team (e.g. Planet Earth Concert) among identified group of clients. Selling content licensing + advertising package hybrid deals to a group of potential partners. Developing commercial strategy and joint hands exploring new collaborations and business model  A key contributor in Asia Leadership Team, the Sales director: Leads the sales team to delivers the sales revenue target for the assigned area of responsibility – ALL CHINA Maximises new business potential from advertisers and agencies Work closely with BBC Storyworks team – our inhouse creative agency to pitch content marketing and creative solutions we can offer to help brands and clients tell their stories to the BBC audiences. Management of an in-house team including: sales persons, creative solution managers, sales planners and other potential role created in China. Engage with our media reps in China directly to identify new business opportunities and empower them achieve revenue target set for them. Management of the reps in China including setting targeting, communication of the BBC latest update, motivating and performance tracking, pipeline management. Leads the sales team to manages direct sales opportunities and delivers compelling proposals and pitches to secure business, an identified corporate (in house) client list will be provided for direct interaction and engagement between the Sales director and client. Works closely with the VP, North Asia to develop China strategies and business plans for long term opportunities. Market and sell BBC.com/Chinese and other BBC commercialised opportunities in China Collaborate with BBC Studio in China to develop sponsorship opportunities and syndication ad-sales opportunities. Promote and advocate the BBC brands in China, be the face of BBC Provides regular sales updates and forecasts to the VP, North Asia on current revenue and the sales pipeline  Success in this role relies on an in-depth knowledge of the media industry (especially digital media) and a comprehensive understanding of BBC Advertising products and services. The ability to forge senior level relationships and develop trust and loyalty with key clients are also key skills for successful performance.   This is a role for an experienced and versatile sales person with significant managerial responsibility who is equally competent at prospecting for new sales opportunities and developing existing accounts.  Good to have : Fluency in English & Proficiency in Mandarin.  May require to: Skillset in bridging conversations between different markets and culture and nuisance. Late hours may be required owing to necessary communication with teams based in other geographies and time zones Travel required domestic China or overseas

A)       PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES § Manage regional licensees: -       Implement regional Category plan / strategy -       Develop & execute appropriate local market category plans  § Develop, implement and achieve yearly revenue budget for the category.  § Ensure licensees have full understanding Disney’s business standards, directions and strategies. Manage licensees to achieve yearly targeted budget.  B)      DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF ALL RESPONSIBILITIES  1.    Strategic Management -       Implement regional category plan / strategy. -       Develop local market category plan in line with regional strategy & plan. -       Undertake market analysis to follow or proactive meet trends & regulations, monitor sub-categories and retail performance, and determine & develop Disney’s segment share. -       Determine category key drivers (franchise, products, price, and retail channel) for DCP to expand brand presence consistently with retailer needs. -       Contribute to regional discussion of the category on behalf of the local market.  2.    Category Management -       Develop, implement and achieve yearly revenue budget -       Identify & contract new licensees instrumental in the development of the category -       Identify product, franchises, and channel gaps and ensure that the plans in place to fill the gaps. -       Manager Contract Renewals based on category plan. -       Assist the establishment of efficient distribution services. -       Provide account management to top licensees for long term business development. -       Coordinate with DCP Compliance Group to ensure licensees comply with Disney’s labor standards. -       Ensure licensees’ thorough understanding and compliance of Disney’s contract, terms and conditions. -       Identify and develop manufacturing centers of excellence (global and regional). -       Regularly communicate with Key licensees and conduct performance reviews (quarterly).  3.    Retail Management -       Work with key retail account to manage Disney’s product range and presence at retail. -       Work with buyers from key retail accounts to develop business opportunities, managing product sourcing, mix / range, pricing and new programs specific to each retailer’s shopping profile. -       Act as communication link between Disney and licensees and retail buyers. -       Conduct retail accounts performance review and marketing update (quarterly). -       Identify signage and merchandising needs.  4.    Creative Management -       Direct product development with DCP Product Developer consistently with category plan and ongoing product quality improvement program. -       Administer and coordinate licensee’s product approvals with DCP Product Developer.  5.    Finance Management -       Responsible for the category budget & bottom line responsibility. -       Provide category forecast on quarterly basis (revenue grading). -       Responsible for collection past due accounts receivable.  6.    Marketing Management -       Coordinate with DCP Retail, Sales & Marketing team to support sales promotion, events and advertising in the local market. -       Work with DCP Retail, Sales & Marketing Team to ensure better understanding of consumer profiles and market needs. -       Ensure appropriate licensees implement the Disney visual merchandising programs.  7.    Information Systems -       Maintain competency in DCP business systems Ø Insight (Contract Admin. & Royalty reports) Ø INvision (Forecasting/Budgeting) Ø SAP (Travel expenses & Purchase Orders)   C)       WORKING RELATIONSHIP  Internal                 -      PRC Other DCP LOB & Business Units -         Regional Licensing LOB. -         Global Licensing LOB  External               -       Licensees (existing and potential)      -            Key retail accounts -            Manufacturers     D)   ACCOUNTABILITY         (In $, human resource and other terms)  § Timely implement global, regional and local market Category strategy / plan.  § Achieve or exceed revenue as per budget.    E)   REQUISITE QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE  1.    Education - University graduate, preferably Marketing or Business Commerce.  2.        Minimum of 5 years working experience in related industry at merchandising, marketing or sales related undertakings.  3.    Personal Attributes § Intelligent, self-directed, self-starter, good ability to work within a team. § Good analytical skill and understanding of business and financial concepts. § Strong interpersonal and communication skills § Strong negotiation and presentation skills. § Committed to excellence.   4.    Other requisites, languages § Fluent English and Mandarin. § Hands on experience on PC software applications (e.g. Word, Excel & PowerPoint)

Job Description Summary  Customer facing staff responsible for winning business Jobs at this level operate with some autonomy but are covered by well-defined Commercial policies or review of end results. The job allows modification of procedures and practices covering work as long as the end results meet standards of acceptability (typically annual volume, margin and compliance requirements). Responsible for medium-sized sales territories.GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  Primary Responsibilities:  Key responsibilities include (but are not limited to):  Financial performance:  • Develop and execute Digital channel strategy & initiatives, Strategy planning (for 3 years)  & SII planning (for 1 year)  and forecasting for alternative channel segment, for public business covering both premium and primary care market  • Responsible for growth, coverage win/lost and penetration of the end user market within different channels   Channel Effectiveness :  • Work with the GEHC Channel management team and sales team to define Digital channel structure, enhance the utilization of existing channels with a view to integrate and simplify where appropriate, help formulate strategies for identifying, developing and managing new channels by leveraging synergies   • Apply methodology to drive channel effectiveness and improvement initiatives  • Apply standards, programs and create Op-Mechs for performance reviews  • Share standards, best practices and capabilities across the other regions  • Coordinate and ensure effectiveness of recruitment, onboarding and management of channels   Channel Development:  • Identify key segments, initiatives, territories and product lines for region to help drive effective and efficient Go-to-market strategy and team structure  • Work with the GM and sales directors to define appropriate coverage model for the region. Identify channel competitive landscape by region/zone and work with the corresponding managers to develop and execute strategic response.  • Cultivating long-term relationship with strategic channel partners to support business growth.  Compliance:  • Create a culture of highest integrity and compliance within channels.  • Enforce compliance standards, perform rigorous due diligence on channels and oversee compliance audit programs  • Maintain region risk profile within accepted standards   • Adhere to and uphold highest standards of compliance to relevant international and local Regulatory and GE Healthcare Promotional Codes•   Adhere to GE and GE Healthcare compliance policies, codes and training requirements  Qualifications Required:  • Bachelor’s degree or above  • At least 8 years’ experience in Healthcare related sales or marketing management  • Rich experience in the management of indirect sales channels • Direct and indirect leadership experience  • Dealer compliance management experience a plus  • Strong executive presence with exceptional ability to present to C-suite level decision makers• Proven success of business coaching   • Strong negotiation skills  • Proven coordination and influencing skills to set and drive an agenda with third parties• Customer focused mindset with proven ability to respond quickly to internal and external customer needs  • Ability to build rapport, energize and influence people  • Analytical with strong ability to present findings in a concise and simple manner  • Interpersonal flexibility, tolerance and listening skills  • Strong ethics and integrity and compliance orientation  • Good English and local language speaking  Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.  Additional Information  Relocation Assistance Provided: No
industries: Hospital & Health Care, Medical Devices, and Pharmaceuticals

Position Summary  The Area Sales Manager (ASM) is in charge of the Monster Business in his Territory, and reports directly to the Regional Manager. The ASM manages all sales-generating activities and relationships with his/her Coca-Cola Operating Unit in order to develop retailers and wholesalers in the assigned Territory. The main role is to increase top-line sales revenue while following strict brand guidelines in terms of profitability (promotional rebates) and brand visibility (approved artworks and merchandise items). The ASM will focus on delivering superior execution in Impulse Channel (General Trade, CVS, and Petro/Gas outlets). The ASM will be a leader who can train, lead by example and motivate the Coca-Cola Sales Organization to execute the planned activities and deliver the expected results.  Essential Job Functions Execute partnerships with wholesalers, retailers, and distributors in order to grow the portfolio of Monster Energy products in the assigned territory. Apply a sales strategy to target key markets and establish a dominant presence in the Territory; execute promotional programs and activities with key partners. Manage sales forecasts and budgets to achieve established goals to deliver profitable growth for assigned Operating Unit. Manage sales reporting obligations in a timely manner to include frequent sales updates, pricing surveys, etc. Keep abreast and report on products, categories, innovations, market conditions, competitive activities, advertising, and promotional trends. Other related duties as assigned. Position Requirements Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience, preferably in Business, Marketing, or Finance. Up to 5 years of sales experience in Retail, Wholesaler, or Distributor sales environment. Fluent in Mandarin, some basic knowledge of English Proficiency using Excel, Word, and PowerPoint Flexibility to travel as needed locally Demonstrated track record of sales achievement in a hands-on sales environment. Proven knowledge of Wholesalers, distributor, and retail customers. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to establish good relationships and credibility with customers and wholesalers; ability to collaborate at all levels Excellent at managing time, priorities, and expenses Able to work independently while being a team player
industries: Food & Beverages, Consumer Goods, and Retail

description: Qualifications Undergraduate and/or master’s degree with a strong record of academic achievement 8+ years of sales experience (B2B/B2C) with leading companies in consumer goods industry preferred Leadership experience in directly managing a team of 10+ subordinates Proven ability to identify insights in industry, build sales system, drive business and manage P&L Ability to identify opportunities for growth and subsequently take a leadership role in exploring new ideas Proven experience in applying strong structural thinking and well-developed problem-solving skills (quantitative, conceptual, analytical) Comfortable with significant client interaction and interest in building relationships Strong interest in and passion for coaching or mentoring others Strong computer skills in MS Office especially in PowerPoint Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English and the local office language(s) Comfort with extensive travel (4-5 days per week) What You'll Do  You will work in small teams with colleagues and clients to build the capabilities, systems and processes needed to deliver both top-line and bottom-line results and ensure those results will be sustained.  You'll have the opportunity to manage projects including tracking metrics, handling complex analyses and preparing communications to report back to client and internal leadership. You'll develop practical recommendations and contribute to team discussions on implications of analysis, identifying implementation challenges. You'll work alongside the client’s staff on each project, assisting with different work streams. This could include facilitating working sessions with front-line and supervisors, connecting and motivating the client team or developing skills of McKinsey or client team members when appropriate, principally through coaching. You'll also solicit feedback from team members to develop your own skills.  Moreover, in Lanyue project, you will also lead a small team to complete the implementation of the project. You will also communicate with the leadership team about the progress of the project, problems faced and future expectations.  Who You'll Work With  You will be based in our Beijing, Shanghai or Shenzhen office as part of McKinsey's Lanyue team.  Lanyue provides continuous, distinctive support to our clients to ensure they achieve and sustain the full benefits of Lanyue recommended changes. Our consultants are involved from strategy through execution with a disciplined eye on impact and sustainability at every stage of the project life-cycle.  You’ll work closely with our client project teams, providing end-to-end support to ensure the clients are able to deliver and sustain the full benefits of McKinsey’s recommended change in their business.
industries: Consumer Goods, Cosmetics, and Food & Beverages

description: Company Description  Harsco is recognized for technical leadership and worldwide experience in virtually all major aspects of railway track maintenance. We enable railroads to operate at peak efficiency over smooth, precisely aligned track that increases railway safety while reducing fuel consumption and other key operating costs. Our broad array of equipment and services support every type of railway operator, from major national and international railway systems, to short lines and high-speed urban transit networks.  Job Description  Position Summary:  Mainly act as sales for the railway parts imported from the US to China Railway customers, also for the customer in Taiwan, Hong Kong as well as South Korea; build up a very good communication with the customers and understand their real needs and respond to get the issues addressed asap; responsible for contacting the customer for quoting, pricing, contract setup, delivery execution, cash collection; record and analyze the sales data to adjust the planning, advise or optimize the inventory items; occasionally visit the customer mainly the dealers in the region he or she covers to understand the market development..  Job Responsibilities Complete a circuit of a contract setup, following the up-to-date status, delivery, and the cash collection. Promptly respond to any of the inquiries and make solutions accordingly. Report and review the sales of the revenue and forecast monthly. Pricing strategy according to the market change.  Qualifications 2-3 years of above experiences in the business or related sales. Experience with the international import &export sales is preferred. Education with undergraduate or above. Can write and read in English.  Additional Information  Disclaimer  This job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not intended to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this position.

description: Company Description  “We’re not in the shipping business; we’re in the information business” -Peter Rose, Expeditors Founder  As a Fortune 500 company, Expeditors employs more than 15,000 trained professionals in a worldwide network of over 300 locations across six continents. Expeditors satisfies the increasingly sophisticated needs of international trade through customized solutions and seamless, integrated information systems. Our services include the consolidation and forwarding of air or ocean freight, customs brokerage, vendor consolidation, cargo insurance, time-definite transportation, order management, warehousing, distribution and customized logistics solutions. Expeditors is headquartered in Seattle, Washington.  Job Description  Scope of Position  The District Sales Manager (DSM) leads our District Sales Program. Through the development of our District Sales team, the DSM ensures a consistent and effective District Sales Program inside every one of our global offices. The DSM is responsible for supporting the growth of each product and service within the district as well as driving collaboration with the global network.  The DSM is responsible for recruiting and developing sales executives both at entry and senior level positions in addition to maintaining an on-going pipeline of candidates. Through leading a vibrant District Sales Program and Sales team, the DSM maintains the momentum and Sales consistency which results in steady and ever-increasing revenue and market share growth for the district and the company. This position reports to the District Manager and Regional Sales Leader.  Key Deliverables  These are the three primary areas of focus for a District Sales Manager. The minimum results expected from a successful DSM are presented below by area. In addition to these, the DSM will be required to take on additional assignments as required to support company needs.  Lead the Sales Program Create and maintain the vision and strategy for the District Sales Program; Assess market trends and communicate them to the District and Regional leadership teams; Maintain an effective Marketing approach aligned with our branding guidelines, to include consistent customer proposals and communication, as well as hosting regular customer events; Work with district and regional Product and Geo leaders to facilitate development of any product initiatives. Manage & Develop the Sales Department Actively engage in closing large opportunities with the Sales executive team; Secure sufficient Sales personnel to effectively engage the district’s customer base. Continually recruit and interview to find new potential candidates; Create and manage the Sales Department budget Facilitate weekly Sales meetings for Sales, Product, and Geo communication and collaboration; Review and coach Sales team towards expectations; Ensure that the team is prepared to successfully transition all new business; Create and manage career development plans for Sales Operations and Sales Executives; Conduct weekly one-on-one discussions, monthly pipeline review and quarterly performance reviews. Qualifications  To be the most effective in this position we are looking for the following skills and experience: Strong oral communication, written communication and analytical skills Strong presentation skills; Proficient in Microsoft Suite (e.g. Outlook, Word, Excel , PowerPoint) Align with Expeditors’ 10 Culture Attributes; 5 years of management experience working a team of 3 or more Ability to perform and meet KPI requirements; Contract negotiations experience; Structured and organized; Effective at delegating; Charismatic with an ability to connect; Ability to understand local market and key industries present in the local market. Additional Information  Expeditors offers excellent benefits Paid Vacation, Holiday, Sick Time Full Social benefit; plus Commercial Insurance plan, Unlimited promotion opportunity Employee Stock Purchase Plan Training and Personnel Development Program competitive market overall package
