jobTitle: Associate Sales Manager, E-Commerce - Ali Group
description: CREATIVITY IS OUR SUPERPOWER. It’s our heritage and it’s also our future. Because we don’t just make toys. We create innovative products and experiences that inspire, entertain and develop children through play. Mattel is at its best when every member of our team feels respected, included, and heard—when everyone can show up as themselves and do their best work every day. We value and share an infinite range of ideas and voices that evolve and broaden our perspectives with a reach that extends into all our brands, partners, and suppliers.  The Opportunity:  Mattel China is currently seeking a Associate Sales Manager, E-Commerce - Ali Group to join the E-Commerce Sales Team. Reporting to the E-Commerce Manager, National Key Account, this role will be responsible for developing the Tmall channel strategy to accelerate Tmall business.  What Your Impact Will Be:  Develop Tmall channel strategy for coming years to accelerate tmall business. Manage and achieve the financial objectives for tmall business. Identify the key business driver for Tmall platform and work out the sales and marketing plan together with the team according to the sales target. Lead the team to significantly improve Tmall fundamentals including right assortment, promotion mechanism, co-marketing campaign, etc. Work with TP to leverage big data to drive brand awareness and leverage CRM to drive consumer loyalty. Build joint business plan and strategic relationship with TP and Tmall. Other duties as needed or assigned.  What We’re Looking For:  5 years+ experience in E-commence, Tmall platform management experience is preferred. Strong leadership to lead team and TP to achieve sales target with great passion. Have great consumer/channel insights and can turn the insights into plans. Positive mindset.  What It’s Like To Work Here:  We are a purpose driven company aiming to empower the next generation to explore the wonder of childhood and reach their full potential. We live up to our purpose employing the following behaviors We collaborate Being a part of Mattel means being part of one team with shared values and common goals. Every person counts and working closely together always brings better results. Partnership is our process and our collective capabilities is our superpower. We innovate At Mattel we always aim to find new and better ways to create innovative products and experiences. No matter where you work in the organization, you can always make a difference and have real impact. We welcome new ideas and value new initiatives that challenge conventional thinking. We execute We are a performance driven company. We strive for excellence and are focused on pursuing best in class outcomes. We believe in accountability and ownership and know that our people are at their best when they are empowered to create and deliver results.  Who We Are:  Mattel is a leading global toy company and owner of one of the strongest catalogs of children’s and family entertainment franchises in the world. We create innovative products and experiences that inspire, entertain and develop children through play. We engage consumers through our portfolio of iconic brands, including Barbie, Hot Wheels, Fisher-Price, American Girl, Thomas & Friends, UNO and MEGA, as well as other popular intellectual properties that we own or license in partnership with global entertainment companies. Our offerings include film and television content, gaming, music and live events. We operate in 35 locations and our products are available in more than 150 countries in collaboration with the world’s leading retail and ecommerce companies. Since its founding in 1945, Mattel is proud to be a trusted partner in empowering children to explore the wonder of childhood and reach their full potential.  Visit us at https //jobs.mattel.com/ and www.instagram.com/MattelCareers .  Mattel is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer where we want you to bring your authentic self to work every day. We welcome all job seekers including minorities, females, veterans, individuals with disabilities, and those of all sexual orientations and gender identities.

Description  At Amazon we continually look for opportunities to invent on behalf of our customers, helping them to find and discover virtually anything they want to buy online. To this end, we are building a range of advertising products that enhance customer experience and are integrated with our core e-commerce platform. We have developed products that demonstrates Amazon's strength as a world-class e-commerce platform and have integrated advertising into the shopping experience from first discovery to purchase.  The future of our business is compelling and we are focused on building a robust, innovative business enabling advertisers of all sizes. We start with the customer and work backwards in everything we do, including advertising. If you're interested in joining a rapidly growing team working to build a unique, world-class advertising group with a relentless focus on the customer, you've come to the right place.  In support to the Amazon Advertising business, Ad Success Team (AST) are building a group of energetic and highly motivated Account Managers. As an Account Manager you will work with a portfolio of advertiser accounts and be responsible in helping them meet their advertising goals via opportunity identification and account optimization. Additionally, an Account Manager also gets the opportunity of testing internal tools, gathering & sharing insights with the internal product and engineering teams.  To be successful in this role, you will be expected to use your analytical skills, help the advertisers in growing their existing business and develop new business opportunities. You will carry business goals and will be measured on key metrics aligned to the sales and account management team goals. You will need to be technically savvy with an interest in online advertising, good at data, well organized, able to multitask, and possess excellent verbal and written communication skills. You will also need to be self-motivated to get on phone calls with advertisers to explain the optimization recommendations and the paths to resolution. The ideal candidate is someone having strong commitment to the success of our advertising customers and having a proven track record of exceeding goals.  Core Responsibilities Include Taking complete ownership for a portfolio of accounts – Standard and High Value advertisers Flexible to work in rotational shifts and make proactive outbound calls to generate leads Establish strong relationship and trust with local and global stakeholders Leading kickoff calls with advertisers and driving discussion using a preset agenda, as and when necessary Analyzing account performance against key metrics to identify, recommend, and implement optimization solutions to increase efficiency and meet clients' goals Identifying opportunities to improve Amazon Advertising products based on customer feedback, data analysis, and feature gaps with competitive products Working with external teams, such as Sales & Marketing team and Product team, to identify and solve issues blocking advertiser performance Basic Qualifications Include  BASIC QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor's degree in a business discipline 2-4 years of work experience in sales/marketing Have managed global clients along with owning up their individual performance goals Outstanding verbal and written communication skills in English and Mandarin Advanced computer literacy, especially in Microsoft Office applications – Excel, Access, Word and PowerPoint Ability to think strategically and creatively while executing methodically with high attention to details, operational excellence, and ability of multi-tasking Demonstrated ability to work in a cross-functional and international environment, to lead by influence and earn trust at all levels Preferred Qualifications Include  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Master's degree in Digital Advertising or other related disciplines Experience in e-commerce or retail industry Passion for online advertising and proven track record of delivering outstanding results Experience in data analysis, interpreting data and making business recommendations Demonstrated ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously Google Ad Words / Bing Ads certification  Company - AmazonInfoSrvs(BJ)-Shanghai  Job ID: A1738238

description: Job Description  This role will be responsible for assisting the Sales Manager of Rail to work with Rail customers/OEMs/Sales Dealers to achieve the sales target for MTU Greater China.  At Rolls-Royce, we pioneer the power that matters to our customers, to society and to the planet.  MTU is one of the world’s leading suppliers of drives and power systems for marine applications, for heavy land, rail and defence vehicles, and for the oil and gas industry. In the traditional spirit of pioneers and inventors such as our founders, Wilhelm and Karl Maybach, and Rolls and Royce, we work to develop solutions that are fit for the future. These include our 10,000 kW diesel engine, our ecologically sound co-generation module, and our innovative injection systems.  Key Accountabilities： Assist Sales Manager of Rail for sales in China market. Attend to sales calls, enquiries and complaints and liaise with MTU Greater China for the follow up. Assist Sales Manager of Rail to review / clarify customer’s requirements / specifications and provide technical solutions / scope of supply for projects with standard scope, or non-standard scope. Assist Sales Manager of Rail to develop, schedule, coordinate and evaluate sales activities for customers (up to commissioning of the product) within the assigned region. Assist Sales Manager of Rail to cooperate with application engineering teams of MTU Greater China and China operations to handle and follow up projects and sales orders technically and commercially. Assist Sales Manager of Rail to prepare and update records of potential customers. Assist Sales Manager of Rail to prepare and update data for sales and country reports. Any other assignment from time to time Qualifications and Experience:： undergraduate Degree for major of machinery or diesel engine application related is requested. Excellent English speak/write skills Frequent business trip is needed We offer excellent development, a competitive salary and exceptional benefits. These include bonus, employee support assistance and employee discounts.  Pioneer the performance of the future. Join us and you’ll develop your skills and expertise to the very highest levels, working in an international environment for a company known the world over for brilliance and innovation.  Beyond tomorrow  We are an equal opportunities employer. We’re committed to developing a diverse workforce and an inclusive working environment. We believe that people from different backgrounds and cultures give us different perspectives. And the more perspectives we have, the more successful we’ll be. By building a culture of respect and appreciation, we give everyone who works here the opportunity to realise their full potential.  You can learn more about our global Diversity and Inclusion strategy here .  So that you can be your best at work and home, we’ll consider flexible working arrangements for everyone, in any role. Member of ASI GROUP and created in 2008 in Shanghai, ASI Solutions is a Trading and Supply Chain Services company that provides bespoke solutions for international businesses with a special focus on the Fashion, Cosmetic and Food & Beverage sectors and etc.. Incubated by ASI Solutions, Foodgates is a digital web platform that enables French and European Producers to sell their product directly to Chinese market. The goal of this platform is to cut most of the intermediaries and digitalize the current food import processes, from the farm to the table. The platform is already live and is now beginning its operation.  This is demanding but rewarding position with multiple responsibilities. The main scope of the position is to setup and lead Foodgates sales BU, to grow sales and profits, to ensure the clients satisfaction. You will also work in close collaboration with ASI Logistics, ASI Solutions, and Foodgates France team to develop synergies. www.foodgates.cn  Responsibilities - Responsible for the development and performance of cross channel sales activities in assigned sales territory. - Maximize the sales and expand the customer base in line with company target, vision and values. - Coordinate with all the department to ensure customer satisfaction and provide premium services to build foodgates name and reputation in the market - Provides accurate and competitive offers to customers while striving to maintain target profit margin - Develop new customers by focusing on key players with important potential to ensure high efficiency. - Visit the customers on regular basis to maintain contact and provide proper service level - Submitted accurate records of all sales, promotion and activity reports per customer per channel - Be an example in areas of personal character, commitment, organizational and selling skills, and work habits. - Cooperate with logistic department to ensure proper communication on special deals and promotion, and support Customer service centre to ensure customer satisfaction:  Qualifications & Requirements Related working experience in the food distribution sector, or F&B; Good negotiator to communication skill; Business oriented, creative and well-organized; Fluency English both in writing and speaking; Mastery of the software such as office suite;  If you’re interested in this position, please send your resume and cover letter to: ping.zhao@group-asi.com.

Kpler is the leading provider of data intelligence for the commodity markets. Our software aggregates data from hundreds of sources including radar and satellite imagery as well as logistics, governmental and shipping databases. By connecting the dots across fragmented information landscapes, we bring our clients - mostly commodities producers, oil and gas companies, trading houses, public utilities and shipping companies, financial institutions and hedge funds - unique, real-time understanding of supply and demand in the commodity markets.  The company has offices in 6 countries and 7 locations (Paris, London, Brussels, Dubai, Singapore, Houston and New York). With individuals of various backgrounds, diverse skills and international experiences, being global & inclusive is in our DNA!  The Sales Team at Kpler is fun, diverse and self-driven. We love to build relationships and to challenge the status quo. Our main goal is to bring value to our clients by leveraging our technology and data intelligence. We are proud to offer a solution that improves business performance and brings disruptive innovation in the commodities market. Join us!  What you’ll do  The Sales team is looking for a highly motivated New business Sales Manager who is excited at the idea of selling a disruptive technology solution in the commodities market and finding new Clients and maintaining some clients’ relationships through new sales, renewal, upsells and cross-sells!  More specifically you will:  Make daily contacts by emails, chats, and most importantly by phone. We want someone who is not afraid of cold calling. Setting up meetings and interacting with senior decision makers and following up on trials and troubleshooting queries. Maintaining accurate customer and sales information in our internal CRM. We are looking for people with a great drive and team spirit, who can multi-task and can offer solutions! Experience in the commodity space, ideally selling a game-changing data solution in the dry bulk (coal, iron ore and grains) and freight industry in Asia Pacific. Work alongside internal teams including pre-sales and research teams to engage new users   You are or have...  • Around 4-10 years of working experience in a sales role (exposure to the energy market would be a strong plus)  • Excellent Chinese and English level and great presentation skills with an excellent ability to convince and relate prospects and clients. • Experience in Sales selling solutions in the Energy, Commodities and/or selling B2B SaaS or data solutions. • Strong interest in building client and product knowledge • Driven and self-disciplined. You can work in autonomy without much guidance and thrive in unstructured, fast-paced, ever-changing environments • A team player who always puts the business first with an eye on maximizing you and your team’s long-term gains • Excellent customer service, listening and negotiation skills • Ability to analyse complex client requirements and needs • Great attitude and motivation  COVID update: This role will be initially remote but candidate must be authorized to work in China and located in Beijing or Shanghai.   And you REALLY want to join us because...  • We offer the best product in the market and are effectively disrupting our market • Our growth is exponential: we build new features and products everyday! We frequently tackle brand new business areas which means we never run out of new clients!  • We are still small enough that you can truly join a rocket ship and shape your career! • You’ll get to work in a truly global work environment: With offices in 6 countries, we come from more than 20 countries and speak more than 15 languages. This also means, we close large global deals which you will get to participate in! • We offer competitive compensation - including commissions - & benefits and are looking for feedback and opportunity to improve them everyday!  Our People Pledge  Kpler is committed to providing a fair, inclusive and diverse work-environment. We believe that different perspectives lead to better ideas, and better ideas allow us to better understand the needs and interests of our diverse, global community. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives and are an equal opportunity employer.

companyName: Don Nelson Recruitment Ltd / Don Nelson Care
description: Regional Sales Manager - Shanghai, Beijing, Chengdu *This is a fully remote position.  KEY REQUIREMENTS •          Must have a great hands-on track record of delivering sales in a start-up mentality. •          Must have deep experience selling to neurosurgeons, and neurologists. •          Must have a strong local network in the region. •          Strong interpersonal and presentation skills. •          Ability to work independently with little or no supervision •          5+ years in neuro focused sales in a fast paced, high reaching, ever changing software or technology sales environment •          BA/BS degree in relevant major required. Graduate degree preferred. •          Acumen in virtual selling scenarios •          Self-Starter that takes initiative, works with limited direction, customer focused mindset, and pursuing rapid growth mindset. •          English language skills preferred.  RESPONSIBILITIES •          Own regional sales number, revenue targets, and sales projections. •          Utilize resources to ensure timely and accurate forecasting utilizing Hubspot CRM system. •          Manage a complex sales process across multiple hospital departments that includes surgery, IT, radiology, legal, and purchasing.  •          Establish and pioneer thought leadership in connectomics and functional brain mapping in geography. •          Utilize tools to target effectively and find high profile targets in geography.  •          Effectively manage transition of initial sale and installation to the Clinical Account Manager team to drive procedural volume and rapid adoption. •          Communicate effectively with neurosurgeons, neurologists, psychiatry, IT, and MRI departments.  •          Work with medical education and marketing to ensure effective strategies and fill key events.  •          Collaborate with Clinical Account Managers to effectively target newly opened markets.  •          Partner with the marketing team to ensure effective marketing strategy.   PERKS & BENEFITS •          Competitive salary, plus ESOP plan •          Flexible and remote working - we value work-life balance   ABOUT THE ROLE Our client is looking for an experienced and qualified Regional Sales Manager to join their team in growing sales. They are driven and passionate about delivering a novel new neuroscience software to revolutionize neurological research and clinical care. To succeed in reaching the targets, they are seeking committed colleagues who can stand behind their core values of teamwork, commitment, and integrity. They are currently hiring in Shanghai, Beijing, and Chengdu regions. Role will include multi-province territories determined by the VP of Sales.   The ideal candidate would be a dynamic, self-motivated, tactical thinker with a proven track record of finding early adopters. As a sales professional, you will operate strategically to find the right targets, the right influencers, reduce the sales cycle, and sell with a customer service mind-set. This role will be calling on global thought-leaders in the fields of neurosurgery, psychiatry, rehab, and neurology.  As a key member of a cutting-edge machine learning driven tech start-up, our client is looking for an individual who will own the concepts and become expert in this new space and contribute creative strategic ideas back into our business and technical teams.

Overview: Astera Labs Inc. is a fabless semiconductor company who is a leader in developing purpose-built connectivity solutions that remove performance bottlenecks in compute-intensive workloads such as artificial intelligence and machine learning. To support rapid international business growth, we are hiring Regional Sales Executives who are living near our customers in Beijing, Shanghai, Shenzhen and Taipei and have experience selling semiconductor products for high-speed communication protocols like PCIe, Ethernet, Infiniband, DDR, NVMe, USB, etc.  Job Description: Regional Sales Executives will work closely with Field Sales Engineers (FAEs) and the sales management team to develop an account strategy to effectively engage with leading cloud service providers, server and networking OEMs to design in Astera Labs’ portfolio of connectivity products.  Responsibilities: Develop a regional sales plan that identifies target customers, size of Astera Labs sales opportunities and outlines steps to effectively engage and develop relationships within key influencers in R&D, Procurement, Executive level GM/CTO. Drive sales efforts by teaming up with FAEs to engage with customers to provide roadmap updates, technology training, product sampling and technical support. Be a strong voice for your customers to communicate their product roadmap feedback, customer support issues and to drive a timely response from Astera Labs development teams Establish regular communication with your customer’s procurement, ODM ecosystem and other industry partners to be able to accurately forecast your region’s quarterly revenue and 6-month demand forecast. Partner with leading CPU, GPU, FPGA, Networking, Memory & BMC companies to develop co-sales opportunities.  Required Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree, preferred engineering and MBA. Minimum of 8 years’ experience selling complex SoC/silicon products to Cloud Services Providers, Server or Network OEMs. Demonstrated ability to prepare and execute customer account plans to win complex silicon design wins that contribute significant revenue growth. Established relationships with some of our key target customers including Cloud Service Providers, Server, Storage & Networking OEMs. Excellent communication and project management skills. Customer-oriented, Goal-driven, Self-motivated, be able to work independently and be able to travel frequently to customer sites. Fluent in Mandarin and English. Entrepreneurial, open-mind behavior and can-do attitude. Think and act with the customer in mind.

Ocean Treasure is looking for an English sales manager for the Asia markets. Job description: International Sales Manager is the first person who initiates the sales for the organization. They are the first persons to discover the requirements and understand the taste and trends of the customer. Here are some of the key responsibilities that need to be handled by an export International Sales Manager： 1.Develop and maintain customers in the countries assigned. 2.Develop plans and strategies by coordinating with the managers to achieve the sales target. 3.To complete daily KPI'S and call plans issued by the Sales Manager. 4.Administer all sales processes to ensure adherence to all sales results. 5.Ensure optimal level of all sales services to customers. 6.Prepare all reports for new markets and analyze all competitor activities and submit same to manager. 7.Evaluate all customer issues and provide optimal solutions to all resolve same. 8.Manage all export sales and ensure compliance to all procedures of organization. 9.Analyze all market coverage and plan all required resources for same and ensure compliance to all timeframe. 10.To maintain trustworthy professional relationship with the existing as well as the prospective clients. 11.To select, analyze and validate the clients requirements and maintain and update the database related to it. 12. Other tasks assigned by leader. Required skills/experience: To be a successful export sales representative, you should have at least some of the following skills: 1.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to understand the clients' needs and interact with the vendors and the senior management personnel. 2. Self-starter, outgoing personality with exceptional selling and negotiating skills to achieve the sales targets ultimately. 3.Ability to research and analyze the trends in the market and take appropriate decisions or suggest recommendations. 4.Proficient in language, where the products are being marketed. 5.Strong presentation skills, positive attitude, and ability to work in a target-driven environment. 6.Should be result-oriented with good business acumen, computer literate with excellent time management and organization skills. Education background and experience: 1.Minimum Bachelor Degree. 2.At least 3-5 years of industry/ international sales experience.  Working location:   Changning District, Shanghai, China We only consider candidates who live in China now.  We will offer a competitive compensation package and a good platform for you to thrive together with us! Please send your application to: sales1@ocean-treasure.com

Opportunities for training and development throughout High level of autonomy and ownership of role from day one  About Our Client  The company helps business leaders make better decisions faster so people can live happier lives. Whether it's helping an emergency communications company developing new products for campus safety, helping medical device companies improve their products that save lives or helping tech companies build the recent software to manage their supply chains, clients turn to us when they need knowledge to advance their work.  Job Description  Career maturity and alignment: Clarity about direction, committed to getting there and aware of how company fits with your journey. Commercial drive: Seeking to develop sales and negotiation skills as well as the rewards for commercial success. Innate self-confidence and ability to thrive in a very autonomous, and sometimes uncertain environment. Can-do attitude: Passion for making a tangible impact. Excellent communication skills: Confidence and poise to initiate conversations with senior executives in diverse markets and functions.  The Successful Applicant  2-5 years' work experience, preferably gained in a demanding, high-growth environment A deep-seated conviction to embark on a career in business, specifically within the business development realm Strong academic credentials, and noteworthy extracurricular leadership  What's On Offer  Great work environment 2. Attractive salary  Contact: Wendy Song  Quote job ref: 4194507

What You'll Do You will empower and develop and lead a team of direct and indirect reports including Account Managers, Systems Engineers, and Systems Engineering Managers. You are accountable for an annual booking/revenue quota with significant growth in subsequent years. You will also drive overall growth for the entire Manufacture, transformation, power segment sales in the North region  Who You'll Work With As part of Cisco North sales team, we are an outstanding sales force with a driven focus on finding and solving our key customer’s most critical problems and partner with them to bring together and gain market opportunities. We pride ourselves in our ability to sell business outcomes and solutions, not just products. We constantly seek to reinvent ourselves to stay ahead of the game. We take bold actions and being all in to deliver our commitments to our customers and partners. We empower our team to go beyond and deliver phenomenal value to differentiate ourselves. Every single day, we strive to live Cisco’s six core values.  Who You Are You will be expected to strategically drive Cisco's end-to-end vision for our customers, as well as maintain an in-depth understanding of competitive conditions, industry practices, market opportunities, and customer requirements. This key leadership role will continue the sales delivery model development through the capability development of our highly-skilled, hardworking and motivated sales organization. Setting a vision and building strategic business decision-making capability to the next level will be a key factor for success in this position.  Minimum Qualifications We are looking for leaders who have the following characteristics and experiences: Consistent and strong record in running and owning significant overall growth of the segment and overachieving targets to meet stretch goals. You are a strong seller with strong experience in closing large, strategic deals in North China. Understanding a wide range of Cisco technologies. Business Development and strategy experience required. Proven thought leadership, you think strategically and effectively communicate vision (both written and verbal) and influence cross-functionally. Adept at balancing short-term pressures with overall long-term goals. Strong executive presence, polished, and political savvy Excellent communication skills and ability to persuade -- using simple communications that convey complex concepts in a compelling, concise, and creative way. Demonstrated ability to build and lead in a matrix-managed team culture. Native Mandarin language skills and proficiency in English.  We Are Cisco #WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all. We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box! But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.) Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward. So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

Position： 全面负责区域直觉外科的销售，达成业务目标。  Responsibility： 1.      根据公司要求，达到年度销售目标。 2.      按照销售目标，组织团队实施，并监督团队完成。 3.      进行销售管理，建立有效的客户数据库与项目数据库。 4.      维护重点客户，发展更多项目机会，搜集和分析市场（含对手）重要信息。 5.      协调并支持临床、市场、售后等团队与客户沟通，开展各类活动，提高客户满意度。 6.      根据业务发展需要扩大销售团队与渠道销售网络，发展政府与渠道资源，促进业务持续增长。  Requirements： 1.    本科以上学历，外科产品与大设备销售背景优先。 2.    区域销售与管理经验，外资医药工作经历优先。 3.    勤奋积极，能适应高频度出差。英语流利。

SuperVisas is an immigration tech company that was built for immigrants by immigrants. Our vision is to become the go-to platform for all immigrants and immigration service providers around the world. SuperVisas empowers them to find the most suitable program, check their eligibility, generate immigration pathway reports for multiple countries with only one submission automatically by our Rule-Based Experts System. We start by licensing our Rule-Based Experts System to overseas immigration agencies who provide immigration services to immigrants in their local region to streamline the process and doubling their revenue.  This is a senior level Sales Executive role, which also entails customer, partner, and corporate sales responsibilities. The primary responsibility of the sales role is to enable, drive and elevate the company’s position and penetration into the global market. The Sales Executive will be internally and externally focused on the company’s functional operations in support of customer sales and market requirements. This person will be responsible for driving the implementation of strategic initiatives to accelerate growth in worldwide sales.  The essential duties of the Sales Executive will be to: Develop a growth strategy focused both on financial gain and customer satisfaction Coordinate sales and business initiatives and integrate sales processes across the company Manage sales team, providing global coverage for target territories Spearhead the development, communication, and implementation of effective sales growth strategies and processes for the company’s business Serve as the thought leader for sales of the company’s products in the allocated Territories regarding product requirements, selling trends, competitive landscape, marketing programs and communications Facilitate feedback to different areas of the company’s business regarding client needs, operational needs, business opportunities, and marketing/sales programs Drive the company’s business in all target Territories to achieve and surpass sales and business goals and objectives Provide executive level representation at high-stakes meetings with prospects, clients, and technology/channel partners Work closely with Marketing: channel feedback on product features and functions, trends, program needs, customer outreach programs and events Recommend creative selling techniques based on market and product knowledge Assist in developing brand identity and recognition in all target Territories Participate as a member of the company’s Sales Leadership Team, responsible for enlisting the company’s Executives in support of sales initiatives Provide accurate and timely Forecasts using the appropriate Sales Tools and Processes and maintain all relevant information about Customers, Prospects, Campaigns, and Leads Work with Sales Operations to ensure business is transacted accurately and within pricing guidelines to the highest ethical standards Work with Customers to ensure timely payments against invoices  Requirements Technical Degree preferred Minimum 5 years Sales Executive experience Experience selling into the instrumentation and industrial process control markets  would be beneficial Familiar with business strategies, as well as their associated metrics Exceptional project management skills and the ability to coordinate and oversee a number of projects concurrently across multiple functional company departments Superior communication and interpersonal skills; ability to build relationships at multiple levels to work cross organizationally toward solutions; excellent leadership and consensus building skills Influencing and change management skills  Benefits Standard vacation pay Fully remote International travel opportunity Disability, dental, vision, physio and life insurance

description: Introduction  In a nutshell  Location  Shanghai - TCN, China  Team  Sales & marketing  Experience  8+ years  Degree  Bachelor  Job Category  Other job categories  Summary  Responsible for managing all aspects of Cymer’s relationship with the assigned accounts to maximize customer satisfaction and profitable market share potential.Ensures that the Cymer value proposition is effectively articulated to the customer (either personally or through other Account Team members) so as to maximize customers’ perceived value of Cymer’s product portfolio.  Radford:This position develops new accounts and/or expands existing OEM/VAR accounts.Customers may be geographic or named accounts.These incumbents are the most senior level individual contributor Sales Account Managers and are viewed as experts by the company and in the field.Incumbents focus on critical, large, complex, high visibility, strategic, or tactically important accounts and may be responsible for the development of new business opportunities for new products or emerging areas.May have a leadership role and in some companies, management personnel will perform these functions.  Duties And Responsibilities  Strategy and Business Development  Develops the overall objectives and strategy to develop a valued relationship within all targeted areas of the accounts.This is done working together with Account Team members from other functional areas (Sectors, Product Management, Applications, IBP, etc.).  Understands customers’ culture, product portfolio, competitive position, financial state, investment plan, organization structure, key decision makers, installed base, and Cymer competitive strengths and weaknesses.  Develops, updates, and communicates Account Plans on a regularly scheduled basis.  Maintains or increases market share of our products and services in assigned accounts.  Ensures alignment of customer and Cymer product roadmaps, and promotes new products and new technology with well planned strategies to assigned accounts.  Account Management  Manages account business essentials including accurate laser (MAF) and Install Base Products forecasts at appropriate margins, achieving revenue target.  Obtains accurate information about competitors, markets, and customer capital spending plans.Analyzes market share by gathering information about competitor’s shipments.  Builds and maintains relationships with all levels for customers’ decision-maker network (economic, technical, user buying influences).  Customer Satisfaction  Manages key customer negotiations - warranty and service issues, new product introductions, etc.  Leads senior management operations reviews as necessary to report and control Account/Cymer objectives.  Works closely with Product Management team to ensure success of technical discussions, including acceptance of product specification modifications and FCO.  Performs other duties as assigned.  Leveling Summary  Considered an expert in the Company and may be the in-house expert on specific technologies. Having broad expertise or unique knowledge, uses skills to contribute to development of company objectives and principles and to achieve goals in creative and effective ways. Technical Committee review may be required to achieve this level (i.e., barriers to entry may exist).  JOB COMPLEXITY  Works on the most complex technical projects or business issues requiring state-of-the-art technical or industry knowledge where analysis of situations or data requires an evaluation of intangible factors. Exercises independent judgment in methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. Creates formal networks involving coordination among groups.  INDEPENDENCE  Acts independently to determine means of arriving at a solution which is not generally determined by anyone other than the incumbent.Generally provides a leadership role across work groups and may supervise the activities of others.  Qualifications  Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Ability to translate, statistically analyze data, and effectively report problems through written and/or graphical formats.  Excellent customer service skills, with an advanced understanding of customer relationship building.  Ability to use MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and electronic e-mail systems.  Product, sales, or marketing management experience.  Familiar with new product introductions, key account management, and working with field professionals.  Cross-functional or matrix management experience.  Semiconductor manufacturing or semiconductor capital equipment management experience.  Professional business manner, appearance, and personal maturity is required.  Ability to explain to others logically the problem in order to achieve appropriate understanding and cooperation from supporting team.  Ability to make accurate forecasts and to reconcile results to the forecast.  Must be a self-starter with ambition and initiative, be a team player, and be able to make a good first impression.  Skills/Experience  Possesses very strong skills acquired through advanced training, study and experience.Often knowledge is “self taught” as formal training in emerging technologies may not exist.Typically has advanced degree (Master's, PhD). Minimum of twelve (12) years of experience is required.  Requires a Bachelor’s Degree (or above) in Engineering.  A minimum of twelve (12) years of experience in sales, account management, marketing, sales promotion, or strategic planning in the semiconductor capital equipment business.  Front-end semiconductor process technology knowledge.  Engineering background is preferable.  PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  While performing the duties of this job, the employee routinely is required to sit; walk; talk; hear; use hands to keyboard, finger, handle, and feel; stoop, kneel, crouch, twist, reach, and stretch.  The employee is occasionally required to move around the campus.  The employee may occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds.  May require travel dependent on business needs.  Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.  Can work under deadlines.  The environment generally is moderate in temperature and noise level.  Must be able to read and interpret data, information, and documents.  Can observe and respond to people and situations and interact with others encountered in the course of work.  Can learn and apply new information or skills.  Ability to travel (domestic and international) via air and auto at least 50% of the time.

Job Description  This is a commissioned sales position primarily responsible for managing the sell-with/sell-through activities with Cloud Service Provider and driving consumption. As SDM, you will define the go-to-market plan that aligns with both Intel and CSP’s priorities and drive pipeline and deal closure to meet Intel technology adoption goals and deliver/exceed revenue growth in covered verticals.  In This Position, You Need To Cloud solution selling mindset and is able to precisely articulate Intel product value positions and how they are built into CSP’s products to win end customer’s mindshare. Build up and manage co-selling sales pipeline with both CSP and Intel partner teams to drive lighthouse project wins and meet competitor Cloud offerings. Develop vertical scaling plan to penetrate IA differentiated CSP solution in different segments and generate market demand. Generate high ROI sales programs to motivate partners to sell IA differentiated CSP products. Extensive collaborations with internal BUs, vertical sales teams and customer account management are expected and required. Qualifications Highly motivated and aspired. Result orientation and proven problem-solving skills with the ability to thrive in ambiguous and complex situations. Insight of China Cloud industry and its future growing trend. In-depth knowledge of China Cloud ecosystem and key cloud player’s competitive landscape. Vertical sales and/or product sales experience and account management expertise Comprehensive understanding of Intel's data centric product portfolio, strategies, and priorities. Strong communication skills, ability to articulate a highly complex topic in front of Intel and customer executives and influence their opinion. Prior work in Cloud Service Provider is a plus. Inside this Business Group  The Data Center Group (DCG) is at the heart of Intel’s transformation from a PC company to a company that runs the cloud and billions of smart, connected computing devices. The data center is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologies—spanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutions—that fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world.  Other Locations  PRC, Beijing

Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  角色与职责  向指定客户销售时，新增客户通常很少，并且通常需要经过审查。包括单个业务组/P&L 中的关键客户 利用自身和他人的销售领域、产品线、市场、销售流程或客户群的深入知识，并运用分析思维和商业经验来执行政策/策略。 具有最佳实践知识以及了解自己的领域如何与他人融合；了解竞争以及在市场上与众不同的因素 运用判断力，并具有在设定参数之外提出不同解决方案的能力，以解决项目、产品线、市场、销售流程或客户的更复杂的日常问题。为决策制定信息优先级的能力。利用技术经验和分析思维。使用多种内部资源和自身团队之外有限的外部资源来帮助做出决定。 这些销售职位将主要由个人贡献者担任。此级别的职位需要强大的人际交往能力。充当经验较少的同事的资源。可能会领导具有低风险和资源需求的小型项目。说明信息；培养使团队成员就领域的话题达成共识的技能。传达绩效期望，并可以处理敏感问题。  基本资格  该岗位要求在领域具有较丰富的工作经验。学力水平相当于从正规高等院校取得学士学位 （或根据相应工作经验具有高中学历）  所需特性  优秀的口头和书面沟通能力。优秀的人际关系和领导能力。能够影响他人并领导小型团队。领导中等范围和影响的计划。能够同时协调多个项目。有效的问题识别和解决技能。可靠的分析和组织能力。  Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support. Senior Sales Manager, East China  Location: Flexible (Shanghai Preferred)   AIOTECH represents Vantiq that is a hot Silicon Valley startup that delivers a software platform to quickly develop and deploy the next generation of applications, applications that manages an ecosystem that consists of real-time devices (IOT, smartphones, tablets,…), legacy applications (Oracle, SAP, Salesforce, etc..), real-time social media feeds, etc... These applications can handle hundreds of thousands of events per second, provides man-machine collaboration, are distributed to any combination of cloud, edge and on-premise and are highly scalable.  AIOTECH (Vantiq) is looking for an extraordinary sales executive who loves joining a hot early stage software startup company and build the business in the region. The ideal candidate has the vision and the track record in building a significant software business in the region, especially in the industries of Energy, State Owned Enterprise (SOE), Local State Subsidized Campus and other public sectors. This position will report to the VP of Sales of Greater China.      The ideal candidate should be comfortable in having relationships with customers and partners at all levels and very important, proven experience in successfully building a partner ecosystem of System Integrators, Resellers and OEMs in a major technology company throughout the region.  Some of the things you’ll be doing include…  Develop business strategy, grow sales and serve customers. Work closely with the VP of Sales of Greater China. Meet & exceed quarterly sales targets. Provide weekly reporting of pipeline and forecast. Define and manage the strategic plan for the growth in the region. You’ll strategize and execute on plans for channel programs, marketing programs and product feedback.  Establish strong channel partners in the region. o  Overview the recruitment and management of local, regional and global partners based in the region. o  Aggressively work to maximize partner total sales potential through best practices, training and support. o  Excellent communication with management, partners, customers and support staff. o  Be responsible for the management and development the partners, providing them with direction, motivation and leadership. o  Create strategic relationships with senior decision makers within our key partners. Provide feedback and coordination to HQ and local team from the region. Provide input, direction and guidance to other staff in the region including Pre-Sales and Marketing. Keep abreast of competition, competitive issues and products. Participate in sales meetings, product seminars and trade shows as appropriate. Conduct contract negotiations. Travel flexibility --- Travel to partner or customer locations to meet partners and support sales efforts.  Who you are…  Experienced.  Significant direct leadership and strategic partnership experience. You have a solid career history and a proven track record of driving success through partners. Leader. Exceptional management, interpersonal, communication and presentation skills. People want to work with you and for you. Entrepreneurial. You are a creative and strategic thinker. Management Experience. Extensive management skills in software sales including strategic selling. Startup attitude. You have a positive attitude and will “roll up your sleeve” and do what it takes. Energy and Enthusiasm.  You believe in what we’re doing and won’t stop at anything to deliver on your goals. Excellent Communication skills - whether that be to the receptionist or the CEO, your communication style is professional at all times - you know what to say, and how to say it. Problem Solver.  You love tackling the most difficult of challenges and know how to get to the best solution. Executive presence and credibility. Performer.  Proven track record of consistently meeting or exceeding assigned goals and targets. Go-Getter. You thrive in a fast-paced, high growth, rapidly changing environment. Conviction and Commitment. Able to work independently and remotely from other members of your team and corporate. Educated. Bachelor's degree in related field, or equivalent experience. Keep abreast of competition, competitive issues and products. Participate in team-building and company-growth activities including strategy setting, sales training, marketing efforts and customer care.  About AIOTECH:  AIOTECH’s goal is to provide the best technology platform for enterprises to digitize their business while keeping humans in charge.  The AIOTECH application platform-as-a-service enables users to develop, deploy and run real-time enterprise applications driven by data streams from IoT, connected products, social, enterprise systems of record and people. All applications created with AIOTECH are event-driven, allowing businesses to respond in real-time to any business event.

Auto req ID: 11030  Title: Analyst Sales  Job Function: Sales  Location: SHANGHAI  Additional Location:  Company: Harley-Davidson Motor Company  Full or Part-Time: Full Time  At Harley-Davidson, we are building more than machines. It’s our passion and commitment to continue the evolution of this storied brand and heighten the desirability of the Harley-Davidson experience. To keep building our legend and leading our industry through innovation, evolution, and emotion we need the best and brightest talent. We stand for the timeless pursuit of adventure. Freedom for the soul. Are you ready to join us?  Our International Markets are focused on creating an inclusive and expanding rider community that appeals to new and existing riders. We strive to deliver an H-D experience with an unequivocal customer focus.  From the UK to Singapore and many places in between, our employees are essential to our success. Our efforts are concentrated on the highest priority markets, primarily North America, Europe and parts of Asia Pacific. We have concentrated our resources in-market for maximum impact in line with our future strategy. Our regional offices and in-market teams have the freedom within a clearly defined framework to make decisions to drive their business. In-market teams are agile and equipped to understand consumer needs, provide focused attention to dealers, and respond more quickly to local market conditions.  Job Summary  The Analyst Sales provides analytical, administrative, planning, reporting and process support to the sales functions of the market. This includes understanding and supporting the product sales order process from order receipt through to invoicing/processing of retail sales recognition and resolving any issues arising during the process.  The position will work closely with the field sales organization to ensure greatest understadning of the related products businesses in regards to product, promotion and systems and coordinate communication to the local dealer network which involved working collaboratively and interactively with the centre-led team by receving information from the centre-led organization and ensuring alignment across market and centre.  Job Responsibilities Issue credits, title documents and other related paperwork required as part of the sales process. Generate daily retail & wholesale reports. Audit, enter and follow sales status through relevant systems and communications with the Markets on a daily basis. Analyze data and raise potential concerns to internal stakeholders when needed. Responsbile for understanding the sales and operations planning process and how replenishment, new products, assortments and promotions drive wholesales and retail business. Monitor the motorcylce production planning and sales processes to ensure the integrity of each dealer is maintained from start to finish. Delivering tactical execution of the annual sales plan fr Related Products. Support the Market Operations Managers to generate monthly regional retail/wholesale forecast in preparation for monthly Demand Planning Call through collaboration with internal team, Commercial Ops & external stakeholders. Proactively support the country teams to encourage dealers retain correct model mix of floor stock and sales performance to plan and engage internal and external stakeholders to ensure that orders are being placed and shipments are being processed in a timely manner. Investigate, resolve and verify all system and physical issues that may arise during the sales order process through from shipment to dealer delivery/retail sales receipt. Act as the market’s single point of contact for all information on orders and product sales. Ensure Field and Slaes teams are adequately informed of any relevant activities being undertaken. As our new Business Development Manager based in Shanghai you will be responsible for acquisition of new clients. You will drive business development efforts that generate leads, enhance brand visibility, and increase sales. In addition to personal sales goals and assigned targets, you will be pivotal in winning business to reach targeted goals by ensuring that leads are exchanged, relationships are managed, and clients are given a seamless experience — working with the international business development team, as well as Space Matrix offices in Asia and the US.  Specific Responsibilities You will prospect for potential new clients and generate new leads and track leads and forecast your sales efforts to create new bookings. You will Drive business development efforts in the region, acquire new clients and manage sales targets . Gather market intelligence, including information on clients and competitors in the Workplace Market Sector, industry trends, future projects, etc You will develop and take part in pitches and other presentations that meet the client’s needs and expectations. You will Work closely with the MD and the team to complete the sales cycle. You will Represent Space Matrix by targeting potential clients, project partners, and collaborators; identifying opportunities; building relationships to expand Space Matrix’s competitive position. Requirements  In addition to experience within the real estate facilities and/or "corporate workplace" market sector in Shanghai, this position requires strategic thinking, quick problem-solving skills, excellent interpersonal and communication skills, digital media experience, and real business acumen.  Does this describe you You are a highly driven and motivated sales / business development professional. You have excellent oral and written communication skills. You have experience in managing complex sales cycle with B2B selling process. You have Undergraduate or graduate degree in business, marketing, or another field relevant to this role, with a minimum of 6 years of sales/ business development experience. You have Knowledge of the Workplace Market Sector in China including competitive positioning and strategy. You have Experience working in Architecture, Interior Design firms or related fields. Our Culture  We can offer motivated individuals who are prepared to confront head-on whatever comes their way. Members describe our company culture as collaborative, innovative, progressive, honest and fast. We perceive this as a nurturing, caring and continually maturing family; but which is also is a little chaotic at times, refreshingly apolitical, flexible and friendly.  About Space Matrix  Space Matrix design is a dynamic and agile 21st-century digital enterprise with a major client focus to deliver a profitable, sustainable and future-ready workplace solutions. We are continuing to revolutionise the delivery of design+build services in Asia with multiple offices across Australia, India, Singapore, Thailand and Vietnam. Space Matrix is number 10 in office design, globally and ranks No. 2 in Asia according to Interior Design Magazine’s 2015 Top 100 Interior Design Giants Survey.  To find out more visit www.spacematrix.
industries: Architecture & Planning, Design, and Management Consulting

description: A Senior Sales Manager analyses local market trends and competitor activity to recommend strategies that keep the hotel a leader in the marketplace through the development of future and repeat business.  What will I be doing?  Responsibilities  Specifically, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards  As Senior Sales Manager, you will analyse local market trends and competitor activity to recommend strategies that keep the hotel a leader in the marketplace through the development of future and repeat business. Analysis local market trends and competitor activity to identify business leads Develop customer accounts and travel within the local area to drive business into the specific hotel/cluster and to increase market/customer share in all revenue streams/li> Negotiate room rates/packages with corporate clients Develop and implement creative local marketing channels, including social media channels Prepare company contracts for the hotel in accordance with current business and pricing conditions Work within current business strategies and recognising potential opportunities Cooperate with other departments in the hotel to create an exceptional Guest experience and build strong, comprehensive sales programs Attend Sales events, as required Produce accurate and timely reports that meet the needs of the Sales Director and senior management to include the reporting of appointments, calls made and business leads Answer customer queries in a prompt and professional manner Manage staff performance in compliance with company policies and procedures Recruit, manage, train and develop the Sales team What are we looking for?  Skills  To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the attitude, behaviours, skills, and values that follow  A Senior Sales Manager serving Hilton brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members. Positive attitude and good communication skills Commitment to delivering a high level of customer service Excellent grooming standards Flexibility to respond to a range of different work situations Ability to work under pressure and under own initiative Experience in a sales role with a proven track record to close a sale It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions: Knowledge of local market Knowledge of hospitality Passion for sales and for achieving targets and objectives Degree-level qualification in a relevant field What will it be like to work for Hilton?  Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision “to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality” unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!  Work Locations  Hilton Shanghai Hongqiao  Schedule  Full-time  Brand  Hilton Hotels & Resorts  Shift  Day Job  Job Level  Manager  Job  Sales

The Overseas Sales manager’s role is to ensure the achievement of sales within their given territory. The position will be responsible for managing all business accounts in the assigned region, create strategies and execute tactics to develop and implement sales plans that will contribute to the financial growth of the company.  Duties/Responsibilities 1、Develop, establish and implement an effective sales plan tailored to the territory and specific accounts to achieve the goals of the budget and financial growth of the territory. 2、Maintain a current understanding and knowledge of the company’s products and services to provide accurate information to clients and customers. 3、Manage existing accounts and expand customer base in territory, developing long-term profitable accounts. 4、Participate in all sales activities and attend meetings.  Qualifications 1、Master degree in life science(molecular biology, genetics etc.) is required, PhD degree preferred. 2、Knowledge and previous experience in Next Generation Sequencing is highly preferred. 3、Outstanding listening, verbal and written English communication skills. 4、Proficient with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint). 5、Demonstrated success in generating new customer leads and building a business. 6、Ability to establish and maintain long-term customer relationships.

Your mission during this flight:  As the first member of our Business Development Team in China, you are driving Volocopter's activities in building up future commercial air taxi routes in megacities all over China. You will take a key role in creating and realizing top priority goals in close partnership with Volocopter's senior management and our partner Geely.   You initiate and maintain strategic partnerships along with Volocopter and contribute to the further development of our company’s overall strategy and go-to-market approach.  Driver of strategic priorities – As the first hire on the China Team, you will contribute to Volocopter's overall strategy in China and create strategic analyses and proposals regarding significant activities, teams, and budgets Expert in public agencies – You will spearhead and manage ongoing relationships with critical government agencies and public institutions to accelerate and ensure continued public support for our launch in China Manager of key business partners – You will be fully responsible as Key Account Manager for important sales and marketing partners, closely maintain this collaboration to develop and execute new business projects Trusted senior manager and colleague – You will help build up Volocopter's talent pool in China for strategic roles in the region and train colleagues in project management, reporting, gaining a “getting things done” mentality and leading by example   Qualifications  Check in your professional skills:  Required skills:   Academic degree in economics, business, and engineering, or comparable study program Minimum 5 years of experience in a top management consultancy, multi-national internet software company, or global aviation industry with strong business development and project management skills Deep knowledge, network, and experience of developing European business in China context Solid experience in design, analysis, and presentation of business models and value chains Excellent command in spoken and written both Mandarin and English Team player with a pioneer spirit  Preferred skills:   Master’s degree in economics, business, and engineering, or comparable academic programs Experience in planning, budgeting, and managing partners, especially in the context of a joint venture Experience and passion for mobility, aviation, or the drone industry in China   Additional Information  Our Volocopter flight includes:  This position is based in Volocopter-Geely Joint Venture Office in Chengdu, China. Fast-growing high tech company with a supreme network of investors and partners Ability to contribute directly to the future of aviation The chance to build up new things/projects from scratch Personal accountability, growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths An inspiring working environment with modern workspaces, flexible work time, short lines of communication, flat structures, great team spirit Attractive salary package Our differences make us stronger. At Volocopter, we value equal opportunity, trust, and the voice of each of our employees. As change-makers in air mobility, we believe that changing the world starts within each of our teams. We are committed to driving innovation by celebrating diversity and fostering an inclusive culture where everyone is treated equally and respectfully, regardless of our different backgrounds and roles in the company.  Fasten your seat belt and take-off with an awesome team as we bring urban air mobility to life!

Be part of something revolutionary We have a vision. Our Digital Brain, o9’s AI-powered platform, is being used by global enterprises to drive their digital transformations. The integrated planning and operational efficiencies we provide is helping businesses do more, be more and mean more to the world at large. Because businesses that plan better, reduce waste, creating value for themselves and the planet.  But we also have a vision for our people. We want the most talented, committed and driven people to power our transformative approach. In return, we’ll provide a nurturing environment where you can be a part of something special.  What you’ll do for us…  You are the expert and trusted advisor when it comes to our platform demonstrations and C level discovery sessions Support global presales requirements for qualified leads, from both partners and RFP cycles Work with global sales and manage the RFP creation/discovery/platform demonstration building process in-light of the strategic priorities Engage with prospects for value leakage analysis, platform demonstrations and discovery sessions You enjoy making presentations and customer interactions at all levels Work with internal sales/presales, reference demo and services team Use the industry demos as a starting point and architect desired incremental workflows in the o9 platform, as per the specific customer and industry needs  What you’ll have... Experience: Solid experience in supply chain planning process & enterprise planning applications is a must Education: Master degree in Computer Science, Business Analytics, Operations, or related field Skills: Expertise in supply planning and optimization will be a huge plus Expertise in R/Python will be a plus  English: business communication level Chinese: native level  Characteristics: Ability to demonstrate thought leadership and develop credibility with prospects as an expert in the area of planning. Strong ability to lead by example and demonstrate proficiency in both product and domain. Customer empathy and business acumen Executive presence and ability to communicate well and make an impact with senior executives and decision-makers  Self-starter with passion, energy, willingness to learn, and an entrepreneurial mindset We really value team spirit: Transparency and frequent communication are key. At o9, this is not limited by hierarchy, distance, or function What we’ll do for you… Competitive salary Tech tools: Complementary laptop. Get social: When we work from home, we play from home with fun after-work activities like Friday Socials. If you’re in the office, feel free to join these events in person. Flat organization: With a very strong entrepreneurial culture (and no corporate politics). Support network: Work with a team you can learn from and every day. Diversity: We pride ourselves on our international working environment.  Employee Testimonial… What I like most about o9 is that I get to work with some of the smartest people in the industry. Every day is a new opportunity to learn and grow. At the same time everyone is friendly, helpful and fun to be around.- Michael Schuster How the process works… During the interview phase, you will meet with Pre-Sales team for 60 minutes. The recruiter will contact you after the interview to let you know if we’d like to progress your application. You will next meet our Hiring manager for 60 min. Our recruiter will let you know if you’re a successful candidate. Good luck!  More about us…  With its recent Unicorn status, o9 Solutions is one of the fastest-growing AI-powered digital transformation companies in the world today. Our high energy environment drives us to grow and aim 10x. It’s this drive that has made us leaders of Gartner’s S&OP Magic Quadrant. The o9 platform, or “digital brain”, is the premier AI-powered, cloud-based platform behind the digital transformations of major global enterprises. These include Google, Walmart, and Starbucks, among others. Our headquarters are located in Dallas, and we currently have offices in Amsterdam, Barcelona, Bangalore, Tokyo, Seoul, Paris and London.  o9 is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applicants of diverse backgrounds and hires without regard to race, colour, gender, religion, national origin, citizenship, age, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by law.

The candidate in this role will be a strong analytical-thinker with a history of designing initiatives and driving process & strategy implementation. description: Job Description Summary  Customer facing staff responsible for winning business Jobs at this level operate with some autonomy but are covered by well-defined Commercial policies or review of end results. The job allows modification of procedures and practices covering work as long as the end results meet standards of acceptability (typically annual volume, margin and compliance requirements). Responsible for medium-sized sales territories.GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  Roles and Responsibilities  Selling to named account(s), addition of a new customer is typically rare and usually subject to review process. Include key accounts within a single business group/ P&L Utilizes in-depth knowledge of own and others sales territory, product lines, markets, sales processes or customer groups and uses analytical thinking and commercial experience to execute policy/strategy. Has knowledge of best practices and how own area integrates with others; is aware of the competition and the factors that differentiate them in the market Uses some judgment and has some ability to propose different solutions outside of set parameters to address more complicated, day-to-day problems with projects, product lines, markets, sales processes, or customers. Ability to prioritize information for decision making. Uses technical experience and analytical thinking. Uses multiple internal and limited external sources outside of own teams to arrive at decisions. These sales jobs will mainly be individual contributors.A job at this level requires strong interpersonal skills. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience. May lead small projects with low risks and resource requirements. Explains information; developing skills to bring team members to consensus around topics within field. Conveys performance expectations and may handle sensitive issues.  Required Qualifications  This role requires advanced experience in the Sales & Account Sales. Knowledge level is comparable to a Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college ( or a high school diploma with relevant experience).  Desired Characteristics  Strong oral and written communication skills. Demonstrated ability to analyze and resolve problems. Ability to document, plan, market, and execute programs. Established project management skills.  Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. description: SHINE Program Highlights An intense 18 months SHINE Program requiring three challenging rotational assignments with a training curriculum to develop both leadership and commercial skills. This program is designed to attract, develop & retain commercial experts and future commercial leaders for SABIC. Program Design: A 18 months Program Three Job Rotation Assignments Leadership and functional trainings Coaching/Mentoring by business managers Regional exposures  JOB RESPONSIBILITIES  Sales Rotation: Understand the assigned market/industry/area and identify the value chains, build connections and maintain relationships with customers handle daily affairs and manage the business. Cooperate supporting functions to provide good service to customers. Find opportunities to develop new customers and new business, understand our products and study the relevant applications, translate the voice of customer into material requirements, and convert the opportunities to orders. About Snapmaker  Snapmaker is a team of passionate and talented people dedicated to empowering everyone with advanced digital fabrication technologies, from 3D printing to laser cutting and CNC carving. With our passion and perseverance, we believe that making will be as easy as taking photos in the coming decades.  Our journey began in August 2016. We launched our first crowdfunding project and raised over $2 million. In 2019, our second crowdfunding project for Snapmaker 2.0 3 in 1 3D Printer raised $7.8 million in 30 days and became the most funded Technology project in Kickstarter. In 2021, we raised millions of dollars from Series A funding. Currently, we are rapidly expanding our product range and global channel network, serving clients in consumer, education, and professional sectors.  Our Team Culture  We are makers ourselves, and hope to enable more people to make good use of the fabrication tools in their daily life. With this mission, we value the application of engineering; believe in positive outcomes brought by tinkering; never leave out details that determine user experience. maintain close and transparent communications with our users so that we can create what they need  What you will be doing  Establish channel framework and design channel strategy to meet the regional sales and strategic goals Lead the regional sales team by supporting individual members to meet their targets, providing them consultation, and enabling them to achieve their potential Develop an extensive regional sales channel by recruiting channel partners in consumer, education, and professional sectors. Manage channel network and cultivate a long-term trusted relationship with channel partners Support and enable channel partners to effectively market our products with high-quality service through training, consultation, and strategic planning Engage in channel marketing such as participating in trade shows, coordinating partners' marketing events, and allocating market development budget Research regional market and gather market intelligence for to optimize our marketing approach and strategic plan  What we are looking for  3+ years of experience in channel sales/channel development/partnership Proficient in English and Mandarin Great interpersonal, presentation, and negotiation skills Experienced in cross-culture communication and coordination, with strong cultural empathy Deep understanding of Southeast Asia culture and consumer behavior, with global vision Good planning and decision-making skills. Able to lead a team and provide guidance Value integrity and team work Self-driven, passionate, responsible, adaptive and result-oriented Willing to travel between Southeat Asia and China after the end of pandemic (4-5 times a year, mostly based in Shenzhen)  Even better if you have  Worked in 3D printing/digital fabrication/STEAM/robotics industry Experienced in team management/mentorship/training Proven record in channel development in Southeast Asia consumer electronics/education/professional sector  What we can offer  Dynamic, youthful, and friendly work environment Comprehensive onboarding program and mentorship Personal development and training fund Internal knowledge sharing and a study culture Loads of 3D printers to play with and life-long makers to guide you Fun time (dining, sports, party, travel, etc.) Competitive salary and stock options
