About Snapmaker  Snapmaker is a team of passionate and talented people dedicated to empowering everyone with advanced digital fabrication technologies, from 3D printing to laser cutting and CNC carving. With our passion and perseverance, we believe that making will be as easy as taking photos in the coming decades.  Our journey began in August 2016. We launched our first crowdfunding project and raised over $2 million. In 2019, our second crowdfunding project for Snapmaker 2.0 3 in 1 3D Printer raised $7.8 million in 30 days and became the most funded Technology project in Kickstarter. In 2021, we raised millions of dollars from Series A funding. Currently, we are rapidly expanding our product range and global channel network, serving clients in consumer, education, and professional sectors.  Our Team Culture  We are makers ourselves, and hope to enable more people to make good use of the fabrication tools in their daily life. With this mission, we value the application of engineering; believe in positive outcomes brought by tinkering; never leave out details that determine user experience. maintain close and transparent communications with our users so that we can create what they need  What you will be doing  Establish channel framework and design channel strategy to meet the regional sales and strategic goals Lead the regional sales team by supporting individual members to meet their targets, providing them consultation, and enabling them to achieve their potential Develop an extensive regional sales channel by recruiting channel partners in consumer, education, and professional sectors. Manage channel network and cultivate a long-term trusted relationship with channel partners Support and enable channel partners to effectively market our products with high-quality service through training, consultation, and strategic planning Engage in channel marketing such as participating in trade shows, coordinating partners' marketing events, and allocating market development budget Research regional market and gather market intelligence for to optimize our marketing approach and strategic plan  What we are looking for  3+ years of experience in channel sales/channel development/partnership Proficient in English and Mandarin Great interpersonal, presentation, and negotiation skills Experienced in cross-culture communication and coordination, with strong cultural empathy Deep understanding of East Asia culture and consumer behavior, with global vision Good planning and decision-making skills. Able to lead a team and provide guidance Value integrity and team work Self-driven, passionate, responsible, adaptive and result-oriented Willing to travel between Japan/Korea and China after the end of pandemic (4-5 times a year, mostly based in Shenzhen)  Even better if you have  Several years of study/work experience in Japan/Korea High proficiency in Japanese/Korean Worked in 3D printing/digital fabrication/STEAM/robotics industry Experienced in team management/mentorship/training Proven record in channel development in East Asia consumer electronics/education/professional sector  What we can offer  Dynamic, youthful, and friendly work environment Comprehensive onboarding program and mentorship Personal development and training fund Internal knowledge sharing and a study culture Loads of 3D printers to play with and life-long makers to guide you Fun time (dining, sports, party, travel, etc.) Competitive salary and stock options

The Team Supervisor is accountable for creating a high-performance culture that motivates associates to demonstrate levels of ownership, accountability. The Team Supervisor will provide coaching, guidance, and mentorship to drive achievement of individual and team performance goals. Other responsibilities include interviewing, training, performance management and employee engagement.  The successful candidate will have a commitment to achieving excellence in the Associates and Seller experience, and therefore a strong record of customer focus, a passion for employee development and a keen interest in process improvement are key requirements for this role.   Responsibilities Lead inside sales team to ·       Qualify all incoming leads and distribute them according to established rules and guidelines. ·       Responsible for both in-bound and out-bound phone calls to support business. ·       Updates and maintains sales database. Maintain a robust sales pipeline ·       Follow up leads generated by marketing campaigns. ·       Lead specific telemarketing projects and guidance as defined by Marketing managers ·       Achieve monthly quota of revenue and meet new opportunity creation target; ·       Work closely with the Marcom and other function teams for demand generation and business development ·       Maintain long-term relationships with our existing customers and acquire new customers to nurture ·       Create and update sales tools for telemarketing and marcom activities ·       Participates in Kaizen events to identify and implement process improvement change initiatives.    Qualification: ·       Bachelor of Science (B.S.) or higher; Education in general Biology, Biochemistry, Chemistry, Physics, Chemical Engineering, and Materials Science is a plus but not compulsory. ·       5 years and above related working experience with a minimum of 2 years managing frontline supervisors ·       Experience in a business-to-business (B2B) environment, high-tech products/services. ·       Technical background in instrument, chemistry, material, Lab related area preferred. ·       Experience of working in an international environment desirable.    Skills and knowledge required of the job holder. ·       Proficiency in CRM system, SFDC is highly preferred ·       Excellent telephone sales skills. ·       Demonstrates effective, clear and professional written and oral communication. ·       Microsoft office essential. ·       Native level Mandarin and good English both spoken and written. ·       Easily approachable, cooperative, and a team player, easily gains the trust and support of Associates and peers. ·       Self-Motivation. Strong prioritization and time management skills, with a high degree of flexibility. ·       Solution focused, with passion for people leadership and a drive to nurture a culture of innovation. ·       Ability to develop, plan and implement short and long-range goals. ·       Outstanding analytical and technical skills, using the data to drive decision making and Implement effective resolutions.

jobTitle: Regional Sales Manager - A Team Leader Role
description: This role is a team leader role, leading a team of three people in Southern China to boost the sales performance.  Key Responsibilities The primary role of the Regional Sales Manager is to lead the sales team in Shenzhen, China to achieve monthly and annual business targets. This position will cover China South market including 6 provinces The Regional Sales Manager will directly report to the VP Sales and working closely with the Chief Operating Officer from time to time to determine the correct sales structure and strategy to accelerate growth in the China South territory The Regional Sales Manager will be responsible for overseeing the hiring of all Business Development Professionals and Account Management professionals in the territory In delivering high-level coaching to the team in China South, the Regional Sales Manager will need to have intimate knowledge of the functionality, content and other aspects of all the products as well as excellent interpersonal and relationship management skills The Regional Sales Manager will ensure that the Shenzhen sales team adheres to commercial policy and company guidelines and apply them in a manner that achieves maximum business benefit and customer satisfaction, as well as minimizes cancellation risk The Regional Sales Manager will oversee all aspects of Sales Process. He/she will be responsible for weekly forecasting, ensuring internal systems (i.e. CRM) are updated and coaching the Shenzhen team to sales excellence The Regional Sales Manager will work very closely with the respective leaders of product, finance and marketing in Shanghai office and to ensure that our commercial strategy is in line with that of company. The Regional Sales Manager will be responsible for educating the local functions in Shanghai office in operation on our sales strategy Key Requirements Degree in Finance, Economics or related business disciplines Ability to work across a variety of functions to ensure that our China South commercial strategy is in line and consistent across departments At least 6-8 years in direct sales or account management experience in financial or information services industries. Sales experience with financial data vendor is definitely an advantage Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, combined with strong business judgment and ability to present and communicate analysis in a clear manner Proven track record of consistently meeting or exceeding assigned deliverables and assigned sales targets Keen interest and understanding of the Financial and Banking environment, corporations, companies in New Economy, government, academic and the market data/research requirements of divisions in these industries such as strategic planners, big data analysts, Credit Research, Risk Management, Equities Research, Fund Management, Economists, Corporate Finance, Corporate Planning, Government think tank and research centre, University library etc. Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills Proficiency in English is a must Self-motivated, mature, target oriented and motivating About The Client  A world-known data and industry report provider

Good team player and the ability to work with a wide cross-section of people in various locations Impeccable attention to detail, passion for processes, systems and data mining High levels of integrity and discretion in handling confidential information. Our Company  Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.  We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!  The challenge  An exciting opportunity to be part of Adobe's digital experience business, selling the market leading Adobe Experience Cloud. You will be responsible for prospecting enterprise named accounts in East China.  What You’ll Do Driving Digital Marketing solutions at the enterprise level. Market & sell deep and wide across the organization within the assigned accounts. Building executive level relationships within CEO and the marketing field (CMO/CDO) as well as establishing meetings with a broad array of marketing executives - proactively selling into multiple levels of an organization. Building executive & mid-level relationships within IT (CIO/CTO) as well as to support the sale of Digital Marketing solutions. Collaboration with the different Adobe business units & functional teams (Solution Consulting, Professional Services, etc) to provide clients a clear understanding of our competitive advantages and why they should choose Adobe’s Marketing Cloud. Overachieve revenue quota contributing to the region’s overall plan. What You Need To Succeed Strong and proven sales track record. Deeply understand key drivers, trends and business issues of either Manufacturing or FMCG Industry. Value selling approach with details analysis on current customer biz operation data and ROI report presentation skill. Experience working across large, complex, high visibility, strategic, or tactically important accounts. Especially to enterprise accounts in East China. Proven experience selling complex software or solution deals at the CXO level. Must have a strong understanding and experience in managing a long term and complex sales cycle, as well as closing six and seven figure deals. Consistent over-achievement of quota in past positions.

description: Globalization Partners simplifies global business by enabling companies to hire great talent anywhere in the world, without the complexity of setting up foreign branch offices or subsidiaries. You find the talent, and we put YOUR candidate on OUR fully compliant, in-country payroll. This enables you to expand into almost any country around the globe – quickly and easily. Our platform enables you to leapfrog over the legal, HR and tax complexities without having to figure out “how” to do business in a foreign country, while getting all the benefits of a global team.  Globalization Partners’ Globalization Partners’ Global Expansion Platform™ enables you to hire in more than 170 countries within days, and without the need to set up costly international subsidiaries. You identify great talent anywhere in the world, and we put them on our fully compliant global payroll—lifting the burden of global corporate tax, legal, and HR matters from your shoulders to ours. Our systems are accessible at the touch of a finger via our software platform and app.    We make it easy for anyone to do business anywhere and hold ourselves to high standards of doing business by maintaining our triple bottom line philosophy that emphasizes happy clients, happy employees and happy shareholders. And not to brag, but we’ve won multiple awards for our culture, including being named as one of the Top 150 Company Cultures in America by Entrepreneur Magazine  Globalization Partners International Business, Simplified.  About the position: As a Sales Executive, you will be joining a team that is laser-focused on taking over the world, building a company we are proud of, and meeting the needs of 30,000 employers hiring internationally. With our record of phenomenal growth, we need to recruit the best of the best, with the potential to grow with us as we expand.   Responsibility of the role: The team is responsible for the generation of new revenues for Globalization Partners by meeting corporate sales targets. As a member of this key team, you would be responsible for meeting your individual sales targets and other metrics established by the Sales Manager.  What you will do:  You will be responsible for all aspects of the sales cycle including reaching out and following on both incoming and self-generated leads, generating deal proposals through to deal close. Although we close sales on the wire, this is a very consultative sales process, where we act as a trusted advisor to educate our clients about overseas expansion, and at the same time differentiate ourselves through our knowledge and client service. We are looking for someone with high energy, high integrity and exceptional attention to detail, who is focused on provide an outstanding client experience from the very first contact with Globalization Partners.   Responsibilities:  Understand prospective client requirements and validate their suitability for Globalization Partner’s solution Complete sales and achieve quarterly sales targets Meet activity KPIs set by your sales manager Build and sustain a strong understanding of the Globalization Partner’s solutions using the education materials provided Maintain a strong understand of the competitive environment by engaging in internal training, self education and research Follow up on company-sourced and self-generated leads from multiple sources including website, partners, sales team colleagues, trade shows, marketing campaigns, etc.  Proactively call prospects, build relationships by understanding their business and challenges  Educate prospects on the opportunities and benefits of our solution  Draft and follow up on proposals, overcome objections and close sales, while working to a quarterly sales target  Maintain a strong pipeline to meet assigned sales quotas and metrics  Identify potential prospects through LinkedIn, news feeds, online research, etc.  Constantly learn about our business, follow industry-related developments and maintain an entrepreneurial drive  Develop, maintain and engage in business related networking online via LinkedIn, Twitter (etc.) and physically through local networking and industry events Build partnership with sales executives in adjacent solutions to maximise lead opportunities Maintain high quality data in Salesforce   What we are looking for:  We are creating this company together as a team, so it is incredibly important that we have the best and brightest people all working together towards our common goals. In order to be successful in our culture, we look for the following demonstrated attributes:  Ability and experience in researching prospect industries and providing insight as relates to talent acquisition Ability to build and develop excellent customer relationships  Outstanding communication skills both written and verbal  Active listening skills  Attention to detail  Collaborative and support skills to team Presentation & product demonstration experience  Problem solving skills  Information gathering skills  Self-starter with strong time management & organisational skills  Ability to understand and explain complex solutions Successful record in selling solution in a remote environment  Qualifications:  Bachelor’s degree, preferably in a business discipline or equivalent  Minimum of 2 - 5 years’ experience in sales, with a track record in meeting sales targets and pitching to C-Level  Experience in global operations, or a B2B product with a financial focus preferred  Structured Sales training in established sales methodologies preferred International work and/or travel experience a strong plus. Experience working in a start-up environment an advantage  Very good English language skills Working knowledge of Salesforce or similar CRM preferred

Markem-Imaje delivers fully integrated solutions that enable product quality and safety, regulatory and retailer compliance, better product recalls and improved manufacturing processes.  Markem-Imaje is a trusted global manufacturer of product identification and traceability solutions. Our connected solutions help manufacturers to reduce waste, increase efficiency, achieve compliance and protect their brand.   We offer the most complete range of market-leading marking and coding systems along with software, services and consumable solutions so you can streamline all your printing needs from one supplier.   The Role The Strategic Account Sales will  -Perform the day-to-day sales activities of Strategic Account at plant Level so that he/she achieves designed short/long term financial and operating objectives (e.g. sales revenue, productivity, market share, managing partnership). -To develop, create demand and implement the business plans for assigned Strategic Account and to deliver growth in line with Global/BU Strategic Account/KA objectives. -Ensure strategy, plan structure, information is in place to deliver the sales budget for these customers including quantity, value, SAP, product mix and after sales. -Achieve personal sales budget. Implement Strategic Account strategy Make sure the company and Key Account strategies (policy & tools), rule and process are properly implemented and followed locally. Our innovative spirit begins with our global team, improves the way we operate, and ultimately helps us deliver compelling end-to-end solutions.  汉朔(Hanshow)是全球领先的数字化门店解决方案提供商，具备自主研发创新、软硬件方案集成及全产业链资源整合的能力。公司成立于2012年，总部位于浙江嘉兴，研发与管理中心位于北京，主要服务于传统零售、新零售、百货时尚、医药健康、文化娱乐等领域。随着零售行业多元化发展，汉朔基于对零售及互联网领域变革的深刻理解，始终坚持以创新与研发为核心驱动，通过提供数字化、高效率、重体验的门店解决方案及服务，帮助客户建立核心竞争优势。 目前，汉朔已为全球超过50个国家和地区、12000多家门店提供电子价签产品及数字化门店解决方案，国内零售百强占有率超60%。

Job Description  角色与职责  向指定客户销售时，新增客户通常很少，并且通常需要经过审查。包括单个业务组/P&L 中的关键客户 对销售区域、产品线、市场、销售流程或客户群有深入的了解。利用先前的经验和获得的商业专业知识来执行政策/策略。 深入理解关键业务驱动力；用这种理解来完成自己的工作。深入了解自己团队的工作如何与其他团队融合并为该领域做出贡献。 大多数决策都在规定的框架内，但是对于项目、产品线、市场、销售过程或客户的最终决策具有一定的自主权。利用先前的经验和在职培训来解决简单的任务。拥有解决问题所需的技术技能和分析思维。可以使用自己团队以外的多个内部资源来做出决定。 此级别的职位可能由个人贡献者担任，且其具有成熟的人际交往能力。向直接相关的同事和业务部门传达所提供的设计和协调服务。为新团队成员提供非正式指导。在简单的情况下向其他人解释复杂的信息。  基本资格  该岗位要求在领域具有较丰富的工作经验。学力水平相当于从正规高等院校取得学士学位 （或根据相应工作经验具有高中学历）  所需特性  优秀的口头和书面沟通能力。优秀的人际关系和领导能力。能够影响他人并领导小型团队。领导中等范围和影响的计划。能够同时协调多个项目。有效的问题识别和解决技能。可靠的分析和组织能力。  Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.

description: About Agoda  Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.  Get to Know our Team:  Partner Development is a team of creative entrepreneurs that develop solutions for Agoda’s accommodation partners and promote Agoda’s top and bottom line growth. We design tailored business and product solutions with our partners and help them generate measurable value. Members of our team are empowered and supported to grow their market(s) or accounts. We develop win-win relationships and leverage Agoda’s unique accommodations portfolio and tech solutions to bring our partners the advantages they seek. Utilizing our strong brand and resources, we roll out new product to increase the visibility of Agoda, introduce more travelers to our great products and service and deliver significant revenues to the overall business.  The Opportunity  As a Partner Development Specialist your key objective is growing the coverage and quality of Agoda’s supply network. You take care of a large portfolio of emerging high growth supply partners and assist in partnership related functions at scale.  In This Role, You’ll Get To Contact high growth supply partners to highlight revenue growth opportunities and maximize value Contact new or potential supply partners to encourage completion of their online registrations Encourage program participation through focused project sprints Communicate efficiently with partners through various communication methods including phone, email, messaging, and webinars Train and inform partners on our technologies, tools, and models Prioritize daily tasks, monitor results, and track progress in internal systems What You’ll Need To Succeed Minimum 2 years’ experience working in sales/business development or execution role preferred although fresh graduates welcome to apply Basic computer and analysis skills Analytical and proven track record in using data to drive achievements and make decisions Intellectual curiosity Autonomous and result driven (history of achieving ambitious targets) Ability to work under pressure in a competitive industry/rapidly changing environment Ability to work in a highly dynamic environment and is open to change in responsibilities, workflows, as needed by the business Able to support Hong Kong, Taiwan and Mainland China markets and following the business hours & public holidays in Hong Kong, Taiwan and Mainland China #shanghai #beijing #shenzhen #taipei #SALE #MRKT #BD #2 #3 #4  Equal Opportunity Employer  At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.  We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .  To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

description: YQNLINK is a leading one-stop international logistics online services platform, offering comprehensive international logistics services, including FCL, LCL, air freight, rail service, trucking, customs clearance, warehousing, cargo insurance , bulk cargo service, port of destination services, etc. It is designed to apply the internet and digital technology to visualize and optimize cross-border supply chain logistics to achieve the same efficiency and convenience as express delivery. ‘Simple shipping and easy freight’ is the mission of YQNLINK. We have developed strategic cooperative partnerships with leading ocean carriers and logistics service providers such as COSCO Shipping, Maersk Line, Sinotrans, etc. We have built up the ocean and air transport network from China to the world and introduced a series of innovative product offerings such as the First-class FCL, First-class LCL, First-class Air Freight, realizing online quotation, online order, online logistics tracking and other abundant functions, to build a more efficient and intelligent cross-border supply chain logistics.  You will do: Leading and performing the of monthly reporting as well as ad-hoc reporting. description: Delta's China Sales organization is seeking a highly motivated individual and established leader for the role of Manager - China Digital & E-commerce Sales. This position will have overall responsibilities for growing revenue and market share on Online Travel Agencies, online flagship store, and delta.com. This manager position will also manage B2B communications with brand partners, marketing units, tourism boards, and other industry partners. Based in Shanghai, this position will report to Director of Sales, China  Summary Of Responsibilities (not Comprehensive Of All Tasks) Formulate, execute, and track sales strategies for OTAs, online flagship stores, and delta.com – leveraging social media, mobile platform, localization. Increase digital channel revenue, channel share, and customer satisfaction for delta.com and mobile channels Manage and strengthen relationships with external stakeholders that include but not limited to OTAs, brand partners, tourism boards, and airline partner China Eastern. Manage and strengthen relationships with internal stakeholders such as Revenue Management, Sales Development, Global Distribution unit and other departments involved in key digital sales initiatives and projects. Partner with Marketing and Corporate Communication to proactively build Delta brand and supporting objective to become the Most Chinese-Friendly U.S. Carrier. Develop interpersonal skills and business maturity of team members, while reinforcing Delta’s best practices and employee-focused corporate culture. Minimum of 3 - 5 years of experience in airline, digital sales, online travel agencies, or related e-commerce fields required. Fluency in English and Mandarin is required. Strong written and verbal communication skills with demonstrated ability to speak confidently before large groups and effectively conduct meetings. Excellent relationship management and communication skills, with both internal and external stakeholders. Excellent understanding of the travel industry, market conditions, competitive threats and opportunities, and strong familiarity with online distribution and e-commerce trends – to successfully guide formulation and execution of sales plans targeting online customers. Good leadership and interpersonal skills with a strong track record of working cross-functionally. Must have the ability to exercise sound judgment, be highly motivated, flexible, and able to work under pressure with minimal supervision. Embraces diverse people, thinking and styles Consistently makes safety and security, of self and others, the priority 3+ years of leadership experience in airline, commercial, sales and marketing fields is preferred Knowledge of airline distribution concepts, including GDS and online distribution policies and strategies Preferred knowledge of Delta Air Lines and/or the airline industry, travel landscape, and consumer behavior Must be strategic, dynamic, detail-oriented, and impactful. The ideal candidate is an analytical thinker, a self-starter, and a solution provider Bachelor's degree, MBA or master’s degree preferred.

About Airwallex Airwallex is a leading global fintech and enterprise services company founded in 2015, which enables cross-border business to grow globally and innovatively. Airwallex has set up 15 offices around the world, with more than 800 talented employees. At the beginning of 2021, Airwallex completed a D+ series of financing with around 2.6 billion USD valuation. Tencent, Alibaba Entrepreneurs Fund, Sequoia Capital, Hillhouse Capital and many other top financial institutions are our investors.    About the Role The Channel Sales Manager/Associate Director is responsible for building partnership network and delivering sales results through channels and agencies. You will work as the primary resource for developing commercial partners and growing relationships and be responsible for educating our channels and their sales team on what Airwallex has to offer and how to position our products to the partners’ clients. Your focus will be sourcing, recruiting and managing new and existing channel partners in order to generate high quality leads and subsequent revenues. It includes the full life cycle of the channel partner sales from prospecting through to commercial and contractual negotiation and signing, followed by nurturing the relationship with those partners.  Job Description The Channel Sales Manager/Director will partner across industries in order to establish networks, develope and manage channels and drive revenue generating activities Recruit new partners, creating new and profitable channels in the market. Mentor and enable relevant partners to accomplish Airwallex’s channel goals Work in close collaboration and partnership with the Sales team and other departments (e.g. Legal, Finance, Marketing, Product). Provide sales enablement to the partner across all relevant disciplines.  Requirements Bachelor’s degree from an established undergraduate institution 3+ year working experiences in channel/distributor/partnership management position with top internet companies (e.g, Alibaba ICBU), cross-border SaaS companies (e.g., ) or relevant finance firms Strong indirect channel management core skills, be able to deliver sales results through others Be able to communicate and work with multiple stakeholders across different teams and areas Be optimistic and good in self-emotion control, with hunger for achievement but humble personality Fluent in both Mandarin and English, capability of excellent data analysis will be a plus  Airwallex does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms/recruiters.  Airwallex will not pay any fees to search firms/recruiters if a candidate is submitted by a search firm/recruiter unless an agreement has been entered into with respect to specific open position(s).  Search firms/recruiters submitting resumes to Airwallex on an unsolicited basis shall be deemed to accept this condition, regardless of any other provision to the contrary.

description: GENERAL SUMMARY OF POSITION As a Territory Sales Manager, you will focus on business development, prospecting, and execution of sales against the target. In addition, you will work closely with Ansell’s regional sales team to deliver Life-Sciences solutions to the Pharmaceutical and Life-Science market. Crucially you will also provide technical consultancy to our customers and advise on best practices concerning garment and accessory selection for the end-users on a country-wide basis.  RESPONSIBILITIES You will be responsible for the maintenance and growth of your territory for the complete line of Ansell™ and BioClean™ Life-Sciences portfolios. This includes but is not limited to Cleanroom gloves, Garments, Goggles, Wipes, and accessories. Using SFDC you will prospect for new customers and qualify leads, whilst supporting and cooperating with the key accounts (KA) and regional team (RST) on managing end-users and channels. You will provide technical customer support (e.g., SOP recommendation, Documentation prep, and training on all Life-Science products and their applications. You will work collaboratively with the China Industrial KA team, body protection (BP), and RST to facilitate, advise and close Life-Science account opportunities. You will analyze your territory/market potential and prepare sales reports on a routine basis including, but not limited to intelligence on customer projects, volume requirements, problems, areas of interest, competitor activity, and potential for new products. Keep abreast of best practices and industry trends Continuously improve through feedback from management Represent Ansell in a professional and ethical manner Travel up to 50-75% to support sales activities  KEY POSITION REQUIREMENTS  Job Experience Minimum 4-5 years of experience in a similar role within a B2B multinational product environment Proficiency in English BS, in Microbiology, Chemical engineering, Chemistry or any adjacent Life Science discipline Experience: 2-3 years of solution sales experience, technical support, or laboratory experience is preferred Detailed planning and organization skills. Familiarity with CRM practices Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work independently. A combination of expert troubleshooting and interpersonal skills are the keys to success in this position. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required. Full, clean driving license  Desirable Job Competencies Analytical and focused on quality Service and Customer-oriented Focus on solution selling Business-minded Strong communication and interpersonal skills Very good organization skills, structured and able to prioritize Proactive, pragmatic, dynamic, and enthusiastic Flexible team player, but who likes to work autonomously

The position of PED Sales Specialist carries an overriding responsibility to contribute to corporate sales efforts by building, nurturing, and managing highly effective sales coverage, leading to profitable business levels in vacuum PED sales. This is an experienced position where the employee will be responsible for coordinating sales activities for specific PED products. The employee will apply their knowledge of both the KJLC organization and PED products to successfully develop the skill set of the Asia Sales Force as well as sell into the Asia marketplace. The employee will perform a wide variety of tasks and needs to communicate effectively.  Key Job Elements: Responsible for achieving and maintaining a high-degree of technical competence. Support and assist Asia Technical Support PED Sales & Service Manager on the PED Technical support and sales. Communicate and work with Sales team and Product Management team on the Technical support and sales business of PED products. Relationship Management: Develops and manages relationships with customers, to develop additional business as well as ensure a high level of client satisfaction. Lead Generation: Develops the customer database from various customer account lists, makes cold calls, participates in corporate marketing efforts, generates leads independently and follows-up appropriately. Proposal/Presentation Generation: Creates sales quotations and contracts using tools and resources as needed. Develops customized presentations using MS PowerPoint. Information Tracking and Reporting: Ensures that opportunity information is detailed and current to ensure accurate revenue and product forecasting, captures activity information on a timely basis as client interactions occur. Responsible for providing a monthly/quaterly vacuum PED market analysis on the following: Executive Summary of vacuum PED market Key account review, including customer overview, sales situation, application notes, product opportunities, timeline, and resources needed for success. Market Threats & Market Opportunities Training KJLC Asia Sales Force to identify PED system opportunities  Qualifications:  Required Must possess strong verbal and written communication skills in English and Chinese (Mandarin) Previous training in engineering, science or business with a commensurate degree and/or appropriate prior experience. Experience with developing sales strategies and tactical implementation for growth. Advanced key account selling skills and technical aptitude are necessary (Generally, role requires 50% sales and customer relationship skill, and 50% technical skill.) Must possess ability to analyze client business requirements and develop creative solutions as well as utilize technical resources to complete accurate and technically assured sales orders. Basic physical requirements encountered in a typical office environment are required. Ability to due light lifting is required. Must be physically mobile and have the ability to travel freely to customer sites typically encountered in industrial settings. Experience in International Travel  Preferred PED key account sales experience PED process knowledge PED technical knowledge  Standards of performance: Maintain a high level of professionalism and ethics. Must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively work and communicate with the sales force, Product Management, Supervisor, and key suppliers. The ability to effectively present Sales Progress and Market Information to both KJLC Senior Management and Product Management is essential. Must serve as a positive example for other employees Must provide timely and accurate correspondence both internally and to external customers Be adaptable to changes in equipment, assignments, procedures, and methods. Accept work assignments that could require additional training to perform. Safeguard company information by observing company security regulations Work must be performed in a safe manner, safety rules observed, and a high standard of housekeeping maintained. Completion and performance on Lead Generation, Proposal/Presentation Generation, and Relationship Management Demonstrate knowledge of and works within KJLC's Quality Management System, including the Quality Policy and Quality Objectives  Working Conditions: This job will be performed at the Regional Sales Office and remote customer facilities. Moderate to frequent overnight and/or international travel is required.  Equipment: Access to Company Data Must be capable of operating and, to a minor degree, maintaining all typical office equipment (telephone, computer, etc). Must be able to operate standard company computer software, which is part of the main operating system. Powered by JazzHR  yhcwVbAlNX

jobTitle: REGIONAL SALES MANAGER – NORTH, GREATER CHINA
description: 公司描述  Fermentis works with everyone in the world of beer, wine, spirits and other fermented beverages. Its range of products and services covers almost all professional requirements: from safeguarding production to expressing sensory characteristics. Born in Lille in the North of France, Fermentis is a Business Unit of the Lesaffre Group; global key player in yeasts and fermentation solutions. For over 165 years, Lesaffre has been focused on yeast and fermentation, and all related applications, with currently more than 69 industrial plants and 11,000 employees worldwide.  Fermentis has a recognized know-how in the fermentation industry allowing the development and production of products adapted for beverage applications based on the research of more than 570 R&D experts. Its wide variety of products has been specifically created to meet the quality requirements of fermented beverage producers around the world, focusing on the development of aroma and character.  职位描述  P&L performance  Achieve the targeted sales objectives in terms of revenue.  Budget, sales reporting and analysis  Assist Area Sale Manager (ASM) in the preparation of sales & marketing budget (Budget)  Reports monthly sales results and/or assist in sales analysis upon request.  Reports on the action plan status.  Marketing studies/research  Carry out studies to confirm projected production volumes in the targeted segments, e.g. by assessing economical & political drivers country by country.  Identify and lobby key contacts (influencers, decision-makers), key organizations, technical institutions and associations for each segment.  Carry out field visits to end users and distributors, as per Fermentis definition and requirements (company information, technology, yeast purchases, etc.).  Update customer Database accordingly.  Identify business opportunities and key prospects.  Establish contacts with business/sector related trade organizations, research organizations, other suppliers - as per instructions of ASM.  Monitor competitive activity by identifying and following up competitors organization and product & services offer. Report to ASM.  Technical sales  Visit existing accounts / distributors, target and potential customers (see Yearly Sales Planner) in accordance with the call frequency defined for each market segment (see Yearly Marketing Plan), developing strong relationships with customers.  Deliver technical presentations to customers.  Prepare sales offers in accordance with the guidelines of the ASM.  Provide technical support to direct customers and distributor (technical advice, assistance in trials, operators trainings…). Seek assistance from Technical Sales Support (TSS) in agreement with ASM, as and when required.  Promotion  Identify opportunities of promotion and report to management.  Promote Fermentis products within the trade, highlighting their technical and economic benefits and raising Fermentis as the expert in the industry.  Take an active role in the promotion of products through technical publications, paper and poster presentations, seminars, and participation at international and national trade shows, conferences and seminars - as per instructions of ASM.  Prepare technical presentations for seminars, conferences, tradeshows, etc., according to a specific plan agreed with management.  Seek assistance from Technical Sales Support (in agreement with the ASM), as and when required.  Assist the ASM in the organization of seminars and events with customers / distributors.  Distribution networks  To accomplish yearly objectives and action plans (market coverage, sales objectives, promotional activities, new product development…) with distributors, reporting progress on a quarterly basis.  To provide distributors with continuous technical, commercial and marketing support. Organise training as and when required. Seek assistance from Technical Sales Support (in agreement with the ASM), as and when required.  Sales administration  Liaison with Sales Administration department of each Lesaffre affiliate operating in the territory assigned, and/or other shared services, ensuring good customer service and satisfaction from order capture through to delivery, invoicing and payment.  Quality  To follow up complaints from customers. Liaison with ASM, DOS and/or TSS as and when required.  Others  Other duties may be assigned.  职位要求  Brewing or Distilling education or job experience.  Ideally from other international food ingredient supplier companies  At Least 3 years sales experiences  Prefer base in Beijing, could be basein Shandong and frequently travel to Beijing

About JMP & SAS  JMP is a business unit of SAS that produces interactive software for desktop statistical discovery. Pronounced "jump", its name suggests a leap in interactivity, a move in a new direction.  SAS is the leader in business analytics software and services, and the largest independent vendor in the business intelligence market. Through innovative solutions, SAS helps customers at more than 60,000 sites improve performance and deliver value by making better decisions faster. Since 1976 SAS has been giving customers around the world THE POWER TO KNOW®.  Job Summary  In a JMP Inside Sales role, you will be responsible for the sales of JMP product family to existing customers and new accounts (SMB Market) in China through phone and email, utilizing a consultative selling approach to prospective and current accounts.  Responsibilities Will Include  Direct selling of JMP product family via receiving and making outbound calls  Responsible for small & medium business accounts  Develop & maintain good business relationship with key customers  To ensure timely distribution and accurate quotations, qualify opportunity and follow-up to close deals  To qualify & identify opportunities and follow-up on potential deals  Enhance positive customer experience & satisfaction through timely response to customers' enquiry  Work closely with Account Executive to develop & identify new opportunities & maintain existing customers  Essential Requirements  Bachelor's degree in Engineering/ statistic or related background  3+ years of successful experience in sales of computer software, hardware or IT solutions (such as ERP, CRM, Data warehouse and etc)  Good communication through phone and email  Willing to learn and to grow to next level of career  Full proficiency in Mandarin Chinese and business-level English  Preferred  Knowledge of software acquisition cycles  Written, verbal, and interpersonal communications skills and organizational skills  Ability to work independently as well as part of a team comprised of a Pre-sales consultant, Account Manager  Ability to sell training and service  Ability to quickly build trust and maintain long term relationship with existing accounts  Ability to build trust through phone call, email and other on-line channels  Want to stay up to date on SAS culture, products and jobs? Follow us on LinkedIn  All valid SAS job openings are located on the Careers page at www.sas.com . SAS only sends emails from verified “sas.com” email addresses and never asks for sensitive, personal information or money. Should you have any doubts about the authenticity of any type of communication from, for, or on behalf of SAS, please contact us at Recruitingsupport@sas.com before taking any further action.

description: As our new Business Development Manager based in Beijing you will be responsible for acquisition of new clients. You will drive business development efforts that generate leads, enhance brand visibility, and increase sales. In addition to personal sales goals and assigned targets, you will be pivotal in winning business to reach targeted goals by ensuring that leads are exchanged, relationships are managed, and clients are given a seamless experience — working with the international business development team, as well as Space Matrix offices in Asia and the US.  Specific Responsibilities You will prospect for potential new clients and generate new leads and track leads and forecast your sales efforts to create new bookings. You will Drive business development efforts in the region, acquire new clients and manage sales targets . Gather market intelligence, including information on clients and competitors in the Workplace Market Sector, industry trends, future projects, etc You will develop and take part in pitches and other presentations that meet the client’s needs and expectations. You will Work closely with the MD and the team to complete the sales cycle. You will Represent Space Matrix by targeting potential clients, project partners, and collaborators; identifying opportunities; building relationships to expand Space Matrix’s competitive position. Requirements  In addition to experience within the real estate facilities and/or "corporate workplace" market sector in Shanghai, this position requires strategic thinking, quick problem-solving skills, excellent interpersonal and communication skills, digital media experience, and real business acumen.  Does this describe you You are a highly driven and motivated sales / business development professional. You have excellent oral and written communication skills. You have experience in managing complex sales cycle with B2B selling process. You have Undergraduate or graduate degree in business, marketing, or another field relevant to this role, with a minimum of 6 years of sales/ business development experience. You have Knowledge of the Workplace Market Sector in China including competitive positioning and strategy. You have Experience working in Architecture, Interior Design firms or related fields. Our Culture  We can offer motivated individuals who are prepared to confront head-on whatever comes their way. Members describe our company culture as collaborative, innovative, progressive, honest and fast. We perceive this as a nurturing, caring and continually maturing family; but which is also is a little chaotic at times, refreshingly apolitical, flexible and friendly.  About Space Matrix  Space Matrix design is a dynamic and agile 21st-century digital enterprise with a major client focus to deliver a profitable, sustainable and future-ready workplace solutions. We are continuing to revolutionise the delivery of design+build services in Asia with multiple offices across Australia, India, Singapore, Thailand and Vietnam. Space Matrix is number 10 in office design, globally and ranks No. 2 in Asia according to Interior Design Magazine’s 2015 Top 100 Interior Design Giants Survey. description: Job Description 1.带领团队完成区域销售指标 2.维护重点客户及管理 3.发展产品区域策略及管理 4.开拓区域渠道及管理 5.有效财务控制及管理 6.激励团队实现公司目标及文化 7.团队人才和能力建设及管理  Requirement 1.能够迅速分析，了解市场； 2.有能力迅速和区域内大客户建立合作； 3.有一定管理经验，善于带领团队，构建和谐的团队内部关系； 4.有韧性，能够克服市场困难，完成销售指标。

Senior Sales Manager, West China  Location: Flexible (Chongqing Preferred)   AIOTECH represents Vantiq that is a hot Silicon Valley startup that delivers a software platform to quickly develop and deploy the next generation of applications, applications that manages an ecosystem that consists of real-time devices (IOT, smartphones, tablets,…), legacy applications (Oracle, SAP, Salesforce, etc..), real-time social media feeds, etc... These applications can handle hundreds of thousands of events per second, provides man-machine collaboration, are distributed to any combination of cloud, edge and on-premise and are highly scalable.  AIOTECH (Vantiq) is looking for an extraordinary sales executive who loves joining a hot early stage software startup company and build the business in the region. The ideal candidate has the vision and the track record in building a significant software business in the region, especially in the industries of Energy, State Owned Enterprise (SOE), Local State Subsidized Campus and other public sectors. This position will report to the VP of Sales of Greater China.      The ideal candidate should be comfortable in having relationships with customers and partners at all levels and very important, proven experience in successfully building a partner ecosystem of System Integrators, Resellers and OEMs in a major technology company throughout the region.  Some of the things you’ll be doing include…  Develop business strategy, grow sales and serve customers. Work closely with the VP of Sales of Greater China. Meet & exceed quarterly sales targets. Provide weekly reporting of pipeline and forecast. Define and manage the strategic plan for the growth in the region. You’ll strategize and execute on plans for channel programs, marketing programs and product feedback.  Establish strong channel partners in the region. o  Overview the recruitment and management of local, regional and global partners based in the region. o  Aggressively work to maximize partner total sales potential through best practices, training and support. o  Excellent communication with management, partners, customers and support staff. o  Be responsible for the management and development the partners, providing them with direction, motivation and leadership. o  Create strategic relationships with senior decision makers within our key partners. Provide feedback and coordination to HQ and local team from the region. Provide input, direction and guidance to other staff in the region including Pre-Sales and Marketing. Keep abreast of competition, competitive issues and products. Participate in sales meetings, product seminars and trade shows as appropriate. Conduct contract negotiations. Travel flexibility --- Travel to partner or customer locations to meet partners and support sales efforts.  Who you are…  Experienced.  Significant direct leadership and strategic partnership experience. You have a solid career history and a proven track record of driving success through partners. Leader. Exceptional management, interpersonal, communication and presentation skills. People want to work with you and for you. Entrepreneurial. You are a creative and strategic thinker. Management Experience. Extensive management skills in software sales including strategic selling. Startup attitude. You have a positive attitude and will “roll up your sleeve” and do what it takes. Energy and Enthusiasm.  You believe in what we’re doing and won’t stop at anything to deliver on your goals. Excellent Communication skills - whether that be to the receptionist or the CEO, your communication style is professional at all times - you know what to say, and how to say it. Problem Solver.  You love tackling the most difficult of challenges and know how to get to the best solution. Executive presence and credibility. Performer.  Proven track record of consistently meeting or exceeding assigned goals and targets. Go-Getter. You thrive in a fast-paced, high growth, rapidly changing environment. Conviction and Commitment. Able to work independently and remotely from other members of your team and corporate. Educated. Bachelor's degree in related field, or equivalent experience. Keep abreast of competition, competitive issues and products. Participate in team-building and company-growth activities including strategy setting, sales training, marketing efforts and customer care.  About AIOTECH:  AIOTECH’s goal is to provide the best technology platform for enterprises to digitize their business while keeping humans in charge.  The AIOTECH application platform-as-a-service enables users to develop, deploy and run real-time enterprise applications driven by data streams from IoT, connected products, social, enterprise systems of record and people. All applications created with AIOTECH are event-driven, allowing businesses to respond in real-time to any business event.

Job Description  Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?  Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.  You lead a field sales representative team to ensure delivery of the sales strategy and achievement of annual KPIs and targets for a particular area. You work closely with cross-functional colleagues to deliver on activation and reporting against KPIs.  How You Will Contribute  You will: Manage, develop and motivate the team and work closely with the sales capability team to ensure delivery of training to the team. Create and manage an annual business unit plan to deliver agreed channel revenue KPI’s and targets and provide reporting as required. Manage winning customer business relationships that facilitate “best in industry” execution of our categories. Work closely with key stakeholders including the account team, category, activation team, sales capability and customer finance to provide the optimum return across your area. Fully understand category and insights knowledge, coaching the team in the use of category tools to engage and influence customers to make informed decisions that will grow our categories and deliver our annual plan.  What You Will Bring  A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge: Knowledge of market and routes-to-market in which Mondelēz International performs Experience in sales Strong organizational and analytical skills Excellent communication and interacting skills Solid knowledge about sales and negotiation processes Perseverance and attention to details  其它职位信息  关于此职位，您需要了解：  您还将带来什么额外价值：  教育背景/资历证书：  工作制定要求：  差旅要求：  工作安排：...  No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary We’ve been bringing our products to Greater China for over 35 years, making, marketing and selling our mouth-watering, well-loved local and global brands such as Oreo, LU and Chips Ahoy! biscuits, Pacific wafers, Stride gumand Milka chocolate. Headquartered in Shanghai, our 4,000 employees proudly work in sales offices and in our Research & Development Technical Centre in Suzhou. We are also proud to be awarded China’s 2020 Top Employer certification.  Mondelēz International is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  Job Type RegularField SalesSales

Today Lonza is a global leader in life sciences. We are more than 15,000 employees in more than 100 locations around the world. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of. We are currently looking for Sales Manager in Lonza Bioscience. You will be able to appropriately identify the needs of both new and current customers in order to aid customers in their success using our product. This will be done by developing an appropriate level of communication with clients and internal team members to better understand and mitigate any issues the customers may face. Key responsibilities:  To achieve sales targets by increasing product sales to existing and potential Pharma and Biotech (and academic) customers. Make visits to our customers to identify opportunities for growth within our platform Develop tactical action account plans to increase sales to reach budgeted sales objectives Assess sales potential in order to achieve specific sales targets should Provide financial information to management by researching and analyzing accounting data; preparing reports. Prepares asset, liability, and capital account entries by compiling and analyzing account information Maintain accurate customer data in CRM Follow up on leads and opportunities on a timely fashion manner Prepare and submit to management timely and accurate reports that provide information regarding sales and market activity and current status of major accounts Accurately report financial forecast information for the designated territory on a regular and annual basis Key requirements:  Rich sales working experience in biopharma, vaccine, cell and gene therapy field. Articulate and well accustomed to a client facing role Education: Bachelor degree above, major in bioscience related. Good team player, result-oriented, open mind, and love to face challenge. Good English in written and oral will be plus Business travel: 50% Every day, Lonza's products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically. People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

About Agoda  Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.  Get to Know our Team:  Partner Development is a team of creative entrepreneurs that develop solutions for Agoda’s accommodation partners and promote Agoda’s top and bottom line growth. We design tailored business and product solutions with our partners and help them generate measurable value. Members of our team are empowered and supported to grow their market(s) or accounts. We develop win-win relationships and leverage Agoda’s unique accommodations portfolio and tech solutions to bring our partners the advantages they seek. Utilizing our strong brand and resources, we roll out new product to increase the visibility of Agoda, introduce more travelers to our great products and service and deliver significant revenues to the overall business.  The Opportunity  As a Partner Development Specialist your key objective is growing the coverage and quality of Agoda’s supply network. You take care of a large portfolio of emerging high growth supply partners and assist in partnership related functions at scale.  In This Role, You’ll Get To Contact high growth supply partners to highlight revenue growth opportunities and maximize value Contact new or potential supply partners to encourage completion of their online registrations Encourage program participation through focused project sprints Communicate efficiently with partners through various communication methods including phone, email, messaging, and webinars Train and inform partners on our technologies, tools, and models Prioritize daily tasks, monitor results, and track progress in internal systems What You’ll Need To Succeed Minimum 2 years’ experience working in sales/business development or execution role preferred although fresh graduates welcome to apply Basic computer and analysis skills Analytical and proven track record in using data to drive achievements and make decisions Intellectual curiosity Autonomous and result driven (history of achieving ambitious targets) Ability to work under pressure in a competitive industry/rapidly changing environment Ability to work in a highly dynamic environment and is open to change in responsibilities, workflows, as needed by the business Able to support Hong Kong, Taiwan and Mainland China markets and following the business hours & public holidays in Hong Kong, Taiwan and Mainland China #shanghai #beijing #shenzhen #taipei #SALE #MRKT #BD #2 #3 #4  Equal Opportunity Employer  At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.  We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .  To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

BASF has been a committed partner to Greater China since 1885. With large production sites in Shanghai, Nanjing and Chongqing, as well as a global and regional research and development hub in Shanghai, BASF is a major foreign investor in the country’s chemical industry. BASF posted sales of approximately €8.5 billion in 2020 to customers in Greater China and employed 8,948 people as of the end of the year. For further information, please visit www.basf.com/cn/en.  Objectives Further enhance and grow market share of BASF’s Animal Nutrition business in China Promote and grow market share with key V&C customers in China Streamline and improve sales processes for V&C Utilize experts and colleagues to promote portfolio selling and promote the grows of PI&S market share in China Support market manager with inputs to empower product and pricing tactics in China Support product launches in China with selected key customers Drive and develop Sales Excellence and guide young talents in technical and sales knowledge Main Tasks Responsible to position and sell BASF ENL portfolio to customers in the Chinese feed industry Provide support to internal project, promotion, and marketing activity in China to promote ENL’s V&C portfolio and product launches, while coordinate full portfolio opportunities within the sales team Identify customer needs, including product application, services requirements, buying cycles, delivery schedules and pricing structure within the appropriate business segment. Act as key point of contact to key customer as e.g. Haida Group, Tong Wei, Cargill, etc., to coordinate technical support needed to build strong customer relationship Collect competition and market information Analyze existing sales, identify growth potential with new and existing customers, and manage opportunities pro-actively via SalesForce with the team with focus on Carotenoids Actively scout opportunities in Aqua culture for carotenoids, while collaborating with experts in the organization (Technical, BNB, PI&S sales) to promote the whole ENL portfolio for Aqua culture application Support supervisors in sales forecasting via APO and initiate mitigation measures to achieve sales targets if needed. Coordinate and work with technical/ customer services/ logistic personnel to solve customer complaints Contract and payment receivable management Make sure that DSO targets are met. Conclude sales contracts by coordinating the personnel of customer services, logistics and supply chain colleagues and make sure DIV on BG Drive business and process efficiency to minimize relative selling cost. Requirements Education: Bachlor or Masters in business administration and/or Master animal Nutrition, Working Experience: Min. 2 years’ work experience in feed and feed additive business Skills: Strong business acumen, strong communication and interpersonal skills (verbal and in writing), fluent in English and Chinese (verbal and writing) Primary Location  CN-Guangdong-Guangzhou  Job  Sales / Technical Sales  Ongoing  For BASF, diversity is one of the essential keys to business success and the well-being of our employees. We promote an inclusive culture that accepts the diversity of people, experiences and capabilities. Join the team and connect with more than 117,000 other minds. Stay alert for possible recruitment fraud!  This can include fake websites, fake job offers, or contact from a person falsely claiming to represent BASF.

description: Job Responsibilities/岗位职责 1. Develop strategic framework to analyze the company＇s existing business as well as new market opportunities. Lead strategic BD efforts, including scanning the market, establishing target lists, summarizing key targets, fit with company strategy, estimates of target size market size/growth. 领导战略性商务努力，包括对市场的分析，建立目标清单，总结关键目标，与公司战略相符，对 目标规模市场规模/增长有预判； 3. Drive a strong cross functional team mentality within and between teams, especially between the account managers. 在团队内部和团队间，尤其是客户经理间，培养强大的跨职能团队心态； 6. Responsible for meeting expense budgets. Coordinate budgets, develop and update forecasts, and provide reports as needed or requested. 负责满足费用预算，协调预算制定和更新预测，并根据需要或要求提供报告； 7. Performs other duties as assigned, e.g. preparing proposals, approving quotations, representing company at trade shows, conferences, etc. 履行分配的其他职责，如准备提案，批准报价，代表公司参加贸易展览会议等； 8. Provides appropriate coaching and performance feedback to all direct reports and assures that all team members are being developed. 对所有报告提供适当的指导和绩效反馈，并确保正在开发所有团队成员。 Job Requirements/岗位要求 1. Have a good understanding of biologics＇ production environment; A thorough understanding of the drug development commercialization process; a thorough understanding of due diligence, asset valuation, etc. 熟悉生物制剂的生产环境；全面了解药物开发的商业化过程；对尽职调查、资产评估等有透彻的 理解； 4. Rich experience management in business development team. 具有丰富的业务开发团队管理经验； 5. 公司描述  Fermentis works with everyone in the world of beer, wine, spirits and other fermented beverages. Its range of products and services covers almost all professional requirements: from safeguarding production to expressing sensory characteristics. Born in Lille in the North of France, Fermentis is a Business Unit of the Lesaffre Group; global key player in yeasts and fermentation solutions. For over 165 years, Lesaffre has been focused on yeast and fermentation, and all related applications, with currently more than 69 industrial plants and 11,000 employees worldwide.  Fermentis has a recognized know-how in the fermentation industry allowing the development and production of products adapted for beverage applications based on the research of more than 570 R&D experts. Its wide variety of products has been specifically created to meet the quality requirements of fermented beverage producers around the world, focusing on the development of aroma and character.  职位描述  Location could be based in Shanghai or Beijing Assist Area Sale Manager (ASM) in the preparation of sales & marketing budget (Budget) Reports monthly sales results and/or assist in sales analysis upon request. Reports on the action plan status. Marketing studies/research Carry out studies to confirm projected production volumes in the targeted segments, e.g. by assessing economical & political drivers country by country. Identify and lobby key contacts (influencers, decision-makers), key organizations, technical institutions and associations for each segment. Carry out field visits to end users and distributors, as per Fermentis definition and requirements (company information, technology, yeast purchases, etc.). Update customer Database accordingly. Identify business opportunities and key prospects. Establish contacts with business/sector related trade organizations, research organizations, other suppliers - as per instructions of ASM. Monitor competitive activity by identifying and following up competitors organization and product & services offer. Report to ASM.  Technical sales Visit existing accounts / distributors, target and potential customers (see Yearly Sales Planner) in accordance with the call frequency defined for each market segment (see Yearly Marketing Plan), developing strong relationships with customers. Deliver technical presentations to customers. Prepare sales offers in accordance with the guidelines of the ASM. Provide technical support to direct customers and distributor (technical advice, assistance in trials, operators trainings…). Seek assistance from Technical Sales Support (TSS) in agreement with ASM, as and when required. Promotion Identify opportunities of promotion and report to management. Promote Fermentis products within the trade, highlighting their technical and economic benefits and raising Fermentis as the expert in the industry. Take an active role in the promotion of products through technical publications, paper and poster presentations, seminars, and participation at international and national trade shows, conferences and seminars - as per instructions of ASM. Prepare technical presentations for seminars, conferences, tradeshows, etc., according to a specific plan agreed with management. Seek assistance from Technical Sales Support (in agreement with the ASM), as and when required. Assist the ASM in the organization of seminars and events with customers / distributors. Distribution networks To accomplish yearly objectives and action plans (market coverage, sales objectives, promotional activities, new product development…) with distributors, reporting progress on a quarterly basis. To provide distributors with continuous technical, commercial and marketing support. Organise training as and when required. Seek assistance from Technical Sales Support (in agreement with the ASM), as and when required. Sales administration Liaison with Sales Administration department of each Lesaffre affiliate operating in the territory assigned, and/or other shared services, ensuring good customer service and satisfaction from order capture through to delivery, invoicing and payment. Quality To follow up complaints from customers. Liaison with ASM, DOS and/or TSS as and when required. 职位要求  其他信息  By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

Synopsis  It’s an exciting time to work for Etihad Airways; we’ve grown from a national carrier to a global aviation group, transforming the industry through creativity and innovation.    We have a great opportunity for an Air Cargo commercial expert to lead, guide and direct the area through effective management of Etihad commercial team in line with the Cargo Commercial and operational strategy to maximize result for the mainland China market. Accountabilities  Lead the implementation of EY Cargo commercial strategy in the respective market and for the respective accounts. Lead, manage and coordinate the team to ensure achievement of agreed targets as per defined strategy and budget expectations. Develop, implement and execute robust country and account plans to maximize Etihad Cargo's revenue, load factor, yield and product mix Lead, develop, manage and stipulate a portfolio of customer contracts in line with Etihad Cargo's segmentation model and commercial strategy Performance manage the local sales, reservations and customer service teams  to ensure the maximization of company reach and revenues possibilities.  Develop, maintain and lead customer relationships including global key accounts (where the key account structure requires), regional key accounts and local accounts at all levels. Ensure Etihad Cargo visibility in the assigned area to all customer decision makers. Manage sales costs, coach, direct and motivate the team. Identify opportunities and potential blocks, plan strategy to overcome any area resistance. Use defined tools of KPI and SLA to ensure compliance with EYCC standards and service levels. Participate in the budgeting process. Ensure no financial bad debt and full compliance to CASS when applicable Drive implementation of iCargo, self-service solutions, direct booking capabilities and e-Airway Bill  Education & Experience  Educated with a minimum Bachelors degree or equivalent Minimum 5 years commercial experience within Cargo with at least 2 years supervisory/management experience Extensive experience of mainland China Cargo market with strong customer knowledge Fluent English - both written and spoken is essential Strong commercial analysis experience Analytical, commercial understanding, knowledge of reporting systems. Sound Knowledge in air cargo industry business drivers, cargo operations procedures and processes.

Their management team is from global top leading investment institutions.  They are looking for Institutional Sales Manager to join their Beijing\Hong Kong\Singapore office. They prefer candidates from big-name organizations such as Bain, McKinsey & Co，BCG，Oliver Wyman，Monitor，Booz Alan.  The Purpose of Your Role As part of our International Business Development team, you will interface with internal & external stakeholders to identify, develop, and execute strategies that create deep and lasting partnerships with institutional clients. As we continue to explore opportunities in digital assets you must be in a position to represent the voice of the client while continuing to achieve production goals. The Expertise We’re Looking For   3 to 5 years’ experience in a client-facing role at a bank, broker-dealer or another financial institution. Understanding of one or more of the following marketplaces: cryptocurrencies, blockchain, institutional custody. Experience in sales, business development and/or relationship management in an institutional context. Ability to conduct market research independently and present deal opportunities. Exceptionally strong interpersonal skills in managing internal and external relationships in a proactive, energetic and customer-obsessed way. Comfort managing concurrent priorities across a diversified workload and ability to drive results in a thoughtful and collaborative way. Experience with the sales toolkit, including experience with CRM systems and development of pitchbooks and sales materials.  The Value You Deliver Assist the Business Development team with managing our high-touch client pipeline from lead generation to implementation Build strong relationships with clients, prospects and other market participants, in order to drive new revenue and ensure customer retention. Develop presentations and sales materials for audiences with varying levels of seniority and understanding of finance, cryptocurrencies. Represent the voice of the market and the client with internal stakeholders in product, marketing, legal, risk, compliance, relationship management, implementation, operations and client service. Identify opportunities for internal process improvement within the Business Development team, present such opportunities and drive change Monitor, evaluate and socialise market trends and signals, including competitor business models, industry news and regulatory developments. Contribute to a corporate climate that values and rewards contributions, drive, initiative, and achievement of results.
