Careers that Change Lives  A Day in the Life  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned. Develops and/or implements global operating plans required to support product and program launches and achieve desired sales results. Works closely with the field sales organization to increase the adoption of Medtronic's products by developing and/or executing strategic field activities involving customer education, training and product messaging. Develops and drives product and service strategies, operational excellence, high quality and high economic value resulting in market differentiation, revenue growth and increased market share. Collaborates with other departments, including but not limited to senior leadership, Clinic Operations, Quality, Legal, Finance, Marketing, IT and Project Management to ensure sales targets are met and strategic initiatives are implemented in region of responsibility. Must Have: Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree required Minimum of 5 years of relevant sales experience or advanced degree with a minimum of 3 years of relevant sales and leadership experience Nice to Have  About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  Physical Job Requirements  The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)  Additional Information Posting Date: Aug 3, 2021 Travel: Yes, < 75 % of the Time

My client is the next-gen attribution and marketing analytics platform, giving marketers actionable insights from previously siloed data. With offices in San Francisco, Tel Aviv, Seoul, London, Beijing and Bangalore. To date, my client has raised $50M from Norwest Venture Partners, General Catalyst, Thomvest Ventures, Method Capital, Translink Capital, DCM and Telstra Ventures. Not to mention, they are currently working with great clients like Lyft, Warner Bros, Airbnb, Yelp, LinkedIn, Microsoft, Zynga, Match and Twitter.  They are looking for a Sales Engineer who is a highly motivated and energetic self-starter with a proven track record of supporting pre-sales teams in consultative value-selling. The ideal candidate thrives in this fast-paced environment, is detailed oriented, and places emphasis on maximizing sales and onboarding opportunities. He or she must have great communication skills, the ability to explain technical concepts, a passion for problem-solving and be excellent at operating in a cross-functional capacity.   The Role Since my client owns all technical aspects of the client lifecycle, through onboarding and beyond to ensure customer happiness. You will be a critical partner to Engineering, Sales, Customer Success, Support and Product organizations. You are responsible to break down technical challenges and enjoy collaborating with teams across the organization. You will be a troubleshooting expert, with a drive to transform our products to fully self-serve/self-healing properties. This position provides career development through daily direct interaction with high profile customers and partners as well as regular cross-department interactions. You are expected to have strong skills relating to internal cross-functional collaboration, and experience in one or many company departments is a plus. You must have a technical background as well as strong sales and service orientation and communication skills.  Demo the Singular platform to highlight customer use cases Align with prospects’ BI/Analytics, Product, Developer teams to answer all technical implementation questions Actively deploy and manage proof of concepts/trials from scoping through to execution against defined success criteria Communicate internal roadmap and new product features to evangelize with customers and their feedback to Singular product management and engineering groups Technical implementation of the Singular platform, from scoping, planning, and execution; encompassing the onboarding process of Singular Attribution and Analytics APIs. You will be expected to know our product inside and out and team up with Sales, Customer Success, Support, Engineering, and Product teams to assist with technical sales activities for new and existing accounts. Build customer trust through professional and swift onboarding Provide answers to customers regarding technical implementation questions Build and maintain strong relationships with marquee accounts Collaborate with Customer Success, Support, Engineering, and Product teams to deliver solutions to our customers Develop internal tools, design workflows and processes, hold training sessions, analyze data, code API wrappers. Collaborate with Engineering and Product leadership to influence product roadmaps.  You must have At least 3 years in a technical customer service/technical account management/solutions engineer/software engineering capacity Experience with mobile development (iOS/Android) Experience and knowledge integrating mobile SDKs and Rest APIs Experience in Ad Tech with attribution and/or analytics SaaS platforms - a big plus Independent, fast learner, and enjoys working in a fast-paced, growth environment Phenomenal communication skills Ability to write SQL queries Familiarity with ETL structure and database frameworks Experience in the Desktop/Mobile Ad Tech space is a plus Knowledge of Attribution, DMPs, and CDPs is a plus Excellent speaking & writing in Mandarin & English BS in Computer Science, related field, or equivalent experience A desire to build things Passion for solving problems

ILC Dover is a world leader in the innovative design and production of engineered products employing high-performance flexible materials. Since 1947, we have provided engineered solutions to complex customer problems. Initially known for the production of space suits for NASA, we leverage our vast materials, engineering, process, and design experience to create high performance systems for a wide range of industries. ILC Dover is a portfolio company of New Mountain Capital, which acquired the company in February 2020.  Recognized globally for our flexible containment solutions, ILC Dover serves customers in a diverse range of industries, including pharmaceutical and biopharmaceutical manufacturing, personal care, food and beverage, chemical, aerospace, healthcare and government agencies. ILC Dover’s visionary solutions improve efficiency, safeguard workers and product, and prevent disasters. For more information visit ILCDover.com and follow us on LinkedIn .  The Territory Sales Manager is accountable for the development and management of business opportunities within the assigned territory by developing and executing business plans, identifying and building strategic relationships including distributors and key customers within the Pharma/ BioPharma industry. This role should both manage existing channel partners as well as proactively seek out and engage key customers within the Pharma/ BioPharma industry. The Territory Sales Manager must educate potential customers on our products, propose solutions to their businesses through the services and products that we provide, and continuously drive new businesses to existing and importantly, to potential new customers. This involves a thorough understanding of the BioPharm/ Pharm industries, the manufacturing process, our clients and their needs as well as our products, our capabilities. The Territory Sales Manager must identify opportunities, such as new prospective businesses and build meaningful relationships with engineering teams. This role must understand the regulatory nuances and also use available resources to fulfill clients’ expectations, i.e. internal teamwork, communications, follow-up, data tracking.  This position can be based in Beijing or Shanghai  Responsibilities Develops and executes business plans to achieve sustained growth. Identifies and builds effective relationships with strategic distribution partners. Engages the distributors in developing and executing business strategies in alignment with market and customer needs, and monitors their performance. Approaches sales with current and new business via a consultative and solutions-oriented strategy Identifies new, potential clients and begins the relationship process Performs key sales responsibilities: Aggressively prospects and drives new business from current and future sites Builds a funnel of opportunities Closes business Achieves and exceeds agreed targets Develops and maintains an on-going relationship with Company clients while also drives new business. Understand and develop viable strategies to help the client manufacture their product, as it relates to our products/ services and continued use of our products/ services Communicates with clients on a regular basis to ensure the strategies are working and to inform clients of enhanced or new products and services Uses all internal resources to ensure clients are satisfied with our products and service, e.g. internal customer service resources, marketing, SalesForce, Engineering, etc. Expedites resolutions when complaints, concerns, or issues arise Prepares and conducts presentations or trainings for our clients and distributors. Prepares reports and updates for our management team on a regular basis Provides feedback from the customer to our internal team(s) as well as propose ideas to enhance our products and service Attends tradeshows and other promotional events Travels within assigned territory on a regular basis Updates SalesForce database with all data on a daily, frequent basis Maintains professionalism and ethical standards at all times This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Other duties, responsibilities and activities may change or be assigned at any time with or without notice. Qualifications Bachelor of Science degree in Chemistry, Engineering, or Pharmaceuticals/ Biotechnology Minimum of 5-10 years’ relevant experience in Pharma/BioPharma Sales with proven sales achievements Understanding of Pharm/ BioPharm Manufacturing process Demonstrated ability for strategic planning Able to Travel 50% of the time CRM use/expertise; SalesForce preferred Demonstrated knowledge of presentation software and report writing Demonstrated presentation, and oratory skills

description: Location: Shanghai or Beijing  Cisco is the largest security company on the planet, with a broad portfolio and dominant market incumbency across the majority of our customer's most critical technology and digital investments. Cisco security is the industry's most comprehensive advanced threat protection portfolio that is integrated, pervasive, continuous and open. Cisco's threat-centric approach to security reduces complexity while providing unmatched transparency, continuous control and advanced threat protection across the entire continuum--before, during and after an attack.  We have a relentless customer focused culture with the ability to execute and build long term partnerships with our customer and channel.  As a Virtual Sales Specialist (VSS) you will be responsible for all sales of Cisco Security technologies and associated services into a named account list in the Mid-Market segment. You are able to craft and grow new relationships within the customer base via direct touch to drive revenue growth while ensuring internal alignment. You will also lead and orchestrate a team to execute on the strategy and plan you build.  Responsibilities: Develop and lead security account plans and strategies for each assigned account using all available resources (executive sponsors, marketing, technical, services, Cisco on Cisco, etc). Drive revenue growth through new project identification, creation, and attach opportunities. Drive SecureX platform strategy and software led approach. Forecast and report activity accurately in line with expectations. Identify major projects within the largest accounts and running activities to improve product and services revenue. Provide customers and partners with pricing and configurations to meet their needs as required. Craft high-level relationships within assigned existing accounts to win incremental product and service business. Partner closely with technical resources to ensure technical perfection in all positioning, competitive analysis, proposals, and exchanges. Team with Cisco authorized channel partners on sales opportunities bringing to bear their capabilities where appropriate. Direct touch sales combined with experience working in a matrixed organization.   Who You'll Work With  Companies digitizing and the Internet of Everything are phenomenon’s driving new opportunities for Cisco and it's transforming our customers' businesses worldwide. We are pioneers and have been since the early days of connectivity.   Today, we are building teams that are rapidly growing our technology solutions in the mobile, cloud, security, IT, and big data spaces, including software and consulting services. Collaborate with like-minded innovators in a fun and flexible culture that has earned Cisco global recognition as a Great Place To Work.   Cisco is a game changer in the security industry. We’re working to deliver technology that not only safeguards customer’s data but doesn’t become an obstacle when they need to access it. We’re developing next gen firewall and cloud security solutions that can adapt to constantly changing threats to the network.   Cisco is taking big steps to position ourselves as the #1 IT Security provider in the industry. In addition to having the right market conditions, capabilities, products and services, we need the right people to take us there.   Who You Are: Native Mandarin speaker. Experience selling complex cloud and software-based solutions such as network security (Intrusion Detection, Firewall, VPN, and related technologies) or Network and Systems management solutions. Validated/Quantifiable track record of over-achievement. Able to build and execute on an account plan which factors in a total systems-based security approach. Adept at communicating with a largely technical audience. Experience in applying solution-selling methodologies to improve corporate revenue growth. Track record of closing both tactical and strategic opportunities. Good all-round knowledge of Security Market. Good interpersonal, communication and presentation skills. Dedicated with ability to succeed in a dynamic environment. Bold and takes ownership. Self-starter. High level of attention to detail. Do not lose mindset.
industries: Computer Networking and Computer & Network Security

Job Description Achieve Rockwell Automation Information Software sales targets, and meet business revenue plans for software solutions using a discipline sales process within targeted accounts. - Demonstrate the value of IoT offering through your activity (phone calls, email, LinkedIn and other social mediums) - Prospect into whitespace accounts and feel comfortable targeting senior level decision makers positioning the value of digital transformation, specifically IoT and AR - Drive the velocity of your opportunities further down the sales cycle and prepare the customer for a meaningful engagement with your dedicated sales rep counterpart and/or broader supporting ecosystem - Leverage Digital Selling tactics to optimize outbound prospecting (e.g. Linkedin Sales Navigator) - Challenge yourself to build upon key competencies in preparation for your future career growth at Rockwell Automation - Ability to manage adversity and consult prospects who may not recognize a need or pain yet - Investigate and understand the internal business processes of potential clients - Partner with cross functional groups such as Global Sales & Marketing selling resources, Deal Desk, Customer Success, Channel, and Operations/Enablement to identify areas of success and growth - Develop and manage an accurate sales forecast and pipeline of PTC IoT and AR Software. - Provide input into customer proposals and requests for information. Sales is responsible for the proposal. We don’t generate it, but ensure its pulled together. - Assist in the development of project scope and ROI analysis. Knowledge of IoT and AR are a minimum requirement. - IOT / IIOT / Annual Recurring Revenue / software / subscription model type of experience, including collaboration with a customer success function - Demonstrated ability to sell at the senior management & executive levels, focusing on the business outcomes and articulating the tangible economic value that information software solutions & services can deliver

description: Reports to: Sales and Business Development Director Location: ShenZhen  Responsibilities   1.    Business Development •    Pro-actively seek and establish relationships with target Key and VIP potential companies and manage end to end sales process from initial contact through client on-boarding and on-going relationship development. •    Support on-boarding of new Standard/low potential accounts and facilitate transfer to Client Support team for on- going management. •    Respond to inbound leads from website esquires, requests for quotation and client referrals. •    Work with colleagues within sales and marketing teams both internally and group partners to engage with high potential accounts which span geographical regions and company scope. •    Assist colleagues to support new prospects which cover multiple regions. •    Support for the different organizations within the corporate group   2.    Existing Account Development •    Take ownership of relationships for Key and VIP accounts to ensure maximization of potential business with those clients. •    Ensure clear handover of information for Standard (low potential accounts) which shall be self-managed by Online system and Client Support team. Additional support may be required to provide for Standard accounts on a case by case basis. •    Liaise with colleagues internally to seek information to answer to Key and VIP account questions, feedback or complaints in a timely and professional manner. •    Regularly meeting and communicating with key and VIP clients face to face and by phone ensuring adherence to client follow up policies. •    Revive dormant / unresponsive clients and work with Client Support team to reduce client churn. •    In the event of claims and complaints from Key and VIP accounts assist in the negotiation to reduce impact to client relationship and seek to establish a reasonable solution with the client while limiting cost impact to the company.   3.    Marketing •    Provide insights and input to overall and regional sales and marketing strategy. •    Assist marketing department activities to develop new content for marketing campaigns.   4.    Administration •    Maintaining CRM records for owned accounts including, but not limited to ensuring opening opportunities related to RFQ’s, logging sales activities (meetings, calls, etc) and updating contact information. •    Follow up creditors on significantly overdue invoices in line with Accounts Receivable policy.

jobTitle: Sales & Channel Development Manager- Asia Pacific Region- Land and Air Prod
description: Applanix, a Trimble company is recruiting for a Sales & Channel Manager for Land and Air Business, to fill an opportunity in APAC (Asia Pacific Region)  The incumbent is responsible for coordinating, managing, and executing all sales activity and strategies for the Applanix Land and Air Product Portfolios to the defined market segments outlined in the business LRPs (Long Range Plans) in the region defined as Asia Pacific with a focus on Main Land China, Hong Kong and Japan. Strategies will be communicated and coordinated with the business director, product manager, to include product mix/portfolio, pricing, distribution, advertising and sales promotion and recommendations for Land and Air. Sales are determined by executing both direct sales and managing existing and recommending new channel network opportunities. The role will demand a commitment to providing exceptional business-to-customer communication, Channel Development, and sales service.  Key Responsibilities  Collaborates with the Director of Sales and Business Director in establishing and recommending the most realistic sales goals for the company in the region defined. Establishes regional sales strategies for Land and Air Products through the strategic development of Regional Channel Partners. Works with the Technical Sales Lead in Asia to develop a sales plan focused on short term and long term grown opportunities of each business. Sales Strategies are expected to remain in line with the regional business plans and determine the objectives for product distribution, how new customers and business will be developed, and provides insights to new product developments. Educates new and existing reseller channels by establishing programs/seminars in the areas of new account sales and growth, sales of emerging products and multi-product sales, profitability, improved presentation strategies and competitive strategies. Manages existing Channel Partners by holding them accountable to their business plans and regional forecasts. Represents the Applanix/Trimble organization in external business relationships with channel partners, distribution and customers so that the strategic messaging is communicated clearly. This position is accountable for Regional Sales targets defined in the annual sales forecast to the Applanix Sales Director.  Qualifications  Minimum of 10 years regional sales and industry management experience preferably in the Geospatial Sector. Strong account management and relationship building skills Extensive (5+ Year) Experience with growing and managing a Channel Partner network Degree in Business Expectation of 40% + Travel  Applanix is committed to an Accessible workplace and provides an Accessible recruitment process. Please note that we can accommodate disabilities upon request. Please let us know if you require any accommodations. Only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.  Our Company  Trimble is transforming the way the world works by delivering products and services that connect the physical and digital worlds. Core technologies in positioning, modeling, connectivity and data analytics enable customers to improve productivity, quality, safety and sustainability. From purpose built products to enterprise lifecycle solutions, Trimble software, hardware and services are transforming a broad range of industries such as agriculture, construction, geospatial and transportation and logistics.  #sales  Trimble Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color, religion, national origin, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, or any other protected factor. EOE/M/F/V/D

jobTitle: Supervisor, Sales, Home Care/I&I, Greater China
description: BASF has been a committed partner to Greater China since 1885. With large production sites in Shanghai, Nanjing and Chongqing, as well as a global and regional research and development hub in Shanghai, BASF is a major foreign investor in the country’s chemical industry. BASF posted sales of approximately €8.5 billion in 2020 to customers in Greater China and employed 8,948 people as of the end of the year. For further information, please visit www.basf.com/cn/en.  Objectives Take the overall sales responsibilities of relevant industry in assigned scope Manage sales and customers to achieve the sales and profit targets Implement relevant industry and SBU strategy to support business growth. Provide input for account plan, pricing proposal and market intelligence. Identify potential customers and set up action plan aim towards new business realization Main Tasks Continuously develop and implement appropriate measures to ensure safety at workplace & during business trips. Develop and implement preventive measures to ensure compliance as defined by company’s Code of Conduct Plan and manage assigned accounts, including direct accounts/dealers/distributors, to meet sales target and ensure account strategies are implemented consistently Manage existing customers CSP, orders entry, delivery and payments relative daily works. Provide accurate sales forecast, supporting efficient planning of products and services Initiate the collaboration with other cross functional teams such as marketing, D&AT, PM, SCM to ensure customer satisfaction, e.g. delivery reliability, and achieving business growth. Consolidate and analyze data on customer needs, including product application, services requirements, buying cycles, delivery schedules, internal regulations, pricing structure, and credibility profiles to help secure business Maintain customer relationship through regular contact, proposals on sales/marketing/technical solutions to establish long term partnerships Fast response to customer requests on product info, technical support via coordination with various teams and functions within BASF (technical, customer services, logistic personnel, product management, regulatory affairs, etc.) to solve customer problems/complaints (NCM) and enhance high level of customer satisfaction Research, identify and develop existing and potential projects to increase sales and profitable growth Create sales projects, closely monitor on project progress of both direct and indirect channels and follow up regularly with key stakeholders Develop and implement measures to continuously track, report and act upon market intelligence such as competitive activities, demand/capacity development, pricing development to ensure BASF’s position as market leader Establish a database to obtain, update, maintain and evaluate market trends, the application of products/technology and service needs etc. in order to identify new business opportunities Establish and capitalize relationships with key stakeholders such as trade association, opinion leaders and partners to ensure BASF’s market position Cost-to-serve and Working capital Actively manage Selling cost, e.g. manage business trip with clear target to ensure effectiveness and efficiency Propose to and implement with team leader for indirect cost management Collaborate with SCM and other departments to ensure effective business forecast, payment terms, receivables and credit risk management, appropriate use of Inco terms and achieve all working capital targets Requirements Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in chemistry or related discipline. Postgraduate education such as Master in related discipline preferred Working Experience: Minimum 3 years’ working experience in related industry Other requirements: Well established business acumen and communication skills.

jobTitle: Sales Manager Powder Coating, East China
description: East China is of strategic importance to Powder North Asia. The purpose of the role is to drive and deliver strong sales and profit (current customers and new prospects) growth in East China in line with business strategy and the overall segment’s profitability related targets.   Responsibilities  Roll-out I&C segment sales programs (including sales process-related knowledge and tools) and implement corporate projects such as CRM and IBP. Develop and execute I&C sales strategies in the marketplace and deliver expected top and bottom line results for the segment in the allocated region. Plan, monitor and periodically report on execution of major sales activities conducted with regard to indirect and direct sales channel. Identify significant business opportunities, pinpoint existing and/or potential problem areas and assist field force where appropriate. Provide demand forecast for regional segment sales plans in line with the business IBP processes. Drive Continuous Improvement across the organization to generate value to customers – Service, capability, efficiency and productivity Collaborate with cross functional teams including support to the relevant key account teams to execute their sales plans and deliver against desired service levels new developments Provide support and leadership to sales, customer services and technical teams by showing vision, putting in resources to ensure high service levels and operational efficiency; build a strong sales team in East region to gain sustainable profitable growth Be familiar with all the applicable corporate as well as site policies/procedures with regard to personal conduct and HSE standards and act in compliance with all applicable regulations with integrity  Qualifications: Knowledge & Work Experience: 8-10 years of B2B working experience in commercial roles, sales and key account management; Paints and coatings industry experience a plus. Minimum Bachelor Degree. Masters of Business Administration in related field preferred Skills: Leadership, stakeholder management, project management, decision making, creating value propositions, drive, results orientation, communication and presentation, commercial and business acumen, basic understanding of cross functional processes and financial concepts related to sales and cost to serve

Background: At Diaceutics we believe that every patient should get the precision medicine they deserve. We are a data analytics and end-to-end services provider enabled by DXRX - the world’s first Diagnostic Network solution for the development and commercialization of precision medicine diagnostics. Diaceutics has worked on every precision medicine brought to market and provides services to 36 of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies. We have built the world’s largest repository of diagnostic testing data with a growing network of 2500 labs in 53 countries.  Position Summary:  Diaceutics business model is one that synergizes multiple inputs and research data streams to guide pharmaceutical clients in precision medicine and diagnostic strategy. This full-time permanent role will report to the Vice President, APAC.  The primary purpose of this position is to drive New Business Development with companies where we are cultivating opportunities. The Head of Sales China will play a key role in establishing and maintaining client relationships, ensuring client satisfaction and be able to identify new opportunities and build an extensive business network. The Head of Sales China will be committed to helping clients solve problems, realise their business goals with Diaceutics solutions and work with the Diaceutics Technical Domain Experts, Global Lab Team, Innovation and Project Managers in ensuring we deliver a quality product and delight our customers.    We are seeking candidates that are currently Senior Sales Specialists and/or Senior Business Development Leads and have a proven track record (year on year growth) for Driving Sales growth with targeted clients being Pharmaceutical and Biotechnology companies. Mandarin must be the candidate’s native language and the candidate must be based in China. The ideal candidate will be apt in building strong relationships with strategic customers, be sales driven and able to meet annual sales targets. The Head of Sales China will be able to identify needs and requirements to promote our company’s solutions and achieve mutual satisfaction, be able to understand the client’s key issues and critical success factors. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing the sales pipeline through relationships, collaborative partnerships and strategic planning. The candidate will diligently update the company Customer relationship management (CRM) and Business Development tools and ensure its adherence, as well as reporting on annual KPI’s and sales targets to the VP, Asia Pacific. The candidate will have a proven track record in selling complex products/services into large pharmaceutical and biotech companies in the diagnostic setting.   The individual will be highly skilled in identifying needs and requirements of pharmaceutical clients and matching these to Diaceutics solutions. This role will require extensive travelling.  Duties & Responsibilities:  Develop and execute strategic plans for China, focused on pharma clients in need of Diaceutics’ services and data. Deliver project sales, build client relationships and extend company presence in China to broaden the impact Diaceutics produces for each client, developing strategic relationships with key decision makers up to C Suite level.  Actively serve as customer advocate, collaborating with internal teams to deploy the essential resources, providing data driven insights supporting clients’ strategic decisions.  Collaborate with VP of APAC to deliver China regional sales targets and support regional business objectives.  Identify new business opportunities at pharmaceutical companies where we currently do not have an active relationship or with local Brand teams not currently engaged with Diaceutics. Drive solicitation, communication and interactions to engage potential customers so they fully understand Diaceutics’ capabilities and range of services and where we can provide value for their companion diagnostic commercialization activities.  Create and implement strategic client plans to identify future business development opportunities, demonstrating in depth knowledge of company pipelines, emerging biomarkers and commercialization challenges. Anticipate and execute directives from Diaceutics management that results in exceeding client expectations. Assume full responsibility as client advocate for assigned projects and their progress through design, development, delivery and evaluation. Participate in key read outs and monthly internal progress review meetings, liaising with the Project Manager and Technical Lead during the delivery process. Delight internal and external clients through extraordinary account management, strong customer service and consistent delivery of projects that exceed requirements and expectations. Promote Diaceutics culture and philosophy as reflected through completed projects, as well as quality of internal and external client interactions. Through the efforts of the team, coordinate and deliver to client expected results by set timelines. Assure ongoing strategic and tactical knowledge and proficiency in all aspects of the current and potential industries served by Diaceutics. Represent the region at key conferences in China. Co-support Conference readiness across the company with the Marketing Team. Build relationships and lead/contact databases regularly working within the CRM database system.  Input into the development of proposals with clear definition on scope, client key expectations, business case and success criteria.  General Education and Experience: Education – Bachelor’s degree required in life sciences, business administration, economics, statistics, computer science or a related field. MBA or higher degrees are preferred. Experience – Minimum 3-5 years of sales experience in life sciences consulting, data services, CRO pharmaceutical or IVD industry. Commercial experience in data services is preferred. Knowledge and Skills: • Proven experience within the Diagnostic industry, preferably Companion Diagnostics (CDx). • Knowledge of Precision Medicine. • Experience in selling complex high value services/products into pharmaceutical companies. • Strong interpersonal skills with aptitude in building relationships with professionals of all organizational levels. • Excellent organizational skills. • Ability in problem-solving and negotiation. • Ability to establish and maintain successful networks. • Strong account management and relationship building skills and experience. • Experience in delivering annual sales in excess of $10M/yr. • High levels of impact and influence – both internal and external across different functions. • Strategic thinking, problem-solving ability, customer focus. • Business and financial acumen. • Entrepreneurial, positive, can-do attitude that seeks to identify innovative solutions. • Excellent communication skills (written & spoken) with individuals with different cultural, professional and academic backgrounds, including the ability to simplify complex issues. • Skilled and autonomous negotiator. • Demonstrated experience with driving revenue within existing clients and in developing new prospects. 4. Computer and Software Knowledge and Skills – Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, skilled user Excel and Powerpoint. Experience of CRM / SFDC is advantageous.  Life at Diaceutics: We are a multi-cultural, diverse team spanning 16 countries around the world with current expansion across Asia. One thing we all have in common is that we are dedicated people who are passionate about patient outcomes. 80% of our employees work remotely and we collaborate together as a global village. At Diaceutics, we live by our values, The Diaceutics EFFECT. Our employees are Empowered to take responsibility for their own personal development, encouraged to use strategic Foresight in leadership decisions, to build positive working relationships through Fun and productive engagements and to think independently like an Entrepreneur where the best idea wins no matter who said it. Communication flow is a key part of our inclusive working culture where team building leads to camaraderie and Trust between co-workers. We hire smart, fun people who care about our mission and about each other. Some interesting points about us:  • Competitive salary (and attractive bonus scheme dependent on role). • Training and development budgets for every team. • Remote / Virtual Working. • Flexible Working including Flex Day Program. • Generous Annual and Public Holiday allowance. • Enhanced Maternity and Sick Pay Provisions. • Robust Performance Management Framework and Individual Development Plan. • Generous Staff Referral Scheme. • Dedication to positive working culture with regular health and wellbeing activities and annual company get together.  We are an equal opportunities employer and we welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons.  Please see link below to our Candidate Privacy Statement - https://www.diaceutics.com/uploads/diaceutics-candidate-fair-processing-notice

jobTitle: SE&TSS Manager of Sales Region South, Guang Zhou
description: Note: Pls submit your Siemens E-mail Address when apply this position (for internal candidate only).  SE&TSS Manager of Sales Region South is responsible for sales excellence and TSS(Technical Sales Support) section, and reporting to General Manager of Sales Region South, Digital Industries.  What are my responsibilities?  Mission  Ensures achievement of objectives and strategy of a sales unit, defines and coordinates respective activities in an assigned team of professionals and make sure smoothly implement Act as an expert to drive and support continuously improve/optimization in business performance, know-how & competence management, guidelines and procedures Act as the trusted advisor to work closely with the sales management, support management and sales to better understand strategy Act as an leader to drive the technical team to support DI SU business in high technical performance, know-how & competence, engineer career structure management Act as the opinion leader to support all SU colleagues for better utilize DI technical & portfolio strength to leverage a successful business growth both in absolute volume and market share/customer satisfaction Responsible to support sales managers for sales steering and inspiring team spirit.  Areas of Responsibility  Acts as the central contact partner for the counterpart in assigned sales unit, focus on DI Country strategy Vision and cross business alignment (SU, BU, Global and Region Tour) Drives alignment on strategy, guidelines and procedures related to SE&TSS from both of DI and Regional level; Analyses, develops, implements and adapts defined regional guidelines and procedures to achieve the continuous optimization, also ensures proper communication and training Monitors, analyzes and comments the relevant business data and KPIs in (SBTA , Sales Funnel, Market Transparency, Market/Customer/branch eco-system, Projects, Vbez performance, Demo Machine in number and quality, Engineer Utilization Rate, Customer Satisfaction, Sales & Technical Engineer Knowledge management, etc.) for assigned sales unit Coordinates sales activities and be responsible for sales systematic daily maintenance in good running and performing (CRM, SieSales/Trust IT, E-booking, TSS Engineer Platform, T&OE and Central SE Interface) and optimization for assigned sales units Be responsible for Sales administration management, organize regional level internal and external event: SU Meeting, exhibition, promotion express, customer events，Sales Pioneer, Annual Party, Outing, etc Be responsible for sales competence development in regional level: Sales Unit Training Plan, Newcomer Integration, Performance Improvement, Sales Competence Assessment, Sales Pioneer, etc Drive Sales Unit operational topics (e.g. target agreements, focus topics, regional initiatives, G2M actions) SE & TSS Team management: Prioritizes and assigns tasks to team members and efficient working plan to monitor progress to ensure timely completion Planning and managing results and performance Professional and disciplinary management. Build a heathy organizational talents pipeline Fostering the learning organization, to coach and support the team members find an attractive setting for their own personal learning and further competence development Act as "Role model" to ensure the team living with Siemens Ownership Culture Other related tasks assigned by superior  What do I need to qualify for this job? (Crucial job profile requirements)  Education and Experience  Solid professional judgment and problem solving practice. Experience in Improves existing processes and approaches. Minimum 5 years professional management within a multinational environment or foreign investment company, multiple function experience especially sales related management experience is preferred. At least 5 years manager experience in automation related company or department. Bachelor or above, better major in automation, MBA is preferred Good English both in written and spoken.  Organization: Digital Industries  Company: Siemens Ltd., China  Experience Level: Mid-level Professional  Job Type: Full-time

description: 该职位来源于猎聘  Major Account Sales Manager  Shanghai, Beijing, China  Would you like the opportunity to work closely with high-performing teams and partners in China？  Do you thrive in an environment which values autonomy, ownership and creativity？  Jabra China is currently on a lookout for an exceptional sales manager, to join our Enterprise Sales Team in China as our next Major Account Sales Manager.  This is your chance to be an integral team-member, serving as the primary liaison and relationship manager between Jabra and our enterprise sales partner.  You will get your hand on the following exciting tasks: To work with China offline non-named major accounts to set & meet/exceed sales targets of distributors and key partners by executing Jabra solution selling model at enterprise segment To complete & update profiles of focus non-named major accounts. To work with China offline non-named major account team on the management of sell in, sell through and sell out of distributors and partners To analyze the performance of focus non-named major accounts to maximize sales revenue with highest efficiency To work closely with non-named major accounts and achieve the target of new channel development, enablement and activation. A strong Major Account Sales and customer development partner, we imagine the following sounds like you: 3 years sales or business development experience key account/end user sales experience A thorough know-how of PC industry/products. Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business is preferred MS Office applications Strong Business Development and strategic planning capability. About Us  About Jabra - Part of GN Store Nord A/S makes life sound better by developing intelligent sound solutions that transform lives through the power of sound, enabling you to hear more, do more & be more than you ever thought possible. Our integrated headset and communications solutions assist professionals in all types of businesses in being more productive. Our wireless headsets and earbuds are designed to fit any lifestyle - from sports enthusiasts to commuters and office workers. Jabra is part of the GN group, which operates in more than 90 countries across the world. Founded in 1869, GN group today has more than 5,000 employees. GN Netcom is an EEO Employer and does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, veteran status, military service, sexual orientation, genetic information, or gender identity.

description: What You Do At AMD Changes Everything  At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.  Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.  The Role  We are looking for our next team member to drive our China strategy and demand for AMD-based Lenovo products. The primary focus is to win market share and grow sales for AMD EPYC and Radeon Instinct product lines across all market segments.  The Person  Does this sound like you? We'd love to talk! A strong drive to “win,” combined with sound business perspective High level of confidence, business maturity and integrity A true hunter mentality identifying new business and partnerships beneficial to AMD sales goals Open communication style and presence to work optimally at all levels Honest and trustworthy in dealings with internal/external customers, colleagues and partners Ability to listen to the customer and articulate their needs internally Proven track record of strategy & planning, building on a strategic vision Proven ability to deliver high level communications, marketing and presentations at all levels. description: Sales Operations Specialist is to provide leadership and oversight to the Sales & Business Management Analysis group. Ensures provision of end-to-end customer support in the following areas: (1) contract and order management, (2) logistics and solution delivery, and (3) billing and invoicing. Coordinates between relevant internal and external parties and ensures timely and accurate execution of sales (lead-to-order) and, especially, delivery (order-to-cash) processes. Ensures effective execution of the company’s global standards and practices across the organization.  You are responsible for Contributes to and assists with efforts to proactively support Sales and related business management processes. With guidance, provides administrative and transactional services in areas such as: Sales proposal and contract development, Sales order, customer and supplier documentation, Administration, production and submission of bid / tender responses, Data gathering and development of pricing information, sales forecasts, and revenue and margin information, Solution delivery management, Billing and invoicing, Sales funnel tool administration, including monitoring data to ensure compliance with company standards and practices. Maintains and updates customer sales records, including sales pipeline and contract details. Maintains and updates the submitted bid library, Serves as first point of contact for ad hoc customer sales telephone and email enquiries. Receives, responds to and appropriately routes sales / customer correspondence and requests for information. Maintains records and filing systems, retrieving information as required. Supports special projects as assigned. Qualifications Bachelor Degree in Business Administration, Business Informatics or comparable training Experience in Sales operations in regard to contract & order management, billing & invoicing ,end to end customer support, logistics & delivery management Experience in business with retail customers and processes Effective stakeholder managements including internal and external parties Excellent knowledge of MS-Office, especially with analysis tools such as Excel and Power BI Good knowledge of SAP is required Excellent organizational, networking, problem solving and analytical thinking skills Good English language skills, both written and spoken

Summary of responsibilities: The Director of Sales & Marketing is responsible for providing overall leadership and development for all Sales & Marketing functions. Goal is to ensure growth of patient volumes and revenue targeted towards existing and new clients in B2C, B2B and B2D sales channels, by performing the following duties personally or through subordinates:  Overall Sales & Marketing Management: • Develop and implement effective sales & marketing strategies, structures, budgets, solutions, campaigns and specific goals to increase patient volumes and revenue for Shenzhen New Frontier United Family Hospital • Provide training, support and leadership to all sales and marketing team members to ensure all key revenue targets are met. • Provide management with monthly, quarterly and annual sales & marketing performance and forecasts. Report on the effectiveness of sales, marketing and lead generation campaigns using pre-determined KPIs. • Oversee the planning and implementation of the facility based digital strategy.   Sales Management: • Directly manage large corporate clients. • Develop and implement innovative lead generation programs that drive demand for UFH packages and services. Continuously monitor performance of such programs.  Product Marketing Management: • Research target consumer’s behavior and buying criteria for purchasing health insurance. • Conduct competitive analysis and develop innovative marketing strategies and products that provide a competitive value proposition in the marketplace. • Develop and manage innovative marketing strategies, product packages, positioning and messaging that drive demand for medical services.  Marketing Management: • Conduct regular market research. Continuously review changes to the market, consumer trends and the activities of competitors, adjusting the marketing plan if necessary • Manage overall brand value of UFH. Protect brand and visual identity by (1) managing traditional and social media, (2) review all materials to be published - whether online or offline - and (3) approve all Media purchases, corporate sponsorship opportunities and external partnerships. • Create and manage a calendar of events such as health talks, webinars, conferences and thought leadership contributions, all aimed at increasing patient volumes.  Internal Relationships: • Establish productive and professional relationships with key personnel across the UFH network, including general managers, medical department chairs, and etcetera.  Knowledge and Experience: At least 5-10 years’ experience in sales & marketing management preferably in the healthcare and / or services industry. Strong knowledge of digital marketing technologies. Able to understand and analyses sales and marketing performance metrics. Strong communication and team management skills Analytical skills with a problem-solving attitude Availability to travel as needed BSc degree in Marketing, Business Administration or relevant field Native Mandarin Speaker with good English language skills.

description: THE ROLE  Burberry is the worldwide high-end fashion brand and also a market leader in China beauty category. Coty took over the Burberry beauty business since 2018 year and rolling out ambitious Go-to-Market strategy including high-quality product offering, strong retail presence, innovative marketing strategy, as well as upgraded customer experience. Our purpose is to elevate a women’s beauty sense inspired from Burberry prestige British royal brand heritage and avant-garde fashion spirit.   KEY RESPONSIBILITIES  The Brand Manager is responsible to drive the development and execution of marketing bundles and brand plans to build the brand awareness, desirability and convert consumer engagement & sales in long-run vision. Identify and implement brand strategies based on consumer/shopper insights, competitive threats and brand issues and opportunities, in compliant to global brand marketing and fashion house guideline. Develop brand annual calendar and wisely use available resource to achieve business targets. including but not limited in brand sales, pillar/category performance, retail excellence, campaign delivery, consumer acquisition, consumer retention, brand awareness improvement. To liaise with local registration team and global brand team to make sure timely new innovation launches in China. Achieve business results through executional excellence and partners with cross functional colleagues to ensure MKT activities are executed according to strategy and are supported by investments in advertising, digital /social and promotions. Applies understanding of local consumers, customers, and competitors to adapt the global license guideline& policy in local adaptation, while also take a role of strong local voice in proposing local initiatives. Provide timely and insightful business analysis and reports to adapt strategy and action plans.  WHAT YOU WILL BRING      5+ years’ experience in Marketing, luxury beauty will be a credit. With excellent track record in innovation rollouts and flawless launch management, S&OP, and media planning & execution Project Management: Ability to inspire and lead team, hold them accountable to deliver project deliverables Experience in consumer work and mix development a plus Strong communication, and good at coordinating and mobilizing the internal and external resources. Fluent Mandarin & English capability. Strong beauty sense and Luxury taste.

Additionally, as needed, support renewals and expansion deals with existing customers – help identify ideas to support new/changing business objectives and maximize value realized from D&B solutions. ILC Dover is a world leader in the innovative design and production of engineered products employing high-performance flexible materials. Since 1947, we have provided engineered solutions to complex customer problems. Initially known for the production of space suits for NASA, we leverage our vast materials, engineering, process, and design experience to create high performance systems for a wide range of industries. ILC Dover is a portfolio company of New Mountain Capital, which acquired the company in February 2020.  Recognized globally for our flexible containment solutions, ILC Dover serves customers in a diverse range of industries, including pharmaceutical and biopharmaceutical manufacturing, personal care, food and beverage, chemical, aerospace, healthcare and government agencies. ILC Dover’s visionary solutions improve efficiency, safeguard workers and product, and prevent disasters. For more information visit ILCDover.com and follow us on LinkedIn .  The Territory Sales Manager is accountable for the development and management of business opportunities within the assigned territory by developing and executing business plans, identifying and building strategic relationships including distributors and key customers within the Pharma/ BioPharma industry. This role should both manage existing channel partners as well as proactively seek out and engage key customers within the Pharma/ BioPharma industry. The Territory Sales Manager must educate potential customers on our products, propose solutions to their businesses through the services and products that we provide, and continuously drive new businesses to existing and importantly, to potential new customers. This involves a thorough understanding of the BioPharm/ Pharm industries, the manufacturing process, our clients and their needs as well as our products, our capabilities. The Territory Sales Manager must identify opportunities, such as new prospective businesses and build meaningful relationships with engineering teams. This role must understand the regulatory nuances and also use available resources to fulfill clients’ expectations, i.e. internal teamwork, communications, follow-up, data tracking.  Responsibilities Develops and executes business plans to achieve sustained growth. Identifies and builds effective relationships with strategic distribution partners. Engages the distributors in developing and executing business strategies in alignment with market and customer needs, and monitors their performance. Approaches sales with current and new business via a consultative and solutions-oriented strategy Identifies new, potential clients and begins the relationship process Performs key sales responsibilities: Aggressively prospects and drives new business from current and future sites Builds a funnel of opportunities Closes business Achieves and exceeds agreed targets Develops and maintains an on-going relationship with Company clients while also drives new business. Understand and develop viable strategies to help the client manufacture their product, as it relates to our products/ services and continued use of our products/ services Communicates with clients on a regular basis to ensure the strategies are working and to inform clients of enhanced or new products and services Uses all internal resources to ensure clients are satisfied with our products and service, e.g. internal customer service resources, marketing, SalesForce, Engineering, etc. Expedites resolutions when complaints, concerns, or issues arise Prepares and conducts presentations or trainings for our clients and distributors. Prepares reports and updates for our management team on a regular basis Provides feedback from the customer to our internal team(s) as well as propose ideas to enhance our products and service Attends tradeshows and other promotional events Travels within assigned territory on a regular basis Updates SalesForce database with all data on a daily, frequent basis Maintains professionalism and ethical standards at all times This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Other duties, responsibilities and activities may change or be assigned at any time with or without notice. Qualifications Bachelor of Science degree in Chemistry, Engineering, or Pharmaceuticals/ Biotechnology Minimum of 5-10 years’ relevant experience in Pharma/BioPharma Sales with proven sales achievements Understanding of Pharm/ BioPharm Manufacturing process Demonstrated ability for strategic planning Able to Travel 50% of the time CRM use/expertise; SalesForce preferred Demonstrated knowledge of presentation software and report writing Demonstrated presentation, and oratory skills

description: The key purpose of this position is to manage the growth within the Field Sales area for prioritised segments and for defined single services and to hold the responsibility of developing the commercial capabilities in the Field Sales team, based on the countries commercial strategy and direction. Job Description 通过对代表的辅导和日常管理完 成区域指标。 负责区域市场推广策略的制定和执行 。 在负责区域内建立市场推广预算并控制费用。通过各种区域会议的方式，确保公司策略清晰有 效的沟通，协助中央市场部执行区域市场活动，特别是培养区域 KOL讲者，以及相关产品市场  策略培训 。 维护区域内 KOL的合作关系，并建立良好的沟通渠道，配合区域市场经理有效的执行市场活动， 确保费用在预算内和活动计划有效执行 。 配合区域大客户团队、市场准入团队、销售培训发展和执行区域活动，参与区域和部分国家级 KOL活动及负责产品顺利进入进院，以及员工培训等 。 向区域销售总监反馈市场趋势，部门职责所需 求的其他相关工作 。 严格遵守公司合规的政策并辅导员工严格执行公司的合规政策。 Locations  Beijing, China  Worker Type  Employee  Worker Sub-Type  Regular  Time Type  Full time

该职位来源于猎聘  主要工作职责：  1、作为公司的核心管理团队，参与公司的整体战略发展与决策。  2、协助业务模式与GTM的整体战略与规划，包括根据市场与客户的未来潜在需求梳理未来的应用与行业方案的蓝图与路线图，并与公司的CEO还有研发、工程与产品开发团队一起敏锐把握行业趋势，梳理潜在需求，构造业务场景，并针对市场与客户需求的推动具体产品与应用方案的开发与落地。  3、详细分析并细分不同客群，确保销售团队与伙伴渠道对于不同产品方案与行业客群的合理覆盖。同时，深入理解客户的需求，针对不同的客群制定相应的销售策略与解决方案以满足其需求。  4、负责领导销售团队，推动公司的业务快速成长与客户满意度。  5、健全公司的大客户销售管理能力，建立规范、高效的合作伙伴机制与销售管理体系并优化完善，制定销售奖惩考评与收入预测确认，还有相关运营标准并推动实施；同时与公司CEO与管理层合作，帮助公司建立未来上规模后的可持续系统流程，法务模板与KPI的基础。  6、搭建整体的销售流程与体系，包括客户划分、销售激励、销售漏斗（从推广到销售线索到销售机会到项目合约到客户管理）与销售预测/回顾节奏流程，通过系统化的方式进行销售管理，建立相应的管理流程、规范和工具。通过月度、季度规律性的销售预测与销售达成的管理，确保高效达成销售目标。  7、负责销售与业务管理团队建设和高潜质人才的培养，不断提升团队管理水平。  背景和经验要求  1、受过良好教育的国内人士（有多年在中国大陆丰富工作经验的优秀海外华裔人士也可考虑），应在管理优异的跨国企业或有良好口碑的国内企业工作15年以上并担任高级管理职位5年以上的销售管理经验  2、具有B2B解决方案销售和大客户销售的能力，对于IT科技行业的解决方案有深入理解。拥有出色的销售业绩和丰富的销售管理经验，能够带领团队完成销售任务，实现销售收入的快速增长  3、具有团队领导与建设能力，还有搭建公司系统与流程体系的能力，并在与公司的成长过程中可以共同成长的潜力。  4、能够认知和接受中西文化及创业与互联网的异同，具备强烈的企业主人翁精神与合作伙伴的创业精神。愿意以发展的眼光和学习的心态来融入UMU，有毅力和创新在变革创新中发展，愿意为企业的发展倾注心血、发挥价值并愿意在与企业一起发展过程中共同成长。  5、既有良好的职业操守、职业水准和成熟的职业心态，熟悉职业的管理方法和方式，又有初创心态与创新精神，有共创事业的情怀、心态自信坚韧、有较强的事业心和抱负。

Experience with online marketing and operation flow of Ecommerce Ability to effectively plan and execute marketing programs with an aim to achieve sales targets Experiences and demonstrated ability of analytical and creative thinking Brand management and marketing experience in a multi-national company preferred Fluent spoken and written Chinese and English (and possibly Korean) Domestic travel. Can travel abroad if so required.   Why join Stokke? You will be a part of a company that creates smart and sustainable premium products, that through bonding between child and parent stimulate the child's development Stokke is an advocate for ethical trade practices and ensures that our business connections take part in a joint responsibility If you want to commit to create high quality products designed for today's children and generations to come, we want you to be a part of our team Stokke offers an extensive benefit package to its employees Stokke is providing a hybrid working model which gives you the opportunity of working up to 3 flexible days and 2 days from the office

jobTitle: OEM/ Strategic Account Sales Manager Automotive - China
description: MacDermid Alpha Electronics Solutions is a leading supplier of specialty chemicals for fabricators, assemblers, and original equipment manufacturers. We provide an integrated product combined with cross-functional solutions in the circuitry, assembly, and semiconductor segments of the electronics industry.  GENERAL PURPOSE OF THIS JOB: ·      Develop, manage, and support assigned key and target Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM) and Strategic customers specifically in Automotive. ·      Identify both established and next generation Electronics market leaders and establish strong working relationship between MAES and the OEM accounts. ·      Focus on obtaining MAES material approvals in order to grow MEAS’ market share at assigned OEM / Strategic accounts and their EMS partners. ·      Overall Objective is Sales revenue and Margin dollar growth through material set approvals at the key OEM & Strategic accounts  ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: ·      Key account manager for assigned and target China and Global based Tier 1 Automotive / Contract Manufacturers where appropriate.  ·      Develop a structured approach to the key account planning process for the assigned and targeted strategic customers. ·      Develop contacts and relationships at these companies with the appropriate people. ·      Identify, investigate and recommend “next on” up and coming companies that MAES should be engaging. ·      Define who the key players are at each of the assigned OEM’s / Contract Manufacturers (CM).  ·      Establish a strong working relationship with the customer team that is responsible for specifying or influencing electronic assembly materials via personal visits along with other means of communication where applicable. ·      Act as customer advocate and provide customer teams with the appropriate information and level of support required to add value. ·      Support qualification and specification efforts at the OEM / CM level. Manage and Coordinate these efforts with the appropriate MAES staff. ·      Communicate and coordinate key account activities with the MAES team – marketing, R&D, executive staff, sales, and others as necessary.  ·      Understand relationships between the OEM and MAES accounts and their products. ·      Develop strategies to support the overall supply chain and leverage this information in developing new business opportunities to support our overall growth of the MAES accounts. ·      Coordinate with other MacDermid Industrial Solutions division business units to ensure Element group promotion and continuity at the OEM / CM. ·      Provide feedback and input into marketing group and R&D functions as market intelligence is gathered. Participate in the R&D project prioritization process as required. ·      Support problem solving efforts at the customer as needed. ·      Present MAES technical product data and initiate product evaluations at key and target customers. ·      Participate in technical marketing activities, including trade shows, industry events, technical papers and articles, etc. ·      Facilitate any required support from the MAES team where we can provide added value to the OEM. This also includes the support of their contract manufacturing partners when necessary. ·      Provide technical training and assistance as well as any other value add support as required in order to advance and enhance the customer relationship with the ultimate goal of the organization. ·      Provide strategy and up to data input in Atlas using Roadmap to Revenue guidelines.  EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS:  ·     Possess a four-year Management or Technical Degree and/or up to seven to ten years significant equivalent industry experience.    ·     Be able to provide “added value” to the OEM / CM via their technical and support skills in order to enhance the relationship and improve our chances of obtaining approvals and growing market share via adding value. ·     Strong knowledge of the Electronic PCB Fabrication, Assembly and Semiconductor process and technologies is needed.  ·     Be able to develop a strong understanding of our materials and their applications and the process to in order to add value. ·     Understand and be able to apply the Value Selling as a foundation to their customer approach ·     Possess the ability to recognize opportunities based on technical discussions with the customer with the entire MAES product line. ·     Develop a strong understanding of what the latest MAES products are and which specific applications they are designed for and be able to also understand the process application behind them.  ·     Possess ability to recommend what are the appropriate MAES materials for a given application across all the product lines. ·     Develop a general recognition and understanding of our key competitor’s materials and what their strengths and weaknesses are in order to highlight the strengths of our materials when challenged ·     Possess strong communication skills and the ability to present MAES product specific information, training, and basic road map information.

description: Job title: Sales Manager. Location: Xuhui District, Shanghai Report to: Regional Business Manager, Asia  The company:  Headquartered in Northern Europe, our client is a global leader in developing and producing hydrogen-powered fuel cell systems. With a more than 30-year successful history, its electrification solutions are now widely used in segments of aviation, marine, power generation, agriculture, mining, and construction machinery across the world.  In order to make the transition towards carbon neutrality, China market has an increasing need to shift power sources from batteries / diesel genset to electrification solutions due to fuel cells’ technical advantages. Therefore, the company is now recuriting for a Sales Manager position to help fulil market needs.   Responsibilities:  The hydrogen-powered fuel cell system is an ideal replacement for diesel genset and other less environmental-friendly power solutions. It has uncapped business potentials in construction machinery and power generation sectors.  Below is a summary of the Sales Manager's job duties: Making business strategies with the purpose of expanding current application areas. Actively developing new accounts in power generation and construction machinery sectors. Manage the whole project life cycle: taking lead in pre-sales technical discussions, contract negotiations, etc. Working closely with colleagues to enhance market exposure, by participating in business events, exibitions, etc.   Requirements:  A Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical, Engineering, Electrical, or other related disciplines. A minimum of 5-year sales experience gained from active industrial BtB sales positions. Successful track record in technical sales and solution-based sales. Fluency in Chinese Mandarin and English is a must. Experience in the diesel genset market would be beneficial. Are you interested in joining one of the most energetic and passionate team in LEGO Marketing team to build up a unique retail brand experience together with us through our LEGO licence stores and toy specialist stores?  The LEGO Group always make contribution to the world and has a transparent and open culture in daily work. We are looking for an excellent talent who can bring along your experience to grow with LEGO!   Core Responsibilities   Lead, plan and operate audience-first-driven GTM campaign including instore merchandising POSM materials, promotions and instore activities based on seasonal, novelty, new store opening highlight; Drive store traffic and improve conversion rates. Special project management such as by channel specific activities, offsite, pop up store initiatives. Work closely with internal and external partners to get fully alignment and maximise the global and regional resources. Deliver effective and seamless communication with sales team and ensure all the retail marketing activities are executed as planned in store. Budget planning and tracking as well as process proceed.   Play your part in our team succeeding  The Retail Brand Experience team focuses on LCS (LEGO certificated store), Toy Specialists and other offline channels, aiming to build up the omni-delightful playing hub and community to the consumers and shoppers and providing the most comprehensive LEGO retail experience in offline channels.  Due to our aggressive sales & expansion plans in China, we will continue to provide unique and distictive retail experience to our shopper and consumer experience with our great effort. We are looking to hire a dynamic, creative and passionate retail marketing professional with omni-channel concept for our team in Shanghai Hub, who will be dedicated to retail brand experience.  Do you have what it takes?   Bachelor’s degree in Design and Marketing related area Minimum 5 years of related experience of retail marketing/trade marketing in a multi-national corporation Have minimum 3 years of management position The ideal candidate will not only possess the marketing accests but also with a general knowledge of retail sales Strong interpersonal and written and spoken communication skills in English and Mandarin Proactive, self-driving and strong sense of curiosity and learning Strong analytical, Excel and PowerPoint skills The skill of independent graphic creative/design would be a plus Advance in both English and Chinese   Join the global LEGO® family  Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.  The LEGO Group is proud to be an equal opportunity and an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.  We support our employees in being there for the moments that matter in life and celebrate families of all kinds, the loved ones that make us who we are. Being part of the LEGO Group also means taking part in our annual Play Day, playing a part in building a sustainable future and continuing our mission to “inspire and develop the builders of tomorrow.”  The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.  Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.  Build your career brick by brick at the LEGO Group.

Job Description  This position will lead HHE Industry Sales team to meet sales target and develop HHE business in China  Job Responsibilities  Danfoss Heating Heat Exchangers will brazed, gasketed and welded heat exchangers is a priority business for Danfoss with a high growth potential in China. From a market and product point of view, the Senior Sales Managers has the following key priorities: Develop current growth hotspots further within expecially the Industry segment, Oil and Gas sector and Food segment Secure continuous profitable presence in the market with current customers and a broad portfolio of advanced components and solutions. Investigate and follow through on strategic opportunities and partnerships. Optimize the Sales Operating Model Combined with the market perspective and Senior Sales Manager has five focus areas: With the sales and support team and key stakeholders, further specify and deploy a three-year growth strategy. As a part of the strategy work cooperate with key stakeholders to define the best products, services and solutions fitted and attractive to the China market. Continue the development of profitable sales to existing customers. Develop network and partnership with key players in the above-mentioned industries in general. Further develop the structure and staff competences to secure a result-driven pro-active and inoovative sales organization that supports the strategy and the Sales Operating Model. Background & Skills The ideal candidate could currently be a Sales Manager having a regional sales or national KAM role with a strong supplier in the industry and wanting to step up with a larger team and full responsibility for a priority country for Danfoss The candidate should preferably have a business or engineering degree combined with +8 years of sales operation experience from KAM, Indirect and Project sales and +3 years of Sales Management experience. It is essential that the candidate has a strong strategic mindset and an understanding of the keys to success. To both participate in sales and be a strong role model to coach the team, the candidate should have a solid understanding of all phases of a successful sales operation process. Further it would be an advantage if the candidate has good analytical and planning skills, pricing perfomance understanding as well as the ablility to combine interests of multiple stakesholders. Danfoss – Engineering Tomorrow  At Danfoss, we are engineering solutions that allow the world to use resources in smarter ways – driving the sustainable transformation of tomorrow. No transformation has ever been started without a group of passionate, dedicated and empowered people. We believe that innovation and great results are driven by the right mix of people with diverse backgrounds, personalities, skills, and perspectives, reflecting the world in which we do business. To make sure the mix of people works, we strive to create an inclusive work environment where people of all backgrounds are treated equally, respected, and valued for who they are. It is a strong priority within Danfoss to improve the health, working environment and safety of our employees.  Following our founder’s mindset ‘action speaks louder than words’, we set ourselves ambitious targets to protect the environment by embarking on a plan to become CO2 neutral latest by 2030.  Danfoss is an EO employer and VEVRAA Federal Contractor. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or other protected category.
