At Branch, we’re transforming how brands and users interact across digital platforms. Our mobile marketing and deep linking solutions are trusted to deliver seamless experiences that increase ROI, decrease wasted spend, and eliminate siloed attribution. Our team consists of smart, humble, and collaborative people who value ownership overall we do to create a product, team, and company that lives and breathes our motto: Build Together, Grow Together, Win Together.  This role will be based in our Beijing office and will lead Branch's expansion efforts in China. You will be responsible for growing awareness, adoption, and revenue among companies in the region as you exercise your expertise in prospecting, managing, and closing deals. In addition, you will be responsible for executing the regional growth plan as you recruit and train additional team members. You’ll oversee the sales pipeline and cadence, mentor team members on tactics and deal progression, and use your network to expand and open up new opportunities for the team.  You will succeed in this role if you are an energetic and driven leader who understands how to recruit and tune a world-class sales team, can meet or exceed quarterly sales targets, and can manage our local marketing and operational efforts to achieve awareness as the recognized market leader. You will be a key leader on Branch’s rapidly growing international team and will play a significant role in shaping Branch’s future.  What You’ll Do Establish, measure, and achieve regional sales and adoption targets. Oversee pipeline metrics and deal progression. Build high-level partnerships to accelerate Marketing and Sales efforts. Identify tactics to build local groundswell and brand awareness to support the sales cycle. Implement localized marketing tactics to support the pipeline and increase brand awareness. Make every potential Branch user happy with every interaction, regardless of deal size. Build and enhance relationships with our largest partners. Represent Branch at relevant regional conferences and events. Recruit and lead a high-performance sales team. You’ll Be a Good Fit If You Have 3-8 years of experience in a Sales leadership role at a mobile technology company, with a track record of top performance. Previous experience recruiting and scaling a team at a growth company. The ability to understand the Branch SDK in-depth and communicate its benefits to both technical and non-technical customers. Strong interest in mobile technology and mobile SDKs. Willingness to travel frequently. Full written and speaking fluency in English A strong work ethic and internal drive to produce results. Data-driven, and experience managing a pipeline using Salesforce or similar SFA tool. Humility, and a partner-first mentality. Nice To Haves Prior experience selling into the China export mobile ecosystem. A thorough understanding of mobile advertising, measurement, and attribution. MBA, management consulting, or equivalent experience with finance and operations. A Little Bit About Us Branch has raised more than $330M from investors such as NEA, Founders Fund, and Playground Ventures. We are headquartered in Silicon Valley and have presence all over the world. Branch Ranked No. 3 Fastest-Growing Company in North America on Deloitte's 2020 Technology Fast 500. Diversity at Branch ranks in the top 10% for similarly sized companies (by Comparably). In 2020, we are recognized as one of Forbes Best Startups, Great Places to Work, and Bay Area Best Places to Work. We have more than 3 billion monthly users and are partnered with over 75,000 apps. If you think you’d be a good fit for this role, we’d love for you to apply! At Branch, we strive to create an inclusive culture that encourages people from different backgrounds, age groups to bring their unique, diverse perspectives to work. We aim every day to build an environment that empowers us all to do the best work of our lives, and we can’t wait to show you what we have to offer!

description: At UL, we know why we come to work Thousands of us around the world wake up every day with a common purpose: to make the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place. Science is in our DNA; we are endlessly curious and passionate about seeking and speaking the truth. We take delight in knowing that our work makes a meaningful contribution to society, and we are proud that our culture is centered on integrity, collaboration, inclusion and excellence. UL stands at the forefront of technological advancement, and we are continually challenged to find new ways to foster innovation and positive change. Satisfying? Yes. Exciting? Absolutely!  What you’ll learn & achieve: The Sales Manager is responsible for the management of sales directly to end users of ULs products or services in a large specified geographic area, and/or is responsible for a specific industry or product segment on a national or geographic area.  Develops and motivates sales professionals by coaching and transferring the knowledge of sales techniques, service offerings, and industry knowledge to the sales team to drive results. Lead client engagement by developing and managing relationships at the middle management and key decision maker levels for large and medium customers. Manages sales transaction pipelines and forecasting. Stays up to date with and understands latest market developments and trends. Manages the performance of direct reports by developing accountabilities, establishing performance objectives, providing career counseling, feedback and guidance and ensuring that all policies are understood and adhered to. Performs other duties as directed.  What makes you a great fit: University Degree (Equivalent to Bachelors Degree) in a related discipline plus generally eight years of directly related experience. Extensive knowledge of company policies and sales processes. Requires the ability to gain cooperation of others, conducting presentations of technical information concerning specific projects or schedules to senior level management and customers. Expert on sales strategies and tactics. Significant business travel and work outside of the office is required.  What you’ll experience working at UL: Mission: For UL, corporate and social responsibility isn’t new. Making the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place has been our business model for the last 125 years and is deeply engrained in everything we do.  People: Ask any UL employee what they love most about working here, and you’ll almost always hear, “the people.” Going beyond what is possible is the standard at UL. We’re able to deliver the best because we employ the best. Interesting work: Every day is different for us here as we eagerly anticipate the next innovation that our customers’ create. We’re inspired to take on the challenge that will transform how people live, work and play. And as a global company, in many roles, you will get international experience working with colleagues around the world. Grow & achieve: We learn, work and grow together with targeted development, reward and recognition programs as well as our very own UL University that offers extensive training programs for employees at all stages, including a technical training track for applicable roles. Total Rewards: UL offers competitive total rewards including 13 months annual salary, incentive bonus, monthly allowance, national mandatory housing fund and social insurances, extended paid annual leaves and paid sick leaves and supplementary medical insurance.

description: Are you a passionate about working with potential customers to add value to their businesses? Do you love hunting for business in order to grow revenue and sales?  If so, we'd love to hear from you!  Position Summary  As a subject matter expert to pre-sales and pursuit activities, you will act in of support Account Managers and Solution Sales focusing on all sales (new, cross-sells, up-sells) for the Risk proposition in a given territory with both existing and new customers. You will lead on deals aligned to specific propositions and serve accounts within a defined territory. The role works in close partnership with internal stakeholders to proactively drive gross sales and revenue.  Role Responsibilities Structure, negotiate and close deals Proactively identify pipeline opportunities, governed by the Account Managers Develop the sales strategy for their proposition within their territory Provide insights and share Refinitiv thought leadership on their proposition with customers Deliver customer demonstrations on their specific propositions Qualifications And Experience Required Deep market understanding including a) expert understanding of financial market b) knowledge of relevant market c) strong understanding of customers' business model workflow World class selling skills (identify, develop, & articulate proposition/ consultative selling) as a “hunter” Strong sales ‘closer’ Become a Product and Workflow Expert in Proposition Products, including but not limited to: Worldcheck (Desktop / Solutions) Anti-Money Laundering (AML) & Know Your Customer (KYC) Creative thinker and good sales ideation skills Presentation skills (verbal & written) Strong interpersonal skills Ability to organize and execute a sales plan Executive presence Over 5 years of industry, sales or market experience Proven track record in a quota bearing sales environment Experience selling to C- level executives People are at the heart of what we do and drive the success of our business. Our culture of connecting, creating opportunity and delivering excellence shape how we think, how we do things and how we help our people fulfil their potential.  At LSEG we embrace diversity and actively seek to attract individuals with unique backgrounds and perspectives. We break down barriers and encourage collaboration, enabling innovation and rapid development of solutions that make a difference. Our workplace generates an enriching and rewarding experience for our people and customers alike. Our vision is to build an inclusive culture in which everyone feels driven to reach their potential.  We know that real personal growth cannot be achieved by simply climbing a career ladder – which is why we encourage and enable a wealth of avenues and interesting opportunities for everyone to broaden and deepen their skills and expertise.  LSEG are committed to supporting emotional, physical, financial and societal wellbeing. Our tailored benefits are a key part of this commitment and we offer colleagues a range of support from healthcare and retirement planning to paid volunteering days and consumer discounts.  We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. If an accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please make your recruiter aware, we want to ensure you perform at your best.  As a global organisation spanning 70 countries and one rooted in a culture of growth, opportunity, diversity and innovation, LSEG is a place where everyone can grow, develop and fulfil your potential with purposeful careers.  Please take a moment to read this privacy notice carefully, as it describes what personal information the London Stock Exchange Group (LSEG) (“We”) may hold about you, what it’s used for, and how it’s obtained, your rights and how to contact us as a data subject .  If you are submitting as a Recruitment Agency Partner, it is essential and your responsibility to ensure that candidates applying to LSEG are aware of this privacy notice.

description: BASF has been a committed partner to Greater China since 1885. With large production sites in Shanghai, Nanjing and Chongqing, as well as a global and regional research and development hub in Shanghai, BASF is a major foreign investor in the country’s chemical industry. BASF posted sales of approximately €8.5 billion in 2020 to customers in Greater China and employed 8,948 people as of the end of the year. For further information, please visit www.basf.com/cn/en.  Objectives Follow sales strategies and tactics to achieve sales target and KPI Lead, challenge and support sales, marketing, technical and customer service to realize the sales plan. China is a key growth market for the Motul Asia Pacific Group. In addition to being responsible for maintaining Motul’s brand identity, this role will be responsible for planning, managing and executing proactive and innovative publicity campaigns and initiatives to increase Motul China’s share of voice in the marketplace via mainstream, trade and social media channels.  Job Responsibilities and Accountabilities: Brand Management Develop short and long-term brand strategy, which includes setting, refining and communicating of style guidelines, vision, mission and value proposition. Provide a new structure and framework in terms of branding and communications, to develop marketing activities to support the organization’s goals.  Corporate Identity Management Support the team in brand governance in accordance with the global brand standards and guidelines. Ensure external marketing /comms materials are aligned with brand standards from tone of voice to visuals, across all public-facing channels. Always be on the lookout for opportunities to maintain brand strength and achieve better demand for the product. Serves as contact point for all brand requests in Motul China (internal & external). Serves as liaison between creative agency and other relevant stakeholders to provide direction and information for development of creative materials.  Communications Management -       Develop and oversee the delivery of digital communication strategy in line with Motul’s mission, values and brand strategy. -       Identify and effectively utilize a range of channels to deliver successful results including above the line, direct and digital marketing -       Amplify our Motul’s story to our customers through impactful storytelling. -       Develop and implement integrated communications campaigns, including but not limited to social media. -       Create relevant and engaging content to drive, targeted, regular and relevant media exposure. -       Support the planning and management of communications calendar for new product launch. -       Work closely with the E-commerce, Digital, Head of Pillar team to ensure seamless alignment and implementation of campaigns / events. -       Provide consultation on corporate communications guidelines to both internal and external stakeholders.  Channel and Partnerships Development -       Explore innovative channels to optimize results. -       Explore new opportunities for strategic partnerships and distribution extension with automobile related partners (tires, sports related)  Report and Analysis -       Monitor and measure the effectiveness of all marketing and communications strategy. -       Manage expenditure and budget and result of plan execution.  Core Competencies Skills: Programme Management -       Have a clear understanding of the company’s desired future state. -       Ability to work and look across multiple workstreams and interrelated projects. -       Ability to ensure stakeholders from different functions are engaged at all times. -       Create structured project plan and tasks that is aligned to the company’s ongoing strategy. -       Articulate thoughts, communicate and influence ideas well. -       Look at bigger picture and understand organization change management.  People developer -       Ability to work with different teams and give good delegation of work. -       Possess ‘coaching’ skills – set the standards and understand the team well. -       Able to motivate and inspire others and live the spirit everyday.  Integrated Solution Builder -       Approach problem solving strategically based on what is best for the business. -       Strong critical thinking and conflict management skills. -       Ability to work in cross functional/regional projects. -       Comfortable to work in ambiguity set up. -       Possess an entrepreneurial and growth mindset. -       Have a sense of ownership of work and the business. -       Driven, independent and resourceful. -       Have a creative mindset.  Key Relationships: Internal -       General Manager, China -       Marketing Director -       E-commerce Manager -        Head of Pillar -       Deputy Digital Manager -       Country Sales team  External -       Agencies -       Marketing Service Provider -       Distributors -       End-Users
industries: Oil & Energy, Consumer Goods, and Apparel & Fashion

jobTitle: Regional Sales Manager区域销售经理
description: 为什么在英迈工作？ 英迈是技术和供应链服务的全球领导者，使业务合作伙伴能够最大限度地提高他们制造、销售或使用的技术的价值。我们帮助超过250,000家业务合作伙伴和2000家供应商在他们所服务的市场中更高效、更成功的运营。 作为区域销售经理，您需要合理规划并推进区域销售工作，并和利益相关者包括代理商以及客户保持良好沟通，以达成达成区域业绩目标。 在此职位上，您将直接向全国区域销售总经理汇报，并与内外部的业务相关者紧密合作。   你会做什么?  您的职责包括但不限于：  1、区域销售计划制定 梳理客户完整画像，定位需求（规模，生意方向，用户群，行业）； 根据公司指标、市场需求，做销售预测，搭建销售渠道，制定区域内的销售计划，分解和落实指标到销售。 2、关键客户关系维护 现有关键客户的维护，理解客户整体业务运营情况，持续挖掘跨产品或解决方案的生意机会，达成框架合作协议； 新关键客户拜访，挖掘生意机会，跨产品线匹配，生成解决方案，促成合作。 3、渠道及新业务拓展 在区域内拓展有效渠道覆盖； 新产品线机会挖掘，并向BU引荐。 4、区域业务执行 利用有效的业务管理工具，多维度追踪区域内各项过程和结果指标，确保业务达成； 定期跟进review团队的销售行为（包含：拜访记录，商机分析，业务计划，客户满意度）； 协助团队与后台支持部门的沟通，协助政策和流程改善。 5、团队组织优化及管理 确保团队整体销售思维、行为、目标的一致； 合理规划和配置人员 人员辅导、激励与发展  你需要具备什么条件才能成功？  教育背景： 大学本科及以上学历，计算机、市场营销专业优先 经验要求： 八年以上IT行业工作经验，至少五年以上产品销售经验及三年以上团队管理经验； 熟悉IT行业现状及趋势，熟悉渠道生态体系，深度理解总代的生意模式及打法； 熟悉主流IT产品，包括技术指标、应用场景、行业趋势、同类竞品市场布局等，有相关厂商产品技术认证者优先考虑； 具备一定的财务知识及Excel数据分析能力； 有一定英文基础，能阅读英文邮件和简单技术文档。 能力要求： 商业头脑和战略思维 市场分析和业务规划能力 商务谈判能力 数据驱动和分析思维 发展和培养团队的能力
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Hardware, and Computer & Network Security

Job description (job content) • The role will be responsible for driving sales performance for the Home Appliances segment (TTI, GREE): • Maintain and develop existing and new key customers • Provide sales technical service to customer • Promoting products and securing new customers • Developing annual business plans with customers/Distributor which includes setting sales goals and planning market development activities • Manage, develop, coach, control and motivate the sales force to develop their skill to ensure that a high professional standard is achieved and monthly sales target and KPI target are met  Profile (candidate's skills) We are looking for an individual with: • Bachelor's or Masters degree in Electronic/ Electrical Engineering or similar • 3+ years of professional experience with a combination of Sales and Marketing or Application Engineering in a semiconductor industry (preferably in Home Appliances segment) • Solid understanding of the Home Appliances market • Fluent in spoken & written English • Positive attitude, strategic mindset, and active team player

该职位来源于猎聘  About The Role  This role is responsible for licensing ARM China technology to key ARM China semiconductor partners and growing ARM China new business in both short term and long-term.  Developing sound, professional, long-term relationships with management/technical/marketing personnel at the partner is a key role as well as creating, reporting and executing on account strategies.  Working with the segment marketing managers, Licensing, FAEs, ARM China executives and business units, the New Business Sales Manager will address partner requirements, drive sales revenue, close license contracts and be responsible for the partner account strategy moving forward which will position ARM China to maximize revenue as well as position the partner for success with ARM China in the marketplace. The New Business Sales Manager is responsible for all business and account management aspects of the partner relationship and is expected to maintain a high level of knowledge of ARM China and its products, services and competitors.  What will I be accountable for? Develop business opportunities and negotiate and close contracts for ARM China technologies and services. Define and maintain detailed account development plan for nominated key partners which covers financial sales goals, strategic target goals and plans to grow partner’s commitment to ARM China over time; report weekly on account progress. Develop and own strategic and tactical relationships at management, engineering and marketing levels; gain understanding of informal decision making organization. Represent partner to ARM China and provide feedback to ARM China business units, engineering, marketing and management regarding partner technical and business requirements. Identify and capture competitive landscape, trends, unit and ASP projections, acquisition activities and other relevant partner information. What skills, experience and qualifications do I need? Achievement of financial sales goals and licensing objectives. Development of strong relationships with key personnel at partner accounts. Successful relationship mapping between key customer personnel and identified ARM China personnel. Solid knowledge of ARM products, services, schedules and key personnel. Over 5 years experiences in sales and marketing. Working knowledge of partner target markets and applications. BS/BA required. Knowledge of microprocessors (RISC) and systems, SoC designs helpful. Knowledge of AI/Internet/Server/Auto market helpful. Good presentation skills; able to present to different levels – management, engineering and executive. Dynamic, self-starting individual who is driven to maintain regular contact with partners. Team player with good interpersonal skills: communication (written and verbal), organized, personable, entrepreneurial, customer focused and customer sensitive, able to motivate team members and co-workers, able to influence, flexible and hard-working. Able to credibly represent partner requirements to ARM China and to motivate ARM China to meet these requirements. Willing to travel up to 50% of work.

该职位来源于猎聘  职责描述：  Position Summary  This position will have the responsibilities of managing existing account portfolio, including several strategic key accounts within this portfolio. The candidate will have balanced KPI of maintaining client relationship to deliver revenue targets, as well as building up-selling pipeline from existing clients. Additionally, the role is also responsible for supporting the deployment of Visa’s digital acceptance solutions in China. The candidate will work with other Cybersource team members and cross-functional Visa teams in China. Success will be measured by client revenue (existing+upsell), account retention; and other key metrics as agreed. The candidate will report to the Head of Cybersource and will be part of the larger China MS&A team.  Responsibilities Own and manage client relationship. Manage ongoing account plans and deliver on both strategic and tactical initiatives. Be the principal point of contact of Cybersource with client organizations, focusing on creating sustainable long-term client relationships. Grow the usage of online payment, fraud management solutions and ancillary products on existing accounts including merchants and acquirers in supporting them in their growth objectives. Identify up-sell business opportunities from existing accounts, provide up-sell consultation and testing of solutions to ensure appropriate fit for client requirements and effective solution implementation, and lead the opportunity acquisition process from conducting sales pitch to contract signing. Negotiate pricing as well as contractual terms within set parameters and adhere to internal policy and procedures when structuring agreements, coordinate internal resources towards client delivery. Represent other Visa capability to engage existing accounts under his/her management. Proactively manage internal stakeholders to ensure customer interactions are well considered and positioned to deliver additional value to clients. 任职要求：  Key attributes Results oriented. Must be capable to handle critical discussions with those key accounts under his/her management and be able to conduct sales engagement with high level personals from large enterprise clients. Strong partnership orientation to growing the client and Visa’s business. Execute a disciplined approach through the right depth of engagement and cadence with clients to deliver business and relationship goals. Candidate must have extensive payments industry knowledge and be contemporary with the latest initiatives in Digital payments, technology along with a contemporary understanding of local regulations. Market understanding of the China payments industry and market landscape. Relationships across key players would be valuable. High degree of self-sufficiency, able to provide timely updates on client opportunities, risks, product lines and services. Essentials Minimum 8-year ecommerce / digital payments experience in the China market. Business acumen and outstanding sales skills with the ability to communicate effectively to diverse audiences Bachelor or higher degree preferably in business or commerce related discipline. Speaking local language is a MUST; Fluency in English both oral and written is also required. Strong data analytic skills to facilitate decision-making and strategy setup Experienced in using a CRM system, preferably Salesforce, to ensure new business activities are visible to a broad range of stakeholders Industry experience Comprehensive knowledge in E-Commerce, Marketplaces and Online Fraud Prevention. Rich experience and successful solution sales record within four-party payment eco-system. Experience of cross-functional collaboration/deployment between technical service delivery, support, product & commercial teams in a matrixed, multinational environment.

Thank you for your interest in Össur.  The most important resource of Össur is its staff. At Össur, we value our extensive skills and knowledge base and naturally we nurture a spirit of innovation. With wide-ranging roles involved in our business, Össur is keen to attract talented individuals and accomplished team players, who are ready to contribute to the achievement of our goals.  As National Sales manager you will be responsible for fostering and maintaining client relationships for our product portfolio Bracing & Support within China.  The main goal of this position the responsibility for the sales targets in the designated area, building long-term, profitable customer relationships as well as developing the team plus you will be leading the Sales team and undertake coaching and mentoring responsibilities.  The Complexity Of This Position Lies In Looking beyond existing methodologies to resolve complex issues often cross-functional in nature or with significant impact to the business. Considering highly skilled and proficient in discipline. Able to guide (senior) professionals and managers. Having a thorough understanding of the business, financials, products/services, and the capability needs of teams and departments. Interacting across functions regularly. Having the knowledge to influence best practices within discipline. You will coach for performance improvement, advise, and negotiate in conflict situations. As well as assist in organizational effectiveness efforts.  The position will be based at our office in Shanghai and will report to the Regional Managing Director Asia.  Your tasks Develop and execute sales strategies for responsible area, in line with regional and global objectives. Develop and maintain relationships with Key Opinion Leaders (KOL), hospitals, orthopedic doctors, rheumatologist, general practitioners, chiropractors etc. Manage, coach, and guide each team member on achieving objectives, using the right tools and personal development. Co-operate and communicate with sales, marketing, and customer service team of Össur Asia in order to educate and execute local marketing and promotion. Analyze sales figures and market data regularly and communicate/react accordingly. Forecast annual sales in line with national target and formally communicate throughout the year on progress to achieving that goal. Gather, manage and update relevant market and customer data in order to build up efficient sales organization. The ideal candidate Bachelor/Masters’ degree in a relevant field of education. Minimal 8 years of relevant experience, including supervisory or advisory experience. Clinical sales back ground in Medical Device/Orthopedic device industry preferred. Positive, enthusiastic, and flexible team player. Creativity and independent working is needed to be able to find unorthodox solutions to various problems. Analytical, persuasive and communicative. High social competence. Good knowledge of English (spoken and written) is required. Össur is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran Status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

Position:  Account Manager  Job Description:  We are looking for Account Manager to join our component business. The location of this role is Shanghai, China. This role will be responsible for developing Japan based customer key relationships for solution selling. The major objectives and challenges are to grow customer base and size, to seek and identify potential customers in Japan region and bring them up to next level at Converge.  What You’ll Be Doing  Develop new business with potential customers/vendors in semiconductor industry in Japan region. Maintain relationship with existing customers/vendors in semiconductor industry in Japan region. Demonstrates a proactive approach and sense of urgency on our customers’ behalf, anticipates our customers’ requirements and communicates efforts in a timely and effective. Identify business opportunities throughout a dynamic & fast speed environment. Tele-selling and cold call will be required. Co-operate and communicate with different departments across multi-culture working environment  What We Are Looking For  Typically requires a 4-year degree. Graduates from 985/211 universities are highly preferred. A minimum of 3-year of sales experience in semiconductor companies, fresh graduates will be considered with can-do attitude. Fluent Japanese speaking is a must. Fair English in written is a must. With sales experience in Japan market, understood Japan’s culture will be an advantage. Proactive, a problem solver, result oriented, fast learner. Able to work independently, flexible, hardworking, and self-motivated.  What’s In It For You  At Converge, we recognize that financial rewards and great benefits are important aspects of an ideal job. That’s why we offer competitive financial compensation, including various compensation plans, and a solid benefits package.  Medical Insurance Paid Time Off Special/Extra Leave 5-Day Work Week Growth Opportunities A bright future  About Arrow  Arrow Electronics, Inc. (NYSE: ARW), an award-winning Fortune 102 and one of Fortune Magazine’s Most Admired Companies. Arrow guides innovation forward for over 180,000 leading technology manufacturers and service providers. With 2020 sales of USD $28.67 billion, Arrow develops technology solutions that improve business and daily life. Our broad portfolio that spans the entire technology landscape helps customers create, make and manage forward-thinking products that make the benefits of technology accessible to as many people as possible. Learn more at www.arrow.com.  Our strategic direction of guiding innovation forward is expressed as Five Years Out, a way of thinking about the tangible future to bridge the gap between what's possible and the practical technologies to make it happen. Learn more at https://www.fiveyearsout.com/.  For more job opportunities, please visit https://careers.arrow.com/us/en.  Location:  CN-Shanghai, China (SOHO Tianshan Sq) Converge  Time Type:  Full time  Job Category:  Sales

jobTitle: LDA OEM Sales Specialist 销售专家（西安）
description: LDA Sales Specialist 大型传动应用事业部 销售专家  Why Choose us?  As a global market leader of large drives and motors, Siemens LDA provides different kinds of medium voltage drives and high voltage motors. As the focused region, China’s business scope is combined with product, service, solution and digital business. Besides, we have inherent collaboration environment, profound industrial-related knowhow, culture of people development, flexible and result-oriented setup. Don’t hesitate to join us!  作为大型变频器和电机的市场领导者，西门子大型传动应用事业部提供不同类型的中压变频器和高压电机。中国作为 LDA 全球业务的重点区域，业务范围结合了产品、服务、解决方案和数字化业务。此外，我们还有内在的合作环境、深厚的工业技术、注重人才发展的环境、灵活和以结果为导向的架构设置。不要犹豫，快来加入我们吧!  What will you do if join us? Sufficiently collaborate with other colleagues and external partners in project business.  对安排的任务进行积极思考和行动，在项目型业务上与同事和外部合作伙伴充分合作  Who are we looking for?  Good communication skills internally and externally  良好的内外沟通技巧  Persistent, never give up  执着和永不言弃的精神  Hardworking  勤奋  Sales Experience in project business is preferred  有项目型相关销售经验优先  Integrity, honesty and loyalty  正直，诚实，忠诚  Work under pressure  有良好的抗压能力  Quick learner and with good business sense  快速学习能力和良好的业务理念  Teamwork spirit  团队合作精神  Organization: Portfolio Companies  Company: Siemens Ltd., China  Experience Level: Mid-level Professional  Job Type: Full-time

This is where you save and sustain lives  At Baxter, we are deeply connected by our mission. No matter your role at Baxter, your work makes a positive impact on people around the world. You'll feel a sense of purpose throughout the organization, as we know our work improves outcomes for millions of patients.  Baxter's products and therapies are found in almost every hospital worldwide, in clinics and in the home. For over 85 years, we have pioneered significant medical innovations that transform healthcare.  Together, we create a place where we are happy, successful and inspire each other. This is where you can do your best work.  Join us at the intersection of saving and sustaining lives—where your purpose accelerates our mission.  Essential and Responsibilities Actively develop and optimize distributors’ network to support company’s ambitious business growth in territory. Responsible for distributor selection, development, assessment, and performance review in consensus with sales & marketing organizations; Participate and contribute for commercial policies including but not limited to products price structure, hospital tender bidding price, distributor rebate scheme, etc.; Responsible for timely collection of in market sales data and sales forecast or other data accuracy; Regularly review distributor payment terms and timely A/R collection, and take initiative actions on any potential credit risk; Monitor and optimize inventory level at distributors with full transparency.  Qualifications University degree or above, preferred from health care related majors or economics; At least 5 years working experience in MNC in China medical device or pharmaceutical industry. Commercial experience in medical device will be preferred; Minimum 5 years experience on commercial management, hands-on experience and proven success in distributor development and management; Highly committed and accountable, have excellent interpersonal and negotiable skills; Willing to travel frequently. Self-motivated, and with wining spirit; Excellent written and verbal communications skills in Chinese.   Reasonable Accommodations  Baxter is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please send an e-mail to Americas_TTA@baxter.com and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.  Recruitment Fraud Notice  Baxter has discovered incidents of employment scams, where fraudulent parties pose as Baxter employees, recruiters, or other agents, and engage with online job seekers in an attempt to steal personal and/or financial information. To learn how you can protect yourself, review our Recruitment Fraud Notice. 048485

The Business Consultant (BC) is a key member of the Teradata GCA GTM Account team. The BC engages directly with named accounts as well as prospects and partners, working closely together with the other account team members – the Account Executive, Industry Consultant, Project Manager, Consulting Team and Sales Engineer.  The BC responsibility in the triad account team is to front the selling of business capabilities and solutions that leverage Teradata’s Vantage software. Solving complex business and industry problems with software and consulting services. This may be stand-alone projects or larger data management and analytics programs. The BC builds relationships to the customer’s business buyers & influencers, and will be focused on fostering customer business benefits and growth, by solving the data and analytics challenges they face.  The BC will have support from GCA BC Lead and Regional I&BC team in the selling and closing of innovative services, solutions, and programs that drive recurring Teradata software revenue.  The BC reports to the BC GCA Lead.  Job Specification  The Business Consultant is a critical role & business driver for Teradata. The consultant is responsible to drive innovation within the target customers and prospects base on how to deliver real business outcomes with data and analytics. The primary objective with this is to drive consumption of Teradata software to the benefit of the customers. In order to accelerate the realization of this, the BC will front the selling of assets, solutions, and consulting services at scale, focusing on the largest and differentiating opportunities.  Specifically, the BC will Work closely with the Account Team to qualify opportunities, and with the GCA Consulting organization and to secure the cross-practice teams to build proposals, project estimates, and contracts Instigate a strong teamwork mentality within the GCA BC team working in the account triads Focus on packaged, value-based services and solutions that drive ROI for the customer and ARR growth for Teradata. Leverage Teradata IP, assets and experience, and adapt pricing behaviors towards pricing for value Work with the GTM team on the negotiation and closing of solution, platform and consulting deals Build and maintain customer relationships at senior management for key accounts Support alignment, collaboration and knowledge sharing throughout the Geo, also working closely with the Regional I&BC team to enable collaboration and knowledge sharing. Drive an innovation culture that promotes new thinking and that enables continuous development and improvement of how we do business Be an active ambassador for the Teradata brand through brand marketing, postings, blogs, and as a speaker at events at conferences Support and promote the full utilization of corporate systems and processes This position implies frequent interactions with the customers & prospects, working in a combination of physical and virtual office environments, including home, office & customer site. Local travel up to 70% is expected depending on the location of the candidate with respect to the customer(s) site(s).  Candidate Profile  Successful candidates will have the following profile BS, MBA, or MS in business, technical or professional discipline or equivalent work experience. Have 6+ years industry experience, including experience of a consulting organization; Demonstrate industry knowhow and the ability to influence and build trust from C to working level; An acknowledged and consolidated experience within the Data domain (Enterprise Data Warehouse, BI, Data Management, Data Analytics, Advanced Analytics, Big Data, etc.), being able to create solid and trustful working relationships with customers, and understand their business strategy and priorities, and use Data & Analytics as an enabler to grow their business; Deep insight into the Teradata products, architecture, offerings and service portfolio is needed, as well as deep understanding of the customer’s business and industry; Be able to motivate and work with an extended team of subject matter experts and practitioners throughout a multi-country organization; Experience in overseeing a portfolio of engagements and activities related to consulting business management; Demonstrate a commitment to life-long learning and personal development of both themselves and of the extended teams that they manage; Support Partner organizations that can work with Teradata for synergistic capabilities at our customers and prospects; Possess good analytical, problem-solving, communication and presentation skills; Fluency in Chinese, be proficient in the use of both written and spoken business English as a benefit. Our Company  Teradata (NYSE TDC) is the leading multi-cloud data platform company for enterprise analytics, transforming how businesses work and people live through the power of data.  At Teradata, we are leading the data era. As enterprises address today’s digital economy, they are faced with new competition and consumer expectations and are turning to data to power their future. Teradata has worked with the largest companies in the world for 40+ years, bringing our experience and expertise to support global enterprises with their most demanding, mission-critical, complex, and large-scale data needs. Teradata is recognized as a leader in the cloud, data, and analytics spaces by top analyst firms, Gartner and Forrester, and Fortune Magazine as well.  Our connected multi-cloud data platform for enterprise analytics, Teradata Vantage™, is an extremely scalable, secure, and resilient offering that simplifies ecosystems by connecting data and making it easier to uncover insights from across the organization…regardless of where that data resides. With Vantage, we enable companies to modernize their data management, from start to scale. Every day, millions of users benefit from our open data platform. Empowering customers and partners to develop and build how they like, we enable hundreds of business outcomes and solutions, including improving customer experience and profitability, driving operational efficiency, realizing financial transformation, or achieving operational efficiency.  As the world of data grows, we are the leader in enabling the future of connected businesses, powered by data intelligence. We are committed to delivering on this vision by following sustainable business practices and with a strong focus on diversity, equity, and inclusion. We believe that only by embracing diversity of identity, thought, background, expression, and perspective can we solve today’s challenges and reimagine tomorrow’s world.

Job Summary  The Regional Sales Manager (RSM) for Contamination Control is responsible for the sales and market development of TSI Contamination Control instruments and software systems in China. In close coordination with supervisor, the RSM plans and implements sales and technical support strategies to achieve revenue and customer satisfaction results that are consistent with TSI’s business goals.  The successful candidate must be a disciplined self-starter capable of selling technical products, innovative in acquiring and retaining customers, able to build rapport with customers, disciplined in time management and the use of customer relationship management tools. description: Careers that Change Lives  A Day in the Life  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned. Promotes and sells Medtronic's products and services within an assigned geographic area and /or specific customer accounts to meet or exceed sales targets. Responsible for developing, building, and strengthening long-term relationships with stakeholders including distributors and healthcare professionals. Responsible for pursuing leads, assessing needs and providing product services to maximize the benefits derived from Medtronic's products and/or services. Promotes and establishes education of the company's products and/or services. Conducts market research including customers and competitors activities. Implements market development plans/strategies and changes as needed. Communicates customer feedback on new products and/or modifications to existing products or applications to internal stakeholders including R&D, Operations and Marketing. Must Have: Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree required Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience and working knowledge of company products and services Nice to Have  About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  Physical Job Requirements  The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)  Additional Information Posting Date: Sep 22, 2021 Travel: Yes, < 50 % of the Time

Are you a problem solver, explorer, and knowledge seeker – always asking, “What if?”  If so, then you may be the new team member we’re looking for. Because at SAS, your curiosity matters – whether you’re developing algorithms, creating customer experiences or answering critical questions. Curiosity is our code, and the opportunities here are endless.  What We Do  We’re the leader in analytics. Through our software and services, we inspire customers around the world to transform data into intelligence. Our curiosity fuels innovation, pushing boundaries, challenging the status quo and changing the way we live.  What You’ll Do  In this role, you will help drive our business development efforts in China with a focus on introducing education programs and training solutions to SAS users. You will be champion for developing and managing meaningful relationships between SAS and current or prospective customers across industries.  You Will Identify new business opportunities, develop as well as manage relationships in strategic territories and accounts. Leverage strategic direction from market insights and proactively craft and propose solutions that clarify how SAS training offerings effectively differentiate from our competitors, can bring business value and address each customer’s critical business challenges. Assist customers in assessing their Talent Development needs. Foster strong relationships with key decision makers, influencers, engineers and business development contacts at targeted SAS clients, especially those that span AE territories. Manage education-related proposal responses alongside AEs. Proactively communicate domain knowledge to sales colleagues and other functions that empower the field to identify opportunities and successfully position SAS offerings. Work with marketing, sales and R&D groups to translate business development strategy into specific initiatives when needed. Additional Responsibilities In consultation with Institute management, assist in targeting specific customers and business partners to promote Institute's sales and marketing initiatives. Initiate and coordinate business development projects and marketing activities with business partners as needed. Prepare and deliver presentations to customers and/or business partners at the highest levels of management when needed. Conduct follow-up with customers and/or business partners to track and uncover additional business opportunities. Drive demand generation and customer or business partner relationship management programs from content design through implementation and results tracking to ensure that objectives are met. Provide overall project management and coordination for customer and/or business partner specific initiatives. May direct internal Institute resources, including pre- sales and post-sales services, contracts, and/or partner relationships. Keep abreast of new company product development and marketing strategies; relate technical concepts to SAS software applications and user needs. What We’re Looking For Minimum of 5 years’ experience in sales, marketing, business partner development, or technical functions related to Analytics/ Artificial Intelligence (AI). Knowledge of sales and product marketing techniques, business partner relationship development strategies, or technical functions within the technology industry and/or knowledge of a specific industry, market, technology, or business initiative related to area of assignment. Exposure to financial services, manufacturing, healthcare, education sectors preferred. Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills in Mandarin plus business-level English skills. Proven ability to work independently as well as in a team environment. Public speaking experience advantageous. Bachelor's degree preferably in Business, Marketing, Computer Science, MIS or other relevant discipline. You’re curious, passionate, authentic and accountable. These are our values and influence everything we do. Why SAS We love living the #SASlife and believe that happy, healthy people have a passion for life, and bring that energy to work. No matter what your specialty or where you are in the world, your unique contributions will make a difference. Our multi-dimensional culture blends our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. Here, it isn’t about fitting into our culture, it’s about adding to it - and we can’t wait to see what you’ll bring. Additional Information  All valid SAS job openings are located on the Careers page at www.sas.com . SAS only sends emails from verified “sas.com” email addresses and never asks for sensitive, personal information or money. Should you have any doubts about the authenticity of any type of communication from, for, or on behalf of SAS, please contact us at Recruitingsupport@sas.com before taking any further action.

description: Why work at Entegris?  Lead. Inspire. Innovate. Define Your Future.  Not everyone who works for a global company shares the same background, experiences and perspectives. We leverage the differences of our employees to bring new ideas to the table. Every employee throughout the company is encouraged to share input on projects and initiatives. Our decision making process is truly a collaborative effort as we realize there are leaders at every level of the organization. We put our values at the core of how we operate as an organization — not just when it’s convenient, but in a lasting and meaningful way. We want the time and energy you spend here to have a positive impact on your life inside and outside of the office.  Entegris is a values-driven culture and our employees rally around our core PACE values:  P eople  A ccountability  C reativity  E xcellence  The Role Manage customer relationships in the Asia region with primary focus on China in the bioprocessing market segment. Leverage existing relationships and knowledge of the bioprocessing market in Asia to position fluid management and other product platforms for this market segment In this role you will Provide input and implement clear Go to Market(GTM) strategic plan for the region. Deliver results by hitting revenue goals and generate market traction in the creation of strong sales pipeline. Direct sales team and other departments to deliver profitable solutions to customers to insure long term business growth. Traits we believe make a strong candidate Greater than five years experience in the bioprocessing market Strong verbal, written and presentation skills to all levels inside and outside the company Fluent in English and Mandarin Have a strong established network of customer contacts in the bioprocessing market segment Time and resource management skills for self, direct reports and other departments Microsoft Office products use and other tools like Hupspot and SAP PACE values Your success will be measured by Integrity of data management and creation Accountability for actions Responsible for representing the company in the most ethical manner Ability to offer solutions to identified problems in a positive way

The Role  As a TPM of IT Sales applications, you will be responsible for leading a wide variety of cross-functional programs across sales and customer experience application, system integration, server systems, and diagnostics. In this role, you will lead the design and development of some of the most advanced and sophisticated systems in the world, with unparalleled agility.  Responsibilities Design the new functionalities in applications to support the growth of our sales. Work with US IT team to implement global rollout to China with local gap prioritized. Manage the implementation as project manager. Manage the daily operation of application. Manage cross-functional software programs from end-to-end. Develop and manage project plans and ensure on-time delivery. Work closely with engineering teams to effectively coordinate complex design inter-dependencies. Constantly work to evolve our processes towards increasing precision and dependability, while still maintaining the agility that has gotten Tesla to where we are now. Lead your teams with strength and confidence through rapid development cycles, changing requirements, and uncertainty. As business partner to manage IT requirements of specific domain. Requirements BS in computer science or electrical engineering, MS preferred. 4+ years' IT application project delivery and operation experience in automotive sales and delivery domain. 5+ years' technical program management (TPM / EPM) experience managing consumer-facing software programs and/or embedded systems. Experience managing end-to-end product deployment — from concept through development and successful launch. Prior software or systems engineering experience with proficiency in coding. Experience building, developing and managing highly effective program management tools and processes. Solid product sense with the ability to understand product architecture and as well as drive and criticize design decisions. Excellent interpersonal, communication and collaboration skills with ability to work in a highly cross-functionally environment. Excellent organization and delegation skills with ability to own the product roadmap and schedule with a track record of delivering projects on-time. Ability to inspire confidence in the executive team as well as the engineering project teams, as the face of your programs. Experience with complex electromechanical systems and/or safety critical systems is a plus. Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines and commitments Individual must be well versed in all Microsoft Applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint …)

description: Want to make a difference and be challenged every day as part of one of the largest global semiconductor companies in the world? Maxim Integrated is a highly successful, $2.3 billion company with offices and manufacturing sites around the world. Within the next several months, Maxim Integrated and Analog Devices are anticipated to combine to create a company with $8B combined revenue, and enhanced product breadth and scope.  Now is the time to beat the crowd and join Maxim today as part of a team that pushes the boundaries of what’s possible. This merger will create the dream team of the analog and mixed-signal market with a combined engineering talent pool of over 10,000 engineers.  With the anticipated merger, you will have a significant opportunity for career growth with 15,000+ employees and $1.5 billion in combined R&D investment.  From the day we first opened our doors in 1983, we’ve attracted and nurtured some of the best problem solvers, creative thinkers, and innovators in the business. We develop the high-performance analog and mixed-signal electronic products that are in the latest cars, smartphones, wearables, hearables, gaming devices, robots, factories, IOT devices, the cloud, and more.  So what are you waiting for? Apply now to be part of this incredible future!  Job Description  Job Description Summary:  We are seeking a motivated, experienced Regional Sales Manager to provide support to our business units in executing the company strategy. This RSM will play a key role in revenue growth and work in close collaboration with Maxim’s business units. This position will be based in Shanghai,China and will manage the sales and field applications team for SMB.  Responsibilities And Duties Include But Not Limited To Establish short and long term sales strategies and solutions by developing business goals with regard to sales revenue, quota, new business opportunities, and the maintenance of customer satisfaction etc. Direct and control all direct and indirect sales activities including the setting of sales plans, objectives and the development of sales strategies to maximize the success of market penetration. Oversee East China sales organization, develop and motivate sales force to drive the business. Drive the collaboration of sales, marketing and distribution partners toward the attainment of business goals. Work with the distribution channel to implement disty strategies for China. Ensure sufficient coverage by business sector and enable the disty process to align with Maxim’s corporate standard through provision of appropriate training, tools and system. Analyze and keep abreast of competitive data of new products/pricings, selling techniques, market trends, customer activities/movements Minimum Qualifications BSEE required, MSEE/MBA preferred. 10+ years of sales management experience with proven track record in developing and driving successful sales organizations within the semiconductor industry. Experience building a top sales organization in the semiconductor industry with a strong understanding of the US semiconductor markets and customers. An acute understanding of key players, technologies, and best practices required to play and win in the US market. Education  Bachelors  Work Experience  Non - Manager  Pay Rate Type  Salary  Eligible for Relocation:  No  Eligible For Work Visa Sponsorship  No  This position may require a deemed export control license for compliance with applicable laws and regulations; including but not limited to US Government International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR), US Export Administration Regulations (EAR), or US Treasury Regulations. If required, placement is contingent on Maxim’s ability to apply for and obtain an export control license on your behalf.  Maxim is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or protected veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

description: To reinvent an industry, you have to build an all-star team. Join Formlabs if you want to bring ground-breaking professional 3D printers to the desktop of every designer, engineer, researcher, and artist in the world. Formlabs is looking for an all-star entrepreneur to drive our expansion. If you can understand complex technology, navigate an industry that is evolving at lightning speed, and thrive under ambiguous objectives, join us as our Channel Sales Manager and help us grow.  The Job: Establish and grow healthy sales channels in China Manage partnerships to maximize sales and build our brand Set ambitious targets for current partners and help enable them to exceed these goals Attend trade shows with partners and increase lead flow Ensure an amazing customer experience  You: Are a strong sales person who is a natural entrepreneur and is willing to get your hands dirty with the details Have a deep understanding of channel sales and strategy, with proven record of driving revenue and hitting ambitious targets Have a track record of bringing products to market and building business operations from the ground up that account for the full life-cycle of the customer incl. post sales support Are an expert project manager and skilled in coordinating people and resources not directly under your control Can craft productive partnerships that align incentives for mutual growth Are a smooth diplomat as well as a tough negotiator Can speak, read and write English fluently Can speak, read and write Mandarin fluently Are comfortable working remotely Bonus Skills:  3D printing or 3D CAD industry experience We build amazing things. Come join us! We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Even if you don't check every box, but see yourself contributing, please apply. Help us build an inclusive community that will change the face of 3D printing. To all recruitment agencies: Formlabs does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Formlabs employees or any other company location. Formlabs is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Unsolicited resumes received will be considered our property and will be processed accordingly.

At allnex, you can go to work knowing you make a lasting impact on the world around you. Our work helps to protect and improve more than 1,000 products from interior coatings for airplanes and scratch-resistant coatings for smartphones, to corrosion protection for cars, and even printing inks for glossy magazines. We are present in 4 regions, with more than 4,000 employees globally, and serve customers in over 100 countries, which makes allnex the world's leading industrial coatings resins company.  Please, come and see allnex insights – Let’s make an impact together!  And here is a sneak peek, how life at allnex sites looks like - allnex Operator Movie  Position Overview  Are you experienced to take on responsibility of customers as a Sales Manager? We are looking for a seasoned professional, well-versed in the chemical industry to lead sales effort. As a Sales Manager in allnex, you will be responsible to achieve the commercial objectives for allnex’s business in China. In this role, you will be responsible for selling allnex products and develop plans to utilize markets to expand revenue. You will act as the primary contact with existing, new and potential customers within their region and serve as the customer advocate, the "voice of the customer".  If you have a sharp mind and the ability to create and maintain a high-performance sales force, let's make an impact together in allnex!  Are you ready to make that career shift? Trust us, this role is always on-demand and you will grow a great portfolio with us. This opportunity does not come often. Click that ‘Apply Now,’ button and we will talk to you soon.  Responsibilities Maintain and further develop the current customers portfolio. Deliver the annual Budget sets for the geographical region (Volumes and Marginal Income). Manage commercial Accounts. Negotiate contracts and prices in a competitive environment. Monitor and maintain profitability standards consistent with overall Company rules. Develop new opportunities through new products. Define and implement Account plans in order to capture new business opportunities in line with the Global Business Unit strategy and the Marketing plans. Ensure formal plans and objectives are communicated internally. Support new Product launches in partnership with Marketing and Technical Service teams. “Innovation” being a key word within allnex Coating Resins. Provide market and competition intelligence. Maintain Working Capital within Company standards. Organize an active prospection in the defined geographical area in order to discover and develop new Accounts. Required Skills And Experience 5 - 10 years in a similar position is required. Excellent Sales skills, relation building, strong passion to win. Fluency in English language and local languages. Strong ability to adapt and learn new technology. Strong customer focus. Good communication, presentation and interpersonal skills. Qualifications University Degree in Chemistry or Chemical Engineer (preferably in Coatings industry) or equivalent. We offer  We are proud to offer an international working experience with a tight-knit network of employees, making it easy to connect and learn from people all across our different functions. On top of that we are a truly innovative company with a strong team spirit, openness to new ideas, and great opportunities to grow and develop your career.  Equal Employment Opportunity  allnex is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to an environment where all colleagues contribute for the benefit of our employees, our products, and our communities.  Find out how you can make an impact!  Check out our career page for available opportunities. We look forward to hearing from you.  www.allnex.com

Learn more: https://www.synopsys.com/software-integrity.html  At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you.  Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. description: Are you passionate about building teams from the ground up?  Do you have the ambition in making a difference in a fast growing company?  Do you thrive when you're contributing to a high-performing, humble team?  If your answers are Yes. Amazing!!! You are the missing puzzle we are looking for.   At Jungle Scout, we are on a mission to empower entrepreneurs and brands to grow successful e-commerce businesses, and we provide the industry-leading data, powerful tools, and resources they need.  We’re growing and we are looking to add a Sales Manager, Enterprise to our fast-paced and customer-oriented sales team.   Interested in learning more? Let’s get into the details:       In Sale Team Manager, Enterprise You will be doing:  Attract and build a high performing enterprise sales team from the ground up to sell Cobalt and Downstream Platforms to brand sellers and other targeted top companies; Plan and create strategy for the enterprise team based on the marketing trend and data; Get insights from the market, develop them into strategies independently and break the strategies into actionable items; Forecast business trend and set reasonable and realistic yet challenging goals for the team; Own the enterprise sales revenue goal and motivate the team to achieve and exceed the revenue goals; Lead the team to develop potential leads, build sales funnel, follow up leads and win deals; Manage performance and outcome of your individual team members; Facilitate and lead team member’s development by creating an open and safe environment for them while also identifying and unlock their potential;  Challenge them to think outside the box and achieve more; Cooperate with marketing to find the targeted customers;  Cooperate with CSM team to ensure that customers have a seamless experience and get user behaviour data insights to help with sales activities;  Who you are:  5+ years of experience in enterprise SaaS sales and providing software solutions to top companies; 2+ years of experience in people management with proven success of leading the team to exceed targets; Experience in hiring brilliant people onto the team and care for their development and achievements in Jungle Scout; Experience in building sales processes including sales funnel building, performance management; Experience in coaching sales reps with sales skills and industry knowledge; From ecommerce industry, preferably with experience in Amazon PPC;  Resourceful, flexible, accurate and with strong analytical skills; Great face to face presentation skills and telephone communication skills;  Business focused with positive attitude;  Active team player; Fluent in Mandarin and English;

description: Sales Manager  As the Sales Manager, you will be responsible for establishing and leading commercial programs and commercial operations including sales operations, commercial partnerships, channel sales, and other business functions to set a foundation for growth and develop our commercial programs, sales partnerships and business capabilities in Korean. You will report to the Business Development Director or Senior Business Development Manager.  What You’ll Do Identify and lead channel sales partnerships and business development initiatives to fuel our growth. Establish and implement systems methods and processes to build scalable commercial capabilities. Provide insightful market intel and data analysis. Partner cross functionally with sales, marketing and pricing to define and refine our go-to-market strategy. Take a high energy and entrepreneurial approach to the role. Working collaboratively with the rest of the Asia team and global functions to drive strategic priorities and get things done. Set up certain business operations functions to support Korean, APEC and South China commercial activity. Operate with a high level of integrity and compliance to global regulatory requirements. Foster a culture of empowerment, inclusiveness, and agility to accelerate things that work and pivot away from things that don’t. Be both local and global, you balance global and local practices to deliver maximum value to our customers, carriers and regulators. What You’ll Need 5 - 8 years of experience in commercial and analytics heavy functions. You’re not afraid to get your hands dirty and will thrive in unstructured and multi-stakeholder settings to deliver results. Proven relationship management, and project/program/process management skills. Ability to deliver on a broad portfolio of responsibilities on your own, and ‘figure stuff out’ quickly and effectively. Great with numbers including strong analytical skills. A strong grasp of real world supply chain concepts including direct knowledge of how industrial and product supply chains work. Knowledge in Korean, APEC and China regions logistics, freight forwarding. A knowledge of e-commerce markets is a plus. Highly effective communicator with good people instincts - able to build trust and work well with a diverse group internally and externally. Eager for a very hands-on role, where you’ll be asked to take on and run with a range of projects outside your comfort zone, and learn quickly. Highly organized, self-motivated and detail-oriented, with great follow-through on projects/tasks big and small. High integrity individual who’s enthusiastic about building a great company for the long term, and making a huge, positive impact in the world. Bachelor's Degree. Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills. Strong command of English, Chinese and Korean. Courage to challenge the status quo when logic and reason require it. See something broken? Fix it.

jobTitle: S&C Auto - Management consultant - Sales/After sales/Retail digital strategy
description: About Accenture Automotive & Mobility  We are the leading digital-powered business transformation partner of choice for our clients in the Chinese Automotive market, and combine deep Auto industry know-how with creative, innovative thinking and data-driven consulting to shape and create the Automotive and Mobility companies of the future.  With the heaviest disruption of the Auto industry in motion, we are helping our clients in China to transform their business along the complete value chain, creating 360° value for our clients by leveraging human ingenuity and innovative technologies.   Job Description   We are looking for young professional team players who are passionate about ideating, shaping and realizing the future of the Automotive industry in China by transforming the business of our clients – from strategizing to realizing change. For that, we need you to bring solid insights and expertise in the Chinese auto or mobility industry, at best with hands-on experience in one or more areas of the changing Automotive value chain.  With your outgoing and proactive personality, you are highly motivated to apply your structured thinking to analyze and understand our client’s challenges, and to share your own ideas to ideate and shape strategies, concepts and solutions together with our team. You are open to explore and learn new technologies, methodologies and tools to create and implement new business and operating models together with our clients through end-to-end transformation engagements. You enjoy taking ownership for initiatives, are reliable and aspiring to continuously develop yourself as part of your team and are a confident communicator.  Sounds like a perfect match? Great. Let’s get in touch and talk about your career at Accenture Strategy & Consulting.  Our expectations on the working conditions:  You will be based in one of our office locations: Beijing, Shanghai, Shenzhen, Guangzhou or Hangzhou  Our job requires us to work at client’s locations mostly across Greater China, and sometimes also other global locations, for short or long term  Depending on clients and projects, we are travelling at least 60% of the time annually outside our base locations. Please be aware that travel is required and may be even up to 100% on a weekly basis on some projects for a duration of several weeks.  Your Role: Automotive & Mobility Management Consultant  There is no ‘typical day’ at Accenture, but that’s why people love it here. The opportunities to make a difference within exciting and leading client initiatives are plenty, especially in the mid of disruption of the Automotive industry.  Here are just a few of your day-to-day responsibilities.  Key Responsibilities:  Project Delivery: work as part of small to medium-sized teams to ideate, create and define solutions to our client’s business challenges, and bringing them into operations, both at client side and remotely.  Business Development: Support the team to identify and win new engagement with our clients, starting to develop and maintain client relations  Domain Development: Bring in your own vision and ideas to develop new thoughts on how Automotive is disrupted and how we can support the change at our clients. Develop new methodologies, points-of-view, research or white papers, support development of marketing materials/  Topics and subjects include, but are not limited to:  Market research & customer insights analysis  Functional strategy definition  New business model ideation & definition  Automotive Sales/Retail & Marketing transformation, e.g. via direct sales, digital customer transformation, eCommerce, CRM  Automotive Customer Service & Aftersales transformation, e.g. new revenue streams, efficiency optimization  Digital & Mobility Service business and operating models  Functional and industry expertise support for technology implementation projects (e.g. SalesForce, SAP, digital applications)  Required Qualifications:  >4 years’ experience and track record in Automotive, particularly in one of the value chain areas: SCM, Sales/Retail, Marketing, After Sales/Customer Service, Connected Vehicle, Mobility Services or in the NEV market  General Automotive industry understanding and market insight  Preferably previous working experience at Auto OEM or Auto (NEV) start-up  Preferably previous working experience in Consulting with Automotive focus  Interest and self-motivation to research, learn and ideate about Auto & Mobility topics  Exceptional drive and willingness to contribute to growth as part of our team  Proactive, open/extroverted, and ambitious mindset  Great team player, embracing our ‘One Accenture’ culture  Possess understanding of regulatory requirements/regulatory trends in the auto industry  Strong problem solving and structured thinking skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment.  Minimum Bachelor degree  Fluency in English, Chinese, additional languages are a plus  Experience abroad is a plus

description: Job Summary/Purposes           The incumbent is responsible to manage buying and merchandising function of Miu Miu Woman Ready-to-wear to optimize business volume.  Responsibilities  ·        Develop buying budgets and the merchandise selection of the Woman’s Ready-to=wear category for the shops in his/her designated area.  ·        Maintain up-to-date records for the stock receipts, stock holding, stock for sale etc. information for management’s review.  ·        Assign and refill merchandise for all shops and properly and sufficiently merchandised.  ·        Set monthly, seasonal and annual sales target for all shops for management’s approval.  ·        Select and buy merchandise and coordinate necessary follow up with Italy on order confirmation, shipment and actual receipts of all merchandise.  ·        Coordinate with visual merchandising to ensure that all shops are presented to customers in line with the Company’s policy.  ·        Compile and submit all necessary sales, inventory, forecasts, budgets, etc. information as may be required by management from time to time.  ·        Provide product training to retail staff to ensure they possess good knowledge for each collection.  ·        Manage shop operation in conjunction with Shop Managers in respective locations.
