HENKEL IS FOR THOSE WHO STEP UP. DO YOU?  At Henkel, you can make a difference and craft your career. That’s why you own your projects and take full responsibility from an early stage. Our unique brands in markets around the world open up countless opportunities to follow your convictions and explore new paths. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset that allows you to always think out of the box - take the chance and shape the digital future together with us.  JOB PURPOSE Take direct accountability for controlling of laundry and home care business in Taiwan. Support business to ensure data integrity, transparency of business performance and providing strong financial decision support and analysis YOUR ROLE Executes local sales plans (short, mid, long term) in line with SBU strategy to maintain and develop existing / acquire new customers Executes customer roadmap and manages / closes respective CRM tool (ACE) growth opportunities Executes pricing actions Builds and maintains relationships with customers and distributors Provides input to Manager on customer needs, business trends, competitive situations in territory Coordinates with TCS to conduct line trials / (re)solve customer requests and complaints Delivers KP OSG and PC % in territory / at defined account INDIVIDUALLY TASKS Maintain good relationship with current customer; provide technical support to customers, make sure the supply by teamwork Exploit new business in non-woven market and collect payments Improve overall knowledge related to market analysis, products, application and selling skills Prepare the sales related reports and sales forecast Your Skills Bachelor's degree in Chemical or Polymer engineering Minimum of three (3) years working experience in Non-woven or Adhesive industry Field sales experience in non-woven market highly preferred Workable verbal and written English communication skills Excellent interpersonal skills, self-driven and has a positive attitude towards learning and personal development What The Role Can Offer You We mainly service for non-woven market, include napkins/baby diapers/ adult diapers company and so on In adhesive industry, we are the leader in the world and win the mostly global and local premium customers We emphasize respect / teamwork / self-development

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:  The incumbent will also be responsible for, but not limiting to the following duties:  * Make reagent sales plan of NSP * Achieve the NSP reagent sales target together with NSP sales. * Explore the breakthroughs of the clinical value of primary medical. * Provide the leadership in clinical value management and clinical education plan to distributors and end customers together with sales. * Work closely with NSP sales team and optimize the sales tools from the medical point of view. * Deliver clinical value to the distributors and end customers, work with all distributors and customers to design and innovate the clinical solution to optimize the assay promotion tactics. * Organize the medical events and ensure all the activities align with compliance and requirements. * Provide support to the business partner with the clinical knowledge. * Act as primary liaison between internal and external groups regarding product safety surveillance. This description is a summary of principle responsibilities and is not intended to include all duties may be assigned.  WORKING RELATIONSHIPS AND CONTACTS:  * External contacts for this position include clinicians, laboratory director, dealers, 3rd partner and Government * Internal contacts include all sales, marketing and clinical department staff members as well as other pre-sale and post-sale department staff in other offices of the company to gain information or to resolve problems. SUPERVISION RECEIVED AND GIVEN:  The incumbent of this position is responsible for his/her own work.  Only new work is reviewed before issue, all other work is handled independently, reporting status to managers/supervisor.  Some work requires analysis and use of initiative and independent judgment, but most assignments are specific and well defined.  ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS:  EDUCATION & SKILLS:  * Master’s degree of Medicine or Clinical Laboratory Medicine from medical school. SKILLS:  * Good English skills in speaking, reading and writing * Good presentation skill and communication skill WORKING EXPERIENCE:  * Three ~ five years working experience in IVD or Pharmacy * Preferred the candidates who worked as both MSL and clinical sales in Pharmacy, IVD, medical equipment, domestic medical company or 3rd lab. * Preferred the candidates who worked as a doctor in hospital. FUNCTIONAL COMPETENCIES:  This position also requires:  * Prioritizes assigned work assuring milestones are achieved * Focuses energy on meeting key targets to achieve quality results * Good presentation, interpersonal and negotiation skills * Strong motivation and initiative in making progress, goal oriented * Be able to work under pressure, self-controlled * Systematically gathers relevant information, considers a broad range of issues or factors * Effectively communicates with internal and external contacts to ensure positive outcomes * Understands goals, objectives and barriers to achievement for defined area of focus * Attends external seminars and visits customers and other companies to continue learning * Uses understanding of the customer’s needs and expectations to identify and suggest ideas or enhancements * Searches for ways to increase customer satisfaction * Excellent in teamwork TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS:  This position may require business traveling in a frequently situation.  WORK ENVIRONMENT:  This position functions in a general office environment.

Hitachi ABB Power Grids is a pioneering technology leader that is helping to increase access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all. We help to power your home, keep the factories running, and our hospitals and schools open. Come as you are and prepare to get better as you learn from others. Bring your passion, bring your energy, and plug into a team that appreciates a simple truth: Diversity + Collaboration = Great Innovation  For our Marketing, Sales and Product Management team, understanding the full potential of our technology and the trends in our markets is highly rewarding. In addition, helping customers all over the world improve efficiency, save resources and reduce emissions gives our work a powerful sense of purpose.  Your Responsibilities Meet or exceed annual sales goals while remaining within expense budget guidelines. Marketing analyse and sales strategy draw up. Develop the new marketing, new product and new customers. Channel and distributor development and management with FES. Continue to improve UT, IN, LV and service business and marketing share by cooperating with FES. Be responsible for export market and business by cooperating with global PQC. Team management and people development. Living core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.  Your background A University degree or high level. 5 years of experience in sales relative. Good English communication skill is preferred. Excellent interpersonal, problem solving and critical thinking skills Effective customer presentation skills. Responsible. Result-Oriented Teamwork is a must.  More About Us  Hitachi ABB Power Grids is a global technology leader with a combined heritage of almost 250 years, employing around 36,000 people in 90 countries. Headquartered in Switzerland, the business serves utility, industry and infrastructure customers across the value chain, and emerging areas like sustainable mobility, smart cities, energy storage and data centres. With a proven track record, global footprint and unparalleled installed base, Hitachi ABB Power Grids balances social, environmental and economic values, and is committed to powering good for a sustainable energy future, with pioneering and digital technologies, as the partner of choice for enabling a stronger, smarter and greener grid. www.hitachiabb-powergrids.com  High Voltage Products

At Lenovo, we are looking for a highly dynamic individual with strong relationship and negotiation skills for a Retail Solutions Sales Specialist position to drive Retail Vertical Business in ASIA. The Retail Solutions Sales Specialist will be responsible for driving worldwide revenue, profit, and customer satisfaction for Lenovo’s largest and most strategic Retail Accounts. This individual will be managing and maintaining account relationships through senior level engagements for Lenovo’s entire solution portfolio. They will also develop strategies for profit and pricing proposals, as well as communicate and understand Total Cost of Ownership, industry trends, and critical success factors for leading effective IT deployments. The Retail Solutions Sales Specialist will also drive the team in responding to RFPs (Request for Proposals), POS system testing, Store POC and MSA discussion.   Key responsibilities will include the following:  • Develops long term sales pipeline to increase Lenovo’s market share in specialized retail segment.  • Use specialty expertise to seek out new opportunities for customer value by expanding and enhancing existing opportunities to build the pipeline in and drive pursuit in specialty area.  • Provide support to the Regional Account Managers. Set direction for business development and solution replication.  • Creates and grows reference customers.  • Sell complex products or solutions to customers on a partnership basis. May act as a dedicated resource to a few strategic accounts.  • Grow contractual renewals for large accounts with more complexity, to higher-total contract value renewals.  • Establish a professional, working, and consultative, relationship with the client, including the C-level for mid-to-large accounts by developing a core understanding of the unique business needs of the client within their industry.  • Maintain and use overall cross-portfolio knowledge to support account leads with integration of solutions.  • Contribute to enduring executive relationships that establish Lenovo consultative professionalism and promote its total solution capabilities.  • Maintains expertise on IT at all levels - new applications, maintenance, typical budgets of the CIO's, typical objectives, measures, metrics.  • Maintains broad market and competitor knowledge to ensure credibility with Customer Executives.  • 10+ years proven track record in strategic selling to Global Retail Enterprise. • Know strengths and weaknesses of key competitors and how to leverage this knowledge in the account.  • In-depth knowledge of client's business, organizational structure, business processes and financial structure. • Demonstrates the ability to leverage Lenovo's portfolio of products and services to change the playing field against our competition. • Demonstrates leadership and initiative in successfully driving full portfolio including hardware, software and services needed for the customer's requirements.  • Understands the leverage of services as part of strategic portfolio of products. Promotes APOS (After Point-of-Sales) services as part of all strategic opportunities.  • Balance strategic and tactical pursuits to optimize coverage and develop a predictable revenue stream. • Uses C-level engagement skills in collaboration with account leads to offer value-add solutions to the client. • Works with the account team to build an effective account plan and strategy to drive incremental revenue in the account.  • Successful partner engagement experience. Works effectively with our partners to drive additional revenue.  • Maintain knowledge of industry trends, associated solutions, and key partner/ISV solutions.

description: POSITION SUMMARY: The Regional Sales Manager (RSM) is responsible for the growing sales within the assigned territory and developing and executing the region’s sales strategy. The RSM will have an in-depth understanding of HaydonKerk Pittman’s chosen markets and key competitors. He/she needs to work closely across multiple business departments within HKP and will be able to clearly communicate the product needs and business needs for the assigned territory.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:  ·      Grow HKP’s bookings and sales in the territory by assigning goals within the territory based on sales opportunities. Develop annual territory business plans.  Track and report performance against monthly and quarterly plans. Assist in the development of territory budgets for the sales team.  ·      Ensure that region achieves sales at or above target levels by meeting forecasted sales targets and driving sales funnel growth.  ·      Identify and penetrate key accounts within the territory. Assists with closing sales, as necessary.  ·      developing and managing customer relationships, and conducting product training.  ·      Recommends product lines by identifying new product opportunities, identifying customer needs and trends, and tracks competitors.  ·      Analyze bid requests and specifications for major projects, and reviews them with Product Management and Sales Director, as needed.  ·      Assist in formulating incentive programs for the regional sales team.  ·      Maintain competitor and market awareness and keep HKP management appraised of significant trends or events. Provide new product and product modification suggestions.  Be familiar with the local market, customers and opportunities. Researches marketing information, competitor strategies, capabilities and pricing patterns in order to recommend plans to improve market penetration. ·      Develop and maintain strong business relationships with key accounts within the territory.  ·      Ability to get along in a team environment.  ·      Maintain Microsoft Dynamics CRM with updated information  SPECIAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES: 3+ years of field sales and sales management experience in the motor industry. Bachelor's degree in Engineering, or related technical degree, is required; Advanced degree is preferred. Ability to establish and develop strong customer relationships.  Action/detail oriented with a drive for results attitude. Strong customer focus.  Must be a team player with the ability to work in multi-task environment and make sound business decisions.  ADDITIONAL CHARACTERISTICS: High energy Strong negotiating skills Location in Shenzhen is preferable Good interpersonal skills required. Results driven and strategic thinking capability

description: Introduction  DI MC LVM (Low Voltage Motor) segment is a newly headquarter set-up which is responsible for developing global LV motor business with full P&L responsibility. Within DI MC LVM segment, there are three Operation Hubs which are responsible for Sales & Marketing, Manufacturing and Product Portfolio Management in European countries and Rest of World (EU Hub), Asia and ASEAN countries (AA Hub) and North American countries (AM Hub).  This position is looking for Head of Sales who is responsible for sales strategy & governance for LVM business on global level.  What are my responsibilities?  Responsible for global LVM sales & business development with focus on governance Drive market transparency of LVM (Market competition, market trend. Define LVM Go-to-market strategy together with hubs, guide and monitor implementation in Hubs Define global channel management concept. Lead vertical development team. Bachelor’s Degree in Drive, Automation, Mechanical or Electrical Engineering 15+ years business development or sales experience in manufacturing industry. Position:  Account Manager  Job Description:  We are looking for an Account Manager to join our component business. This role will develop all key relationships to ensure strong foundation for solution selling. Maintain and promote relationships with customer contacts who may be determining shortage and cost saving opportunities and deal with existing business challenges. Ensure customer satisfaction as it pertains to supply chain management and other value-added services. Extensive understanding of pricing programs and models within the electronics industry.  What You’ll Be Doing  Provides the highest level of service to meet customer satisfaction while maintaining efficiencies in corporate operational processes and procedures Serves as a liaison between Arrow’s internal resources, vendor resources and customers. Demonstrates a proactive approach and sense of urgency on our customers’ behalf, anticipates our customers’ requirements and communicates efforts in a timely and effective processes routine/ smaller customer orders accurately and timely. Resolves discrepancies with the customer prior to order entry. Enters sales orders into the Arrow system. Review backlog report to fulfill orders most effectively. Meets customer service agreements established in SOW Backlog Management, Billing and Resolution of vendor Invoice Discrepancies and Claims  What We Are Looking For  Typically requires a 4-year degree with a minimum of 5 years sales experience in semiconductor companies or electronics distributors. Could Work within established procedures with a moderate degree of supervision Problem-solving, service oriented and "Can do" attitudes Solid understanding of product cycle and manufacturing procedures of customer Solid knowledge on products and technology development in the electronic components industry  What’s In It For You  At Arrow, we recognize that financial rewards and great benefits are important aspects of an ideal job. That’s why we offer competitive financial compensation, including various compensation plans, and a solid benefits package.  Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance Life Insurance Performance Bonus Paid Time Off Special/Extra Leave 5-Day Work Week Growth Opportunities And more!  About Arrow  Arrow Electronics, Inc. (NYSE: ARW), an award-winning Fortune 102 and one of Fortune Magazine’s Most Admired Companies. Arrow guides innovation forward for over 180,000 leading technology manufacturers and service providers. With 2020 sales of USD $28.67 billion, Arrow develops technology solutions that improve business and daily life. Our broad portfolio that spans the entire technology landscape helps customers create, make and manage forward-thinking products that make the benefits of technology accessible to as many people as possible. Learn more at www.arrow.com.  Our strategic direction of guiding innovation forward is expressed as Five Years Out, a way of thinking about the tangible future to bridge the gap between what's possible and the practical technologies to make it happen. Learn more at https://www.fiveyearsout.com/.  For more job opportunities, please visit https://careers.arrow.com/us/en. Description  Amazon strives to be Earth's most customer-centric company where people can find and discover virtually anything they want to buy online by giving customers more of what they want - low prices, vast selection, and convenience - Amazon.com continues to grow and evolve as a world-class e-commerce platform. The Selling Partner Support Operations team acts as the primary interface between Amazon and our 3rd Party business partners, so to our Selling Partners. We are looking for an ESPR Account Manager who will be responsible for handling escalated matters that originate with the Seller/Vendor/Brand or Selling Partner. These escalations arrive through various inputs, like emails sent to Jeff B, Amazon Executives, or escalations presented by leaders throughout the organization. Many contacts have no clear solution and require work cross-functionally throughout the organization with the appropriate teams to find a solution for the current escalation, objectively handle highly sensitive situations with integrity and discretion, as well as looking for long-term mechanisms to prevent future occurrences. Solving these escalated matters should lead to the opportunity to repair systemic issues and create an ongoing environment of process improvement.  Key Responsibilities Recognize system, quality, and process concerns contributing to poor Selling Partner experiences and share with PSAS team. Work cross-functionally with other teams to identify root causes and drive process improvements to Selling Partner facing issues. Maintain aggressive service levels for escalations Timely and accurate reporting on escalation status, create and communicate escalation summaries to executives and senior leaders for current open executive escalations. Capture success stories and surface innovative ideas to drive improvement for all Selling Partners. Collaborates to build partnerships with key stakeholder groups, businesses and leaders to ensure systemic problems are addressed and corrected. Solves ambiguous and complex Selling Partner issues Deep dive repeat issues for individual selling partners, collaborate with business teams to solve all technical and marketplace process issues. Identify and communicate any potential risks and obstacles with current Marketplace processes, initiatives, and system issues affecting Selling Partners, providing recommendations for corrective action to business stakeholders. Manage all ESPR intake mechanisms, providing resolutions to high priority issues and ensuring required security protocols are complete to protect confidential Seller information. Lead small to medium sized projects from initiation to resolution, focused on internal business operations improvements, Selling Partner facing products/processes, and updates that impact Selling Partner Support, leading discussions with all involved stakeholders to scope needed changes.  Basic Qualifications Able to work independently with little supervision, self-motivated, and flexible in approaching responsibilities and change Proficiency in using written and oral communication skills in a business environment in English and Chinese Business acumen Proficiency in composition skills, ability to compose concise, accurate and appropriately targeted responses Demonstrate effective conflict resolution and negotiation skills, professional attitude Demonstrate comprehension skills (reading and listening) -- ability to understand and represent Selling Partner issues Demonstrate superior time management and multitasking skills, self-discipline Demonstrate “big picture” thinking and sound judgment and discretion Preferred Qualifications 1-3 years of previous technical/customer support experience Highly experienced in handling complicated executive type escalations, problem ticketing, incident management or very comparable and relevant alternative experience is preferred Detail-oriented, analytical, proactive approach to problem-solving and identification; ability to operate both a granular or macro level Ability to multi-task and make tough decisions in a fast-paced environment Strong written and verbal communication skills including the ability to comfortably engage with all levels of stakeholder up to CEO internally, and any customer externally; ability to translate technical jargon into everyday language Proven ability to build relationships and influence others across the organization Project management skills  Company - ICP-Chengdu Branch  Job ID: A1735549
industries: Computer Software, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

description: Company Description  Do you want beneficial technologies being shaped by your ideas? But we can’t do it alone. Today’s exceptional data challenges require your exceptional skills. It’s You & Us. Together, we’re the next big thing in data. jobTitle: Regional Sales Manager 销售经理
description: Job Description Regional Sales Manager – Titan International Industries  As Regional Sales Manager of Titan’s Data Acquisition and Analysis business (including Floating LiDAR System and Predictive Machine Health Management System), you will report directly to the CEO and work as a key strategic player within the organization to drive domestic and international growth strategies, leading projects, and supporting business critical work streams. As a leader of Titan’s key project management you will: Coach a team of professionals and provide guidance and support; Plan and execute deployment and measurement campaigns in several international markets, including budget management, scheduling, and managing relationships with a variety of internal and external stakeholders (suppliers, subcontractors, clients, etc.); Collaborate with Titan’s technical team to mediate between client and local government requirements and site-specific technical challenges; Select, vet, and qualify local subcontractors and partners to develop and maintain robust local support in each market; Participate in the preparation of tenders and proposals and liaise with clients and subcontractors; Ensure Titan remains compliant with internal and client HSE requirements and all applicable international standards and maritime regulations (e.g. IEC 61400-12-1 Ed.2 and the OWA Roadmap ed.2 2018) Coordinate with Titan’s technical team to ensure the technical aspects of each campaign comply with client requirements, including validation, data analysis and weekly reporting, asset management, and decommissioning. Work Location - Asia, South Korea   Qualifications  Titan is seeking a high-performing Regional Sales Manager ready for the next step in his/her career or an experienced sales manager/account manager/project manager eager to tackle new challenges. The successful candidate will have the following qualifications: 5+ years’ experience in sales management; Degree in engineering or a relevant discipline; Practical experience as a marine engineer or naval architect and experience in the offshore wind industry is desirable; People management experience; Demonstrated ability to devise creative solutions to problems involving multiple competing stakeholders; Knowledgeable and experienced in conducting inspections (e.g. weld quality, electrical connections, sealing strategies, cabling management) and evaluating HSE compliance (experience drafting internal HSE policies is desirable); Dedicated, pragmatic, and detail-oriented; Passionate and self-driven; Adaptable and able to travel frequently; Fluent in English and Korean(Chinese highly desirable).  *** Interested candidates can apply by sending a CV in both English and Chinese to titanhr@titangroupco.com

description: GRIMME Tianjin is now seeking dynamic and dedicated Chinese candidates for following job. You analyze the market situation, market environment and competitors of agricultural technology in far inner Mogolia, China (Wulanchabu,Siziwang Banner, Baotou, Dengkou), in the segment of Potato Technology. You organize sales-promotional activities and training sessions concerning our products, always in due consideration of the competitive situation and strategies from our headquarters. Your main activities include supporting our dealer network and the end user at their farms. On this occasion you operate as a competent consultant regarding all matters of our range of products. Your job includes a high amount of travelling to rural areas. You will be part of a young, dedicated team with many possibilities to learn and grow. It reflects their pioneering spirit combined with our long history of engineering in the ever-evolving healthcare industry.  We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment with opportunities to go beyond your comfort zone in order to grow personally and professionally. Sound interesting?  Your tasks and responsibilities:  Achieve sales target in assigned area or market for responsible product lines.  完成所负责的产品在指定区域或市场的销售目标。  Promote Siemens Branding and Company Value to customer, participate in area marketing activity.  积极参与所负责区域的市场活动，向客户推广西门子的品牌形象及公司价值。  Exploit assigned customer needs, maintain close relationship with named account in assigned area.  客户需求开发，在负责区域维护客户关系。  Guide and maintain business channel and support business partner in bidding.  维护商业渠道，指导并支持业务伙伴的项目投标工作。  Maintain a high level of customer satisfaction through consistent high quality interactions with management of customers.  与客户管理层保持持续和有效的沟通交流，以维持高水平的客户满意度。  Cooperate with cross functional departments internally and customers to ensure smooth project implementation.  积极协调内部跨部门合作，以确保项目顺利实施。  Act as Mentor to Account Specialist / Sr. Account Specialist in demand.  在客户专员/高级客户专员需要时给予工作上的指导和帮助。  Other tasks assigned by management.  上级安排的其他工作任务。  Your qualifications and experience:  5 years above working experience in sales, project management and technology in the field of medical equipment  5年医疗设备行业的的工作经历，有销售、项目管理和技术方面的相关经验  Excellent in understanding an acting on customer's needs  善于理解客户的需求  Excellent skill in selling, skilled both in BP management and direct-sales.  优秀的销售技巧，具备代理商管理能力和直销能力  Excellent skill in negotiation, project management and market information collection  优秀的谈判、项目管理和市场信息收集能力  Excellent verbal and written communication skill in Chinese as good command of English  优秀的口头和书面沟通能力，良好的英语水平  Self-motivated, strong power on implementation, quick learner, able to work under high pressure  自我激励，极强的执行力，快速学习能力，能够承受高压的工作  Frequent travel is required  适应高频率的差旅  Bachelor degree preferred, or equivalent degree with major in medical, marketing, business or related  本科或同等学历，医学、市场营销及商务等相关专业  Our global team:  Siemens Healthineers is a leading global medical technology company. 50,000 dedicated colleagues in over 70 countries are driven to shape the future of healthcare. An estimated 5 million patients across the globe benefit every day from our innovative technologies and services in the areas of diagnostic and therapeutic imaging, laboratory diagnostics and molecular medicine, as well as digital health and enterprise services.  Our culture:  Our culture embraces different perspectives, open debate, and the will to challenge convention. Change is a constant aspect of our work. We aspire to lead the change in our industry rather than just react to it. That’s why we invite you to take on new challenges, test your ideas, and celebrate success.  We care about your data privacy and take compliance with GDPR as well as other data protection legislation seriously. For this reason, we ask you not to send us your CV or resume by email. We ask instead that you create a profile in our talent community where you can upload your CV. Setting up a profile lets us know you are interested in career opportunities with us and makes it easy for us to send you an alert when relevant positions become open.  To all recruitment agencies: Siemens Healthineers does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, employees, or any other company location. Siemens Healthineers is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.  Organization: Siemens Healthineers  Company: Siemens Healthineers Ltd.  Experience Level: Experienced Professional  Job Type: Full-time
industries: Medical Devices, Hospital & Health Care, and Biotechnology

jobTitle: Regional Sales Manager区域销售经理
description: 为什么在英迈工作？ 英迈是技术和供应链服务的全球领导者，使业务合作伙伴能够最大限度地提高他们制造、销售或使用的技术的价值。我们帮助超过250,000家业务合作伙伴和2000家供应商在他们所服务的市场中更高效、更成功的运营。 作为区域销售经理，您需要合理规划并推进区域销售工作，并和利益相关者包括代理商以及客户保持良好沟通，以达成达成区域业绩目标。 在此职位上，您将直接向全国区域销售总经理汇报，并与内外部的业务相关者紧密合作。   你会做什么?  您的职责包括但不限于：  1、区域销售计划制定 梳理客户完整画像，定位需求（规模，生意方向，用户群，行业）； 根据公司指标、市场需求，做销售预测，搭建销售渠道，制定区域内的销售计划，分解和落实指标到销售。 2、关键客户关系维护 现有关键客户的维护，理解客户整体业务运营情况，持续挖掘跨产品或解决方案的生意机会，达成框架合作协议； 新关键客户拜访，挖掘生意机会，跨产品线匹配，生成解决方案，促成合作。 3、渠道及新业务拓展 在区域内拓展有效渠道覆盖； 新产品线机会挖掘，并向BU引荐。 4、区域业务执行 利用有效的业务管理工具，多维度追踪区域内各项过程和结果指标，确保业务达成； 定期跟进review团队的销售行为（包含：拜访记录，商机分析，业务计划，客户满意度）； 协助团队与后台支持部门的沟通，协助政策和流程改善。 5、团队组织优化及管理 确保团队整体销售思维、行为、目标的一致； 合理规划和配置人员 人员辅导、激励与发展  你需要具备什么条件才能成功？  教育背景： 大学本科及以上学历，计算机、市场营销专业优先 经验要求： 八年以上IT行业工作经验，至少五年以上产品销售经验及三年以上团队管理经验； 熟悉IT行业现状及趋势，熟悉渠道生态体系，深度理解总代的生意模式及打法； 熟悉主流IT产品，包括技术指标、应用场景、行业趋势、同类竞品市场布局等，有相关厂商产品技术认证者优先考虑； 具备一定的财务知识及Excel数据分析能力； 有一定英文基础，能阅读英文邮件和简单技术文档。 能力要求： 商业头脑和战略思维 市场分析和业务规划能力 商务谈判能力 数据驱动和分析思维 发展和培养团队的能力

description: Zespri is more than simply the world’s single-largest marketer of kiwifruit. We like to think of ourselves as fruit on a mission and as rebels with a cause: to help people, communities and the environment around the world thrive through the goodness of kiwifruit.  We supply one of the world’s healthiest little superfruits to millions of people around the world in more than 50 markets. We are one of New Zealand’s best-known international brands, dedicated to creating sustainable long-term value for growers.  We believe in guardianship which, for us, means going the extra mile to look after our people, the community, and the land. We are results-driven, challenging ourselves to think big and deliver better. We cultivate personal connections, which means listening and acting with empathy and humility – and treating each other better for it.  Assistant Supply Chain IBP Manager Specifically, the position includes a focus on: Implementation of SAP IBP sales forecasting solution Leading the Integrated Sales forecasting Planning Process Inventory Planning for sales forecast Project Management - Continuous improvement of sales operations processes, metrics and systems Reporting of sales performance  In this role, your key responsibilities are as follows:    Deployment of SAP S4 Hana IBP Sales Forecast Deployment in mainland China  Lead the IBP Demand/Sales forecasting design process, plan user testing, implementation for China.  Work with the Project Horizon team, customers, distributors and consultants to understand the full capability of the tool and implement it within the relevant constraints.  Design the bottoms-up sales forecasting process  Continue to enhance systems capability to drive efficiency in the IBP Sales forecasting process.  Lead Sales Forecasting Planning Process  You are expected to have lead Sale forecasting meetings on a regional function with a good understanding of the concept of implementing Integrated Business Planning (IBP) module within a structured organization.            Continuously look for deepening and improving the sales forecasting process to make it no manual touch process.  Understand and implement statistical forecasting models for customer/region and/or channel  Collaborate with Supply planning team to periodically review the supply plan.  Analyze forecast accuracy and bias and identify and implement process enhancements to improve these KPI’s.  Participate in monthly S&OP process to drive key decisions.  Partner with key account managers/customer teams for short term forecasting.  Effective communication with all relevant stakeholders to achieve consensus on all demand plans.  Address risk and opportunity and work with finance to estimate the cost impact  Drive continuous improvement on Demand review process  Inventory planning for Sales forecast  Support staff to develop appropriate inventory policies that optimize the trade-off between service level and demand requirements.  Project Management  Process improvement and risk management - identifying gaps and opportunities.  Support Sales forecast Risk Assessments for assigned projects at each project stage.  Stakeholder engagement - internally and externally.  Having an appreciation for end-to-end processes to provide solutions.  In order to be successful bringing this to life, you will ideally bring the following experiences with you:  Bachelor’s Degree; concentration in sales operations/supply chain preferred; master degree is a plus 10+ combined years of experience in sales forecast planning experience preferred 3+ years’ experience in managing people Certification like APICS and/or CSCP or in the Forecasting domain Exposure to SAP S4 Hana (IBP, APO and Sales Forecasting Modules)  with experience using advanced planning systems (SAP APO, IBP etc), experience with data visualization and reporting tools (BI, Power BI etc), with high learning agility Ability to build, discuss, and implement a wide range of topics from business strategy to the tactical execution of the strategy Strong team player who demonstrates strong personal initiative and integrity Understanding of FMCG industry, Fresh produce industry preferred. Excellent analytical and forecasting conceptual skills, with high attention to details Sales forecasting process and systems/tools professional knowledge, understanding of business and commercial operations Ability to identify, summarize, communicate key information required across multiple functions to support business to make sound decisions Key/Super user within the sales forecasting planning area  Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.  In return, Zespri offers competitive remuneration, a great working environment, opportunities to develop and grow, and flexibility. If you would like to be a part of our growing team, and to find our more, hit apply!  Zespri will not accept applications or contact from any temporary staffing agency, placement service or professional recruiter for this vacancy (“Agency”).   Where Zespri requires the support of an agency to fulfil a vacancy, we will proactively seek this support from our network of Agencies. We respectfully ask that you do not contact Zespri or any of it’s affiliates/employees regarding vacancies, and reserve the right not to reply.

description: Position Purpose  The Marketing Strategy Manager will lead development of the Lincoln Marketing Strategy and will drive creation of integrated marketing plan for the fast-growing business. Equally important, this role will serve as the lead interface of multiple function teams (media, digital, social, CRM, Retail, CX) and ensure alignment on strategic directions and deliverables per Launch Process. In addition, this position will serve as the lead interface with sales team to ensure the marketing activities fully supporting business needs. Also the role will be responsible for agency management and coordination of finance governance such as budget planning and requests.  Key Roles And Responsibilities Of Position  Lead development of Lincoln marketing strategy and drive creation of integrated marketing plan. Based on Lincoln Portfolio and business objectives, lead the multi-channel marketing strategy development & implementation for both short-term and long-term. Develop the nameplate communication directions and build the annual nameplate big ideas around the nameplate strategy and coordinate various resources and channels to complete each project. Develop the integrated marketing plan for annual, quarterly and monthly bases. Facilitate the dealer communications of Lincoln marketing strategy and planning. Develop the structural KPI measuring the business performance and ensure alignment on strategic directions and deliverables per Launch Process. Lead interface of multiple function teams (media, digital, social, CRM, Retail, CX) and support developing the structural KPI of each function team. Guide, monitor & review the KPIs to drive better efficiency, meet collective business targets, identify of lessons learned and take timely actions accordingly. Close monitor and collaborate with each function team to ensure the implementation aligned with strategic directions and ensure timely deliverables per Launch Process. Muti-channel marketing related business intelligences generation empowered by data insights for ad-hoc diagnose and suggest on-going optimizations. Lead interface with sales team to ensure the marketing activities fully supporting business needs Support the leads and traffic analysis, working with the sales team to ensure the marketing activities fully supporting the delivery of business targets. Provide ongoing agency management Coordinate function teams in managing global agency such as SOW development and regular Agency Performance Review. Facilitate finance governance Facilitate the Mkt & CX team to develop the business plan and budget. Monthly participation in FM Spending Approval Process. Team Support and Coaching On-going team coaching & development, to enhance the team’s capabilities, and strengthen the core valuable traits like agility, resilience and collaboration as one team. Preferred previous experiences / competencies to prepare for the position A Marketing or Business Degree, MBA or other Masters Level 5-10 years marketing, preferably within Brand or Communications, with proven record of delivering breakthrough marketing - Prior experience in developing Brand management, marketing launch strategy, Consumer Communications would be beneficial. Great communication skills and excellent One Ford Behavior. Dependable, committed and highly responsible to deliver the outcomes Excellent interpersonal, teamwork, motivational and communications skills Key competencies: marketing strategy, consumer insight; brand positioning; managing the marketing mix; data analytics. Broad marketing functional competencies and knowledge is desired High energy, self-starter, with ability and desire to take responsibility and deliver results with minimal supervision is a must. Ability to balance both creative thinking with organization and process Passion for growing the Lincoln brand.

customer financials and business drivers Accountability Business and Financial Impact - Responsible for revenue attainment, margins where appropriate, and personal expenses Relative Size and Scope - Average to high individual quota for business in like roles or strategic growth potential to be there within a year or two Types of Projects - Moderately complex deals with a few large, complex deals Strategic Impact for Zebra - High in near term; medium in mid-term Qualifications Bachelors or equivalent experience; advanced degree preferred 5-8 years of relevant work experience Uses advanced domain/solutions knowledge to competitive advantage Develops and adapts advanced sales strategies to unique customer needs; creates customer partnerships Often leads others in their development; provides input to policies and practices

Areas to growth horizontally and vertically in the account. ·        Manage overall client relationship at CxO level, bringing thought leadership as a trusted advisor. ·        Develop and implement account strategy, in line with Pininfarina initiatives. ·        Meet all account KPIs including growth, profitability and customer satisfaction.  ·        Participate in the development of solutions to drive innovation and profitability. ·        Ensure adherence to company and client-defined standards and commercial procedures. ·        Accurately forecasts & achieve annual, quarterly and monthly revenue streams and monitors the growth. ·        Partner with customers to understand their business needs and effectively communicate the company’s value proposition through relationship, proposals and presentations. ·        Gather information related to market dynamics, competitors positioning and any new developments in the market.  This announcement is aimed at both sexes, regarding laws 903/77 and 125/91 and to people of all ages and cultures related to legislative decrees 215/03 and 216/03. companyName: 百特(中国)投资有限公司
description: 该职位来源于猎聘  This is where you save and sustain lives  At Baxter, we are deeply connected by our mission. No matter your role at Baxter, your work makes a positive impact on people around the world. You'll feel a sense of purpose throughout the organization, as we know our work improves outcomes for millions of patients.  Baxter's products and therapies are found in almost every hospital worldwide, in clinics and in the home. For over 85 years, we have pioneered significant medical innovations that transform healthcare.  Together, we create a place where we are happy, successful and inspire each other. This is where you can do your best work.  Join us at the intersection of saving and sustaining lives—where your purpose accelerates our mission.  关于百特  百特提供多样化的核心肾脏和医院产品线，包括家庭治疗、急重症和中心透析治疗;无菌静脉解决方案;注入系统和设备;肠外营养;手术产品和麻醉学手术;自动化药房，软件和服务。百特在全球的足迹和对产品和服务的关键作用在扩大新兴和发达国家的医疗保健方面发挥了关键作用。百特全球员工基于公司丰富的医学突破的传统上正在促进下一代的员工创新医疗让病人得到照顾。  岗位职责 负责带领团队在指定区域内开展公司产品的学术推广，并达成年度工作目标； 负责在指定区域市场活动和项目的执行，维护公司的品牌形象； 拜访客户，建立并发展良好的合作关系； 充分了解市场动态，并及时向上级汇报、反馈。 任职资质 本科及以上学历，医药相关专业； 6-8年以上医药行业工作经验，其中至少2年同等岗位的管理经验； 熟悉医药行业的工作流程，具备专业的临床推广技能和学术知识； 具备良好的沟通协调、团队管理和辅导能力，良好的市场洞察力和商业敏锐度； 热情、诚实、主动、有冲劲、有责任感。 为何选择百特？  这是一项重要的事业  百特员工以拯救生命，延续生命为使命。我们充满激情，运用科技创新满足全球数以百万计人们的需求，他们依赖于百特医疗设备，技术和医疗必需品延续生命。我们致力于让越来越多的人接触到医疗保健，在重要的未知领域开拓创新，追求创新性的合作，以此来实现我们的使命以及对患者的承诺。  立即申请职位，体验这一充满使命的职业！  在百特每个员工享有均等的机会。员工不会因为种族，肤色，宗教，性别，性取向，国籍任何招聘决策，特有地位保护，残疾或其他受到法律保护的因素受到歧视。百特是一个机会均等的雇主，不会因为种族、肤色、宗教、性别、性取向、性别、国籍、受保护的退伍军人地位、残疾或任何其他受法律保护的情况影响招聘决定。

jobTitle: 数字营销经理Digital sales & business development

jobTitle: Software Sales Account Manager (管理软件客户经理)
description: Exact是总部位于荷兰的管理软件领导厂商。成立于1984年迄今的37年历史。全球2000名员工分布于16个国家，为40多万家客户提供ERP、 协同，BI 等解决方案。 www.exact.com   Exact于98年进入中国, 深耕中国市场。近期Exact 上海公司针对SME企业,招聘管理软件解决方案销售。  工作职责：  您将会有机会在这个职位自我发展并与Exact共同发展，您的工作职责: 目标客户：制造业/专业服务/贸易分销业。 以目标为导向开拓新客户及渠道， 在整个区域内（含部分现有客户）开发新的Exact软件及服务商机并完成销售业绩。 在整个销售周期中，运用Solution Selling及LAMP的管理方法协调内外部资源完成销售并协助提高客户的满意度。 完成从销售商机到销售结束 (WIN/LOSE)的全过程管理  任职资格: 大学本科及同等学历 中英双语交流 3-6 年软件或咨询直销或渠道销售经验 理解企业的财务、运营及IT规划知识 具有C-Level 对象的沟通能力 以结果为导向，积极进取，出色的沟通能力，人际关系和谈判技巧 具有特定的行业与人脉为佳  Your sales team really wants to make a difference. All executives have the ambition to inspire and enable SMBs to grow with Exact. At Exact, you can think and act proactively and see your good ideas come true. And where is your career heading? That’s up to you. The career opportunities are unprecedented. 1,850 enterprising colleagues have already paved the way. Are you on board?  The job This = the job you are looking for In this role, you will get the chance to develop yourself and to grow with us. And that's not all, we can rely on you as a Software Sales Account Manager to be: Goal-oriented new customer hunter to drive revenue from new customer relationships and via few channels. Prospecting for new Exact software license and service business throughout the region. Solution selling mentality that aims to further build up customer reference base. Regularly closed deals in CNY200k to 1 million range. Experience with business software/ERP systems used by medium-sized businesses, focus will be manufacturing industries; professional service; wholesale, and distribution. Assume ownership for revenue generation within assigned accounts, as well as the quality and strength of the executive relationships within them. Pursue and follow up on new leads. Identify and qualify opportunities within their accounts, develop and drive account strategy and executive relationships within each account. General understanding of manufacturing concepts. Providing customer support and maintaining a high level of customer satisfaction. Manages sales funnel from lead to closure:- Cold calling on the assigned customer base. Prepares quotes. Generates sales orders from new or existing customers. Prepares and executes presentations. Negotiates contracts. Initiate the order process. Conducts on-site customer visits. Communicates customer needs and requirements to project manager and internal departments. Prepares and implements sales account plans (incl. activity reports and forecasts). Manage a few install base customers to dig opportunities.  This = your team You will join the Sales team in Exact Shanghai office. Our sales colleagues have an entrepreneurial spirit and a down-to-earth mentality. They put themselves in the customers' shoes and understand their wishes. This helps them to offer the best solutions. Getting to know our customers and building a solid relationship is part of our culture. Asking for help if necessary and offering help if possible is part of their DNA. We have few predefined paths, which gives you plenty of room to choose your own.  This = what you bring With us, you can be yourself, and we would love to discover what sets you apart. For the position of Software Sales Account Manager, it’s helpful if you have a strong sense of hunting for new business and are preferably fluent in Mandarin and English. What’s more, you bring: Bachelor's degree or equivalent level in a related field;  3-6 years outstanding direct and/or channel selling results in software and services within software industries required; Thorough understanding of business solution; Capable and confident in influencing and interacting with people at all level; Be decisive, result-oriented, aggressive, excellent communication, interpersonal and negotiation skills; Self-starter with high level of integrity; Have specified industry focus or network will be a plus   This = what you get  At Exact we work hard and play hard. We believe in the need to balance personal and professional commitments. Our office is located strategically at Shanghai, Jingan District. As a Software Sales Account Manager, you can also count on: All love what we do. Find it really important that you feel at home with us. To achieve world leadership with you. Give your ambition all the room it needs. Organize meaningful training sessions that help you to fulfil your career potential. MNC working environment exposure.  This = Exact Founded in 1984 and now operating in more than 100 countries, we are a leader in the global business and financial software market. What makes us stand out? We combine the energy of a start-up with the advantages of a multinational. Our aim is to create the best business software with the most innovative software solutions. Over 550,000 entrepreneurs and accountants trust our software and use it on a daily basis.  As an employer, we accept our social responsibility. This is important to us and we genuinely believe in it. We think green in everything we do, whether it's by reducing paper consumption, encouraging digital working and minimising travel by plane and car. We also support employees who want to contribute to the local community. Exact celebrates differences and views them as a learning opportunity. We assess ideas based on merit, rather than source. It’s passion, dedication and ownership that earn you a place at the table.   This = why you shouldn’t wait  If you’re feeling good about this position, don't hesitate to reach out to us. If you have any questions about the position and/or the application procedure, Sherney Leong will be happy to answer them via sherney.leong@exact.com, by phone at +603-21794242 (ext 4152)  This= our application procedure Once we review your application, there will be a short phone screening with the recruiter. Followed by a face-to-face interview with the hiring manager in Exact Shanghai office.  Then, a short presentation in English to the hiring manager on next interview.

工作职责:  Job Description Summary  You will be responsible for generating growth for products in digital health through demand creation and funnel acceleration; and supporting future product planning by identifying market trends, products, customer needs and business model. Develops a regional digital product/portfolio strategy including product positioning, market segmentation and targeting and installed base retention.  GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Roles and Responsibilities Accountability for functional, business, and broad company objectives. Integrate and develop processes that meet business needs across the organization, be involved in long-term planning, manage complex issues within functional area of expertise, and contribute to the overall business strategy. Requires specialized knowledge across product lines, markets, sales processes, or customer groups. Requires strong commercial awareness and is expected to influence the development of strategy for their broad sales territory, including control of resources. Interprets simple internal and external business challenges and recommends best practices to improve products, processes, or services. Stays informed of industry trends that may inform work. Uses high level of judgment to make decisions and handle complex tasks or problems within projects, product lines, markets, sales processes, campaigns or customers. Has ability to assess quality of information given and ask pertinent questions to stakeholders or customers. Able to offer new solutions to problems outside of set parameters and is able to construct and provide recommendations. Uses multiple internal and some external sources outside of own function to help arrive at a decision. May lead functional teams or projects with minimal resource requirements, risk, and/or complexity. Communicates difficult concepts and may influence others' options on topics. May guide others to consider a different point of view. 任职条件:  Required Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in medical, Marketing, Business Administration or equivalent technical degree from an accredited university or college. At least 5+ year working experience in digital health platform and product development, or product management, or product marketing in a medical IT company. Strong oral and written language skills of Mandarin and English, and strong communication skills. Knowledge and ability to drive market intelligence analysis and build up program business case. Able to afford 30% work time to travels within China. Preferred Qualifications MBA or master’s degree in medical, Marketing, Business Administration, or equivalent technical degree is preferred. Experience on healthcare imaging or healthcare IT type products is preferred. Experience of working in MNC with global communication is preferred. Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.

Job Purpose Helps the Region BD Leader or Country BD Head deliver superior and market beating commercial performance (New Business Wins / Pipeline growth) and Topline revenue growth through an effective use of all the available marketing tools. This primary purpose applies to all CEVA products, notably within the Air, Ocean, Ground, Contract Logistics and Lead Logistics product portfolio, all customer segments (Century / MNC / LLA and SME), and all local geographies where CEVA operates within the region or the country, in close coordination with the Global Commercial Marketing team and the other marketing teams across regions and countries. This role is also acting as a regional Champion in CEVA BD Cross Sell and synergies team, develop cross-selling activities through commercialization of CEVA Products & Services to CMA CGM clients, and play a critical role to succeed in establishing the commercialization of CEVA range of Products & Services through CMA CGM network.  Responsibilities Ensures that the local BD teams are ready to sell and equipped with all the needed customer facing marketing material, including but not limited to customer facing decks, flyers, email templates, videos, social media posts etc., either through adaptation of GHO produced material or material or through the conception of local tools in collaboration with Communication Department when needed. Ensures that local BD members are properly onboarded and trained and / or have access to all the right resources to be able to position and sell all the CEVA products that they are in charge of. Builds and executes a growth focused annual Marketing Strategy in support of the BD Business Plan. Builds and executes global or local sales campaigns with identification of the relevant targets, definition of the unique selling proposition, creation of the marketing support material, internal launch with the local salesforce, result tracking, reporting and learning in collaboration with Communication Department (notably for digital execution) Analyzes the local commercial performance through dashboards and local analytics leveraging tools like C-View, Qlikview and other available market and CEVA sources. description: Hitachi ABB Power Grids is a pioneering technology leader that is helping to increase access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all. We help to power your home, keep the factories running, and our hospitals and schools open. Come as you are and prepare to get better as you learn from others. Bring your passion, bring your energy, and plug into a team that appreciates a simple truth: Diversity + Collaboration = Great Innovation  For our Marketing, Sales and Product Management team, understanding the full potential of our technology and the trends in our markets is highly rewarding. In addition, helping customers all over the world improve efficiency, save resources and reduce emissions gives our work a powerful sense of purpose. You will adapt and implement sales support strategy for designated area in accordance with the global support strategy. Ensure technical and commercial support for internal and external customers. Oversee estimations and bids and proposals ensuring alignment with Hitachi ABB Power Grids standards and targets. Proactively lead, develop, and coach the Sales Support team.  Your Responsibilities Create, implement, and review local sales support strategy. Define key targets and ensures these are achieved for the factory, such as but not limit to, OR/Rev., profit, AR etc. etc. Oversee the preparation of proposals through internal and external resources. Ensure all proposals follow relevant Hitachi ABB Power Grids procedures and guidelines as well as legal requirements. Ensure most competitive offers taking into account the market situation and customer’s conditions. Identify which approach (e.g. direct sales, consortium, or channel) can be applied to better serve the customer. Oversee the validation of terms and conditions (commercial, technical, legal, pricing) in each offer. Assign and allocate internal and external resources for technical and commercial support and proposal preparation. Support bid/no bid analyses and decisions. Participate in project risk review processes. Ensure support to the Sales organizations during the technical meetings, product presentations and negotiations with customers and provides technical support and clarification as needed. Ensure (with HR Manager support) that the area of responsibility is properly organized, staffed, skilled and directed. Coach, motivate and develop direct and indirect subordinates within HR policies. Drive and ensure know-how sharing and cross-collaboration. Living core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.  Your background Engineering Degree and Marketing degree / MBA is preferred Exceptional communication and negotiating skills, customer-focused mindset and a professional, “can-do” attitude. More than 10 years of experience in Sales and Marketing function. Mechanical or Electrical Engineering Experience. Strong communication skill to different stakeholders. Excellent learning ability and good management skill. Ability to communicate fluently and effectively in both English and Mandarin. Result-orientated and very responsible.  More About Us  Hitachi ABB Power Grids is a global technology leader with a combined heritage of almost 250 years, employing around 36,000 people in 90 countries. Headquartered in Switzerland, the business serves utility, industry and infrastructure customers across the value chain, and emerging areas like sustainable mobility, smart cities, energy storage and data centres. With a proven track record, global footprint and unparalleled installed base, Hitachi ABB Power Grids balances social, environmental and economic values, and is committed to powering good for a sustainable energy future, with pioneering and digital technologies, as the partner of choice for enabling a stronger, smarter and greener grid. www.hitachiabb-powergrids.com  High Voltage Products

description: During the current global health crisis, the priority for Siemens Digital Industries Software is the health and well-being of our entire community including current and future employees, which may add time to our hiring processes. We appreciate your patience and invite you to visit our website to learn more about how Siemens is responding to the pandemic.  Siemens EDA, formerly Mentor Graphics, is a part of Siemens Digital Industries, is a global technology leader in electronic design automation software. Our software tools enable companies around the world to achieve their design goals developing new and highly innovative electronic products faster and more cost-effectively. Our customers are world leaders, creating sophisticated electronic systems impacting major industries from automotive to consumer electronics incorporating cutting edge technologies spanning cloud computing, machine learning, AI and beyond.  Position Overview  As a member of Siemens EDA Technology Solution Sales (TSS), you are responsible for working with leading edge customers defining methodologies to solve their hardest problems verifying the correct function of their latest ICs. You will own development and execution of the strategy to achieve business targets and strategic objectives for hardware-assisted functional verification products (hardware prototyping and emulation) within a territory comprised of assigned accounts in China.  The ATM drives the relative priorities of all assigned Product Line opportunities in the territory and provides a clear direction for resource allocation to the field technical resource management and business unit. You are responsible for maintaining up-to-date data for tracking customer engagements including sales stage, progress against plan, action items, risks and prioritization.  As part of this role, the ATM is responsible for defining and owning the technical opportunity plans and campaigns necessary to achieve the initial win, and to then proliferate the technology to additional teams.  Responsibilities include:  Develop the customer-facing product strategy, in partnership with field technical management, to achieve business targets and strategic objectives through the construction of top-down and bottom-up plans account by account within a territory.  Define technical account engagement plans and campaigns necessary to achieve results.  Lead and manage the account campaigns.  Ensure understanding of all elements of any technical campaign - decision process, success criteria, committed usage upon success, run rate impact, AE resources required and, of course, how best to solve the customer’s problem.  Establish regular meetings with specific customer management to support successful campaigns.  Align with account team on business opportunities and build up the engagement tracking mechanism to ensure ability to summarize data and communicate progress vs plan across multiple accounts effectively.  Define, track and report the priorities for all engagements at every stage and communicate closely with technical management helping to prioritize engagements and short vs. long-term objectives.  Build strong customer relationships to enable establishment of strategic relationships for Mentor in product / technology.  Serve as the key field resource to summarize competitive threats and opportunities.  Job Qualifications  The successful candidate will possess the following combination of education and experience:  BS EE degree or equivalent  10 years of related and relevant experience in various aspects of hardware-assisted functional verification  This position, under normal circumstances, may require up to 50% travel. Currently, Siemens travel is restricted in some regions and subject to change upon company policy.  Working knowledge of business financials, metrics, and language  Organizational knowledge including formal and informal structures  Product, market, and industry knowledge in emulation and verification technology  Negotiating skills  Prospecting/uncovering skills  Demand creation  Demonstrated ability to create and maintain technical campaigns  Set appropriate expectations and decision criteria  Bring technical campaigns to successful closure  Positive relationship with account management  Positive relationships with field technical organization  Positive relationships with business unit R&D and Marketing  Professional customer presence  Technical knowledge  Ability to manage indirectly  Organization: Digital Industries  Company: Mentor Graphics (Shanghai) Electronic Technology Co., Ltd.  Experience Level: Experienced Professional  Job Type: Full-time

Ormco, headquartered in Brea, CA, is a global leader and innovator of orthodontic products and solutions designed to enhance the lives of our customers and their patients. For nearly 60 years, Ormco has partnered with the global orthodontic community to help create over 20 million smiles in over 130 countries. Our distinguished products range from twin brackets (Symetri Clear, Titanium Orthos and Mini Diamond) to pioneering the self-ligating appliances with the Damon System (including Damon Q2 and Damon Clear 2). Our latest Spark Clear Aligner System is designed to meet the needs of the orthodontist with the TruGEN material and 3D Approver software, making a more comfortable and aesthetically pleasing aligner experience for patients. From personalized service to professional education programs and marketing support, Ormco is committed to helping orthodontists achieve their clinical and practice management objectives. For more information about Ormco, visit www.ormco.com  Job Description  Maximizes revenues from sales of the organization's products and/or services through a base of reseller partners in specific assigned channels and/or vertical markets.  Job Requirements  8y+  Operating Company  Ormco  Envista and its family of companies (Envista) will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Envista will consider unsolicited referrals and/or resumes submitted by vendors such as search firms, staffing agencies, professional recruiters, fee-based referral services and recruiting agencies (Agency) to have been referred by the Agency free of charge and Envista will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt such unsolicited resumes. An Agency must obtain advance written approval from Envista's internal Talent Acquisition or Human Resources team to submit resumes, and then only in conjunction with a valid fully-executed contract approved by the Global Talent Acquisition leader and in response to a specific job opening. Envista will not pay a fee to any Agency that does not have such agreement and written approval in place.  About Us  Envista is a global family of more than 30 trusted dental brands, united by a shared purpose: to partner with professionals to improve lives. Envista helps its customers deliver the best possible patient care through industry-leading dental consumables, solutions, technology, and services. Our comprehensive portfolio, including dental implants and treatment options, orthodontics, and digital imaging technologies, covers an estimated 90% of dentists' clinical needs for diagnosing, treating, and preventing dental conditions as well as improving the aesthetics of the human smile. Envista companies, including KaVo, Kerr, Nobel Biocare, Implant Direct and Ormco, partner with dental professionals to help them deliver the best possible patient care.  Envista separated from Danaher as an independent company in 2019. We brought with us the proven Envista Business System (EBS) methodology, an experienced leadership team, and a strong culture grounded in continuous improvement, commitment to innovation, and deep customer focus to meet the end-to-end needs of dental professionals worldwide. Envista is now one of the largest global dental products companies, with significant market positions in some of the most attractive segments of the dental products industry. For more information, please visit www.envistaco.com .  By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

(NYSE: ARW), an award-winning Fortune 102 and one of Fortune Magazine’s Most Admired Companies. 该职位来源于猎聘  Job Summary  The Regional Sales Manager will be responsible for promoting and increasing the sales revenues of DICKEY-john products in given geography i.e. Asia Pacific. These revenues are comprised primarily of a distribution sales channel that requires active management and direct OEM business. Specifically, existing Channel Partners (CPs) will require review and development on an ongoing basis. The RSM will identify and replace failing CPs with better performing CPs who will require technical and sales training which the RSM will coordinate and deliver. OEMs will require technical sales and support from the RSM. The RSM will report to the Director of Global Sales. The job requires up to 50% travel within defined territory.  Job Responsibilities Develop and implement tactical sales plans to achieve sales volumes with the assigned accounts consistent with annual business goals. This includes using gap analysis tools e.g. non-performance / geographical territory void. Manage, train, and motivate CPs for sales growth and increase in market penetration. This includes conducting joint sales calls with CPs on a regular basis. Identify, cultivate, and grow direct OEM business accounts given current product portfolio. Provide on-going, quantitative evaluations of CP added value to DICKEY-john Sales and Service Operations. Analyze market drivers, technology developments, intellectual property landscape, regulatory drivers, and competitor posturing of assigned product line segments. Recommend new product development opportunities based on findings. When required contribute to the creation of all field materials including brochures, data sheets, and other marketing collateral. Gain understanding of customer and potential customer business and technical requirements and help conceptualize and communicate to other business and product managers. Work with the customer base to provide DICKEY-john with demand visibility to be incorporated into DICKEY-john’s forecast and production planning and provide routine account updates including but not limited to account scorecards, DAP planners, etc. Travel extensively to support sales activities by visiting customers and potential business partners, training, new product launches, and VOC efforts. Complete other assignments and special projects as requested. Supervisory Responsibilities  None  Job Requirements Education Required  Bachelor’s degree in agriculture, engineering, or business.  Desired  Master’s degree in agriculture or related technical field. Experience Required   Minimum of 3-5 years selling to different types of end users and different markets, for example, Precision Agriculture, Electronics, Instrumentation.   2-3 years Channel Partner, Distributor management experience.   Defining, planning, executing, and evaluating successful channel partner review and motivation.  Desired  Agriculture methods, practices, trends.  Agricultural trade associations, groups. Core Competencies: Demonstrates competency in basic selling skills. Self-motivated and directed. Evidence of positive sales track record. Effective in territory planning and time management. Transactional selling skills including the ability to identify end user key user requirements to validate Channel Partner feedback. Working knowledge of customer relationship management (CRM) software for managing accounts/contacts, activities, and sales opportunities. Proven ability to excel in a cross-functional team environment. Demonstrated ability to execute on multiple projects and excel in a results-oriented work environment. Highly skilled in making presentations to audiences of different participants and size (potential channel partners, OEMs, sales staff, technical staff and non-technical professionals). Is knowledgeable of the global climate in the agricultural industry; is aware of global trends in technology and understands the global market; deals effectively with global partners and is aware of multicultural issues.

To succeed in this role, we will need you to have:  • More than 3 years working experience, sales support, data analysis, project management experience is preferred • Proficient in Excel, PPT and other office software • SAP, Salesforce system application experience is preferred • Owned attitude, able to deal with problems actively and quickly • Proactive, patient and meticulous, strong sense of responsibility • Strong communication and coordination skills, logical thinking ability and ability to work under pressure, experience in connecting with sales team is preferred  Good learning ability • Good at multi-tasking • Strong data processing and analytical skills • Good command of English, able to communicate with group project colleagues in English

Do you want to help create the future of healthcare? Our name, Siemens Healthineers, was selected to honor our people who dedicate their energy and passion to this cause. It reflects their pioneering spirit combined with our long history of engineering in the ever-evolving healthcare industry.  We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment with opportunities to go beyond your comfort zone to grow personally and professionally. Sound interesting?  Then come and join our global Siemens Healthineers Treasury team as Treasury Advisory Manager to develop, implement, and manage Front Office Core Treasury activities.  Your tasks and responsibilities:  Responsibility under a functional matrix set-up for Front Office Core Treasury (Cash Management, Funding and FX Management) for designated countries in the Siemens Healthineers Asia Pacific region. Acting as a first point of contact for the countries to provide guidance on Cash Management topics and strategies (including Bank Account advisory), as well as on how to deal with cash transactions and treasury banking instructions. Directing the countries on liquidity forecasting and reporting, and analysing such forecasts to identify potential money market needs (funding and/or deposit placement). For money market needs, in alignment with Siemens Healthineers central Treasury, propose and coordinate internal/ external financing or oversee placement and management of deposits. Guiding the countries on the collection, monitoring, and reporting of FX exposure. Responsibility for the development of FX hedging strategies for special projects / topics. In coordination with Siemens Healthineers central Treasury, develop and maintain relationships with local banks and have a close interaction with the banking partners in the region. Ensure financial risk management on Core Treasury activities (FX, interest income/expense) and ensure that such activities are done in compliance with Siemens Healthineers Corporate and Treasury policies as well as local regulations (including Central Bank Regulations).  Your qualifications and experience:  Completed a university degree ideally in business administration (with specialization in treasury, economics, accounting, or finance). 10+ years of professional experience: gained in an international environment within either a Corporate Treasury department of a MNC or an international Bank; and performing and managing activities under a Front Office Core Treasury product line (either Cash Management, Funding, or FX Management) with a solid understanding of remaining product lines, and experience/ ability to negotiate and implement Credit and/ or FX Facilities; and ideally focused on regulated territories such as Korea, ASEAN etc. with a solid understanding of Central Bank requirements relating to those territories.  Your attributes and skills:  Well organized and have outstanding communication, negotiation, and consulting skills in liaising at all management levels internationally with internal partners (such as Siemens Healthineers central Treasury and Treasury Back Office, Finance, Accounting and Legal) as well as external partners (such as Banks). Working style is characterized by a high degree of independence, and you demonstrate strong result orientation combined with a proactive personality. Strong analytical skills with structured thinking capabilities. Ability to excel in a fast paced, highly analytical environment where multi-tasking and short timelines are met with consistent ability to achieve financial accuracy. Familiarity and experience in using Treasury Management Systems (ideally ITS) and treasury trading tools (e.g. Bloomberg or Reuters). Business fluency in English (both verbal and written), other regional languages such as Korean and Bahasa are an advantage.  Organization: Siemens Healthineers  Company: Siemens Healthineers Ltd.  Experience Level: Experienced Professional  Job Type: Full-time
