At a Glance:  We are looking for a full time Head of Operations APAC, to join the On team in Shanghai. This role is for someone who has a regional and global mindset, is passionate about everything that is physically hap- pening in between the factories, suppliers, stores and consumers, and strives not only to be in-time, but also to think out of the box to lead the industry standard of excellence and to continuously deliver best- in-class customer experience. His / her team will be a key part of both the APAC business (currently comprised of a growing set of markets, including China, Japan and Oceania) and the global supply chain organization at On. They will work in close collaboration with supply and demand planning, customer service, customer experience, IT, marketing, sales and DtC teams across APAC.  Your Team:  We work closely as a team on both APAC and global ends to convert innovative product designs and prototypes into commercialised products, and bring them into the hands of customers. We are focused and data-driven, but are also action-oriented and able to multi-task, we are also continuously challenging the status quo and "industry standard".  Your Mission: Set up and lead the Go-to-Market framework for Asia-Pacific, including monitoring of invento- ry balances, monitoring and setting intro dates across channels together with Sales and Mar- keting teams and making channel prioritization and soft allocation decisions in collaboration with Sales and DtC teams Set targets for and continuously monitor On’s order book, incl. key account growth targets and long range plans, seasonal sell-in targets and forecasts, in close collaboration with local sales teams Leading a team of happiness delivery specialists in the region, ensure that On delivers a Wow experience to DtC and B2B customers across Asia-Pacific Set strategy for product flows in the region, including warehouse solutions and product deliv- eries for offline and online business across direct and distributor markets, Take a lead role in regional system implementation and customization (in particular for China), working closely with a team of regional IT project managers and specialists Own and monitor KPIs with 3PLs, establish/apply SOPs across service providers and manage relationships to ensure highest service level and smooth operations Collaborate with planning and procurement teams to ensure on-time delivery of all merchan- dise and non-merchandise products Lead continuous improvement in freight, warehousing and distribution processes, identify are- as to achieve better cost efficiency while improving quality and performance Closely track, analyze and report costs on freight, customs, warehousing and distribution and take fact-based decisions on how to operate our cross-recgional business in the most profitable way Lead all ad-hoc / strategic logistics related projects, such as global logistics network design Your Story: Strong people leadership skills, enthusiast team playerPassionate about working in a fast paced environment Excellent planning, project management, analysis and coordination skillsDetail oriented, data driven, with a good understanding of what matters in delivering great customer experience and ease of doing businessAbility to take initiatives, multi-task and prioritize, to think and react in a high-energy and fast-paced environment Min 5 - max 8 years' of relevant business experience with team leading experience, preferably in an international logistics environment; experiences in Ecommerce/DTC (direct-to- consumer) businesses strongly preferred Proficiency in English Proficiency with Excel and Powerpoint What we offer:  We offer a dynamic, challenging and sportive environment that has been ranked as the ‘fastest growing sports company’ of its time. With offices across the globe, we are an international team who is hungry to innovate and build something incredible. We foster an active environment where each individual thrives for excellence and can achieve their full potential. This is where your work matters, you’re hands-on and your team members are amongst the very best in their respective disciplines and fields. If you are driven to bring On to the next level, curious about the opportunity and want to be part of our growing team send us your application, and join the ONiverse!

jobTitle: Regional Sales Director China - Meat Processing
description: To drive sustainable growth and increase our market share in China year on year, while meeting our customers’ requirements. We are seeking an energetic and dedicated:  Regional Sales Director for the Marel Meat Processing Industry.  Leading a team of Account Managers and Industry Sales Managers in China, you are responsible for the commercial activities and reaching your targets.  Working closely with internal and external stakeholders, you will drive customer visits, creating and qualifying sales opportunities, determining customer needs and developing and selling matching propositions.  Why work for us? Join a global leader in the field Surround yourself with experts International company with opportunities for travel  What you’ll be doing Key elements of your role include: Create and maintain sales strategy and operational plan for the poultry industry in China. Ensure compliance with internal processes and quality standards in collaboration with the Industry Sales Director and other stakeholders. Drive and deliver opportunity management through your team, and input for progress reporting and monthly S&OP-process. Build, manage, motivate, train and coach your team and facilitate them to reach their individual commercial targets. You will also be doing operational sales activities for (key) Accounts in your region as well as being involved in operational sales of key opportunities.  What we’re looking for Ideally, you have a Bachelor degree within a technical area, combined with minimum 8 years of capital goods sales experience. Ambition to develop yourself further as a Sales Director in a 1st class market leading company. You know how to develop a team that reaches commercial targets. Strong people management and stakeholder management skills. You are willing to relocate to Bejing within 12 months from the date of hiring.  Commitment to Global Safety As a Marel employee you are expected to respect internal rules and actively contribute to the delivery of the corporate Safety policy and guidance to ensure Marel is a safe place to work.  Marel Vision and Values In partnership with our customers we are transforming the way food is processed. Our vision is of a world where quality food is produced sustainably and affordably. Marel’s core values are: Unity, Innovation and Excellence.  If you’re looking to join an international company with a great culture, flexible working arrangements, career growth and development opportunities then click 'apply' and include a resume!  For more information on the position, you can contact our Corporate Recruiter Meat, Elaine Zhou on email: elaine.zhou@marel.com  Marel does not accept unsolicited applications from third party recruiting agencies.

Business Development  The ambition is to double the size of the practice in revenue and headcount over the next 2-3 years. With that in mind, as well as ensuring that the practice is well structured and profitable, this individual will need to have a strong focus on Order Book and Revenue Growth .  • Customer relationship management up to CxO level across the region for key clients.  • Work closely with the SAP Alliance team to build Atos’ brand as a partner and ensure this becomes a viable and productive route to market and business development channel.  • Work to improve Atos’ local brand regarding SAP and build a reputation as an innovative market leader.   • Continuously extract and understand customer intelligence from portfolio Client Managers in order to drive growth and innovation. • Drive growth trajectory for SAP practice in region by proactively pushing and ensuring cross-selling, upselling and fertilization on accounts across the region. Drive continuous expansion of Atos services in existing accounts to prevent erosion of profit over time. • Ensure additional client demands are translated into agreed service enhancements: identify, pursue and on occasions personally close strategically importantly contract opportunities in the region. • Initiate, monitor and manage renewal of existing contracts in coordination with Market Sales.  • Support the planning and development of key accounts across the region in coordination with Sales.  • Ensure Atos is well placed to win large, complex work with enterprise clients as well as maintaining the current footprint with the mid-market.  • Maintain Atos’ market share in their chosen sectors  Delivery  • Work closely with the Head of Operations for Vertical and Practice to ensure contracts and services are delivered as designed and remain adapted to customer business. Ensure customer satisfaction and act as point of escalation when required.  • Shape and provide the Atos vision on how to address customer needs for the region. • Oversee client management and service delivery teams in the region across many different cultures and client requirements.  • Drive transition towards increased offshore delivery model within the BU, including negotiations with works councils; ensure quality and regulatory standards compliance are met within the unit.  Finance • Accountable for achieving maximum profitability within scope (as set in the last approved P&L). • Oversee and manage investment and purchase requests, including preparation of business cases. • Support finance processes for the unit portfolio across forecasting/planning, backlog management, P&L analysis (after months’ end closing), escalations in case of major invoice issues, cash collection, and budget preparation.   Required Profile  Experience/Knowledge • General Management of a large SAP organization in a matrix environment, including responsibility for substantial revenue, budgets and FTEs.   • Innovation oriented regarding SAP, with demonstrated track record of working on S4/HANA and Cloud transformations, across the full core ERP suite. Able to credibly build and explain business cases for this type of work to C Level client stakeholders across business and IT.  • Experience with integration of core SAP modules into other areas (e.g. C4, Ariba, Azure etc.) would be desirable.  • Expertise in service delivery, costing, escalation and crisis management within a complex and multifaceted delivery organization. • Commercial acumen around effectively managing a sales pipelines, including knowledge of how best to channel time and resource, how to direct Client Managers and support them in growing existing accounts, and how to bring in new logo accounts.    • Strong personal networks in the enterprise space; a hands on leader who can be a difference maker in the room with C level client stakeholders.  • Significant exposure to working in an international environment, with understanding of cultural sensitivities across multiple geographies. This should include strong experience with offshore models.  • Strong technical judgment with technical experience in the past - comfortable getting into the details when necessary. • Experience of working in a highly diverse/dynamic environment and strong persuasion towards transformation. • Well known, SAP expert in the French market who can act as a “lighthouse” to further Atos’ position and standing in this area as well as create significant thought leadership through participation in events and conferences etc.  Key Competencies  • Business Management: Understands Financial Forecasting and Resource Requirements Planning. • Results: Creates and Executes on Strategy.  • Program Management: Delivers Major Transformation.  • Energy: Committed with Outstanding Work-Ethic.   • Customer Relationship Management: Maintains Customer Satisfaction. • Leadership: Motivates, Executes, and Achieves Results. • People Management: Defines and Communicate Responsibilities. • Talent Development: Continuously Improves Quality of People. • Commercially Minded: Financially Sound and Influences Key Stakeholders.  • International Outlook: Sensitive to Different Cultures and Modes of Operation.      • Keeping overall objectives and strategies in mind and not being deflected by matters of detail. • Willingness to travel.  • Articulate and able to present at board level.  • Leadership and directing others to undertake tasks. • Influencing and persuading others to take a specific course of action when is not direct line of command or control. • Keeping commercial aspects continually in mind when taking actions or making decisions • Passion for customers. • Local Language is an advantage and English is a must

description: Sales Manager  As the Sales Manager, you will be responsible for establishing and leading commercial programs and commercial operations including sales operations, commercial partnerships, channel sales, and other business functions to set a foundation for growth and develop our commercial programs, sales partnerships and business capabilities in Japan. You will report to the Business Development Director or Senior Business Development Manager.  What You’ll Do Identify and lead channel sales partnerships and business development initiatives to fuel our growth. Establish and implement systems methods and processes to build scalable commercial capabilities. Provide insightful market intel and data analysis. Partner cross functionally with sales, marketing and pricing to define and refine our go-to-market strategy. Take a high energy and entrepreneurial approach to the role. Working collaboratively with the rest of the Asia team and global functions to drive strategic priorities and get things done. Set up certain business operations functions to support Japan, APEC and South China commercial activity. Operate with a high level of integrity and compliance to global regulatory requirements. Foster a culture of empowerment, inclusiveness, and agility to accelerate things that work and pivot away from things that don’t. Be both local and global, you balance global and local practices to deliver maximum value to our customers, carriers and regulators. What You’ll Need 5 - 8 years of experience in commercial and analytics heavy functions. You’re not afraid to get your hands dirty and will thrive in unstructured and multi-stakeholder settings to deliver results. Proven relationship management, and project/program/process management skills. Ability to deliver on a broad portfolio of responsibilities on your own, and ‘figure stuff out’ quickly and effectively. Great with numbers including strong analytical skills. A strong grasp of real world supply chain concepts including direct knowledge of how industrial and product supply chains work. Knowledge in Japan, APEC and China regions logistics, freight forwarding. A knowledge of e-commerce markets is a plus. Highly effective communicator with good people instincts - able to build trust and work well with a diverse group internally and externally. Eager for a very hands-on role, where you’ll be asked to take on and run with a range of projects outside your comfort zone, and learn quickly. Highly organized, self-motivated and detail-oriented, with great follow-through on projects/tasks big and small. High integrity individual who’s enthusiastic about building a great company for the long term, and making a huge, positive impact in the world. Bachelor's Degree. Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills. Strong command of English, Chinese and Japanese. Courage to challenge the status quo when logic and reason require it. jobTitle: Sales Manager, Chinese Enterprise(Stationed in Shenzhen, China）
description: Key Responsibilities: To achieve sales & revenue targets by identifying and securing business opportunities from prospective customers To identify and develop new business opportunities, develop a portfolio of key customers in Chinese Clients  To formulate a Sales & Marketing Strategy and assist department head to deploy an effective marketing events to our targeted customers To establish, develop and maintain effective business relationships with nominated accounts and develop long term partnership with them To strengthen customer confidence into loyalty  To review & analysis the market situation and report to senior management periodically  Requirements: Minimum 4 years sales experience in IT & Telecom industry with proven sales track record, preferably with global Chinese carrier or IT company working experience Sound knowledge in selling telecom products and ICT Solutions Experience in China Market or Mainland China Background is a plus Excellent interpersonal, organization, negotiation and presentation skills Positive mindset, result-oriented, high level of initiative and integrity Good command of both spoken and written English and Chinese Occasionally travel is needed  Personal data collected would be used for recruitment purpose only.

The purpose of this position is to be in charge of implementing retail strategy, managing boutique staff and daily operation, building customer relationships and generating the majority of the company’s revenue. He/She plays a critical role in the organization as the Brand’s ultimate services and sales leader.  Key Responsibilites Implements retail strategy and generates the majority of the company’s revenue Develops the turnover of the Boutique and meets the sales targets set by the Retail Department. Assists the Retail Manager/Director with the development of the Boutique action plans, which will include assessing the relevant market indicators and planning short-, medium-, and longterm campaigns. Manages the Boutique staff Assesses and articulates recruitment needs. Conducts manpower planning, tasks assignment, individual sales target setting, coach the Boutique staff on-the-job, performance evaluation and appraisal rating. Manages sales associates’ appearance, behaviour, attitude and professionalism, to ensure the set individual targets are met. Understands staffs’ strength and potential to help them realize a higher level performance and development. Motivates staff through feedback and any other sales reward actions. Manages the Boutique operation Supervises the safety and security of Boutique customers, staff and products in line with brand procedures, keeps in mind that the safety of people comes before that of goods, and resolves urgent security cases. Manages and maintains stock and products properly, accurately and efficiently. Oversees the money operation at the Boutique, including cash register consolidation, general Boutique expenses management, banking and petty cash management. Delivers product news and company policy to Boutique staffs and ensures the understanding level. Ensures the timely and accurate Boutique Diary, Daily Sales reporting and Monthly sales report. Manages visual merchandising, new catalogues renew, NSI system maintenance, CDB management and Boutique facilities maintenance. Builds and manages customer relationships Maintains the Boutique’s external relationship with business partners such as shopping malls, restaurants, hotels, and journalists, and local dignitaries. Negotiates and reports the conflict if there is. Maintains VIP relationship and cooperates with brand on VIP activities. Develops client and prospect locally for new clients. Experience  KNOWLEDGE AND PROFESSIONAL SKILLS:  Extensive experience in retail luxury or hotel industry First management experience required  Hard Skills  Results-oriented leadership Strong sales and negotiating skills Excellent communication skills, both written and oral Attention to detail, with the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously Strong emphasis on organisation Computer-literate  Soft Skills  Passion for service Positive attitude (dynamism, optimism, enthusiasm) Entrepreneurial thinking Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to cultivate good relations with staff and consumers Charisma Diplomacy Excellent presentation  Education  Degree in Management/Business is preferred Good general knowledge Understanding of the local market Strong local network already developed English skills are solid and excellent.

Job Description  Danfoss is looking for an energy-efficiency minded Key Account Manager to develop and manage our sales. The preferred candidate will have a proven track record of supporting customer accounts at the corporate level as a true partner to our customers.  Job Responsibilities  Responsibilities for this position include, but are not limited to, the following. Sales growth for the HVACR product portfolio within the assigned region of account manager territories. Develop an understanding of account needs within the region, key decision makers, applications, products/product development plans and competitive situation. Provide input for the demand plan and rolling forecast. Lead customer visits and maintain/cultivate senior level customer relationships. Maintenance of a high-quality opportunity pipeline (MYP, NWT?). Ensure alignment and provide support to Global Key Account Managers on regional activities. Direct sales responsibility for select strategic accounts. Background & Skills  The ideal candidate possesses these skills. To be considered for this position, you must have at least a bachelor’s degree in business; engineering preferred and have outstanding communication and business acumen. Sales experience stemming from a technical background. Understanding of the Food Retail, Energy Management and HVACR industries. Collaborate with others in a matrix organization. Danfoss – Engineering Tomorrow  At Danfoss, we are engineering solutions that allow the world to use resources in smarter ways – driving the sustainable transformation of tomorrow. No transformation has ever been started without a group of passionate, dedicated and empowered people. We believe that innovation and great results are driven by the right mix of people with diverse backgrounds, personalities, skills, and perspectives, reflecting the world in which we do business. To make sure the mix of people works, we strive to create an inclusive work environment where people of all backgrounds are treated equally, respected, and valued for who they are. It is a strong priority within Danfoss to improve the health, working environment and safety of our employees.  Following our founder’s mindset ‘action speaks louder than words’, we set ourselves ambitious targets to protect the environment by embarking on a plan to become CO2 neutral latest by 2030.  Danfoss is an EO employer and VEVRAA Federal Contractor. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or other protected category.

description: Job Overview  Are you ready to redefine what’s possible, and discover your extraordinary potential at Labcorp?  A career here provides the unique chance to create a lasting impact and difference in our patient’s lives. Joining our team will offer you a rewarding career, an opportunity to work in a high-energy & collaborative workplace. Your work will be meaningful, the patient outcomes are real, and the results are lasting. With the support of exceptional people from across the globe and an energized purpose, you’ll be empowered to own your career journey with mentoring, training and personalized development planning.  Our mission is to help our clients bring the miracles of medicine to market sooner -- join us for your next career move.  Our Sr Regional Sales Manager Works closely with Senior/Executive Directors of Sales and/or Vice President of Sales on client selection strategy, Inside Sales Manager (ISM) assignment, and account development plans. Manages, trains and provides leadership to a team of <10 people (coaching, mentoring, guiding, challenging, problem solving etc) to assigned ISMs. Hires and develops diverse talent for open positions. Assigns accounts, territories and forecasts individual territory sales goals. Delivers lead generation and awards goals. Partners with Marketing colleagues on lead generation and awareness campaigns. Partners with Fiels Sales Leaders to heighten client communication and maintain efficient processes between Inside Sales and Field Sales. Stays current and coaches team on Social Selling, Social listening and partners with eMarketing / Marketing Demand Management in leveraging latest methods of client contact and engagement. Assists sales team in developing internal and external relationships and identifying new market opportunities. Manages team performance and feedback providing guidance on development opportunities and action plans. Monitors and controls team operating expenses. Leads scheduled networking events and team meetings. Functions as an advisor to Inside Sales Managers, troubleshooting and resolving internal and external issues. Facilitates strong internal relationships and communication with operational colleagues. Identifies and executes process improvement opportunities. Utilizes SFDC to manage team pipeline, forecast and analyze key sales metrics. Develops ISM coaching/action plans as needed. Gathers and shares market intelligence and competitive information with sales team, Sales Directors and marketing. Assists with annual sales meeting planning. Provides sales reports/updates to Senior Management. Discover your potential in a company that truly invests in you. Talk to us to learn more and explore your career. Apply online today.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.  Education/Qualifications Bachelors degree in life science or business field preferred; advanced degree preferred Experience typically 7+ years sales (or relevant) experience selling services directly to the pharmaceutical and biotech section with direct interaction with mid-level and executive level decision makers Demonstrated client retention skills Ability to manage difficult client and/or financial situations Ability to differentiate Covance from competitors Experience developing and executing strategic business plans Ability to manage and motivate inside sales staff Demonstrated leadership experience in leading and presenting to executives and senior levels of the client organization Extensive global collaboration experience Highly consultative Strong customer orientation Excellent negotiation skills and demonstrated ability to influence sales decisions Demonstrated ability to lead Experience managing people 2021-65049  Covance is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer:  As an EOE/AA employer, the organization will not discriminate in its employment practices due to an applicant's race, age, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

jobTitle: 大客户销售经理/主管（预混料业务）Key account sales manager (Premix business)
description: 大客户销售经理/主管（预混料业务）Key account sales manager (Premix business) 汇报对象: 预混料大客户业务线总经理  Responsibilities/岗位职责 拓展维生素和矿物质预混料的业务范围，为饲料生产商和大型农场合作社提供产品定制服务(一条龙的客户)。 潜在客户拜访、产品推广、商业谈判和客户关系管理。 协调当地和全球技术部门，为客户提供技术支持。 The position willbe in charge to develop our business of vitamin and mineral premix range, designed for compound feed manufacturers and large farming operations. The position will handle prospect door opening, product promotion, business negotiation and customer relation management. In coordination with the local and global technical department, you will facilitate technical assistance to your customers.  Job Requirements候选人资格 拥有动物科学工程、兽医学或应用生物学相关领域本科及以上学位的中国公民。 良好的英语和普通话交流。熟悉中西方的工作环境。 具备丰富的国内动物营养行业相关经验，尤其是预混料或饲料添加剂市场 候选人应该具有一定程度的大客户资源， 此岗位主要面向猪和鸡板块。 工作地点不限，负责区域（广东、江苏、江西、贵州、云南，至少一个省区）， 同时欢迎优秀的在校生，应届生，往届生投递简历 Chinese citizen with a Master degree in Agriculture / Animal Sciences Engineering, Veterinary sciences or Applied Biology. Excellent communication in English and Mandarin. You are familiar to both Chinese and western working environments. Have rich experience of animal nutrition industry ,especially in Premix or feed additive market You should have a first relevant experience in animal nutrition business in China, preferably in Pig and chicken markets. Location is not limited ,mainly area is southeast including Guangdong, Jiangsu and Jiangxi, Guizhou and Yunnan  请您将简历直接发送给 xingyu.liu@adm.com

该职位来源于猎聘  Today Lonza is a global leader in life sciences. We are more than 15,000 employees in more than 100 locations around the world. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.  Capsugel - now a Lonza company - designs, develops and manufactures a wide range of innovative dosage forms for the biopharmaceutical and consumer health & nutrition industries. We partner with more than 4,000 customers in over 100 countries to create novel, high-quality and customized solutions that align with our customers’ evolving needs and benefit patients and consumers.  Key Responsibilities  Develops new sales opportunities  Introduces new products  Ensures payments by customers  Ensures total customer satisfaction  Ensures adequate branding for the territory  Develops long term relationship with customers  Negotiates contracts  Applies Capsugel policies  Uses Capsugel sales tools  Monitors competition  Coordinates customer visits/ audits  Involves internal departments when required  Participates to the organization of customer events/ seminars  Responsible for maintaining sound EHS working conditions, practices in your assigned job or area and ensure continuous compliance to Capsugel EHS Standards and local law requirements.  Key Requirements  Experience in sales or business development in health care industry preferably, sales function is a must, B2B environment is a plus  Junior College above, a major in Pharmacology/ Medical & Health Care is a plus  Ability to communicate and build relationships  Strong negotiation skills  Willingness to learn, curiosity  Ability to work independently  Flexibility to travel, location: remote, home base to work  People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

description: Position:  Manager, Field Sales  Job Description:  We are looking for a Sales Manager to join our electronic component business. This role will develop all key relationships to ensure strong foundation for solution selling. Maintain and promote relationships with customer contacts who may be determining shortage and cost saving opportunities and deal with existing business challenges. Ensure customer satisfaction as it pertains to supply chain management and other value-added services. Extensive understanding of pricing programs and models within the electronics industry.  What You’ll Be Doing  Provide a high level of service and maintain relationships with existing electronic contract manufacturers and similar customer base. Maintain and promote relationships with customer contacts who may be determining design opportunities and deal with existing business challenges. Visiting new & existing customers to promote Arrow's full range of electronics components including semiconductors, electro-mechanical and passive products. Identify new opportunities primarily within the Guangzhou region, plan strategy and develop all key relationships to ensure strong foundation for solution selling. Ability to work in a team environment. Provide competitive quotations to customers & following up in a timely manner.  What We Are Looking For  Previous experience in the electronics industry will be highly regarded and is desirable. 8 years relevant experiences. Inside sales support experience will be a preferred qualification Ability to build strong relationships with customers & suppliers. Ability to achieve required sales targets. Good interpersonal, communication and time management skills. Experience in Microsoft Excel, Word & Outlook. Enthusiastic, driven, energetic & motivated. Excellent oral and written communication skills  What’s In It For You  At Arrow, we recognize that financial rewards and great benefits are important aspects of an ideal job. That’s why we offer competitive financial compensation, including various compensation plans, and a solid benefits package.  Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance Life Insurance Performance Bonus Paid Time Off Special/Extra Leave 5-Day Work Week Growth Opportunities And more!  About Arrow  Arrow Electronics, Inc. (NYSE: ARW), an award-winning Fortune 102 and one of Fortune Magazine’s Most Admired Companies. Arrow guides innovation forward for over 180,000 leading technology manufacturers and service providers. With 2020 sales of USD $28.67 billion, Arrow develops technology solutions that improve business and daily life. Our broad portfolio that spans the entire technology landscape helps customers create, make and manage forward-thinking products that make the benefits of technology accessible to as many people as possible. Learn more at www.arrow.com.  Our strategic direction of guiding innovation forward is expressed as Five Years Out, a way of thinking about the tangible future to bridge the gap between what's possible and the practical technologies to make it happen. Learn more at https://www.fiveyearsout.com/.  For more job opportunities, please visit https://careers.arrow.com/us/en. description: At Branch, we’re transforming how brands and users interact across digital platforms. Our mobile marketing and deep linking solutions are trusted to deliver seamless experiences for consumers and outstanding results for advertisers. Our team consists of smart, humble, and collaborative people who live and breathe our company motto: Build Together, Grow Together, Win Together.  As a Senior Account Executive in China, you will primarily be responsible for bringing Branch’s Premium Solutions to market in the region. You will work with the largest companies in your market to help them leverage our newest products and features. You’ll also reach out to new potential partners and drive them to integrate Branch’s deep linking solutions. You will succeed in this role if you are an energetic and organized self-starter who understands the sales process, can build relationships with the right decision-makers, and can succinctly define and communicate the specific benefits of Branch appropriate for each customer. You will be a key driver of revenue growth for the company, and on the front lines for evangelizing our product to prospective and existing users as well as strategic channel partners.  What You’ll Do Prospect into the China cross-border market. Deliver sales revenue for the company. Show ownership of your markets and leverage your network to drive growth. Demonstrate how marketers and mobile app developers can utilize Branch in a variety of ways, through phone calls, demonstrations, and presentations. Identify tactics to build local groundswell and brand awareness to support the sales cycle. Design and execute sales pitches Build and manage a sales pipeline. Make every potential Branch user happy with every interaction, regardless of deal size. Build and enhance relationships with our largest partners. Create and localize sales materials and demos to effectively showcase Branch. Represent Branch at relevant regional conferences and events. You’ll Be a Good Fit If You Have Ideally 5+ years of sales experience in mobile marketing technology and/or SAAS platform business, with a track record of top performance. Full written and speaking fluency in English and Mandarin. Ability to understand the Branch SDK in-depth and communicate its benefits to both technical and non-technical customers. Strong interest in mobile technology and mobile SDKs. A strong work ethic and internal drive to produce results. Strong network with the top China cross-border export app developers. Data-driven, and experience managing a pipeline using Salesforce or similar SFA tool. Humility, and Customer-first mentality. A Little Bit About Us Branch has raised more than $330M from investors such as NEA, Founders Fund, and Playground Ventures. We are headquartered in Silicon Valley and have presence all over the world. Branch Ranked No. 3 Fastest-Growing Company in North America on Deloitte's 2020 Technology Fast 500. Diversity at Branch ranks in the top 10% for similarly sized companies (by Comparably). In 2020, we are recognized as one of Forbes Best Startups, Great Places to Work, and Bay Area Best Places to Work. We have more than 3 billion monthly users and are partnered with over 75,000 apps. If you think you’d be a good fit for this role, we’d love for you to apply! At Branch, we strive to create an inclusive culture that encourages people from different backgrounds, age groups to bring their unique, diverse perspectives to work. We aim every day to build an environment that empowers us all to do the best work of our lives, and we can’t wait to show you what we have to offer!

description: 岗位描述： 1.负责京东物流自动化立体仓库产品面向企业客户的独立项目销售工作； 2.负责定期完成公司安排的销售工作任务，对业绩指标负责； 3.负责大项目招投标梳理与支持； 4.负责行业研究，竞品分析，及策略制定； 5.负责与其他部门、区域的沟通与衔接工作；  任职要求： 1. 有5年以上自动化立体仓库、无人仓储等软硬件集成产品销售工作经验； 2. 有较强的表达能力，能独立陈述解决方案； 3. 踏实、严谨的工作作风，具有良好的职业道德素养、敬业精神；    4. 出色的分析解决问题能力，勇于承担工作压力；    5. 优秀的沟通能力、执行力并具备团队合作意识；    6. 本科及以上学历，物流工程、物流管理、机电工程、机械工程等相关专业优先；

In this role you will be responsible for certain solutions of our company which in China is focused on direct and indirect sales of loading Bays, industrial doors and other products  As Senior Sales Manager, you will be responsible for approaching and managing key projects and supporting distributors and for exploring and developing new business opportunities.  Responsibilities  Direct Sales ·       Visits to clients to understand their needs and market realities, identify new business opportunities and provide products and services of the company to try to get the sale thereof.  ·       Promote the company's products in the market.  ·       Perform and follow-up the orders to provide good service to customer loyalty.  ·       Accomplish the activity reports and visits to know and report promptly the situation of each client, including further requirements and complaints. ·       Carry out a follow-up of unpaid bills to get the customer paid the invoices.  ·       Perform market reports (trends, competitiveness, products, prices, etc. ..) to know and focus on the market needs and adapt quicker to their needs  ·       Provide technical advice to customers of how products work to learn about the features, performance and / or applications thereof.  ·       Propose changes or developments at the technical level of products to suit customer needs.   Indirect sales be responsible for the existing distributors.. You maintain and further develop the relations; you visit potential new distributors and make a selection of preferred distributors  together with your local distributors, create the demand in the market and support your customers through individual consulting, training and support where needed (eg. trade shows, lead generation, product positioning, sales opportunity evaluation, customer procurement to post-sales). You also join the distributors for important meetings with end-customers  closely monitor the results and sales figures. based on the project and prospect pipelines, you provide the management with accurate opportunity and regional forecasts on regular basis  You analyse the market potential and support your distributor-network pro-actively in the implementation of business opportunities  provide global market intelligence and competitor activity is part of your reporting to the management   Skills And Experience requested  We are seeking for a person with  at least 5 years’ experience selling and promoting technical products, better if from a competitors or from a General Contractor for industrial building. Several years of successful experience in distributor/dealers management and supported field sales in the mentioned business is preferable. Bachelor Degree/Master in Engineering is requested. He/she must be fluent Native in Chinese and have a good or higher level of English.  Driving licence and car are required and he/she is willing to travel minimum 50% of time  -       is ambitious, result driven, committed, reliable and autonomous  -       is a committed person that knows how to win over business partners and who knows how to manage professionally and generate growth in a structured manner
